hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed at this hotel as part of a birding tour and found it to be excellent. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable with a good bed and a great balcony with a clear view of Diamond Head crater. The bathroom was clean and well stocked. The WiFi is good. The location is very good because it is far enough away from Waikiki and Honolulu to be peaceful, but just a short walk to both those places. We walked to Diamond Head crater from here to do the Diamond Head crater walk. We found the breakfast at Hau Tree Lanai to be quite expensive, so recommend a short walk along the foreshore towards Waikiki for any meal at Barefoot Beach Cafe. This became our favourite place to eat. The beach is 60 seconds away and Kapiolani Park is across the road. Fantastic location. It was also fun to get something to eat and a few beers from the ABC Store and sit on the balcony with Diamond Head as a companion. We will definitely be back.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is a Japanese hotel so the rooms are relatively small by American standards. This is not much of a problem if you are alone but two people will find it a little crowded, especially if you have much luggage. The room is equipped with coffee maker and refrigerator and a balcony. The area is very quiet and you have excellent access to the beach, Kapiolani park, and, if you don't mind a short walk, Waikiki. Parking is limited to valet parking unless you park on the street.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Just finished a 5 night stay here (2/02/20-2/07/20). I had one of the lower priced rooms as that was all I needed as a solo traveler (room 724), and below $200.00 a night, which is a relative bargain in this area. Although the hotel is not actually "in" Waikiki, it's an easy 20 minute or so walk to the center of it all. I love the location as it is never rushed, crowded or hurried, and their beach is never crowded and very nice. Clean room, high floor, with lanai and views of the water and Diamond head, if you looked out over the railing.The oceanfront rooms are a good deal ....the corner rooms with a view of Waikiki and the Pacific are the best deal if you can get one. Check out the website for more info.The Hau Tree restaurant is well known among the locals, but I prefer the Miyako Japanese restaurant on the 2nd floor - (ck at check-in for discounts!).If you really want to go "budget style", there is a well stocked convenience store on the property that has just about everything from papayas, sandwiches to alcohol, to every necessity you might need.I guess you can tell I like it here!Happy trails,conrad

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We were meant to stay at this hotel for a couple of relaxing days, but ended up wasting hours to get our booking cancelled and find a new hotel as when we arrived, an incredibly noisy construction work was taking place in the restaurant/lobby area. We were told that the deafening noise would start every morning at 8.30, but the only compensation we were offered were for them to waive the 20$ resort fee, which already seems steep as the hotel is not a resort but a regular hotel. The construction work also meant we couldn’t use the advertised outdoor patio dinner/drink area and made staying on the small beach in front of the hotel less than peaceful. On top of this, the room we were offered smelt of old cigarette smoke and a had a view of the parking lot. What made it all more aggravating was the receptionist’s attitude as the first thing she did when we, after trying to get some of compensation for the noise, asked if we could cancel, was to say - rather gloatingly - that we had already prepaid. Probably she was in a bad mood for having had to stand in the midst of a building site all day, but a bit of sympathy would have gone a long way.After some discussions, the hotel offered to waive the 200$ cancellation fee and we left and found a new hotel, the Pacific Monarch Hotel, where staff were beyond helpful and we had a lovely stay. Anyhow, after two days, we realised that the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel had still charged the cancellation fee, but when we called - first to hotel.com, who luckily had confirmed and recorded the hotel’s promise to cancel without a fee, and then to the hotel -they said no such fee had been drawn. More work and phone calls and they finally blamed a fault in their system for charging the fee to our card and promised to refund it within seven days. We have still to se if this happens. All in all this was a disappointing and slightly aggravating experience which we wasted hours of our Honolulu trip on. Had it not been for all this I reckon the hotel would have been pleasant enough though there would still have been a discrepancy between room, staff attitude, and price.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: For the last few years we had our winter vacation (plus looking for a house or condo) in Hawaii (one of Kauai, Maui, or Big island plus Oahu every year). In Oahu, we always stayed in Hilton Hawaiian Village (mostly staying an ocean front unit facing the ocean. Everything was ok but increasingly became tired of 'madness' around the Hilton (too many people in a rather small area, hard to get a desired unit, expensive if you want a good view, a lack of really good restaurants without paying a lot) we decided to try this boutique hotel at the opposite end of Waikiki. We had the ocean front/Waikiki unit that looked the Pacific Ocean and the entire Waikiki sky line. Yes the hotel is generally a bit old, but the room was nicely renovated and really really clean. The view from the unit was spectacular (the view after dark is special), far better than any view that we ever had in Hilton. Also the atmosphere of the hotel and surrounding were so calm and resting, you can breeze. Beach was small but not crowded compered to the rest of Waikiki beach. It is close to the Zoo and Aquarium (waking distance) and Diamond head park. Also the neighborhood was surrounded by multimillion dollar houses. There are two excellent restaurants, a Japanese restaurant and Haute Tree Lani restaurant, both of which serve excellent food. Also if you like busy, loud, and 'exciting' shops/night clubs and restaurants along Waikiki beach, you could walk less than a mile.to get there.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This smaller hotel was closer to Diamond Head, about a 20 minute walk into downtown Waikiki. It is situated across from a large park that made the walk very pleasant. It is away from the high volume area but close enough to access all the amenities. It doesn’t have a pool but is on a great stretch of beach. Our queen room was small but large enough to unpack and get comfortable. Best part was our ocean and downtown facing view! Nice bar, restaurant with a terrace and on site is a little convenience store with everything you made need. Staff are friendly and helpful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at New Otani hotel. Very convenient location with city bus at the door. All the important shops are at walking distance, Beach is also not far and walk able. Hotel lobby is fairly good and front desk well attended. Lots of Japanese people visit and stay here . And good number of Japanese speaking staff available.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Great little boutique hotel. Super quiet on Sans Souchi Beach.This is for of you like a quiet spot, away from the hustle of Waikiki, which is a mile awayNo pool etc. The staff are spectacular! Close to the zoo and to the aquarium.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I certainly enjoyed my stay at the New Otani. It's right on the beach and we were lucky in that two Hawaiian Monk Seals were using the beach as a resting place each day we were there - an amazing mammal to see in that they are highly endangered. The rooms are a bit small but very clean and comfortable. There are two very nice restaurants (one with al fresco dining overlooking the beach) and the hotel is right across from Kapi'olani Park (great for us bird watchers) with its Zoo and Aquarium right nearby. The park is right below Diamond Head!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Saw this hotel on a previous visit and just loved the area. It’s just at the end of Waikiki beach next to the park towards diamond head. The rooms have everything but are on the small side but the views are to die for. We had room 416, fabulous. We booked well in advance to ensure we got a decent room and it was well worth it. Staff , especially the cleaners are excellent. Lobby and corridors are a bit dated and need a lick of paint but would go again. Between 2 and 5 pm is happy hour and the small plates of food and drinks are great. Access to the beach is through a side door and ten steps your on the sand. The locals use this area and there is a life guard. Views across Waikiki are just amazing and you can here what’s going on in the park but it doesn’t stop you sleeping.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel is an older property and shows its age in some places but it is well maintained and I have never had a cleaner bathroom in any hotel anywhere. I spent 8 days there.The staff was friendly and helpful. Housekeeping does and amazing job.The Hau Tree Lanai Restaurant and Sunset Lanai Lounge located off the lobby are both great (The Hau Tree provides the food in the Lounge.) I had the catch of the day and Eggs Benedict, both were delicious. I didn't eat at the other restaurant at the hotel, Miyako but I heard it is very good as well.The location was about perfect for me. Dining and shopping in Waikiki are just a short walk away but the hotel's location near the aquarium and Kapi'olani park is peaceful. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The 2 Japanese ladies at front were extremely rude and incompetent at check-in as was hostess at restaurant, stayed here numerous times without a problem, never saw a supervisor/manager whole stay, paid $300+ for beachfront room but as mainlanders we were obviously unwelcome.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed in Jan 2019 as family 4 , we deliberately picked this hotel as it is away from the main beach (It has its own small beach out front , perfect) but still within walking distance of Waikiki if you feel the need . The rooms are small but have everything you need with a small balcony and we were lucky enough to have a great view to watch the sunset over the water for our standard afternoon happy hour . We ate in the restaurant a few times and the food is good but it was a little expensive compared to the many other options around. We loved the fact it has a small beach out the front which we never had an issue getting a great spot , we loved Waikiki for drinks and eating but not our idea of a nice beach with that many people on it . One of my clients has been coming to this hotel for over 40 years and recommended it if you are looking for a smaller more Hawaiian style Hotel. There is plenty of turtles out the front of the resort if you are ok with swimming a few hundred metres offshore. Also good access to walking tracks up around Diamond Head etc

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Great Old Hawaii feel at the New Otani Kaimana Beach. Located next to Kaimana Beach and across the street form Kapiolani Park this resort has a fabulous location. It is walking distance to Waikiki for dining, or explore the options near or at the hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We’ve stayed multiple times in this charming hotel. Check our the room sizes when booking as some of the rooms are very small Japanese style rooms. The beach is beautiful and uncrowded. For families there’s a wing of 1-2 bedroom suites. Definitely eat breakfast at the Hau Tree Lanai restaurant.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We had quite a few delicious meals at the Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel's fabulous "Hau Tree Lanai Restaurant." The most memorable was my birthday dinner on 9 August 2019. It started with our reservation made by Donna, our friendly servers, Allen who insisted on taking many photos of us with the setting sun as the background, and Andy who served us our first breakfast. It was all an absolute delight. The food was superb and so beautifully plated at every meal that we were served. The fading sunlight was replaced by flaming torches and a live guitar player sang and set the mood with wonderful Hawaiian music. The breeze off the ocean was perfect. The view of the deep blue Pacific and Waikiki beach from our balcony was priceless. Our room was perfectly made up each day by Jemma who always had a smile. Everyone from the front desk to the Valet attendants was helpful and gave us directions and suggestions whenever we asked. We highly recommend the Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel and their "Hau Tree Lanai" restaurant for a lovely experience whenever you visit Oahu Hawaii. Do also check out the "Barefoot Cafe" which is just a short walk away. This hotel is located at the base of Diamond Head, within walking distance to the Waikiki Aquarium with its amazing gift shop and is a short drive to the Honolulu Zoo

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: From when we arrived as a family we were put into a single double when we booked two double beds. Thley moved us to a walk up three levels of stairs with no escalator. Our room was neat but has no hot water for the length of our stay. To get luke warm from the shower we had to run the water for 15 min whilst running the sink tap . Asked for service on this and it wasn’t fixed. Will not stay here again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The Staff was pleasant, breakfast was very good. We changed hotels because the hotel is far from new and badly in need of updating. One of the elevators had a terrible odor which was not taken care of for 2 days. Our room had a noisy air conditioner in the wall but there was no AC in the rest of the hotel. The beach was very disappointing and the hotel offered towels and a mat but no chairs and NO UMBRELLAS.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Nice property. Away from the bustle of Waikiki. Store on property. Next to Elks( if member). We had a nice room with view of the city, beach and diamond head(610). Great breakfast. Would recommend highly. Good value. No pool.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We booked a Waikiki Ocean Superior view room for a week. We choose this hotel because of its location away from the very crowded Waikiki Beach area. We loved the view we had! Our room was great although a bit on the small side. There is a mini fridge which we always like to have. The housekeeping staff was very friendly. The atrium was very dated and in great need to be refreshed but it didn’t really effect our stay. This hotel does not have a pool but the beach is right in back of the hotel and it is lovely. Not very crowded and easy to get to. We walked into Waikiki each day and it was about 10-15 minutes each way. We enjoyed the walk. We only ate in the restaurants at the hotel one time each and the food was good. Overall we really enjoyed this hotel but it was mainly due to the location and the view from out room.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Spent 7 days here with my dayghter and it was great. All the staff was caring and helpfull. Perfect location right on the beach. The room was not big but it was clean and had the ammeneties that we needed. Fridge coffeemaker and a nice balcony. We did not want to go home .. thanks

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is a pleasant hotel located at the southern end of Kapiolani Park and right on Kaimana Beach. It’s a favourite spot of locals, especially in the weekends. That gives a great atmosphere. And it’s only a 10-15 minute walk to the bustle of downtown Waikiki. The main hotel tower has rooms either overlooking the ocean or Diamond Head. As we are a family of four we were staying in a one bedroom apartment in a separate walk up wing with views over the park. It was wonderful for us. Kaimana Beach is fantastic. Lovely white sand and clear water and not too crowded (even in the weekend). The Hau Tree Restaurant is special, particularly at sunset as it faces west over Kaimana Beach. We loved the little touches of flowers on the pillow at night. The only reason we give this a 4 star and not 5, is that the reception staff are neither as responsive nor as helpful as we have come to expect from our extensive travels. As the first encounter with the place they should at the very least ask guests what they would like to do and ensure they are comfortable.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: View of the ocean or Diamondhead- not bad! Excellent restaurant out back- tiny but picturesque- reservations a must. Seal took a nap on our beach. Favorite picnic spot. We were close to a trolley stop, but even the walk in wasn’t terrible. Our area was quiet. Best thing was a little market on the end of the hotel. We went daily for water, breakfast and sandwiches. We did laundry. Only negative really was the bathroom door. It had slats and was like not having a door.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Literally standing on the beach, far enough (but not too far) from the noisy touristic attractions and the overpriced cheap bars and restaurants @newotanikaimanabeachhotel is the best place to relax and enjoy the hawaiian way of life.I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for quiet and quality vacations. Perfect for family.My tip: if you can, go for a see front room, you won't regret it.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stay here every time we visit Honolulu. It’s definitely worth the price to upgrade to a ocean front room. It’s worth to note that there are different levels of Ocean front rooms here-Ocean front deluxe (largest and best), Ocean front Waikiki deluxe, and Ocean superior. You can also get an Ocean Waikiki superior but that’s sort of a side view of the ocean and more noise from the beach. There’s a big difference in terms of the view-ranges from that you’re right there, just the ocean all around at 360 degree, to that you get a glimpse of the ocean and beach from an angle-depending on how important the view of the room is to you and how much you want to pay. The hotel has a wonderful onsite restaurant, Lau Tree Lanai which has both inside and outside seating as well as a bar that also serves small dishes. Reservation is recommended as it is also one of the most popular restaurants by the beach in Waikiki. Breakfast is served here but not included if you’re hotel guests. Overall the hotel’s decor and amenities are a little dated. The ocean rooms have good views but the courtyard leaves much to be desired. We are underwhelmed with Miyako restaurant on the second level, but highly recommend their Hau Tree Lanai. The famous beach is literally right there by the restaurant/hotel. What makes this our favorite hotel is definitely it’s fantastic location with unbeatable views. Located at the end of Waikiki strip you are within walking distance to where most actions are but still has a sense of peace/seclusion. The front desk and house keeping staff are wonderfully helpful and courteous. The valet parking staff are only average. Highly recommend if you prefer staying in a hotel than a condo while visiting Honolulu.We will always return to this hotel and our beloved room here. What a vacation in paradise!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed in room 617, for 7 nights, July 2nd through July 8th. We splurged on an ocean front/corner room. The view was amazing. The moment we opened the door, and pulled back the curtains, we were in awe. The ocean out the front and the Waikiki skyline/ocean out the side, was breathtaking. The room was well appointed and nicely updated. The bed was comfortable, and the bedding and towels were good quality. The room had nice updates.I believe this is our fifth time to stay at this hotel....but, the first time to have such a nice room. It was well worth the extra cost.As others stated, it is about 1/2 of a mile walk through the park to get to the beginning of the Waikiki "strip". However, it is a pleasant walk and mostly shaded. The park did have a few homeless people, but they kept to themselves, and at no time did I feel insecure with their presence. The beach outside the hotel was nice. Seems to be a somewhat protected area, so wasn't real rough. A lot of locals use the beach, and it was great to see so many people surfboarding, kayaking, etc... The World War 1 monument next door is still in a state of disrepair, albeit, not the hotels fault. It would be a grand site, if the city/state would ever fix it up.We had room service from the Hau Tree restaurant on July 4th. The food was excellent, and we just enjoyed our meal on our balcony, watching the 4th of July fireworks over the ocean....a fantastic experience.We had drinks and appetizers at the Sunset Bar....the food and drinks were good.Our only complaints this trip:1) Our departing flight did not leave until 5:20 pm, so we asked for a late check out. The hotel staff said they could not accommodate, even though they confirmed there were various openings/availability for corner rooms that day. I politely reminded them I have patronized this hotel at least five times before and have spent tens of thousands of dollars here, this would be a nice "value added" service to allow a late check out for a returning guest/repeat customer....but, they said no. This is very disappointing. It also puts a hardship on me; we had to check out at noon....so, for five hours we had nothing to do....we don't want to jump in the ocean, or walk far, working up a sweat before we get on a plane...as our room was not available in which to shower or change. This really sucks...and the New Otani needs to review this policy. AGAIN, I AM A RETURN GUEST THAT HAS SPENT A GREAT DEAL OF MONEY HERE.2) Review your statement closely. I had prepaid the room months ago, to get the best rate....yet they still presented me a bill of over $400.00 additional charges. Some were expected, room service and lounge charges. But, the resort tax was not prepaid. And, the hotel also charged me for parking the car for every night...even though we only had a car for one night. The front desk made the change after I pointed out the error. Lastly, note they charge a resort fee. This is not a resort. There is not a pool....there are no cabanas. They do not serve their patrons outside, or bring them drinks, while lounging at the ocean, etc... This is a gotcha fee....plain and simple. They state the resort fee covers: wi-fi, free local calls and beach towel....come on.....every hotel covers these things.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I made reservations at this hotel to bookend a NCL Cruise of the Hawaiian Islands. I have never been more pleasantly surprised in my life! When I made the reservations for our group we requested ocean view rooms, the rooms had gorgeous views of the ocean and Waikiki Beach. This hotel turns out to be a diamond on a diamond in that it is located on the other side of a park from the busy hustle and bussell of Waikiki beach yet just a short walk away, handy to the Aquaium and the Honolulu Zoo. Much to our surprise after checking out and back in a week later after our cruise, our whole group was upgraded to suites with all exterior walls being glass from floor to ceiling offering phenomenal views of the Ocean, Beach, Ft DeRussey Park, and Waikiki all at no additional charge. The service at the hotel was exceptional with very friendly staff sincerely interested in making our stay comfortable and a joyful experience. The hotel has a bar in the lobby area with nominal prices. The Lobby is open air to the street and the beach sporting a comfortable sea breeze most of the time. There is a restaurant down from the first floor offering a spectacular menu for Breakfast, lunch, and dinner. For the connoisseur of great Japanese dishes there is a five star restaurant on the second floor, Myaki's offering the best Japanese cuisine. If I have the good fortune to ever go back to Honolulu, regardless the purpose of my visit, this is where I will stay. Oh, and the room rate was much less than the pricey over rated name brand hotels!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Thank you Donna Bender at Maui Calls for introducing us to the New Otani. We booked two adjoining rooms with views of Waikiki, the Ocean/Beach and Diamond Head - unbelievable. 5 star views. We love the quieter location away from the busy Waikiki Strip. You can walk to the action in 10 minutes, as well as nearby restaurants. The beach is also great in terms of what you find in Waikiki. We enjoyed the hotel - it is not fancy - but the rooms were nice and clean and we found the staff very nice. We have stayed in higher-end Waikiki properties, but would return to the New Otani - best value and view for the price.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Loved the location of this hotel: not right in the busy section of Waikiki yet a short walk from the action. Loved the hotel's small beach out front, the walking distance to restaurants, the quietness of the immediate neighborhood, the open-air bar, the friendly and helpful staff (they patiently and graciously helped me print tickets for Pearl Harbor), large room and nice-sized bathroom. The bed was comfortable as well. We had a beachfront room with a long wall of sliding-glass doors...so lovely and relaxing to see and hear the ocean every morning upon waking up. This is a comfortable hotel with an authentic feeling of Hawaiian hospitality. While the corridors are dated and somewhat depressing (cinder-block walls in unappealing colors and carpet in need of replacement), the room itself was nice enough and certainly met our needs. Another plus: we were able to walk to Diamond Head! We will return to the New Otani, for sure!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We enjoyed our stay so much, the hotel is quaint and has an awesome Hawaiian Vibe. The staff was so friendly. Great location on beach and short walk to shops and restaurants. Can’t wait to go back next summer.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Here is the question. What is the best value. The worst room in a luxury world class hotel like the Royal Hawaiian, or the best room in an average hotel? After reading hundreds of trip advisor reviews we chose the latter. If you can possibly afford it book a de luxe corner room on a high floor. We had room 810 and it was spacious, well furnished and comfortable. But when we opened the curtains the views were jaw dropping. From one end of the room we looked over Diamond Head. and from the long side glassed wall we had gob smacking views over Waikikki.In 40 years of travel the views across to the Royal Hawaiian and the strip were the best we have seen. It was a delight to sit on the balcony and watch the amazing sunsets.Now, one error we made was underestimating the distance to the action which centred around the area of the Royal Hawaiian. Yes, if you are young and super fit it may be possible to walk the distance, but for a couple of seniors with joint replacements it was out of the question. If you ask reception how to get the bus they tell you to get a 19 or 20 'just out the front'. It is not out the front.If you walk to the left it is 500 metres to the stop but if you walk to the right it is only 300 meters. Time by bus to the centre of the action is 15 minutes, that is if the driver doesn't stop for a rest break. Remember this is Hawaii. On half of our bus trips the driver stopped at a park and announced he was taking his 15 minute break. No one seems to worry while the driver wanders off and returns in 15 minutes.There is still a further catch. Because of the one way streets and chaotic traffic you may not always get the bus back to the hotel from the same street. You will have to figure out on what street the stop will be located, and where the stop is on that long street. Not a lot of fun in the heat and humidity.Now here is my point. The reception staff book you in and check you out. Any further requests will make them stare like a deer caught in the headlights. A simple request for a sheet of copy paper brought a stare of amazement. And how hard would it be for them to open a map and mark the bus stops for first time visitors? But that's not their job description.We dined one evening at the Hau Tree Restaurant and it was wonderful, but with our Aussie dollar languishing at 68 cents it cost a kings ransom (Please President Trump no more tweets or it will be 60 cents). We did find that the Bar had small portion meals that were very good, and by sheer chance found that if you walk along the path by the shore you come to a wonderful beach restaurant which we highly recommend.We recommend the area as being quiet and the beach right outside the hotel perfect. It was a delight to see families enjoying the surrounding park and the beautiful blue water.Do not walk the parks at night as homelessness is always in your face. One guy was aggressive and spat on us when we refused a request for money.For the rest of the world that live in a non tipping culture do be aware that right through the U.S gratuities are expected for any service from the house keeping staff right down and it is rising to 20 per cent. Just do it.Would we stay at this hotel again? Yes if we could be certain of having the same room, but no if it was not available. We think we would need to find something closer to the centre of Waikikki.PS why don't they have a shuttle bus? Problem solved.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We were pleased to have chosen the New Otani Kaimana Hotel for our recent stay in Honolulu. It is an easy walk to all the hub-bub of Waikiki but, is located in a much less busy area. It is oceanfront and a great place to swim or watch the surfers.Parking is a breeze right across the street. It is free from 6PM to 10AM and across the park there are free spots where you can park all day for free. Saves you the big $$$$ of Valet parking.We were on the 9th floor and even though we were not oceanfront we had 2 different views of the water. The room is not real big but it is comfy enough and beds were comfortable. The beds were made promptly and all supplies replenished daily.Would highly recommend!!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The location was perfect for us - the quiet end of Waikiki yet a walkable distance to many restaurants, bars, and shops. We were in Hawaii to see birds so it was great to have Kapiolani Park and nesting White Terns just outside the hotel's front door. The front desk staff was pleasant, and check in was simple and straightforward. Our room (king ocean view deluxe) was spacious, well appointed, and had a very comfortable bed. We were on an upper floor with a balcony and had a great view both day and night. Parking can be difficult and valet parking is expensive ($34.00/day if I recall). We paid for valet parking our first day but then utilized on-street parking for the remaining 3 days. It's meter parking during the day (2 hours max) but after 6 pm it's free. Since we were out every day until late afternoon it worked out well for us. If if ever return to Honolulu we would be happy to stay at the New Otani Kaimana again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you’re Japanese or Chinese or from that that area of the world this is a great hotel.The women at the front desk weren’t the nicest. Told us no to a late check out, that was a first for me lol. They didn’t even tell us have a nice day after check out or safe flight.The restaurants are over priced in my option but the service staff was friendly.I would recommend staying closer to town, better food and easy access to the beach.The hotel was overall ok.That’s it .

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I spent 11 days here with family and was happy with the location. The beach in front of the hotel is very good and not to crowded like many other places on Waikiki Beach. It is far enough away from the "madness" of Waikiki Beach to be quiet, but still only a short walk away. Took about 10 minutes to walk either through the park or following the road. I do recommend following the road to avoid homless people during night which is a Waikiki problem.Both the breakfast and dinner at the hotel was excellent. Usually not a problem to get a table, but to be sure i recommend a reservation for dinner atleast during weekends. When it comes to parking it is expensive at the hotel, but it is free parking in the street outside daytime hours. So if you rent a car and plan to drive between 10:00 - 17:00 it is free the rest of the time, and a max of two hour parking during those payable hours.We had a beach view deluxe room and it was awesome, tho pricy. The ordinary beach view rooms are disapointingly small and i was quite disapointed when seeing it. Hardly room for luggage and small bed. Normal rooms with no view are a bit better when it comes to space. Consider hardly whats important for you when it comes to room before ordering here. The balcony at the Ocean front deluxe rooms were spacious and private with both sunbed and chair/table.Clean, comfterable, polite staff and good location maked it worth it for me, however at a high price to get a good room.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I had just a short weekend visit to celebrate my niece's birthday so I was hoping to find a hotel on the beach. This was the most affordable. Our room was really small (like the coffee maker is in the bathroom small) and it had twin beds but it worked for what we needed. Parking was $35 a night (not including tips) and there was a resort fee but still good price in comparison to others on the beach. Location is nice, older part of town next to the aquarium. Can't really see the sunrise from the beach here, and the view from my room was mostly of buildings but if i looked to the left I could see the mountains and even saw a turtle swimming in the ocean in the slit of the ocean view I had! I went out super early swimming and ended up getting a really bad jellyfish sting. The staff there was so nice and helpful trying to help me with it. In all, I would definitely stay here again, for the price it was worth it for the small rooms and obstructed views.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: To be perfectly honest, this wasn’t exactly the most luxurious hotel I’ve ever stayed at, BUT, it does have its charms. The lobby is nice and the staff is friendly and accommodating. The rooms are very no-frills and small, and I was disturbed to find tiny ants crawling around in the bathroom sink, but I turned on the water and that was that. Now onto the good stuff, the back of the hotel is on the beach, and the sun sets right there over the water...it was very peaceful sitting on my balcony every night watching the sunset while listening to crashing waves. The front of the hotel faces Diamond-head, and there’s a big beautiful park in between if you just want to chill or walk around. They have a convenience store just a few steps outside the front door that literally has anything you can want, need, or imagine...including spare tires for the space shuttle. But the show-stopper is the Hau Tree Lanai outdoor restaurant which sits on the beach; I highly recommend any of their Eggs Benedict variations, they are out of this world!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My sister and I stayed here last week and we loved it! We were looking for something close to the beach and quiet, where we could sit out on our balcony and enjoy the sound of the ocean. We didn't want Waikiki, but close enough to walk. This fit the bill perfectly! We had originally booked the Ocean Superior room, but upon arrival they immediately upgraded us to the Ocean Front Deluxe. And a free welcome thermal bag full of treats! Awesome!Most mornings we walked (6 minutes) to the Barefoot Beach Cafe for breakfast. Our favourite restaurant. Great food at good prices and beautiful views! We only walked into Waikiki on 2 days (12 minutes to get to the edge of Waikiki), and it was a pleasant walk. We had rented a car for our whole trip, so the rest of the days we just toured around the island. It was a wonderful holiday and we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: A wonderful hotel towards Diamond Head. On the quiet side of Waikiki.. Near the zoo and the aquarium. A fun and easy walk to wild and busy Waikiki. I stayed in a room with two twin beds, a small lanai with a view of Diamond Head. They have a great swimming beach. Small and not crowded. Mainly locals and not a lot of tourists. An amazing restaurant on the beach.... Exactly where you want to have your MaiTai at sunset. It's the only hotel I'll stay!!!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I had 10 days of business on Oahu and put myself here, it being out of the busy of Waikiki...and near the east end, where I was working. Room was spotless with good wifi...and both Diamondhead and beach views!! The food was good, esp the bar/lounge - perfect light dinner fare for me. The best part - everyone treated me like ohana, from the front desk to the bartender to Kealii and the guys who delivered my car each morning and evening. Big Mahalos to this little gem!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is not a resort and it next to the park which means the beach is full of locals. The beach has harsh sand. Topless women were everywhere which made it for a very unfriendly visit for family. The room was very old with design of the bathroom and other areas very very very old. Think twice before booking as you will have to walk to get anywhere worthwhile.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Average but nice place at a great price, which is why I rated very good. Simple and nice and I thought it was a good locations, which was close, but not right in the middle of the busier areas. All the action is a short walk.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Is it an older hotel? Yes, but it's had a high quality update. The rooms are immaculate. The staff is friendly and helpful. And absolutely don't miss the restaurant. It pricy but excellent. The hotel is really just outside of Waikiki, but it's not crowded or touristed and has a lovely sheltered cove for swimming. A lot of locals use the beach and the neighboring parks.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Love this place because its not as crowded like other hotels and away from the congestion. Beach is steps away and perfect spot thats not over crowded. Best views of Waikiki beach and landscape and to watch the Honolulu festival fireworks. Its the quiet safe side of waikiki.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel is a little outdated and our room was small and a little overpriced,but the hotels location and above all the service was outstanding! From check in to drinks at the bar, the best Mai Tai in town (Chad) and the breakfast was what made this so special for our first trip ever to Hawaii. The entire staff deserves a Maholo from us❤️

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon. It is a bit of a walk from the centre of Honolulu so worth bearing in mind when you arrive from the airport. However, day to day we didn't mind the walk along the beach to the town. Th hotel itself was nice, but the best thing for us was the view of Diamond Head. When we booked the hotel, we were told our room was an upgraded room with a Diamond Head view. Personally, there was nothing upgraded about the room but the view was stunning and it was lovely to wake up to every morning. Overall, I probably wouldn't stay there again and the experience was no different from a standard stay considering it was our honeymoon.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for a few nights in early November. Clean, modern room. Great valet, Mai Tais were good. Great beach location, friendly staff. Enjoyed watching the sunset from the bar, and strolling along the beach amongst the locals. Lobby could use some updating, but the open air feel and high ceilings offer a lot of potentials.
user_name:
Jeremy S
Toms River, New Jersey

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is THE PLACE to stay in Oahu! The area around Waikiki now looks like Las Vegas and is just a noisy and frenetic. The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel is located directly on the beach south of the beautiful and quiet Kapi'olani Regional Park. the New Otani feels like Oahu from the 1970s - relaxed and unhurried. We stayed for a week in room 617, a corner room with a glass wall facing the ocean and an adjacent glass wall facing Kapi'olani Park and Waikiki. The views were fantastic! It was fun to sit on the balcony and watch the ocean or activity in the park. The Kaimana beach outside the hotel is very quiet, but no beach chairs are available. A large monk seal came to sleep on the beach while we were there. My wife enjoyed a massage at the hotel. One night we ate street tacos and nachos in the lobby bar, and they were spicy and delicious (we live in Texas so we eat Mexican food a lot). We ate at the Hau Tree restaurant (separate review) and enjoyed the food and atmosphere. Be aware that you have to pay $32 @day for parking. We liked everything at the New Otani, and we were sad to leave after a week of fun and relaxation. We would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Our bartender, Chad Galanto, was such a friendly and great bartender/waiter/happy hour server. We have stayed at the New Otani and have enjoyed the view and atmosphere at the bar many times. I was especially impressed by how Chad was so friendly and went out of his way to be welcoming and helpful. We will return to this bar again the next time we are in Waikiki .

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed overnight in the Kaimana Beach Hotel to celebrate our 40th anniversary and it was fabulous.The accommodations left nothing lacking, the room was pristine and the view looking west down the length of Waikiki beach was spectacular.Just literally 3 minutes to the beach and a 5***** breakfast on the Hau Terrace to cap off a fantastic 40th Anniversary celebration.We already have reservations to do it again for our 41st.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed last night and had a wonderful stay thanks to an outstanding hotel staff. From the first contact with the valet, to the outstanding front desk staff, it was a quick but enjoyable stay. Only stayed one night while waiting to get into a nearby condo. We had appetizers in the lounge and then breakfast in the morning in the restaurant. Everything was well prepared and the wait staff was very helpful and attentive. They were so friendly and seemed to enjoy their work. The room was what surprised me. The hotel is not new and so has a wonderful, comfortable feel to it. Small but comfortable. The room was so clean and well cared for, they must have a great housekeeping staff. Thanks for your efforts. Enjoyed our stay. I don't understand the negative reviews.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This small hotel across from the park is close enough to the action of Wakiki, but quiet enough to enjoy the beautiful sunsets and warm waters of the Pacific without the crush of people.The beach front dining is so special. Staff friendly and rooms comfortable.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Came for the happy hour before going to the restaurant for a few drinks and appies. Things started out fine but I have now been sitting at my table for 27 minutes with empty drinks and food plates. The staff is talking at the corner of the bar with a regular and hasn’t bothered to look up at all. I would have ordered another drink but now it’s time to move for dinner. Pretty disappointing and I understand why we were one of two tables the whole afternoon. Hopefully management stops by one afternoon to see the lack of attention or caring for the guests

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel is our place to stay in Honolulu. Located at the quiet end of Waikiki on a wonderful beach. Lifeguard included. The staff at the hotel are very accommodating and will go out of their way to make your stay one that you will remember. We have stayed at this hotel many times and enjoy the beach, the Hau Tree Lanai (restaurant at hotel) and the Sunset Lanai (lounge). It is an easy walk to stores and a public bus stop a short walk if you do not have a rental car. Wonderful Activities Desk in the lobby to help you with tours, snorkel gear, and a paddle/surf board rental right on site. A small market on site with just about everything you will need during your stay. We love the laundry service that is out in the morning and back in the afternoon. Wish I had them at home. They do a great job on the cleaning. My husband and I just can't say enough good things about this hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: One staff member had a really bad attitude, very unwilling to help. Not sure if it was because of my handicap or if he was just generally rude. Any case, I will not come back. Rooms are outdated and dirty, they say the renovated the hotel. No way that can be true.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Hotel was so run down and there was loud noise from the venitlation shack. Vibrations that sounded like a jack hammer. The receptionist told us we could wait till next day to get another room but it was too loud to sleep. So we checked out to go to stay at another hotel, receptionist didnt want to return the full amount even thou we had only been in the room for 90 minutes, He had a 1 hour policy, so ended up paying $250 for that 90 minutes. Since I have health issues I had no energy arguing with him, I just wish they treated others in a way they themselves would want to be treated.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: When I checked into this hotel, I was disappointed to discover that they didn't have a pool. And the room was a little small. But the whole experience was absolutely wonderful and I will return to this hotel. It's right on the beach, so who needs a pool. The concierge will loan you beach mats and umbrellas. We had a beautiful view of the beach and northward toward Waikiki. We were right next to a large park with parrots living in the trees. We could hear the waves crash on the beach at night. Spent hours out on the balcony with wine and music. Very romantic. The Hua Tree restaurant on the ground floor was perfect. Altogether a wonderful experience.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My family and I stayed here one night. We came early for my cousin's wedding. We ate supper at the restaurant on ground level with views of the beach and the sunset was breath taking. The food was delicious and wait staff was very nice. My parents and I stayed in one of the suites. It was spacious and had everything updated which was comfortable for all of us. We would highly recommend this place. We also had breakfast the next morning and we loved the fresh pineapple, pancakes, and guava juice.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel is being renovated. The location is great ,Out of the Waikiki craziness close enough to walk.The beach in front of the hotel is awesome . The restaurant in the hotel is literally on the beach great for breakfast or lunch.Not a luxurious hotel but I enjoy stay at this hotel frequently.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I've stayed at 16 different places in Hawaii and at least 7 in the Waikiki area. The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel has a really cool ocean front location near the base of Diamond Head. If you are looking for peace and quite and being away from the hustle and bustle of central Waikiki then this might be the place for you. It is really quiet down here and everything shuts down very early and there isn't much nearby. For some this is a plus.  The beach is very good and rivals any portion of Waikiki Beach. It is not crowded and it is good for swimming, not many waves, and appears safe for all ages. Access to the beach from the hotel is a little funky in my opinion but not something to stop someone from staying here. The New Otani Kaimana doesn't have a pool but its beach location makes up for that. The building is an older Mid-Century building which some may like but it is not architecturally significant and most of the common areas are very "dated." Not much if anything has been changed in the common atrium area for decades. The common lobby is commensurate for the size of the hotel. The Hau Tree Lanai is definitely a cool spot for breakfast, lunch, or a drink or two. Service is adequate but not exceptional. While the common areas are dated our ocean front corner room had been updated. It was adequate but not top of the line. The photos on TripAdvisor were a fair representation. Our corner room was just slightly on the smaller size but two full walls of glass with awesome views in each direction more than made up for any size issue. In addition, our lanai was substantially larger than what you will find at just about any place you might stay at regardless of the price. The views from the ocean front rooms and ocean front corner rooms at the New Otani will rival anything you will find in other areas of Waikiki. I would recommend trying to be at least on the 4th floor or higher since the palm trees may block some of your park/Waikiki view. All of that being said I would only recommend this place if you are going to stay in an ocean front room or ocean front corner room and if you are okay with the slower pace and quiet aspects of this hotel. However, I would not recommend this place if you are going to stay in one of the rooms designated as economy, standard, or Diamond Head.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I booked an ocean front deluxe room and our room exceeded expectations. We were on the sixth floor direct beach and ocean view with an extended lanai. I believe these rooms have been recently renovated so everything is new and in great working order. Outside of Waikiki, nice and quiet with still the great views of the city lights. You can walk along the waterfront walkway to the thick of the action and return to the quiet sanctuary of the New Otani. We were there during the unfortunate Marriott strike and were glad to have picked this hotel out of Waikiki.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is a hidden gem in Honolulu, away from the bustle of Waikiki but with close access to it. The nicest beach in the areas. Rooms are affordable and some have outstanding views of the ocean. They are immaculate and well appointed. Housekeeping was excellent. The Hau Tree Lanai (an iconic restaurant) is still outstanding and popular - make reservations to avoid disappointment. Although the 4th time to Miyako restaurant on the 2nd floor, I found the food disappointing and not as good as I remembered. The Sunset Lounge is excellent with wonderful food (best Angus burgers in the world) and drinks. But what really marks this hotel is the staff: Jun Gonzaga and Ted Teruya have really developed a culture of excellent service and they should be most proud of Laurie, Chad, and Patty. These three people made us feel at home and made us most welcome. It felt like leaving family when we left a few days ago. I could not have asked for better service. Thank you.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We got a one bedroom suite but it was in the parking lot. If we realized the room would not have ocean views we would not have stayed here. Was noisy at night with cars. Room was large and nice but location not good. Asked to have the couch made up at 2pm, they said it would be done by 4pm, arrived back at 9:30pm couch not made up for bed and kids exhausted.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: What a wonderful place this hotel is! They gave us an upgrade and we didn’t even ask for it. A great view of Waikiki and and Honolulu. Direct beach access. The locals are friendly and in very engaging. We would come back here for sure.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I was expecting this to be a bit shabby and very basic.I was in for a very nice surprise. The staff were super helpful and friendly, the room was clean, modern and well equipped, breakfast was great and the location of the hotel was lovely, with it's own little beach just steps away from my bed.I'd stay here again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Having breakfast while watching a monk seal not twenty feet in front of you. Now that is a site. The New Otani has its Hau Tree Lanai for breakfast, lunch or dinner where this is a wonderful place to have a meal. The Sundet Lanai Lounge is a great place to have cocktails and appetizers. This hotel is not located in the middle of Waikiki but at the foot of Diamond Head at the end of the strip. Access to and from the hotel is much easier because of its location. It is a pleasant walk from here to middle of Waikiki. Catch the bus to return if necessary. The hotel has recently been remodeled but not necessarily to the approval of some visitors. There is a wing of the hotel that has kitchenettes. Self parking is not available, only valet.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I moved to The New Omani Kaimana Beach Hotel from the Hilton Hawaiian Village - so I'm trying not to compare apples to oranges here!The view from the restaurant is really gorgeous and my meal there was also wonderful - no complaints whatsoever. I found the wait staff to be prompt and attentive - really top notch.The valet staff was friendly, as were the front desk staff. They answered questions well and were engaging. Maintenance was quick to respond with the couple of issues I had as well.Now, onto the accommodations. I had a room with 2 twin sized beds - not something I've ever experienced outside of Hawaii. I did have a balcony, but it was overlooking the parking lot. The carpet was quite frayed in many places and appeared in need of a deep cleaning. But the twin sized beds were comfortable (I slept in each one) and the bedding was clean.The bathroom is small, but has what you need. My shower was very slow to drain, but maintenance addressed that problem quickly. My biggest complaint about the bathroom is that the shower head in my room was handheld. When it was resting on the wall so both my hands could be free, the shower was hitting the shower curtain directly. I tried many times to angle it away from the shower curtain, but nothing seemed to work. As a result, there was a SIGNIFICANT amount of water all over the bathroom floor after each of my showers.From inside the hotel, access to the beach is a little awkward. However, the beach is nice and has a life guard. You can get beach towels from the lobby, which is great.This is a much quieter end of Waikiki Beach and is close to Diamond Head so that may be a plus for some people.For the price paid, I would return. But I wouldn't return because of the luxury or anything like that. This was a very average hotel with good staff.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I found this hotel in a 2010 Fodor’s travel guide written up as a hidden gem in the Waikiki area. It didn’t disappoint! Loved this place! Nice area across from Kapiolani Park with views of Diamond Head and right on the beach. My husband and I stayed here 3 days before a cruise and 2 days afterward. We stayed in standard rooms both times which we found to be small yet so well designed so that we weren’t cramped for space. Sliding doors to the bathroom, nice size closets, a lanai in each room, and coffee area in bathroom make this place very accommodating! Other perks include a Honolulu paper delivered each day, L’Occitane shampoo, conditioner, and lotion ( top of the line products!), a convenience store ( with a 10% discount) with food, fresh sandwiches, alcohol, toiletries, etc at reasonable prices -comparable to ABC stores in Hawaii , and free towels and mats to use on the beach. The staff we found to be very friendly and helpful! The concierge gave us information on getting a public bus to visit various museums and areas in Honolulu— $5.50 per day. One of the front desk attendants printed out our boarding passes. Nice beach front cafe to right of hotel and restaurants near zoo about 0.7 mile from hotel which is walking distance! If we travel to Hawaii again, New Otani Kaimana will definitely be a place we will revisit!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel is a GREAT location, right on the beach to enjoy romantic sunsets and just float in the ocean. It is right next store to the Aquarium and down the street from the Zoo. The Hau Tree restaurant was awesome!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is an older hotel but beautifully renovated and furnished. We found it clean, comfortable with a very friendly and helpful staff. Our room offered an excellent view of Diamond Head and the Pacific, with one night being very romantic as a full moon arose over Diamond Head. And, if you like the morning paper with a cup of coffee, a copy of the Honolulu newspaper is delivered to your door. Convenience store is located just outside the front entrance to the hotel for last minute purchases on your way out. The front desk staff were friendly, efficient, and punctual. I would definitely stay here on any return to Honolulu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: After one night in a very loud Waikiki hotel even on the 14th floor, the street noise boomed on through the night, we found a quiet retreat at the New Otani Beach hotel. We enjoyed breakfast on the ocean front lanai and were in awe of the sunrises and sets from our ocean front room. At night, we could hear the ocean waves soothe us to sleep. Great location. Quiet!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel is an older hotel away from the noise and lights of Waikiki. If you are looking for glitz, glamour, flash and crash, this is not your hotel. Its location is quiet, quaint and private. The rooms are a bit dated but that is to be expected since it is constantly filled with visitors from Japan, Australia, New Zealand. Adjacent to Kapiolani park, this property has wonderful beachfront access at San Souci; one of the last beaches on the south shore that doesn't reek of sunscreen. This is the kind of hotel that doesn't mind sandy flip-flops. The mornings greet you with the sounds of birds and the sunset views are to die for.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Years ago I got to stay at New Otani for a meeting and I finally got back there for another meeting this month. The biggest selling point for me has always been the location - away from Waikiki but walkable, across from Kapioloani Park, and on the beach (Kaimana Beach) but not mobbed at all hours. Other benefits are a very well stocked grocery store adjoining, and two exceeding good restaurants on the premises, as well as a lobby bar that makes excellent mojitos, maitais, and other locale-appropriate drinks. The rooms are plenty spacious, with refrigerators and a proper drip coffee maker so you can run out to buy some proper Kona coffee (their provided brand is OK, but you're in Hawaii, so why...) I was able to do my preferred Hawaiian breakfast of fresh fruit with macadamias in the room, and I was able to get out for regular runs around the park at my usual HI hour (i.e., 5 AM or so, as I never adjust to the time change). The bell staff and desk staff are all excellent - they get things done for you! As before, my stay here was excellent, and I'd recommend it to anyone. The place isn't cheap (nothing near Waikiki is), but you get value for your dollars here.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We wanted to be a little away from Waikiki beach so picked this hotel which is located at the end of the beach. It’s a nice hotel. There we three of us so we stayed in a corner room with a separate lounge which had a pull out bed. Rooms were clean and the bathroom was large. The bar and restaurant are small and lack atmosphere but do the job. It is advertised as having a private beach, which it does not have. It does have a beach right in front of the hotel which is open to the public. It’s an ok beach and is really convenient. The staff were accommodating although the gym and some other facilities do charge extra and aren’t actually part of the hotel, although located in the hotel grounds. If you will be spending much of your time exploring Honolulu then this hotel is a good base and very reasonable when compared to other Waikiki hotels.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Nice location, 10 minutes walk to Waikiki, rooms are small and need to be refreshed, rooms and food are 20% too high according to me. Parking is $32 a night! Staff are friendly. Looks like a grand hotel ... back 20 years ago.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We started our Honeymoon on Oahu with 6 nights at this beautiful Hotel. Rooms are clean, service is very good and hotel staff always be pleasant. We really can recommend the Ocean Front Waikiki Deluxe room. Best view, you will wake up every day in a paradise with relaxing ocean sound. Parking Service is as well a good recommendation otherwise you need to park outside the hotel (watch out the parking zones and times). Hotel has a very good location, you can reach every destination easily.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The location was very good on Waikiki Beach, but away from the crowds in Honolulu. The restaurant, Hua Tree is outdoors in the shade of the trees. Great view and great meals, especially breakfast and lunch. The service was also very good. We stayed there for a week. Would definitely go back. If you want a room you can relax in and have an ocean view, you need to upgrade to a superior room or suite. The basic ocean view was a balcony but only one straight chair and small table in the room. The bathroom is useable, but only for one person at a time. Even with the upgrade, its at a lower cost than the hotels on the beach downtown with a very nice room.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Perfectly positioned front-and-center on a mellow section of Waikiki beach that's patronized largely by Honolulu athletes, singles and families, close to Diamond Head, and removed from the bustle and noise of central Waikiki's forest of towers, the 9-story, mid-century-modern New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel is serene and lovely, and cherished by locals for its casual style. I would say that locals recommend the hotel above all others in Waikiki because of its moderate prices, its location "at the quiet end of Waikiki" -- and because it embodies the laid-back, open-air style of island life. But, if you need the clubs and fine dining choices that Waikiki offers, they're just a 10-minute walk west along the scenic beach promenade along adjacent Kapiolani Park. This venerable park, given to the City of Honolulu by King Kalakaua in 1888 to remember his queen, surrounds the hotel with wide open lawns, tall swaying coconut trees, shady banyan trees, flowering shower trees etc. To its credit, the Japanese-owned hotel has NOT been tarted up, or streamlined, or otherwise fussed over. Nothing trendy here! It's pure old-style, no-need modesty in a perfect setting. The clean rooms are smallish and reasonably priced -- and who spends time in their hotel room in Hawaii, anyway? The beach and park beckon, all day and moon-lit night. Just about every room has a great ocean or park/Diamond Head view. Service is low-key and friendly, island style. The open-air lobby bar must be one of the most glamorous rendezvous spots in Waikiki. The famous beach-front Hau Tree Lanai restaurant is expensive but worth it for its views of Waikiki and Honolulu, for its timeless menu, table-settings and service, and for its legendary hau-tree canopy, under which, they say, Robert Louis Stevenson once lolled. A breakfast, lunch or dinner there is a memorable experience. Last tip: parking on site is expensive, but there's lots of free and metered public parking all around the park. No nerve-wracking parking garages! Driving, getting anywhere else on the island, is generally much easier from the Kaimana than from congested central Waikiki with its crazy one-way streets. Easy in, easy out!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Had a wonderful time here with our two young kids. The rooms are a bit on the smaller side - but they are clean and well maintained. The only challenge for us was that the food in the restaurant in the hotel was extremely limited in terms of vegetarian options.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We booked 2 Superior - Ocean View rooms here for 1 night after a 10 hour flight from Washington DC. Both rooms had an amazing view of Waikiki ,the mountains and the ocean. With the well placed mirrors in our room, the room felt large and you could see all of these views while lying in bed. The area near the hotel is much quieter and much more relaxed than central Waikiki. We had a lovely breakfast,with an ocean view, at the shaded Hau Tree Lanai restaurant in the hotel. Everyone in our group of 4 adults enjoyed their delicious a la carte food. You should call ahead to get a good table for breakfast. We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki at the end of our trip and we preferred the New Otani.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We spent two nights at the hotel. We were very pleased with the Ocean Front Superior room. It was right on the beach with a large lanai. The morning skies were beautiful as were the sunsets too. We even saw a monk seal swim up to the shore one morning! The room was very clean and everyone was extremely courteous. Both restaurants on the property were excellent. It's away from the hustle and bustle of central Waikiki, but within a walkable distance. The peacefulness at night was nice. We are looking forward to another stay next year!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We came off a cruise and they let us check in 6 hours early and the next day check out late. They upgraded our room for free. While enjoying their shaded beach area in front of their hotel a monk seal beached. The whole experience was magical. The room was clean, large, and quiet. The lanai looked out at Diamond Head though we could have gotten a beach view. The serene courtyard in the middle of the hotel was very peaceful. Beach towels are provided, beach chairs are $5 to rent, and it’s a convenient & easy 10 minute walk to a store for beach snacks, sunscreen, etc. There was a convenience store on site. Close by was The Barefoot Cafe a Delicious on-the-beach restaurant that served breakfast, lunch, and dinner for very reasonable prices.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The location is awesome, right at the beach, with a private beach that is just like a swimmable pool and you won't have to worry about rocks unlike the rest of the wakiki beach. It's also right next to the aquarium which they have an awesome Luau, it is also 1 mile away from all the stores and restaurants and the walk there is beautiful. Nice place nearby to run or enjoy a beautiful walk.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I got a room here after returning from Maui and for our last night in Hawaii before heading home via Honolulu airport. Some of the reviews had mentioned it being a little tired in appearance and I would say partially true but I would also say still very comfortable. The inner courtyard of the upper floors is very plain and nothing to look at but it doesn't affect the comfort of the room or the overall stay. I was very impressed with the room, not deep at all but wide which is a little unusual but works with a small footprint. We had an upgraded room on the 8th floor facing Waikiki and the entire outer wall was windows. It had a balcony with a small table and a couple of chairs and provided incredible views of the entire expanse of Waikiki, the ocean and part of the inland hills, which is something you cannot get FROM Waikiki beach. We were able to get late reservations for dinner at the restaurant downstairs and everything was wonderful. Dining was outside and under trees and torch lighting, with sounds of the waves, views of the beach and views of fireworks on the other side of Waikiki (which occurs every Friday night). It was simple and romantic, convenient and a perfect way to end our Hawaiian adventure. The room was cool and the bed comfortable and I even loved the hair products they provided!!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We recently spent 2 nights at the New Otani Kiamana Beach Hotel at Diamond Head in Waikiki, Hawaii. We were on our anniversary trip, which we told them ahead of our arrival. We didn't even get a "congratulations" at the front desk! Nothing! We requested a queen bed and got two singles moved together with a hard edge through the middle. The view to Diamond Head and the mountains was nice as long as you didn't stand up, since below the beauty was the ugliest hotel roof with AC units and a car park. I guess you can enjoy it sitting down. The price seemed too high for what you get. The 14 dollar per night "resort fee" is ridiculous since this is a simple hotel with no resort facilities, no pool etc. Apparently the coffee machine with fake powder creamer provided is part of the resort fee. It's cheaper to go out for coffee! The bed was a bit hard, so we slept on top of the comforter (which you won't need unless you sleep with super high AC on). It does get very stuffy in the room without the AC, since you can't really leave the balcony door open at night due to security issues (stated in the room info pack) and a lack of bug screens. The pillows are super small and very lumpy but have standard pillow cases on them, which get all tangled and messy during sleep. I was hoping for a decent sleep before travel back home, which we didn't get. The bathroom is well stocked and has a good shower. The maid was friendly but the bellhop was a bit too pushy for my taste. Breakfast was not included but is available for a whopping $30 Us dollars, which is ridiculous considering you can find it everywhere for $10 bucks or less. The entire place is a bit old and needs and upgrade. My 500 Aussie dollars for 2 nights would've been better spent elsewhere.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is a bit out of the way but as we were on a budget we didnt mindUpon arrival they asked if we wanted to upgrage to a sea view room, we looked at the room first and instantly decided to upgrade - which was worth every bit of the extra cost. Fantastic views, watching the sunset every night was lovelyWe had breakfast in the hotel on the first day and found it a bit expensive so after that we walked along the beach and found a beachfront cafe which was more reasonableNice walk to the main beach in Waikiki, very helpful reception staff and the valet guy was a mind of useful information, very helpful

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This small hotel is a jewel at the base of Diamond Head. The hotel is not fancy but offers one of the best locations in all of Waikiki. There are two excellent restaurants on property. One on the beach, The Hau Tree Lanai and the Miyako Japanese restaurant on the second floor. I personally prefer the oceanfront rooms as the view of Waikiki is amazing

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: i had stayed at this hotel 33 years ago and shared a small room with a friend. We loved the view from the restaurant and the beach and the area near Diamond Head on the outskirts of Waikiki so away from the hustle. This time I got a deluxe oceanfront room that had beautiful views, nice lanai to sit on. Bed was a little soft but they brought a board which they put under the mattress and that worked.Reasonable price for even a deluxe room compared to many. Restaurant was still good like I remembered with beautiful view.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This place is ancient and the rooms and overall facility show it. If you're looking for a budget option it could work, but honestly avoid if at all possible. There are plenty of better value options than this.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I truly enjoyed my stay at this hotel! I paid for a moderate room (the smallest) and upon check in we were upgraded to a bigger room with a beautiful mountain view! We had no issues , until our 2nd to last day there when the air stopped working. But that was a blessing in disguise because they quickly upgraded us AGAIN to an Ocean View room with an even more spectacular view! This hotel is right on the beach! They have 2 restaurants and a bar, the restaurant outside has a great ambiance, you truly couldn't ask for a better location or scene. The beach area was quiet yet still fun, a slower pace than a mile or so up in the hustle and bustle of Wakiki (which is in walking distance as well as the shopping area in Wakiki). Also within walking distance of the Honolulu Zoo and the Aquarium. 15-30 minutes from the airport and a mall, depending on traffic. Outlet mall was like 20-30 minutes away as well. Perfect location! Rooms are nicely redone, halls and outer are clean and kept. Valet guy was friendly and informative as was the front desk staff. Ate at Hau Tree Lanai and Miyako, both great! Please do not sleep on The New Otani!!!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Booked a friend from Japan at this hotel because staff speaks some Japanese, and their service is helpful and friendly, and the room rate for a hotel directly on the beach in front of Diamond Head and across from Kapiolani Park was perfect for his stay. The Hau Tree Lanai restaurant is excellent, and picture-perfect under the native hau trees. Not the most modern appointments, but clean and tidy, and who needs a pool when the beach is right in front? Rooms are small, but all you need is a place to sleep, then head out to the beach, sightseeing and exploring! Parking via valet but reasonable, considering this is Waikiki! Considered hotels on the beach closer to Waikiki Beach but the prices and crowds were discouraging. If you like crowds and busy shopping, this hotel is not for you as the Royal Hawaiian, Sheraton, and Moana Hotels offer full resort experiences with plenty of shopping venues.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is an unpretentious property. To be honest, the lobby and common areas could use a design refresh. However, it has a well appointed bar overlooking the beach-side restaurant under the Lau trees. The layout of the place is excellent. Staff was friendly and accommodating although I did not have any special needs.My ocean-view room had an epic view. The porch spanned the length of the rom with two sliding doors for access. This was by far the best vista I have ever had in a hotel room and the room made the most of it. My room had been recently renovated and felt up to date although not particularly luxurious.The hotel is next to the War Memorial and in a very secluded end near Diamond Head (which you can walk to if you want to hike for $1), although the center of Waikiki is a mere 20 minute walk away. If you want to be close to some great parts of Honolulu without feeling like you are stuck in the middle of a city, this is the place to be.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The room wasn't extremely big but it was extremely clean!! Very quiet and the staff was extremely nice!!! We travel a lot and this was super great location but the was it was laid out you didn't feel like you were in the busy area that it was. If coming to Honolulu it's a great option.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Wife and I stayed at the The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel. This is the best kept secret in Waikiki. The staff and employees customer service was outstanding. We were minutes from the beach. The food was amazing, the room service was great, the valet was on spot.I will definitely book my stay at this great place....

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This property is located far enough away from Waikiki that you actually can get a glimpse of the slower pace of island life without denying yourself the conveniences of being located on the beach (towel service), near food (all chains) and night life. We reserved a park view, one-bedroom that included a separate living room (with comfortable sofa bed) - dining room (with wet bar, microwave, coffee maker and broken mini fridge). The hotel parking is EXPENSIVE but, unlike other Waikiki properties, you have the option to park on the street (metered, free between 6pm and 10am).

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is down the beach, closer to Diamond Head, just before condos and residential area. The views are fantastic, the rooms are clean and comfortable. While a tiny bit quieter, you can walk to so much! Downtown shopping, food, a wonderful beachfront cafe and the Waikiki Shell. (we went to a concert!) You can book all of your excursions, anything you want to do, at the tour desk in the lobby (see Tom, he will take good care of you!) The beach area is beautiful and you can snorkel right there with turtles! The restaurant is a little pricey but the food is good and atmosphere is so nice. The bartender makes a mean Mai Tai :) HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: A quiet location on Waikiki. Hard to believe it is possible, but this hotel is the exception. I'd agree with reviewers who said the rooms are upgraded but the grounds seem a little down-market. It does feel a little old. But it's a small hotel.
