One charming thing about a small hotel is that the staff gets to recognize you, so if you feel like going to the beach, just hand your room key to the front desk, grab a sand matte and a towel, and jump into the water. It's a calm, beautiful beach within eyesight of the chaos of Waikiki. So nice! We stayed on the fifth floor, in a corner deluxe oceanfront room #521 The wraparound lanai was really just one side facing the ocean and Waikiki, the other side facing the adjacent Sans Souci building south. Obviously we spent all our time on the main side. Photos say it all. It's right on the sand!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We booked this hotel for 3 nights while visiting Oahu. The hotel is close to but not too close to all the hustle and bustle of Waikiki beach (less than 10 minute walk away). The hotel has a nice beach. The only reason that I didn't give 5 stars is that they have no amenities on the beach. Especially lacking are chairs and umbrellas. The rooms are very nice. We had a junior suite type room which was very spacious. We had a nice balcony overlooking the beach and ocean. The rooms have individual A/C units and that works really well to keep the rooms cool. There are two restaurants and one bar/lounge on premises. The restaurants are ocean front (one on the ground floor one on floor 2) The food was very good and not too expensive by Hawaiian standards. Service was amazingly good and the drinks were awesome. Very friendly staff from the valet to the managers. This is a good option if you don't want a mega hotel right in the middle of the action.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We booked a package through Hawaiin Airlines and chose this hotel. What a great pick! On the Diamond Head end of Waikiki, it is quiet and away from the congestion of Waikiki. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We walked to the busier parts of Waikiki so we got to see that without the higher cost and congestion. The location is ideal for visiting Diamond Head and eastern parts of Oahu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We had a one-day layover and are not big city people, but wanted to still experience Waikiki. We chose the New Otani Kaimana Beach hotel for this reason. We also knew that we wanted to snorkel in the morning before heading to the airport at 9. Our room had a very nice ocean/Waikiki view. We checked in, and then walked towards Waikiki for dinner and dessert. We walked back and watched the Hilton fireworks from the Queens Beach pier on a Friday night. This was a nice night for us in Waikiki - not to overwhelming. The television was a bit far from the bed making it more difficult to see. The shower was fantastic temperature and water pressure. The bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows. Everything was clean. My husband did not like that there was not a fan in the bathroom, and that the door to the bathroom was a vented door...but then again, you can open the balcony up for fresh air. I do wish that there was a screen on the balcony...it wasn't so much that we thought bugs would be a problem, but more the overly friendly birds.There is no pool, but the beach is nice. It has a lifeguard on duty during the day. Also, a shower for washing off before going inside. The snorkeling was not fantastic for us at 6:00 am on a Saturday in May. While we had the beach almost to ourselves, the visibility was not good. There were fish though...just hard to see due to visibility. Did not see a lot of coral. At a total of $300 on a Friday night in May (with parking and resort fee), we had a $50 food credit which we used for breakfast...note, for two persons, the $50 credit didn't quite cover it.Overall, we don't normally spend this much on a hotel - but I suppose that is just the cost of Waikiki. It was a very nice stay...but just a bit much for our budget. I liked being on the "quiet" side of Waikiki away from the touristy/shopping area. There were still plenty of surfers/SUPers to watch. A nice walk along the beachfront too towards Waikiki.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Underwhelming experience. The location was great.We booked the hotel using an online service. Kayak.When we arrived, we were given a little tiny room right in front of the elevator. We could hear constant noise anytime the elevator was in use (through the thin walls). When we told them that we needed a room that we could sleep in, they said they didn’t have any available. They managed to find a suite upgrade for us at an additional half of the cost we were already paying. We were staying for three nights, it took us way over budget, but we would not have been able to sleep in the room that they provided.Same experience at the restaurant downstairs. We were scolded for not having a reservation. We made a reservation for 2 hours later. When we arrived they had a table in the back corner that was available. But otherwise, our reservation didn’t amount to anything. We tried to wait for a better table, but after a half an hour, we decided we were hungry enough to take the table. Our waiter was phenomenal. He was very attentive, and we enjoyed talking with him. He was the best thing about this hotel.We were given tips for parking on the street, but there are so many rules about when and where to park, that we decided to pay the $30 a night parking. The valet service was also exceptional.Rundown hotel, with a lot of little hidden upgrades that are required to make it enjoyable.If you don’t have a car, and don’t mind the room or sleeping, this would be perfect. The location and price we’re within our initial budget. If I had it to do over again, I would skip the upgrade game. Probably won’t be staying here again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: i love this hotel ,this is our second time staying there ,it is not big hotel and not new ,it is quite old ,but service is so nice ,staff all of them are so friendly to give you the felling you are home ,we will be there again in the summer because we really love it ,front office are super friendly ,not pushy for tips .welling to help ,parking is too expensive ,i wont recommend it ,,you can park outside of the hotel almost free of charge after 6.00pm to 8 or 9.00am or you can use the miter also wont cost you 30 usd ,,,.that is the only cons..Japanese restaurant very nice ,bkft also good ..
user_location: Emirate of Dubai, United Arab Emirates
user_name:
Hesham H
Emirate of Dubai, United Arab Emirates

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani (the "new" is probably a bit deceptive) ... is a great location in Waikiki away from the madding crowd but close enough to everything to feel like you are having a Waikiki holiday.Lets be clear - this hotel is old and while the rooms are very clean and functional - 5 star it is not. The staff were generally very helpful and quite old fashioned in their approach.A few key things to note:The in house restaurant has a bit of a following and can get busy - to be honest it must be because of the al fresco outlook and delightful setting because the service and the food is pretty average. Don't expect that because you are staying in the hotel that you will get some priority treatment to have breakfast - we were told very directly that we should have made a booking and that if we wanted to beat the crowds then we should get up earlier !! (made me laugh out loud). The wait staff are very fixed in their ways and you get the sense the menu has not changed in many years.We got around via Uber and it was very easy and cost effective for a family of 4.There are some great new and funky restaurants close by that are well priced with clean, fresh food off the main strip.Would I stay here again ? .... for the value ... probably.The dining and water sports options could be so much better fo such an iconic location .... I hope they can address some of this in the future.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: An older hotel east of Waikiki. It was recommended by my cousin and her husband, who liked it because it wasn't in the center of all the noise and lights. It's about a 10 - 15 minute walk east of Waikiki, in a quiet area past the park. The good: decent price, great view, uncrowded beach with excellent snorkeling, good housekeeping, several dining options on site, Russell's Convenience store downstairs, comfortable bed with good linens/towels/toiletries, and Tom the Concierge was wonderful with his advice and booking excursions! The not-so-good: front desk staff were attentive... but looked miserable most of the time, room was small and in need of either an update or some maintenance (carpet was worn, paint needed some touching up here and there, grout missing, etc.). Oh, and the valet stuff really hustled and were friendly, though we didn't use them. The quick walk to Waikiki enabled us to work off the calories a bit, as well. The good far outweighed the bad, so we'll likely stay there again on our next trip to Honolulu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This old hotel is a little bit of a hidden gem. Its a 10 min walk along the beach towards Diamond Head from the centre of Waikiki's more expensive and fancy hotels. Its never crowded, traffic noise is at a minimum and the beach is right at your feet. The hotel sports a fantastic beach restaurant, perfect for breakfasts, where you can watch surfers or sea turtles from your breakfast table, whatever you fancy. The breakfast tables tend to fill up so be sure to be there before 8 AM. There is a bar in the open air style lobby with a view over the sea and beautiful sunsets.While less expensive than the central Waikiki hotels rooms are available from a bit over 200 USD. There are taxes and fees adding around 50 USD to this. The breakfasts usually land at 30 USD each (but they are nice).

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I stayed in room 817 perfect view of Wikiki and the ocean room a bit small house peeping was on point, I would recommend this hotel.It is on the quiet side away from the hustle and bustle of Wikiki,the beach was not crowded either..

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Pleasant hotel on the beach in a quiet safe area.The restaurants are expensive but town is a quick walk or $2.75 on the bus.The rooms are clean and updated.There is a convenience store down stairs on The road with many things

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The rooms were fine but the rest of the hotel was outdated and shabby. It looked like they renovated the rooms and didn’t touch the rest of the hotel at all. In our room the walls and the doors were scuffed and marked a bit, which made it feel worn. And a small thing, but there was only one nightstand by the bed, so kind of inconvenient if there are two people sharing the bed. The first morning we went to breakfast we were scolded a little bit for not making a reservation, even though we got there when it opened and it wasn’t busy. Even though the location on the beach was great, the hotel was underwhelming. The hotel is right on the beach, and it’s away from the busy area of Waikiki, so it’s quiet. They have beach towels you can borrow, but they don’t have beach chairs or umbrellas. If we paid half as much I wouldn’t have been as disappointed, but it was not as nice as I was expecting.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We spent two nights here and were very satisfied. Reviews we read complained about the rooms being small so we elected to go with the Ocean Front Deluxe. It is a corner ocean front room with a king bed. We were high enough up to have a grand view of Waikiki. This hotel is not in the concrete sprawl that is Waikiki so don't stay here if you want to be in the middle of the action. There basically is no parking so valet parking is necessary. We don't like to spend a fortune on huge hotel breakfasts. Happily, next door to the hotel is a great convenience store that has everything from muffins to fruit and OJ.The staff was very friendly and when we needed something, the room service was very prompt.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel is a comfortable nine-story hotel with about 100 rooms just south of Waikiki near Diamond Head. My husband and I had a corner room on the fourth floor that provided a panoramic view of Waikiki Beach and downtown Honolulu, as well as a view of Diamond Head from the wrap-around balcony.The hotel is in a quiet, unhurried section of Honolulu. On-site parking is limited and is provided by valet only – for an extra daily fee ($32).The hotel is located right on the beach; it provides beach towels and mats. There’s a nice restaurant on site with beach-side outdoor seating. There’s also an enclosed traditional Japanese restaurant on the second floor fronting the ocean. It’s about a 20-minute walk to the main Waikiki area where there are plenty of restaurants.The toilet in our room was an automated, heated device that purred when you sat on it. It made me want to do my business quickly before something unexpected happened. It was supposed to be a deluxe feature, but without a user’s manual, I wasn’t sure what to make of it!My husband and I chose this hotel for our 3-day stay because we prefer small, quiet hotels and we love the beach. If you desire a livelier experience and want to be close to the action, a hotel on Waikiki Beach would suit your needs much better.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We arrived to our hotel late morning, and were pleased it was already available for us. They also easily accommodated a trundle bed.The room had been recently renovated, and was like a small serviced apartment, with a small kitchenette and dining space and separate bedroom.The room looked out onto the park, and could see the beach.Whilst not in downtown Waikiki, it was nice to be slightly removed, but easily walkable along the promenade.We could also walk up to Diamond Head from our hotel (about 2.5hrs return trip).The internet worked great, bed was comfortable, shower was good (although not adjustable angle/height).The only issue we had were being on a slightly separate wing, we didn’t find an elevator, which was a bit annoying with our bags.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Let me preface my review by saying I booked a superior room based on reading past reviews. I had a Waikiki / Beach corner room which had amazing views. Whilst the hotel hallways were a little dated (I really didn’t mind as I was only using them to get to and from my room) they were clean and the size of my room was decent, very clean and bright. Staff were great, I didn’t eat at either of the restaurants, however they were full each time I walked through so I’m assuming they were good. The New Otani Kaimana isn’t a five star hotel so if you’re looking for a big hotel with lots of frills and amenities this isn’t the place for you, however if you’re looking for more of a boutique hotel that has a great beach front location, right next to the park at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki (which does mean its a 10 to 15 minute walk into the main drag) which feels a little like what it must have felt like staying in a quieter Waikiki 30 years back then this is the place for you.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you want the wonderful beach experience of Waikiki but would rather avoid the available anywhere else in the world commercial congestion of the main part of Waikiki, i recommmend this property.separated by the green of Kapiolani Park from the more commercial part of Waikiki, this hotel is either a 15 minute park/beachside walk or 5 minute taxi ride from the bright lights of the main hotel district.there is nothing between this hotel and the beach aka beachfront!. compared to other larger properties this is a more intimate property which is well known to local Hawaiians as the Hau Tree Restaurant is a favourite for birthdays, anniversaries and other special occasions.The public spaces, lobby, reception, reading area and cocktail lounge are all comfortable and overlook the beach and/or the historic Hau tree.i always choose an oceanfront room with a direct view of the pacific ocean , the setting sun and the beach itself. it's always a pleasure to sit out on the spacious lanaithe room is large enough for both a sleeping and sitting area, all fronted by glass and sliding doorsthe beach is favoured by local ocean swimmers as there is a break in the reef opposite the hotel. the adjacent park fills up with local families and friends gathering that often offer an invite to passersby coming up from the beach.the rooms are comfortably contemporary in design and the large ensuite have good size bathtub/shower combosthe restaurant is a treat and generally full of hotel guests and local for breakfast lunch and dinner which is well prepared and served in a friendly manner

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I had a suite with ocean view , it was very nice . Full kitchen set up with living roomWasher and dryer! All the employees were kind and helpful .. shout out to Chet the valet guy who always found the time to give me directions., employees are great they were very attentive.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed four nights in February of 2018, probably would not go back again.We asked for 2 separate beds in our reservation which was confirmed as such. When we arrived, we were told such a room was not available. My wife has problems sleeping and gets up a lot, waking me up if we're in the same bed. It was uncomfortable but since we had no choice, took the room with a bed and got a roll away bed as well. It was manageable but tight, and the next night a room we wanted opened up. But this did not start things off on a good note.Came here wanting a more reasonably priced alternative to the Outrigger and other hotels down in the denser tourist area of Waikiki, and it was a little less expensive but in the end, I will pay more in the future rather than putting up with this kind of service and lack of communication.This colored our view of the place, which had good points like the open air lobby, nice location, quieter than being in the busy Waikiki area, and we enjoyed breakfasts (not free) in the downstairs restaurant sitting by the beach, and had a nice time at the upstairs bar once having a second dinner there which was good.The room was okay, nice and simple, but the common area corridors were pretty run-down. Overall, if we forgot about the initial room error experience, it would have been a decent value for what we paid. I would recommend it to someone who wants to pay a little less yet get the Waikiki experience with a Japanese hotel chain.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We had a couple of nights here on our first stay in Honolulu. The location was perfect being on a beach next to Waikiki so 15 mins walk to all the action but in a much less frenetic environment and where the beach did not get crowded. The room was a good size and comfortable with all the services you would expect. What really made the stay was the friendliness of the staff and willingness to help (the concierge in particular was very helpful with our many queries). Also a great and reasonably priced breakfast in the hotel’s restaurant on the beach, though you do need to book.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: In town for a memorial service. Not a big fan of the crowds and noise of Waikiki. Room was quiet and well appointed, parking is easy and two good restaurants on site. Only negative is the hallways outside the room need to be updated as they are a bit worn.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Our hosts made the recommendation to stay at the New Otani because it was away from the busiest section of Waikiki. It was a great recommendation, it's still only a 10-15 min walk to the heart of Waikiki if that is what you want. The rooms are a bit small, but the location is great. The food is a bit pricey in the restaurants (especially) breakfast, but the food was very good and the views are wonderful. I would recommend stopping at the convenience store (which is virtually attached to the hotel) for breakfast items, etc.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I just spent 4 nights at New Otani. We really enjoyed our stay. Every person we interacted with, from the Valet, to the receptionist, to the bellman, was kind and helpful. We found our room (ocean Superior rm 318) to be quite comfortable and with wonderful views straight out to the beach and ocean. Our room was roomy enough for two of us but I did notice on the fire escape map, that there are great variances between room sizes, so do your homework when you book and pay attention to sq footage. I had read on previous reviews that some parts of the hotel could do with a little TLC and we did notice that. There were parts of our room that could have used a new coat of paint and the halls need to be re-papered or painted. Also I noticed in the lobby that some of the floor and ceiling tiles need to be addressed. Having said all of that, I would stay here again without hesitation. Its location away from the busy end of Waikiki was much appreciated. We also appreciated having a restaurant on site.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Great location on the beach, (which was never crowded, and also frequented by locals, which to me is a good thing) and in a quiet area (relatively). A 15-20 minute stroll takes you to the Royal Hawaiian, which is about the centre of the Waikiki strip. The hotel is an older building in which much refurbishment has been done. I had one of the cheapest rooms (below $200 a night) on the 7th floor - small, but clean and up-dated and had a lanai....and I never heard my neighbors during the 5 nights I was there...:) Wi-fi was free - I never even turned on the the 32" TV. Staff was pleasant, especially the doormen. If they aren't busy, they are happy to "talk story" with you.Food and beverage were of good quality. Be aware that breakfast can sometimes get very busy....however, a convenience store attached to the hotel has all kinds of breakfast needs - cereal, yogurt, coffee, fresh fruit (including papayas!) at reasonable (read "cheap") for Waikiki. You can buy your breakfast there and walk across the street to Kapiolani Park, where there are picnic tables to enjoy your morning repast.Would absolutely stay here again....

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed in a one queen sized bedroom over the entrance - not the greatest view, but there on a bird watching tour and there were many from my window. Quiet, everything you need - very comfortable, newspaper every day, very pretty garden courtyard - the on site Hau Tree Lanai restaurant has a delicious menu - adjacent to pretty park and easy walking - also adjacent to pretty beach I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Great location easy walk to the busier part of the beach with restaurants. Our room was tiny!!! We had no idea the room would be so small. Although we were on the beach, we wished they had a pool. The views of Diamond Head were amazing!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My sister and I had to travel for a conference to Oahu. We came across the New Otani Kaimana Hotel. Absolutely the best decision we made for 1st time visiting the island. We chose their ocean view rooms & there are no words to describe the wonderful ocean views we were able to take in while there. The fact they had their own restaurant on location not to mention you get to have your dinner or breskfast at eye's view of the ocean just seals the deal. If and when we get to travel back, we are definitely coming back to stay here.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is a fantastic find! Wonderful staff, very clean. The Diamond Head wing, where I stayed, has been remodeled to fantastic standards. Hau Tree Lanai and bar is a great place for dining and enjoying a cocktail at the end of the day. This is going on my list of places to stay in Honolulu!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Spent two nights at this economical hotel on the east side on Waikiki Beach in Honolulu. The hotel staff was welcoming, and the amenities were good. Our room was tiny, with little room for our bags. But for the price, we believe we got very good value.
user_name:
Peter K
Cockeysville Hunt Valley, Maryland

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This Japanese-owned Hotel is very well-run. The staff couldn't be more accommodating the rooms and the hotel spaces are clean and well-kept. The beach is very convenient, and also kept very clean. A very enjoyable experience, if you can live without luaus, Hawaiian dancers, and tiki torches.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I stayed at the New Otani for a full week, mostly on business but also a couple of days vacation. This is a perfectly fine hotel. I have no real complaints but a few very minor “dislikes” (none of which would keep me from coming back). The rooms are on the smallish side (compared to most modern hotels) but are clean and spacious enough for a single person or couple. I wasn’t in the room much except for sleeping anyway (this is Hawaii after all). I’m not a big fan of the louvered doors on the bathrooms though. I really like the individual wall-mounted A/C unit in each room to get the temperature just to your liking, but it was hard to find the exact vane position where it didn’t blow directly on some part of the bed (note to staff: clean the vanes of the A/C units periodically). Each room has a small balcony with chairs and table. The rest of the hotel was very clean, bright, and airy. The restaurant and bar are good but a little pricey (but on par with other places in this area) and all the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is right on the beach (although my room overlooked the neighboring parking lot and buildings but at the right angle I had a great view of Diamond Head). The beach is right out front and the resort fee includes the use of beach towels, mats, etc. with all sorts of additional recreational water gear that you can rent. Perhaps the biggest drawback, or asset depending on how you see it, is the distance from other restaurants and shops. It’s about a 15 minute walk to the edge of the main part of Waikiki which made it a little inconvenient to pop out someplace other than the hotel to get something to eat but also was nice that you are away from the hubbub of the city. The Barefoot Beach Café’ is a little closer and the breakfasts that I had there were great. So, all in all, if I head back to Waikiki I will definitely consider the New Otani for lodging.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The best thing about this hotel was that it is right near the Outrigger Canoe Club, if you can organise access (perhaps with reciprocal rights as we did), because it has excellent facilities. Be well aware that this hotel is about 3km for the heart of Waikiki, and it has few other tourist facilities such as restaurants nearby.We had a corner room facing Diamond Head (ie inland not beach) as it was the most suitable room for a family of 4. The room was ok, and very clean.We didn't use the restaurants or facilities at the hotel, although they didn't look too inviting. Service was average, the whole place was a 3 star standard.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Located at the north end of the main drag in Waikiki, easy walk along the beach. Excellent restaurant right on the beach with great service. We booked the Diamond Head deluxe room, had a great view as long as you look out, down below is a large parking lot. We had an amazing wrap around deck that we used a lot. The Lotus hotel is also in your view, they have an unobstructed view of the mountain. Large sitting area and comfy bed.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Excellent location and serviceI had here with my family of 6 for 13 nights and the place is beautifulThe management and staff are great, congratulations to John Pierre for his outstanding commitment to the serviceThe hotel is on the beach and perfectly located 10 minutes rom Wakiki shops which means privacy from the noise and busyness of the touristsThe restaurants are superior and the rates are reasonable to stay

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Spent 9 great days at this hotel. Very nice, very comfortable, great atmosphere, very professional and courteous employees. The restaurant has great food, deserts, drinks, and very respectful,courteous, friendly,and professional wait staff. The same goes for the lounge. Great drinks and very friendly atmosphere. Overall a Great place to stay!!!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Nice hotel and bit further down the street from the chaos that Waikiki can be. Decent food but a bit over priced. Nice staff. Great also that its on a beach which has a lively and relaxing mix of locals and tourists. Its also across from the park.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you'd like to walk from your hotel room to the great beach in two minutes - this is your place. We stayed there for the last 10 years in December-January. We tried some other hotels in Honolulu, including Hilton Hawaii Village, just to check them out, but would always return to New Otani. Without a doubt - the best place on Waikiki stretch.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This was a first stay for us although we have stayed at this quiet "Diamond Head " end of Waikiki before. If you do not rent a car or cab it, this is a more challenging location. Most restaurants are a mile further along in central Waikiki. We like that because we were clocking lots of walking and felt less guilty about all the dining out . One drawback was finding ackoseby option other than the hotel restauraunt/bar for breakfast. Hotel staff varied in their willingness to let us take a bar irdered kunch out to the beach although locals were at the beach with their own box lunches.The hitel room we had was small but very comfortable dwell kept. Higher priced rooms look out on one of the best beach views on the south shore. A beach protected by a reef made swimming very safe. Several days we were treated to seeing a monk seal snoozing for hours on the beach. The restauraunt is open air with beach view and lovely shade trees we would return again but wish we had our own kitchen. This is close to the aquarium and just a little farther is the zoo. Lots of free tennis courts nearby and backs onto Kapuolani Park. Beach is less populated than other Waikiki areas.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel was nice, it's an older hotel away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Honolulu. Very close to Diamond Head. Our room was nice, the service was excellent. It's on the beach, within walking distance to downtown, the zoo, aquarium, a really nice park. If you like to walk, it's a nice walk to diamond head! The food was good at the hotel restaurants. Breakfast was a tad pricey but...again the food was good!! I would stay here again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: To preface this review, I will say this—my boyfriend has worked in hotels for 30 years and I have worked in customer service roles (food + beverage industry) for over 10 years. We really value good customer service and supporting smaller, local hotels. We know it’s a hard job so we try to be as understanding as possible. This review covers our five days/four nights at the New Otani. We were there from Saturday 12/30/17 until Thursday 01/04/18.Bellman:My boyfriend and I spent the month at Sans Souci next door and wanted to check into this hotel for the last leg of our trip. Since we are planning to spend future winters in Hawaii, we especially wanted to make sure this hotel would be a good one to recommend to friends while they visit us. It shares a parking lot with Sans Souci so it seemed like the perfect choice.We called New Otani to see if a bellman could help us move our luggage from our condo to the hotel. They were used to this request and Chris (our bellman) came up to our condo, loaded our luggage, and took it to our hotel room. Chris is amazing! He is so friendly and really made us laugh. He made a great impression and definitely set the hotel up for success, in terms of our experience. Check in:We walked over to check into the hotel, only to immediately encounter a rude interaction with the front desk receptionist, Aki. Perhaps it was the language barrier, but she was very condescending. She also paused in the middle of checking us in in order to enthusiastically help another guest. We took note of her name and decided to just go to our room to unwind. Americano run:Once we got to our room, my boyfriend started getting a caffeine headache. He requested I get him an Americano from the bar while he gets some work done. No problem, so I went downstairs to the hotel bar + restaurant to get him an Americano. The espresso machine was behind the bar so, naturally, I went to the bar. What I did not expect was the bartender to look at me like I was barged into her room as soon as I stepped foot into the restaurant. The look was seriously a cross of “what TF do you want” and “you don’t belong here.” There were 3 people at the bar—2 European women, 1 European man. Yet she made me feel like a pariah. I later learned her name is Lori. Nevertheless, I politely asked her for an Americano. I had my hand on the bar chair to pull it out and sit down while I waited for my beverage. Before I could move it, she aggressively told me that I could take a seat at the table and a waiter would help me. She then rolled her eyes and began to ask the woman seated closest to me if she needed anything. Ooookay. The waiter witnessed all of this yet he didn’t say or do anything. I go to a table a couple of feet away from the bar and look up at the waiter. We make eye contact and he looks away to look at the bartender. They share a look and a few words. He looks back at me and again looks away. After a minute (it felt much longer) he finally comes over. He hands me a menu and asks what I would like. I order the Americano and the check. At this point, I felt so hurt and humiliated. I was treated like rift raft meanwhile witnessing other patrons receiving good service. I asked myself if it was my clothes—shorts & a tank top—but it’s a beach front hotel in Hawaii, everyone is dressed similarly. The only thing that separated me from the people at the bar is the color of my skin. The waiter came back with the Americano and the bill. I asked him if I could take it up to my room, signed off on the bill, and left. For the first time in my life, I did not tip. Aftermath:I went up to my hotel room and felt like crying. I’m not a sensitive woman, but I haven’t had an interaction like that in a long time. Especially not in a establishment that we were spending quite a bit of money on during peak season. My boyfriend could tell I was upset and after a few moments, I told him what happened. He immediately recognized her behavior as wildly inappropriate. He went downstairs to talk to a manager. He was met with what could only be described as incompetence. No managers available and a promise to pass along his message for a chat with the dining manager, Ted. That would have to do for now. He came back upstairs, I took a shower, and we went on with our day.Bedtime:We were determined to try to make the best of the day (and the rest of our stay). The lanai in our ocean view room was beautiful. We loved looking at the water while chatting and enjoying each other’s company. As we were getting ready for bed, I playfully fell backwards onto the bed with a huge yawn. As soon as I opened my eyes, I saw more than 100+ bugs flying along the ceiling. Shocked, I began to look around and noticed they were all along the walls, in my cup of water, in the bed sheets, and pillows. Horrified, I jumped out of bed and got my boyfriend’s attention. I pointed out the bugs and began to feel itchy. He called the front desk. Apparently they were having a gnat infestation and did not bother to tell us upon check in. Not once did they apologize. Instead they tried to make it seem like it was our fault for using the lanai. Luckily, they sent over housekeeping and they vacuumed up a good chunk of the gnats. Falling asleep after that was very difficult and I shudder to think what else we would have found if we had a black light.Ted:My boyfriend and I continued our stay, although every hotel was booked so we didn’t have much of a choice. Upon returning from lunch, my boyfriend went up to the desk and asked to speak to Ted. Ted was within earshot to he turned and said, “yeah, I’m Ted.” We introduced ourselves and asked if he received our message from the day before. He did not. I’m not quite sure how to describe Ted, but he is a much older man. During the conversation he had a blank look on his face. Quite frankly, he doesn’t know what is going on and doesn’t seem all there. His speech was very slow and he seemed confused. It appears that his employees take advantage of that. He left to speak to Lori. He came back and stated that she “doesn’t recall” that interaction and that there was a misunderstanding. My boyfriend tells him that’s not an acceptable answer, especially because the situation was pretty straight forward. Again, Ted says it was a misunderstanding. My boyfriend repeats that he will not accept that as a valid excuse then asks for the general managers name. Finally Ted apologizes “on behalf of Lori.” We asked for the general managers name again. Ted tells us his name is “Mr. Celebrate.” Huh? Ted tells us he’ll be back on Tuesday. My boyfriend tells Ted our room number and asks him to set up a meeting with the four of us. We go back to our room and I tell my boyfriend that I’m pretty sure the GM’s name is Jean-Pierre. I read it somewhere but wasn’t completely sure. We look up his name & it’s Jean-Pierre Cercillieux. Either Ted didn’t know his manager’s name or he gave us a fake name. I’m leaning towards he didn’t know his name or how to pronounce it. I hate to say it but incompetence has become a trend here with the staff. The exceptions being the bellmen, valets, and the housekeeping staff. They were and continued to be amazing and kind—were the highlight of our stay.Ted failed to set up a meeting with Jean-Pierre and I suspect he never even tried to set up a meeting. He and my boyfriend played phone tag with Ted. Ted left us a message Tuesday afternoon while we were out, my boyfriend returned the message the following morning. Ted was not there when we checked out on Thursday.Gnats Attack:Our room got progressively worse with the gnats. We no longer left water cups by our bed, and had a nightly “ritual” of having someone come up to vacuum as many gnats as they could with a handheld vacuum. We often laughed and joked with them as they vacuumed the gnats. We thanked them profusely every night and tipped them for their time (as we should). By Wednesday, the gnats became out of control. I attached photos of them in a corner above the bed. That night Jonathan was helping up and he stopped vacuuming a quarter of the way through. He said there were way too many gnats and suggested we ask the front desk to move us. He saw the gnats all over the bed and in the sheets. He was so sweet and was very concerned. I called the front desk and told the male on the phone that Jonathan suggested we changed rooms. He responded with “oh okay. I’ll take a look at the rooms available.” I should mention that we had to call them every night so the gnats would get vacuumed and not once did we receive an apology from the front desk. The only ones that showed pride in the hotel & genuinely felt bad were the men that came up to vacuum the gnats. Thank you, gentlemen, we appreciate you. Oh and shout out to Gemma for being our housekeeper and doing a fantastic job with our room everyday. My mom is a custodian, it’s not an easy job. We appreciate you!New room:Jonathan took care of the entire room change and came back up to our room with keycards. We couldn’t help but think that THAT is how a manager should respond. He saved the evening. He showed my boyfriend the room while I packed my suitcases back up. Jonathan got us an ocean view suite with an 180° view of the ocean. Honestly, I wish we could have enjoyed it more but this was the worst hotel experience of our life. During the walk down to see the new room, Jonathan asked my boyfriend about our stay. He is the first person in the hotel that asked either one of us that question. My boyfriend was honest with him about our experience. Jonathan felt really bad and we could tell he really wanted to redeem it for us. Unfortunately it was our last night and a little too late. Huge thank you to Jonathan for trying to salvage the trip for us. The view was beautiful. We speculated about what our experience would have been like if we spent every night in this suite instead. Honestly, the room was spacious and the view was spectacular. However the sink was somehow cracked and resealed, the paint was chipping, and there were weird, dirty smudge marks all over the walls. Also the bathroom was painted blue while the room was green. For a hotel that was recently remodeled, it seemed a little run down with seemingly new furniture.There were still gnats in the suite due to the infestation but it wasn’t as bad as our previous room. We went to sleep knowing this nightmare was almost over. Checking out:Chris helped us with our luggage again. He brightened up our morning with his positivity. Both he and Jonathan should be promoted—they are the only ones that actually care about the hotel and the guests. Checking out was relatively painless. Not a single apology was offered over the hostility we encountered nor the gnat infestation. I looked over the bill while my boyfriend called the Lyft. Chris and the valet loaded our luggage into the Lyft and cheerfully sent us on our way, wishing us safe travels. We let out a huge sigh of relief as our Lyft driver drove us away. We survived.P.S. Avoid the restaurant. The servers are nice but aren’t well trained. They don’t know anything about their wine list. The bottle red we got was barely drinkable (even with a decanter).The mushrooms in the mushroom soup were undercooked; I only took two bites, my boyfriend was starving so he took it down. We had to go to another restaurant nearby after we paid for the meal because we were still hungry & didn’t trust anything on the menu. New Otani, unfortunately Sans Souci shares a parking lot with you so we’ll be seeing you again next year. However, in the future, we will not make the mistake of dining or staying with you.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Magnificent view of Waikiki on the water next to Diamond Head. Rooms are small and beautifully acquainted and clean. Long-time staff so friendly. Sitting on our lanai watching people swim and play below. Easy walk to shops. This will always be our go-to Honolulu hotel (2nd stay).

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We arrived to the hotel early with very little time to spare before heading to friends’ wedding photo shoot that was put on right next door. And we had just been on flights for close to 20 hours, having spent Xmas in Paris. The staff did everything in their power to accommodate an early checkin for a much needed shower. They didn’t need to do that as our checkin time was 3pm, but they went the extra mile. Our entire experience there was great. It was good being out of the intensity of Waikiki, and being able to enjoy a nice beach in front of the hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I booked for 5 nights to celebrate our honeymoon. The room is completely small. From the bed one step to the right there is the window and one step to the left and there is a wall but two step to the front and there is the table much bigger here lol. Also a little view to the ocean on the floor #3. I think you see this not what you expect for a honeymoon and completely different from the picture I booked. I was in a position so all the rooms on the right and left can see my balcony and bed if I let the curtains open. I tried to change for another room but they want to charge $79 extra per day for an other room with just a Mountain View. So I decided to stay in the same room and not spend more money. Plus they charge extra fees when we check out. For the price I pay in this hotel I could have found something much better. No way I can go back to this place.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We spent two nights here and had a wonderful experience. It overlooks Waikiki, but is quiet and away from the hustle of Waikiki. Our room was upgraded at no charge to the Queen Kapiolani Suite which was beautiful and spacious. The floor to ceiling windows in the room and bathroom were absolutely incredible.the staff was extremely courteous and helpful. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The room we booked was definitely on the small size. What the room lacked in size was made up for with quality service, a comfortable bed and the balcony with fantastic views of the beach and ocean. The size of the room was not a problem for us. We made a reservation for breakfast at the hotel's outdoor beachfront restaurant. It was expensive but very nice and in my opinion worth the extra splurge. We also enjoyed happy hour at the bar with appetizers. A daily resort fee was added to the price of the room which included use of beach towels, internet and daily newspaper. The hotel sits on a quiet beach near the Diamond Head district. There is a pleasant park nearby for evening strolls. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here. Stay at the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel if you are looking for a quieter beach in a park- like setting away from the busy stretch of Waikiki.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We booked a double room, however when we arrived, we found out the room is pretty small. The beds are single-sized bed, which are smaller than my expectation. We were in room 429 for 2 nights. There were big loud banging noise and it continued for both nights. After our first night, I made a complain, was told that someone will come up to fix the door next to our room. However, the problem was not fixed and there were no follow ups at all, so we had to sleep with the big bang noise again. Location is ok, not the best, still had to walk 13 minutes to get to the beach.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is a all time great value as the rate was a fraction of other hotels that sis not have the same ambiance. Yes the lobby is not all marble and the the hotel is smaller, but is located directly on the beach and the corner rooms offer great views of Waikiki. Quiet and good beach that is not overly crowded on week days.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We wanted a quiet hotel on the water and near Waikiki amenities which was relatively reasonably priced for short 4-day holiday to celebrate our 29th wedding anniversary. The New Otani was absolutely the right choice. Not only is it on the beach, it is also set in a big regional park with loads of trees and even young people training and playing soccer and dancers practicing their routines. We had a standard room, which was small but perfectly formed. The balcony with sliding doors was a wonderful bonus. (With the doors open, it was a little noisy from a fan down on the ground and when they cleared the bins some early mornings, but hey not a problem, really).The staff in the bar/light meals area as well as the fancier restaurant below were lovely. Our final meal in the restaurant couldn't have been more romantic. The food was absolutely delicious and the wait-lady lovely. The sliver of a moon, the lapping of the waves and the lights of Waikiki curving off into the distance completed the picture.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Always love staying at this hotel because of the quiet and relaxed feel near Diamond Head. Ocean swimming at Kaimana Beach is perfect and you may see a turtle or Hawaiian Monk Seal. It is a good place to launch walks or jogging.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed here looking for an alternative to the hustle & bustle of tourists on Waikiki row. The hotel is located on SANs Souci beach, which is on the far side of the aquarium, zoo and park towards Diamondhead. The hotel is right on the beach, good for swimming, not so much for snorkeling. The beach itself is kept very clean and there is a freshwater shower right at the entrance. Very convenient for washing off the saltwater. The room had a great ocean view of Waikiki with outdoor balcony to our delight. Room was on the small side, but very efficient in the layout. Comfy bed, extra pillows if you ask, L’Occitaine products, bath robes, refrigerator & coffee maker. It was a 15 minute pleasant walk in through the park to Duke’s statue, shopping, restaurants and ABC stores. There are also good public tennis courts within a 5 minute walk of the hotel. We enjoyed the hotel and it’s location very much and would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I spent the first 4 days of our Hawaiian honeymoon at the new otani on one of the suites we had an amazing view of Waikiki and the Pacific ocean from both the main room and also from the extremely large window in the bathroom (that also had a electric blind for privacy if wanted), the room was wonderful and the bathroom was something that was modern and classic, has a seperate deep soaking tub and stand alone shower and exceptionally clean, it is one of the more recently renovated rooms and you can see a lot of thought has gone into it.The check in was very easy and smooth and our room was ready early which was very much appreciated after a 14 hour flight and a 3 hour delay at our stop over in SydneyWe were greeted with a welcoming hamper in our room from management congratulating us on our recent nuptials which was wonderfulThe bar downstairs serves a variety of tasty bar snacks, cocktails and beers and has the best Mai Tai on the island, exceptionally well balanced and if you're able to, I definitely recommend strolling down to the hotel to try it!The breakfast at the restaurant was amazing, I would book a table everyday of your stay, the portions are very generous, if you order the pancakes, I would highly recommend sharing as they are huge!I would also like to mention the exceptional service from a staff member we received during our breakfast on 2 of the mornings we enjoyed with the hotel, I think his name was Chad, he was lovely, such a cheerful and helpful team member, and was able to give us some information for our trip to big island which was very much appreciated, very lucky to have such a wonderful team member like him on your staff!It is only a 10 minute walk to the main Waikiki strip, either via the beach or on the path by the road, the beach at the hotel is lovely and quiet, making it feel very relaxing, there is a surf lifesaver posted there so its great if you are cautious about that kind of thing and the sunsets there are so wonderfulBook one of the suite as you get more for your money then u would in the Centre of Waikiki, we had the queen kapiolani and it was magical to wake up to that view every morningThe staff are all kind, helpful and extremely aloha, and when we come back to Waikiki we will definitely return to the new otani Waikiki

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We found this hotel online, looking for a place to stay on the beach, away from the city. It is perfect, by Diamond Head, just past Waikiki. On our morning visit to the beach, we were greeted by a full rainbow, from the the tall Waikiki buildings to the ocean in front of our hotel. The service has been friendly, attentive, and prompt. Dinner at one of the restaurants, the Hau Tree Lanai, was superb (have not tried the Japanese restaurant in the hotel yet). The view from our room includes Waikiki in the distance, sunset on the ocean, and the length of beach in between. The beach in front of the hotel is uncrowded and clean, a perfect getaway for us. The rooms each have balconies and a table to work at, though our room is small. Since we love Mother Nature, the beautiful Pacific with a warm sandy beach at our front door, and a friend hotel staff, it suits us to a T.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I stayed here October 2016 and it was very beautiful with a touch of old Hawaii. Our room was a renovated and newer room with an ocean view. It wasn't the biggst of rooms but it held our suitcase had a couch and queen size bed. This hotel has no pool but does have a private beach which is quiet and the waves are calm. We noticed that the rest of the hotels were loud and super crowded. It is also at the end of the Waikiki strip away from the craziness but not far enough where you couldn't walk to or take a quick uber to everthing. The hotel has a great restaurant available for breakfast and a great dinner with great ocean views. It is also really close and across from Diamond head. Just fyi if you book any tours, you will be the last stop to be picked up or dropped off. It also was fairly close to the airport. There was very little noise if any at all, we always slept comfortably. I would also recommend dinner at the surfs club next door for a romantic ocean view dinner. There are also towels and beach mats provided for guests at the beach. Close to a lot great restaurants and all of the ABC stores which you can get snacks and gifts and anything you need really.
user_name:
Vtravels5050
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My sister and I both had an ocean view room. Room 716 has an amazing view towards Waikiki, the ocean and the park. Room 720 is a view straight out to the ocean. Both wonderful clean rooms, totally updated with lovely granite / vessel top sinks in the bathrooms and clean, clean clean! As noted in previous reviews the ocean view rooms are a bit small BUT perfect for a single. I think if I was sharing a room I would go one step up for a little more space but other wise both my sister and I can say nothing negative about the rooms. We both enjoyed going down to breakfast at Hau Tree Restaurant in the hotel. IF they are busy don't worry they will let you eat in the lounge which we much preferred. The staff as noted in many reviews are the best of the best. Aloha and kindness and helpful and fun! This is a wonderful hotel to stay at away from Waikiki and all the homeless and noise. It is not luxury but it is a beautiful hotel! I walked daily at sunrise from the hotel up to the lighthouse and sometimes through the residential area in Diamond Head that has many historic homes. The beach in front of the hotel is never crowded and an easy place to swim. I really think you'll love it here. We would stay here again in a heart beat! Thank you Otani!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you want to stay just outside of Waikikiby Diamond Head this hotel is perfect. Great staff. Great air conditioner. Close to sweet kids beach. Bus transportation, taxi, Uber/lyft. All hereFamous Superb restaurant . Everything is good.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Love the location!! No garbage trucks, party animals or annoying city noises..Fantastic beach out front. Super friendly, helpful staff. Love the shower and amenities. Exercised daily with jaunts to busy Wakiki.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: You can't beat the view great hotel staff is very nice goo restaurant downstairs.A wonderful place to relax just a block or 2 off Waikiki beach so it not crazy wonderful place to relax and chill.Shhh monk seals share da beach with us and her new baby!!!!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Lovely location and friendly staff. Well worth the money to get ocean views. Has an amazing restaurant on the beach level. Plenty of parking available as well as valet. I was lucky and able to find a room last minute with out reservations but it was in February.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I really like this hotel! I stumbled on the hotel at the last minute & Im glad I took a risk. It's about a mile away from all the action in downtown Waikiki-and that's a good thing. I'm a big "walker", so my morning walk to downtown took about 15 minutes. Your on a great beach of your own that is never crowded. When you go to bed at night it is completely quiet! It's not opulent or fancy, but more than adequate. All the staff were very friendly & professional. I paid 70.00 more a night when I got there (over my hotels.com) for an ocean view room & it was great. The 15 minute walk to downtown is though an interesting park that is quite a pleasant stroll. I would highly recommend this place.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: this hotel is wonderful. I can't figure out why its not higher rated. Our room was clean, and they upgraded us for free to the oceanfront deluxe room, which was spectacular. We had wonderful views of the ocean, could hear the waves crashing onto shore, could walk right down to swim in the ocean, and the restaurant is basically on the sand with trees for shade. The best is its not in downtown crazy Waikiki, but its about a 7 minute walk to it. There is a lovely park across the street and you can stroll up to Waikiki so easy. Don't need a car here and its expensive to park it here. I'd stay here again for sure but without a car next time. The food in the restaurants was good, nothing to write home about, but good and the view, well, you can't ask for better. The hotel was super clean and the bar downstairs facing the ocean was good. The concierge was super nice, and overall, I'd give this 5 stars. The winds blowing through the hotel lobby is so nice.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I just came back from Hawaii and was lucky enough to stay at this hotel when we arrived and then again before returning home; we went to Maui in between. This hotel is beautiful and has amazing room views that are worth the extra couple of bucks. The hotel is situated at the end of Waikiki beach which if you like a little more quiet, is definitely a plus. It is also in front of Diamond head which means you have two amazing views (volcano and beach). The rooms are very nice and spacious. This is also a pretty affordable hotel considering it's on the beach. There's a little walking (10 minute walk) distance to the main part of Waikiki but nothing crazy.The staff is great. They upgraded us to the corner ocean/diamond head view room which had a wrap around balcony for no extra charge. The view was insane!!! I would definitely recommend staying here to all!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The reason we chose this hotel was because of its location and beach. The crazy scene that is Wakiki was not what we were looking for in a place to lay our weary heads. New Otani had good food and cocktails. They were generous with their beach towels. The small connivence store on the premises was a good place to pop into for snacks and beer.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Our return visit to the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel was even better than our previous visits. The beach and ocean were delightful with perfect weather and less swimmers than the busier part of Waikiki Beach. We split our stay with a trip to the outer islands. Our first room was an Ocean View one, with fabulous vistas of the beach, Waikiki skyline and sunsets. The second room, Diamond Head View, was lovely too. We looked over Diamond Head, Honolulu and the beautiful mountains. This room has been updated and was a bit bigger than the Ocean room. As always the management and staff were very friendly and helpful. On our last night, we enjoyed a delicious dinner with friends at the Hau Tree Lanai Restaurant, just metres from the ocean on a perfect Hawaiian evening. lf you're looking for a boutique hotel at the quieter end of Waikiki, you'll love the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: They say that location is the most important consideration when buying real estate. It's certainly as important when choosing a hotel for a stay in Waikiki. And the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel has the perfect location for a visit to Honolulu. It's a few hundred yards away from the crowded beaches and the congestion of Waikiki, sits right at the base of Oahu's iconic Diamond Head crater, and is smack on a perfect uncrowded beach. The rooms are on the small size, but they're well designed and you're not going to be spending a lot of time in there anyway. The hotel staff is excellent and most have been with the hotel for years.A feature attraction of the hotel is the Hau Tree Lanai, an outdoor restaurant with tables set under a canopy of ancient branches that once shaded Robert Louis Stevenson on his visit to these islands. The food is excellent, the setting is incomparable and reservations, even for hotel guests, are essential because this restaurant is a favorite spot for local residents, especially for Sunday brunch. As a Hawaii residents for more than 50 years now living on Maui, the Kaimana Beach Hotel is where we stay whenever we return to Oahu for a visit. It's the location; it's the beach, it's the hotel staff, and it's the Hau Tree Lanai. An incomparable combination.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I Have been going here for the last 15 years . All of the staff care deeply the you are comfortable and makes sure to meet all of your needs. I have been working with Kunchana for years..she's so professional, yet kind and makes sure your needs are met.. The bellmen are the best in the world...they have been at this hotel for years..the hotel is beautiful inside and out. The best beach right in front of you

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I love thus side of Waikiki-- serene, quiet and way beautiful. Easy 15 minute walk to the madness of Waikiki strip.Small front desk area. Nice lounge.Towels and mats nearby for beach use. Beach chairs: they charge...that's lame. (Lotus next door doesn't charge for chairs.)Small rooms...No, tiny rooms! Great view from ocean view room-- worth the extra moneyTiny rooms are hatched by tinier bath. Both are kinda beat and need updating (520).Elevators are tiny and have a strange odor- kinda musty. Hallways are beat and have a strange odor. Grounds are clean. Very good staff is always greeting you. Wifi strength is acceptable.Average-- update the hallways/rooms, quit charging for beach chairs.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Nice hotel, very clean. I thought the price we paid was a little high for an "ocean view" that was primarily of the park next door. Restaurant was very expensive in the hotel, so we didn't eat there. Nice areas to eat at the end of the park. Valet was very nice, helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Pros: room had a gorgeous view as we stayed in the oceanfront superior king room, away from the crowds a little, has a connivence shop right outside the front which was nice but expensive, very kind people and enjoyed the restaurants inside. We received a newspaper every morning which was a nice touch. Cons: we had a king size room got two twin beds pushed together, the age of the inside of the building. While the rooms are gorgeous the hallways are kinda spooky.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: You're just not going to find a warmer, friendlier place than the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel. From the valets to the bellman, front desk staff, housekeepers to the servers at the patio restaurant, smiles and the aloha spirit are omnipresent. We're frequent visitors to Oahu, as our son and his family reside here. As a result, we've tried a number of different lodging solutions. This was our first stay here and without question, we'll be back and are already looking forward to doing so.We also liked the location, away from the Waikiki buzz. I'm a pickleball player and found some great games and a welcoming group a short walk away at the Diamond Head Tennis Club, right across the park.Breakfast at the patio restaurant was super convenient and really good. The view is tasty, as well.So if you're looking for a warm place to call home during your stay on Oahu, this is it.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: While we had a spectacular view from our great room, we had some friends who's rooms were the size of a closet--and they were almost the same price?? Who does the pricing? The outdoor restaurant is fabulous and always yummy, but they have cut the staffing and it can be a very slow breakfast or dinner. The outdoor floor tiles are chipped and cracked, most things need a good polishing and painting, and the whole place is in need of a good renovation. The spa was also reminiscent of a very, old cheap Japanese spa. Towels were shredding, and it was creepy for friends who haven't been to the seedier parts of Japan. This hotel has great bones and the BEST view of Waikiki and the ocean. It truly is an aging gem. Hoping they will update soon.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you want scenic views of both Waikiki and Diamond Head, great beach space without the crowds this is the place! The New Otani will meet you needs. Want to access the shopping areas? Hop on the bus, only a few steps from the hotel for $2.50. The hotel does not have a pool but is directly oceanfront which is what we wanted. Restaurants and a convenience store are located on site however beware; the restaurant is very pricey but you can't beat the open-air, oceanfront view. Staff were very helpful and handled an upgrade without any problems. We would definitely return!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I love this hotel! Rooms are large, air-conditioned, and clean. Robert, the parking valet, is awesome! All of the staff are very accommodating and personable. Housekeeping staff are always available. Highly recommend this hotel on the beach.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is excellent for the hotel room views of Waikiki and serenity of the ocean from your Lanai. Excellent for couples. The ocean is so close to the hotel I felt really spoiled. The only issues we had can easily be corrected. 1. Put up a small sign in each room to let folks know that when your slider door is open your A/C shuts off. Also how to reengage it.2. You need to spell out your check-in times. We waited almost 2 hours after arrival.3. Do not tell folks to just get to Pearl Harbor early and you will get Arizona Memorial tickets easily. I never was able to see it, a low point of my trip.Ok, that's all I saw that was a problem. Now, the staff at this hotel is the finest group I have ever dealt with. You should be proud, from the front desk to the sweet ladies turning down the beds to the great young man who reset our A/C's in both rooms. What a wonderful trip this was. We will be back for those amazing Mai-Tai's and the unbelievably excellent restaurant on the 1st floor with the great tree on the beach. Also, we were blessed to see the Monk seal and her pup born right below our balcony-Wow!!Thank you all!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Great beach location away from crowds of Waikiki (but within 20 minutes walk). Good for swimming, walking in water, enjoying the beach and sky. Clean, helpful staff, good restaurant, across street from park.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The ocean view room is the only way to go! It's a teeny room but, realistically how much time will you spend in the room? The service was phenomenal. The restaurant downstairs are a bit pricey but the service and food are worth it. Predominantly Japanese clientele setting the service standards high.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I love being out of Waikiki craziness but close enough to walk. The beach in front is one of my favs for swimming and paddle board. The restaurant at hotel is great too. The hotel and rooms are very dated and could use a face lift . For the price it can't be beat .

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani is at the far end of the Waikiki beaches, toward Diamond Head. I like that it had less of the hustle and bustle of more central locations. The best part for me was that the hotel is on the water. I dropped my luggage and was in the water within 10 minutes of check in. The room was small, but well kept, with a balcony. It does not have an exercise room, but it has a spa that I did not use. The hotel restaurant on the beach is in high demand at breakfast. It is on the pricey side, but the Garden Eggs Benedict are terrific! I used this hotel on a layover, and have liked it enough to book it again for my return layover.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I chose New Otani because it's not in Waikiki Beach so I don't have to put up with the noise, crowd and busy street. Our hotel is right on the beach and we always sit on the beach waiting for sunset less people. Our balcony is facing the carpark but on the right side we can see the beach so we move the chairs towards the beach, it's beautiful. The room itself not big but we hardly stayed in the room. The walk to Waikiki beach is a leisure walk with a nice breeze and view. I really enjoyed my walk every morning even late at night it's quite safe. We love the l'occitane toiletries and the reception is very helpful. I didn't have a chance to try the onsite restaurant as we always ate outside but the restaurant is always full so has to be nice. We're lucky when we arrived there's a fireworks so we've got to watch it from our hotel. I enjoy my stay in New Otani it's much quieter than where I used to stay in Waikiki and having the beach to yourself is a real bonus. I will definitely come back.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We booked a standard ocean view room with queen bed. We wanted a suite but missed out. This room is small but has nice view with a small lanai. Just a small fridge and a coffee percolator. In my opinion a small kettle and a couple of mugs would have been better, so you could choose to make tea! This was a real issue for me. Also during our stay they ran out of English Breakfast tea!!! How is that possible? Not good enough really. The valet parking is a pain, don't see why you can't park yourself, and a pricey $30 a day parking along with $12 resort fee, but the wifi is good. No pool but beach out front is nice and safe with lifeguard. Bed was ok, too small really... we like a king size. This hotel has no frills but is adequate for the price. 15min walk to the start of the Waikiki strip which suited us. Would I come again? Yes, if we had suite and a kettle!!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: A perfect hotel for a fuss-free vacation. With genial & helpful staff and excellent housekeeping, my party had everything we needed for a calm, enjoyable stay. Whether we wanted the bustle of Waikiki or the neighborhood gems on Monsarrat Avenue, all we needed was minutes away. I couldn't be happier to have found this hotel!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: New Otani is a 10-15 minute walk down the beach and waterfront from the hustle of Waikiki (in the 'Gold Coast' at Diamond Head) and has its own beach that is where ocean swimmers gather for morning and afternoon swims. Two super restaurants including Miyako, the most authentic Japaneses experience we have had in 40 years of visiting Hawaii. Rooms have superb views and some corner rooms get the full spread of Waikiki skyscrapers and a western view to the always amazing sunsets.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Close to the center of Waikiki yet have the luxury of quite gold coast.Super restaurants near by.Great beach.Hard to find a better breakfast.Dining on the beach....Ono (good in Hawaiian)Parking rates are over the top so I fo not rent a car...cabs are worth it if you're too lazy to Walk 15 minutes to Waikiki.Outrigger Canoe Club and Elks Club next door.Convience store next door Hard to beat in my opinion !!!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Sure the lobby looks a little dated and the corridors to the rooms look like a make over wouldn't go amiss but I only ever walked through them.I had an Ocean front room on the 3rd floor with a wrap around balcony. The room was very spacious and the balcony doors opened super wide. Some nights, my wife and I just slept with the doors and curtains wide open listening to the waves lapping at the shore.The rooms were modern, brightly decorated and comfortably furnished. The room attendants did an excellent job when making up the rooms and making sure we had enough coffee and sundries for the filter machineThe beach outside is a lot quieter than Waikiki and it's nicer too as it doesn't have the obvious social problems where the local homeless people are resting/sleeping/trying to survive on what little they can get from the tourists or trash bins.We always from the hotel to Waikiki and it's not far. It's a nice walk along the parkway where you will see lots of birds and those crazy Banyan tree's which I found amazing. Yes there are some homeless people in the park at times but they did not bother us and at no time, day or night, did we feel unsafe while walking to or from Waikiki.The hotel does not have a swimming pool nor does it need one - it has the Pacific Ocean on its doorstep and the hotel will give you sand chairs, beach mats and towels to use.There is a small convenience store beside the hotel and it's a little more expensive than the shops in Waikiki which in turn are probably a lot more expensive than the shops at home... wherever home is!.I don't think we will ever return to Hawaii; 1) it's expensive, 2) it's too far from Scotland and 3) there are nicer places in the world to have a holiday. But... I would prefer to stay at this hotel for the peace and quiet that probably is missing in many of the downtown hotels.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We arrived at The New Otani Kaimana Beach hotel at about 9 pm. The hotel was recommended to us as it was away from the very busy and noisy Kalakaua Avenue. We wanted to go immediately to Kalakaua Avenue to have dinner. The walk was 15 minutes and we did not like the long walk as the route was quite dark. However, our opinion changed on our walk back as we appreciated the quiet surrounding of the hotel and the walk was breezy and cool.The room we booked was small. There was no space to put an open suit case. After unpacking out stuff and closed our suitcases, we found the room is bearable. Although small, the room was well designed with good lighting and electric wall sockets were available in many places which make charging of our phones and computers easy. There is no swimming poor in the hotel but it is a beach front hotel and the beach is literally just next to it. Staff are courteous and nice. The hotel is clean and tidy.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This boutique hotel is right on the ocean. No pool, but who needs that when the beautiful water is just steps out the door. Right close to Diamond Head, so if you want to hike the volcano, this this the ideal spot. The food was fabulous. Views spectacular. By a park not big commercialized area. Room was spotless, hotel is quaint. Staff Friendly. Walking path to Waikiki.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The room I got was amazing. One side is city view and other is the beach. The room facility is good. Good bed, coffee maker, hair dryer with a nice TV. Even though I did not drive, parking space is good and is valet. You got to pay a price. Breakfast, lunch and dinner are served at the lobby level. The price is not that bad when you are on a vacation. Front desk service was excellent. Overall the experience is good. Aloha, Honolulu is a bit pricy compared to even los Angeles. You could give it a try because it is not congested, nominal prices, quiet, very close to the beaches. About 10 minutes to the shopping area. I loved it. Take care.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Having stayed at this hotel a few years ago and loving it we decided to return on a recent trip to Hawaii.We once again stayed in an ocean front corner suite this time on the 7th floor ( it is well worth paying for one of these rooms as they have the best views ) The wrap around balcony is an extension of the room which is a little smaller then most hotel rooms, however you don't notice this due to the balcony.The view is magnificent of Waikiki through to Honolulu city and the ocean beyond and also taking in the gorgeous safe swimming beachfront, you will be reluctant to leave the room as there is always something going on.The night time view of Waikiki is just as spectacular and on two nights we had the pleasure of experiencing the fireworks display from the Hilton Hotel.You don't even have to get out of bed to enjoy the views.The toiletries are L'Occitane, the bathroom was on the small side , however it was adequate and spotless as was the room. The beachfront restaurant is ideally situated with two old beautiful trees for shade and ambience, the food here is very good as is the Japanese restaurant on the 1st floor. The beer was always nice and cold in the bar and restaurants .Staff in all areas of the hotel are exceptional, some having been here for many years.The hotel is around a 10 min easy walk depending on your fitness level to the mosh-pit of Waikiki and its many homeless people ( another reason to stay in Diamond Head ).I would absolutely not hesitate to recommend this hotel and will be definetely staying here on any return trip to Hawaii.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: When returning home to the islands, there is no hotel I stay but here at The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel. Perfect location at the very end of the Waikiki Strip, quiet, nice morning and sunset walks. Great to sit on the beach early morn and watch the sunrise over beautiful Hawaii. What truly makes this boutique very special, is it's people. Very natural hospitality, excellent service from the heartJP or Mr. C. the General Manager has to be the most nicest, aloha spirited person and has lots of heart.
