He is down to earth and cares that his guests are comfortable and having a wonderful time. He makes this place.So if you just want a quiet, small, clean, iconic hotel, away from the crazy main stream of Waikiki, this place awaits you. Best kept secret but again so many already found this gem!Without no hesitation, as a local boy from the islands, I highly recommend this hotel when visiting sunny Hawaii!
user_name:
Huntley Hotel S
Santa Monica, California

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We were here for 1 week, on the quiet end of Waikiki.The hotel seems a bit old, we were guessing sometime in the 1960's for construction, but it has been well maintained. The room we had, on the 6th floor,looked back across the water to Waikiki and the other, bigger, newer hotels.Fabulous view: from our balcony we watched the fireworks over the beach (sent up from the Hilton) one night, and rather than pay the exorbitant prices for a beach side restaurant, we got food to go from a nice Greek Restaurant (The Fat Greek https://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g60982-d949998-Reviews-The_Fat_Greek-Honolulu_Oahu_Hawaii.html ), and ate it on the balcony. No one had a better view than we did. And the hotel staff was very nice about providing the silverware, cloth napkins etc. to do it with.That's because there are quite nice restaurants on site. We did not eat at the Japanese one, but the Hau Tree Lani on the first floor is right on the beach and did well for both breakfast and lunch.The beach is immediately outside, and is uncrowded and great for swimming. It has a sandy bottom, is shallow/gradual in its depth, and has iifeguard. The hotel provides you towels and beach mats.My only negative comment is the quirky design of the bathroom. They could have used the same space much more efficiently and provided more room. On the other hand, you do get the fancy-schmancy Toto Japanese toilets which provide some amusement as you play with the various controls...It is about a 15 minute walk down into Waikiki, but there is a very nice pathway along the beach, so we never felt out of it. I would return here in a minute.....

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We selected this hotel because it is located in a less crowded area. We booked a 2 room suite partial ocean view. It exceeded our expectations. Room was clean, staff was friendly, food in restaurant was glorious. Wonderful beach great for snorkeling. Park right next door and still in walking distance to shops. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is a gem, situated at the quiet end of the Waikiki Beach. Set right on the ocean, there are many rooms with wonderful views. Everything was clean and the two different rooms we stayed in (beginning of vacation and back at the end) were nicely furnished. The hospitality is wonderful at all levels. There's a very nice open air lounge, as well as a lanai-type restaurant open for all meals. There's also an upstairs Japanese restaurant, Miyako, also with the ocean views. Any of these eating spots were magical toward sunset or for watching the moon rise over the Pacific ocean.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We booked one of the "specials" that included a $50 food/credit. One trip to the bar or any restaurant will use that up pretty quick. After booking, I discovered that booking just the room with AAA rate would have been less expensive. We had the ocean view room, which is extremely small, basically a room with 3-4 feet around the bed, and a bathroom. Ok for 3 nights, but not much longer. The view (westward) was good of the beach & sunset. Room was very clean.At check-in, we asked where the pool was, they told us that the "pool" was the ocean. Yes, it was a beautiful beach, which is great for nice walks and swimming. However, I'm not a fan of sand in my shorts (and everywhere else). I simply assumed that a pool is an "automatic" for a resort/hotel at the beach. I have since gone back to the hotel's website and see no mention of "no pool". We were offered mats, towels and beach chairs (not loungers). We did that for a couple hours, but simply weren't comfortable. Fortunately, we had 2 full days planned of sightseeing around the island, so had little time available to spend at the hotel. If this were planned to be a vacation to relax in the sun, we would have checked out and gone to a hotel with a pool.Highlights: 1) The breakfast was really good, our table was outside on the patio viewing the beach. 2) The bar service inside was very good. Bartender/server Ashley was very friendly and attentive!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you want to be in Waikiki on the beach with palm trees swaying in the breeeze, but without the crowded sea of humanity, this is your place for a lovely vacation on Oahu. Located right on Kaimana Beach next to a park and across the street from another park, we had a room with a view of the ocean, trees in the park and city lights at night. It was a short walk to the main part of Waikiki where the action is, but nice and quiet at the hotel and Kaimana Beach. Room was comfy and clean and hotel staff courteous and very helpful. The Hau Tree restaurant on the premises has excellent food, service and a view at sunset that can't be beat. Only complaint was the smell of cigarette, cigar and marijuana smoke occasionally on the lanai. I wouldn't have even mentioned this in the review if the smoke was only coming from other guests. On two occasions we noticed the smoke coming from an employee on the side of the building. This is supposed to be a non-smoking hotel. If the smoke hadn't happened, our stay there would have been PERFECT!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If location is everything, the Kaimana Beach has it. On Waikiki but not in the core uproar zone of 3000 room hotels jammed with tour groups. Rooms tastefully remodeled since our last visit, but the beachside lanai still a prize-winning al fresco dining space. Waiters who were there years ago and who remember you. Five minutes walk into Kapiolani Park and you're at the Aquarium, 15 minutes to the Zoo. Secluded beach, stunning views of Diamond Head on one side and the city on the other. Quiet boutique hotel. As good as it gets for relaxation. SNOWBIRD

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We had been at the New Otani several times from about 10 to 30 years ago, and were glad to find that it has remained an excellently located and reasonably-priced hotel near Diamond Head - away from the Waikiki crowds but close enough to make it easy to access when needed. It is also easy to take trips around the island avoiding the more congested routes by getting out through the back roads of Kaimuki or Kahala and enjoying days traveling to the various beautiful spots (beaches, hiking, gardens, museums, and scenic spots like the Pali) on the less crowded parts of Oahu that we have enjoyed over the years - and are always curious to see whether and how they have changed - or not! The hotel's restaurant is quite expensive, but one can eat out by going to the cafe at Queen's Surf for traditional "hapa-haole" mixtures of local and tourist oriented dishes, and can always drive to Kaimuki and Kahala and beyond for a wider range of both local and other more sophisticated fusion and specialty menus - as desired. A breakfast or brunch under the hau tree at the New Otani is relaxing and has not changed that much - still a nice reminder of how the earlier experiences in Honolulu could be quite a few decades ago.....and the swimming from the beach is great, watching ships coming into the harbor is relaxing also, and the sunsets from the ocean-view rooms of the hotel are spectacular!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I didn't wanna stay in the middle of center Waikiki so we chose this hotel as it is near the beach with panorama view over the hole city and quieter area. The room was clean and nice, staff really service minded and restaurant had good food. Go for beer rather than drinks in the bar. Do book a table for breakfast as it is very popular to come in from street to eat. Only negative is that it is a bit pricy - eating if one is trying to keep a low profile.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: A couple of weeks before our stay, I asked my travel agent to try and get a larger room, as the reviews on TripAdvisor suggested the "moderate" room we had opted for would be too small. We were in New Zealand at this point, and had stayed in quite a few hotels in the past few weeks on an extended trip. We were unable to get an upgrade via the agent after several days trying, and finally got confirmation from him that there was no upgrade as we arrived from New Zealand at the hotel desk at 9:00 am. The reception staff were not at all helpful, firstly telling me the hotel was full, then that we would have to wait until 2:00 p.m. for our room, and only reluctantly giving me WiFi access to check my latest email regarding upgrades. I insisted on getting the room number we would be given, and this was at first refused as well. We decided to have breakfast and check again afterwards.The restaurant is lovely, right on the beach, good food, just as advertised. The bill came with a schedule attached, advising what tips should be given for service. (Having never seen anything like this I photographed it). There was some confusion with the waiter as to which room to bill the breakfast to. He wouldn't bill it to the room number I had been given.When I went back to reception, I was told there was now unexpectedly a bigger room available for our 7 day stay, and we could choose whether to take it, or keep the "moderate" room, as soon as they had both been serviced. So off we went to kill some time until we could see the rooms.Comparing notes with my travel companion, he had been told the upgrade cost would be $60 per night, whereas I had been quoted $146 plus tax.When we were eventually shown the two options, the "moderate" room we were shown was not the room we were assigned earlier, which wasn't explained. As expected it was very small for two single people, and we felt it would be too cramped for a whole week. The bigger room was ideal for size, and came with an ocean view and large balcony.Enquiring about the price we were told it was the only bigger room available, and the price was non negotiable. The staff denied they had quoted $60 per night to one of us, and insisted on the $146 plus tax. I'm afraid by this time I felt we had been manipulated into taking the most expensive option, but of course, I can't prove that.Although the room and the view were lovely, and we liked the location at the quiet end of Waikiki, the treatment from staff at reception was a constant disappointment. Another example, not the only one, on checking out, they refused to let me take a trolley up to the room, with a monosyllabic explanation "liability". Maybe a language / culture issue, but it all left an unpleasant impression.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel was nice on right on Waikiki beach. All members of the staff was excellent -very friendly and helpful.But we requested a room with a double bed and got two singles that were pushed together for make one double bed.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The positioning of this "old world hotel" is a mile and a half from central Waikiki! Although on the beach, there are no chairs or umbrellas to be rented, which is totally unbelievable! They do give you a matt and towels which do little for any extended comfort time! There is no pool! The restaurant has wonderful breakfast and great view. The rooms are updated but please DO NOT RESERVE A "MODERATE or STANDARD" room! I could not have even fit my suitcase in either!!! Therefore, to get an oceanfront room which is triple the price, would be the only rooms acceptable!!! This hotel has outlived its charm... For the same money stay closer to the action so you don't have to spend 30 or so dollars for round trip taxis just to have dinner. Oh, yes, they tell you there's a city bus for $2.50 but it stops every 40 or so minutes... Also, I desperately needed internet. The internet they have is too weak (cheap) to get any sort of proper reception.... I had to travel into Waikiki to get work done!!! Awful! Staff tried to help and tried to be kind but did NOT help.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We spent Christmas And New Year in Hawaii and decided to stay at this hotel, a short distance from the main beach resort of Waikiki beach. A well run hotel with clean presentable rooms and stylish furnishings. Great facilities and stunning views and a beautiful beach and quiet location in the evenings. Just what we wanted.
user_name:
Vic U
London, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you want quiet away from Waikiki beach, this the place for you. However if you are not to much into the beach and like to do sun tanning on your lanai then pick your room wisely. Do not expect the sun on your lanai unless your facing the beach. You get the last few hours of sun. The place was very clean and the staff very helpful. The shower sucked just like all the hotels in the area. Not enough water pressure.We just checked out today January 19th, with a 4 nights stay. We had a corner unit on the northeast side, so we got about 2hours of cold early morning sun, and could not get the whole sunset from the west. The room we had was very tastefully decorated, and quite large, but long and narrow. No microwave. (which would have nice to warm things up, because shopping in Waikiki is a good 15 min. walk or a $10.00 cab ride). Really enjoyed being out of the Waikiki beach area, but would most likely not stay there again, because it appeared to have no sunny lanai rooms, even on the sunny side of the building because there was another taller hotel blocking the south sun. Overall a very nice stay for the money.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel is a bit dated but is in a fantastic location. It sits adjacent to Kapiolani park next to the outrigger canoe club. Its away from the craziness of Waikiki but still close enough to walk if you want to check it out. If you want to surf tongs beach is straight out and a short paddle to the left for excellent surf. The hotel restaurant sits right on the beach, and although out dated, makes for a lovely setting. I have stayed at this hotel several times and always enjoyed it. If you want something fancy or new please dont book this hotel. If you want something with a laid back traditional feel of old Hawaii then this is the spot!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Decent hotel, clean, good housekeeping and friendly staff. Lost points due to the location and smaller size of the rooms (our bed took up the entire room and it was difficult to fit our baggage) - whilst I appreciated it was in a quiet area (and this might suit some travellers) the walk to and from the main stretch in Waikiki gets quite tedious and is a decent 20 minute walk. Walking past the park at night is also not always the best idea as it seems a little unsafe at times. The hotel restaurant was quite expensive and as such we tended to avoid it however the beach out the front of the hotel was nice and more relaxed than further down the strip. Would definitely suit families. A good hotel for the price but not an excellent hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We would highly recommend this hotel. The staff was exceptional from the valets, check-in, wait staff, and housekeeping. Our room was clean and had the most beautiful view of the ocean. I would especially recommend this for couples looking for a calming experience vs. the resort experience.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Great accommodation, beautiful little beach right in front of the hotel, the staff were fantastic nothing was too difficult, even for the Australian guest who wanted a cup of tea! Within walking distance to Waikiki, lots of eatery's close by and the restaurant at the hotel was lovely too. The location was very quiet which for us was great. Lovely views of the beach and Diamond Head - we would sit on the balcony and have a cuppa and take in the views before heading off for the day. I would highly recommend this hotel it ticked all the boxes.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is a good hotel if you want to be near Waikiki but not in Waikiki.It is quiet. It is within walking distance from the aquarium and parks.It is another retro experience. Many Japanese go there and have pictures in wedding dresses on the beach. It is not too big. It has a good feel to it and depending on which view you want, you have a diamond head or beach view. It is not cheap but it is good value. I did not stay here this time but had breakfast under the tree that looks out to the beach. Good breakfast but pricy. Sit in the second row of chairs away do to too many birds under the tree and too interested in your food.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This place is the perfect place to stay when visiting Oahu as it is away from the hectic Waikiki beach scene yet within easy driving distance to everything. Our room was fairly small, but the view was fantastic and the breakfast restaurant was perfection. The staff is very service oriented and the location is perfect for strolling up the beach to Waikiki. This place really grows on you and the lack of traffic really makes everything more accessible. The only area I wish management would improve is the quality of the mattress which needs to seriously be upgraded to make this a top notch hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: As Alaskans, we're frequent travelers to Hawaii and this is hands down our favorite place to stay on Oahu. That was confirmed with our recent stay in November when a scheduling mishap landed us in the Waikiki Suite. Jaw-dropping views of the ocean and Waikiki from the wraparound balcony, gorgeous room with floor to ceiling windows. The staff is amazing, going out of their way to help. And breakfast in the outdoor oceanside restaurant is fabulous. Love that it's close to Waikiki but out of the traffic and crowds. I don't think we'll ever stay anyplace else.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed in Diamond head wing, extra large 1 bedroom suite. Sleeps 4 with sofa bed. Only $10.00 resort fee. Free parking on street in front of hotel. On the beach. Employees friendly. Especially Tony !!! ( works as valet, a service they also offer for fee) I have to mention Tony made us feel very welcome and was always more than happy to help us. The diamond head wing is an older part of hotel, could use an update but for price i paid ( pennies compared to fancy hotels downtown) the older decor didnt bother me one bit. Everything was cleaned very well and smelled clean everyday. Beds were super comfy. Our big family had no problems feeling like home here. Five stars from us !!!! Will stay here again if back to Hawaii !!!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel must be the quietest place to stay in busy Honolulu and Waikiki. It's so peaceful and maintained very well. The biggest plus to staying here is that it's within walking distance of the Honolulu Aquarium and the Honolulu Zoo. It's located near The Bus stop so this trip we didn't even get a rental car for our four days at the New Otani.We've stayed here at least four times and it never disappoints. It's located right at the sweetest little beach, too!And wonderful Wi-Fi.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My room has an ocean view facing the strip and mountains in the background-just as stunning at night with the sparkling lights. Next to a park, so no other building blocking the view. Room was small but perfectly comfortable. Little sparrows came to my balcony to snack on the crumbs from mt chips-just adorable!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Great view of Waikiki. AWAY from most of the tourists. Clean rooms (stayed twice in 2 weeks for 4 days) Hot shower. Excellent restaurant ON THE BEACH - complete with a couple of trees. Easy check-in. Beach towels & mats for use.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed here last week for 5 days . Thanksgiving week , our first !!! Right on the beach away from the throngs of Waikiki !! From our room on the 5 th floor ( beach facing more expensive than the Diamond Head view !! Rooms excellent & worth the extra !! .) u got a great view up the beach towards the Pink Palace / Royal Hawaiian hotel . 10/ 15 ( if that ) minute walk to the hub !! Great view & wonderful peaceful beach . Snorkelling 50 metres off shore !! The restaurant on the beach is wonderful . We dined on the beach at the Royal Hawaiian & Dukes . New Otani far better value , great food plus u r at beach level !! Service excellent , understated really compared to the more slick operations up the road !! Depends Wat u r after !! U have Kapiolani Park across the road also !! Staff were very helpful & obliging !! Expensive to valet park yr car . If u don't need a car don't bother . Uber if u have to go further to Ala Moana shopping centre !! Otherwise walk or rent a car for the day & go visit the North shore !! Well worth it !! We are golfers and drove to Turtle Bay & played both Fazio & Palmer courses . Great spot & if yr cheeky enough u can have a swim on the beach in front of the resort close by . Change in the Loos if necessary !! Nice way to start or finish yr golf off !! Take a towel remember !! U can drive back to Waikiki over the Pali Highway abt an hour or so away . Suggest u call & book at Buzz's bar & restaurant . It's iconic . Grt food & atmosphere , relaxed . It's busy so book !! Highly recommend it !! It's abt 30 mins back depending on traffic over the Pali highway !! Work yr google maps & it will be a breeze !! Enjoy Mahalo !!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Beautiful hotel situated RIGHT on beach. Great service from all hotel staff. Excellent view of Waikiki. Beautiful restaurant - complete with trees coming out from the floor - BUUUT a bit expensive. Walk right out to ocean from hotel. Great shower. Comfy bed. Clean room. Good Wifi.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: For a relaxing tasty lunch with a stunning view of Waikiki, go the the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel. There you can find on the outdoor patio a leafy table, watch endless waves and see the beach action of Waikiki from the other side of a half wall. I highly recommend the salads, especially the fruit platter. Pure bliss!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife had stayed at the New Otani before, when her sister was married. I had a wonderful first stay at the New Otani. My wife did an amazing job. We loved the very friendly hotel staff, house keepers, and valet folks. Robert was by far the best valet. He was incredibly helpful with directions & was very considerate. He ALWAYS smiled. We will be back

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Advising a friend who is going to Hawaii for the first time on a romantic trip with husband, I recalled the wonderful stays I had at Kaimana Beach with my late wife, the kind staff, ocean sounds, fantastic meals. Made me very nostalgic.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We've been going here since 2002. The hotel is older but has been taken care of and some recent remodeling it looks quite good. The private beach is public but only a few locals. On ocean front rooms you get a great few of the hotels of Waikiki, the ocean itself and spectacular Sunsets. The Hau Tree Lanai restaurant has great food and beautiful Sunsets. The only drawbacks is they not have a pool but the beach took away the desire for the missing pool. Great hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Just stayed the weekend for a staycation. The room is a little small but neat. It's the view we had! We looked back at Waikiki! Since our first night we got to see the fireworks at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Because the hotel is at the foot of Diamondhead it was very quiet, unfortunately it was quite a walk in the new International Marketplace. Your dining choices at the hotel are only the bar, the Hau Tree Terrace and Misako. All of which are excellent but pricey. The famous Michels is next door but that's pricey too. Had a nice quiet stay.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you are going to Honolulu and are looking to stay away from the bustle but in walking distance to Waikiki, if you want a beautiful beach at your doorstep, if you like friendly, more than helpful, staff and spacious well appointed hotel rooms.... This is the place for you! I can't recommend this hotel highly enough, so clean and welcoming. Also the service is amazing. I was struck down with a migraine on the plane into Honolulu and desperate for a bed, although it was earlier than usual check in time. The beautiful receptionist arranged a speedy make up of our room and luckily after several hours in a dark room and comfortable bed I recovered to enjoy dinner in the restaurant and time on the beach watching the most sublime sunset. Our big regret was the short length of our stay. Highly recommend a beach side view room.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: After a lot of research we booked with the New Otani. It's an easy 15 min stroll to the madness of waikiki, so significantly quieter on the beach next to the hotel and the hotel itself. The hotel has a variety of rooms, we had a standard ocean view, the view was beautiful. We could see the beach and a bit of the road, great for sitting on the lenai and watching the world go by, and the beautiful sunsets!The rooms are a little small but plenty of storage, and as we spent very little time in our room we didn't mind at all! The rooms were kept lovely and clean, with the air con popped on for our return. The staff were very friendly and couldn't have helped more (even opening corked wine I got from the local shop for me).Only downside was the valet was $28 per day! There is free parking across the road, but we preferred knowing the car was safe and we didn't have to move it unless we needed it. Stress free.Breakfast was also fantastic, huge portions and a great view sitting out next to the beach, I could have stayed there all day.If you want a nice quiet hotel, then the new Otani is for you. It was very safe walking to waikiki and really didn't take us long at all, in fact it was quite nice after a big meal.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Once again, amazing stay at The Otani. Best neighborhood (no bars next door), ocean front, room service and housekeeping are amazing! Robert was our Valet and he was a welcome smile everyday! Would highly recommend!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This could not have been better, The staff were wonderful and so helpful about places to go and where to eat....located in Diamond head the hotel if you rent a car you have access to the whole island and not stuck in the busy part of Honolulu like most hotels....We had the best vacation ever thanks to one of the best places to stay in Hawaii.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We had a great time and the location was great. Restaurants were great and beach was very cool you can see military jets cruise ships and everything else but the beach was nice and calm. Rooms are a little small but very efficient and nice. Only issue is parking but if you park across the road you only need to pay the meter from 10am to 6pm and really we may have spend a dollar a day as it was a quarter for 30 min and we did lots of running.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Out of the rat race of Waikiki, nestled near the foot of Diamondhead, this lovely hotel offers spectacular views and white sand beaches. The upper rooms are quite beautiful and worth the price if you plan on staying in your room a lot. If you're just sleeping in your room then the lower rooms are great and the price is great. They have one of the best restaurants in town, The Hau Tree. Located right on the beach side under the shade of an ancient Hau tree. Best eggs Benedicts anywhere. When ever we stay on Oahu this is where we stay.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Location, location, location. Nicely renovated room, quiet with breathtaking view. Too bad no check in parking as in any hotel or resort. Valet parking staff was so insistent and gave us bad first impression. Their daily price is outrageous, when plenty of car space available across the street and free until 10 am everyday.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The setting is perfect - the location is the best - you can walk and walk from here and the beach is one of the safest on the island - we have stayed here many times and feel grateful every time!! And the history is worth reading about!! Staff is lovely.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Waikiki has lost its charm. Expensive brand name retail stores, food chains, and concrete towers make it feel like Times Square with a beach. But take a short drive or a long walk down towards Diamond Head and you will experience a bit of romance and solitude at the New Otani Kaimana Hotel. It sits right on the beach, has a friendly and knowledgeable staff, and a small restaurant where you can enjoy macadamia nut pancakes while you watch the sun rise. It's special.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you want to be away from the congestion of the downtown Waikiki area this hotel is an option. The walk into the heart of Waikiki is about 20 minutes. There are no resort fees but this is no resort. Parking... there is no designated parking for this hotel. There is street parking but you have to feed the meter every 4 hrs during the day. Who wants to deal with that on vacation? So if you use the valet it's $28/day plus the tips. Our ocean view room was recently updated and clean. It was very small. Like European rooms. Our hotel room in Paris was actually larger. The valet, bell hop, and housekeeping were all very friendly. The staff at the front desk rarely smiled and never welcomed us or thanked us for staying. The beach is ok. There's an old war memorial building next to the beach that had graffiti on it. There's no shade. No umbrellas or lounge chairs are provided. You can ask the bell hop for beach chairs. Would I stay here again? Possibly. I have no intention of visiting Oahu again. I prefer Maui and Kauai. But if you want a decent, small but updated hotel room that's a little less expensive, and are ok with parking meters or paying for parking then this hotel is fine.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Omani Kamaina Beach Hotel sits in a rare peaceful old Hawaii environment with true Aloha spirit. There are a variety of accommodations for all budgets, but without all the manufactured glitz of Waikiki proper. The staff is exceedingly polite, pleasant, and helpful. No matter which accommodations you choose, you will still be able to enjoy the amazing spiritual world of Diamond Head and Kaimana Beach.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Loved the hotel. We were facing towards the beach. We stayed 3 nights and we watched sunset everyday. It is a long good walk to get to the main stretch of the Waikiki beach and the town but it was a good quieter end of the stretch.We found the room very small. We had to put our suitcases on the bed to open as there was not enough space for the suitcase and one could not be on the bed while opening the suitcases.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed 2 nights here recently. We had a beachfront room on the fourth floor. The room was small but very nice. Clean and well appointed. The view was fantastic, looking down on the beach and also up towards waikiki central area. Location is on the beach but if you don't have a car then it is about a 15 minute walk to the main part of Waikiki where the shops and restaurants are located. There are two restaurants on site ( we didn't eat there) and a very well stocked convenience store.The service here was good. The hotel provides beach towels. The wireless Internet was good. The resort fee was responsible at $11 per night. No swimming pool. The building is dated but we'll maintained. Overall a good affordable option for beachfront accommodation on waikiki.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: There aren't too many places to eat on this stretch of beach. We just popped right into the bar for a simple, yet satisfying turkey club sandwich and an ice tea. Service was good and they prices were decent. Sorry, no pictures of the food because it was just a club sandwich.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Immaculate room, a little small, but I expected it from reviews. Very clean, spotless bedroom and bath. Newer bathroom counters, sink, and tile. Very comfortable bed. Nice lanai big enough for 2 chairs and table. Very nice people to check you in. Loved being close to Waikiki, but not too close. Loved the daily walk thru the park. Our view from our 'standard' 9th floor room was an amazing mountain view, I just specified view and high floor, if possible. Lobby area a bit dated, but room was very modern.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed here with a family of 4 two kid ages 8 and 5 cons: 1)there is no elevator 2)The room is very outdated3)the ac was just ok in the room Pros:1)Staff was very friendly and took time to get us set up in the room and also took time to answer any questions 2)the beach access at the hotel was perfect away from all the tourist foot traffic and you can watch a great sunset.3) good view of diamond head4) Very close to Shell Waikiki if you are going to any concerts there this hotel is very close to the venue bottom line:if you want friendly service and a hotel on a budget that your just going to sleep in and be out all day and not worry about esthetics then this is the place for you.Note:The walk to downtown Waikiki was about 15 min was not a bad walk even with two kids My first time booking with trip advisor the were the cheapest price available and everything went smooth will definitely book other rooms with trip advisor if price is right

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel was an elegant surprise when we arrived. Very friendly & attentive staff, clean, and a great view of Waikiki and Diamond head. The beach in front of the hotel is a super place for swimming, snorkeling or sunbathing, the water is relatively calm thanks to a reef just off shore. It's within walking distance of several restaurants and we also took advantage of the restaurant in the hotel for breakfast. Would definitely come back there if we visit Oahu again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I stayed at The New Otani Kaimana Beach as we traveled back to the US from living in Japan. The hotel is beautiful, clean, situated at the foot of Diamondhead on the end of Waikiki. It has a small beach area, and being at the end of the strip the beach was a bit less crowded than other areas. I took a snorkel out to a small reef within 50 yards of the beach and saw some cool fish!My greatest complement to this hotel was the customer service. All members of the staff we encountered were helpful, friendly, and welcoming. I specifically want to shout out to Kealii-he was a member of the valet team, and was kind enough to share some shark diving pictures with us! My husband and I went out cage diving and were raving about seeing the sharks, but sad we had no pictures....so Kealii emailed us some pictures and we were able to share the experience with family and friends.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We have stayed at the “New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel” (We just call the "Otani"), numerous times over a span of many years. My wife and I officially began our lives together here with a wedding and honeymoon; and it has always been a very special place for us to go, spend time, and watch sunsets together. Here we have enjoyed a smaller, quieter, more attentive hotel compared to other properties in Waikiki. We’ve always looked forward to our visits with great anticipation. But, to say that our most recent visit in late August, 2016 was not good...would be an understatement. This will not be a five star review of this hotel like I've written in the past. However, I will try to make this review, likely my last for this property, as objective as possible.There is no doubt that the views from the ocean-front rooms are spectacular, but can be a little pricey depending on the room you choose. Our room, "The Waikiki Suite"-917) was north of $1,500 for 2 nights. The standard rooms are just too small---way smaller than an average hotel room. We arrived in late afternoon and our room was not ready. This can happen and, we were offered another room to stay in until ours was ready. When we did get our keys and went to settle in and relax before dinner, we noticed a dirty dish in the sink...tsk,tsk,tsk!When we arrived at the Hau Tree Lanai for dinner, they did not have record of our reservations made 5 days earlier...not good! We were seated but at a sub prime table---This was my 70th birthday dinner. At this point I'm not too happy. I won't go any further with this but I did hand write a letter to the hotel manager voicing my disdain.Afterward on our beautiful lanai to enjoy the evening, noise from a live band a short distance from the "quiet end of the beach" breaks out. Our visit here is now gone and overrides the good experiences here. At checkout, there was no non-courtesy, but there was no real courtesy either. Just "review your bill and sign please". No usual how was your stay or hope to see you again soon. At check-in, there was noticeably more courteousness. Upon arriving home, I had been billed for valet parking for our entire stay of 2 nights---we did not have a car. We did later contact the Otani, and they credited our bill for the nearly 60 bucks. I wish they would have credited the "Resort Fee" also. This is not what I would consider a resort---theire is not even a pool!To summarize, most hotel rooms here are too small, the area is not as quiet as advertised, there are limited dining options, it is a long walk back to the main part of Waikiki (guess 1/2 mile +), Not everyone is as courteous as they should be all the time, And I'm still angry about not being seated near the water for my birthday! There is a Hawaiian word "pono". It means doing the right thing, at the right time for the right reasons. The Otani should study this word.Finally, the hotel is a little dated in some areas. Not that this bothers me...I'm more into other things; but noted for the readers information. If you decide to book here...please enjoy for me. My wife and I have had many good past experiences. However, we will likely not ever come this way again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Just over for a family weekend on a budget. Love the quiet end of Waikiki - close, but not in middle of throngs of tourists. Hotel and rooms are a little dated, but that's part of charm. Very clean. Probably the most comfortable pull-out sofa bed I have ever slept on!Has Tree Lanai for breakfast is an added bonus - great food and views.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Everybody there was so nice. The beach is just a few steps away. We had a beach/Waikiki skyline view...very nice with a . Easy to get a taxi, just ask bell captain. The walk to Waikiki is 15-20 minutes, it's nice walk. You can walk through the park or by the beach. The food at New Otani was good, we mostly ate breakfast, about $22. I really don't need a lot of bells and whistles, that you will pay through the nose for, (Hawaii is already too pricey) but I think this place really needs is a whirlpool or hot tub. If you are taking a lot of tours,(like we did) plus, the walk to/from the hotel...you could really use one at the end of the day. We wanted something like we were used to when we go to Fla. Quiet,great view,on the beach, and not too expensive...the New Otani was just right.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is really tired. The front desk staff is really tired. The rooms, while clean, are poorly done and cramped. The best part of this hotel is the view and the beachfront location. If you need to stay here, be sure to request a larger room with a view. If you get the "garden" view, you'll be looking at a pile of potted plants. Be sure to take the $28 parking fee and the $10 resort fee into your room rate comparisons. The required valet parking is very slow. We had to seek out an attendant who was socializing to get our car. The resort fee, which is to cover the cost of making beach towels available, and having a coffee maker in the room, is a bit annoying, since the coffee and extras are replenished sporadically or not at all. You will play for them, though. In general, this "hotel" is shabby, disappointing, and unfriendly.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This Hotel feels homey, and has a comfortable, non-resort feel. Close to beach and park. Very handy if you would rather not rent a car, and simply walk to the surrounding areas. Nothing fancy, but very nice.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Ok standard, but we thought it would be more modern judging from the pictures online. Some staff could have been friendlier whilst others (at least two younger members of staff) was great! A lot of older people working and they seem tired. Located in a quiet and peaceful area and the hotel is right on the beach, but not in the "city center". To get to the hustle and bustle it’s a ten minute slow stroll. Breakfast in the restaurant was just ok. Nothing more, nothing less. Didn’t like the dining area under the trees. A lot of birds and leaf falling from the trees so we moved when having g breakfast there. Only ate there once.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Pro beach front , maintenance works fast on any requests you need people work fast and the busboys work well. They wanted us to up grade our room because we had an in between view of the water and diamond head but it was a great view. The room was very tiny, your in and out at the same time. its very quiet and away from it all but with in walking distance so thats good. the lobby needs comfortable seating pronto. And it would be nice if there was activities for us to do in the hotel. The guy outside at the front was very nice, we call him duane reade, dont remember why though. the men in the hotel were all very nice an helpful, wish I could say the same for the women. although none of the beaches are private, it seemed like we had our own private beach because we were away from all the hype. It was cute
user_name:
CAtour2
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Located on the beach at the "quiet end" of Waikiki, New Otani is a great choice if you'd rather avoid crowds of tourists in Waikiki. Our room was oceanfront with a small balcony. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay; the only drawback was the size of the room. Other than the shirt hallway leading from the door, there was a roughly 12 inch-wide area between furnishings. Closet and drawer space was shy of adequate. And, there was no space to store luggage. We would still choose it again, though!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Booked a king room for our honeymoon at this hotel through their own site. The room we got was one of the most old, smelly, run down room I've ever stayed in. For $200, even here in Honolulu, you'd expect a room better than the local hostel. Not so. No vent in the bathroom, everything from the 70s, super old and moldy. And roaches. Scurrying everywhere. It was so bad it was almost funny, especially given the photos you see when you book online. It made me wonder what hotel they show in their photos because this place was so gross. No elevator, old dingy narrow hallways. Stay far away from this roach motel. You are better off getting the downtown hostel. At least there'd be clean sheets, less roaches, and you'd save some money.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel is about 2km away from the main Waikiki area. The room we had was small but clean. The maids service was excellent. However this hotel is more like an upmarket motel than a hotel. It is more 2 than 3 star.Pro'sThe hotel s situated on the beach. The beach is a great family beach if you want to be away from the crowds and it has a life guard.You have access to beach towels, chairs, mats and umbrellas at no additional cost.The rooms are clean.The maids are friendly, efficient and helpful.The tour desk is very informative and service centric - thanks Tom.The bar has a nice vista over he beach.The hotel has a restaurant on site - on the beach - but it is expensive and the food is acceptable but overpriced.There is a convenience store at the front of the hotel that is open late.Cons.The front desk is not friendly and not responsive.The hotel is far from other places to eat. There is the barefoot café near the hotel and then you need to walk for about 2KM to the next restaurant.The lobby is old and has no aircon.Our room was tiny with the TV on the side - difficult to watch from the bed.The restaurant charges top quality prices but delivers middle of the road food and quality.The bus service to this section of the beach is intermittent.The cost of an espresso is horrendous. If you get there early there is no secure area to store your bags.There is no Gym - there is a private gym at a feeAll in all our stay there was underwhelming. The cost of the room is not in keeping for the amenities. being far away from the main drag makes choice difficult unless you are happy to walk or use a cab.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Our 2nd stay at New Otani Kaimana beach. We love the location. It's away from the noise and bustle of the central tourist center but close enough to walk. Nice protected beach for swimming or sunbathing. We booked an ocean view room and were placed in a small oceanfront room. The room was a small but clean and comfortable( why stay inside while in Hawaii). If visiting Waikiki again, we'll always stay at the New Otani.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I booked a room for 4 and when I arrived was told I was up graded as my room was being renovated. It had been advertised as a garden view and a view of Diamond Head. Saw the "garden" and it was inside the building and the Diamond Head view was overlooking a parking lot. The room I was up graded to was a BEAUTIFUL view of the beach and Diamond head with wrap around windows and lanai. That part was great, but the room was so small they had to bring in cots for the 2 teenagers traveling with my friend and I. The room only had a1 queen bed. The sofa had to be leaned up against the wall in front of the area for clothing storage. There was barely room to walk and we could not get to the TV. Good thing there was a TV remote. Could not access the curtains or windows on one side of the room as the TV was in front of it and kids cots were in front of that. Glad we only stayed for 2 days. You could not get into the restaurant at the hotel as reservations were required in advance. Guests of a hotel should always be able to access the hotel restaurant. You could sit at the bar during non peak times and eat breakfast or mid afternoon if you wanted a drink. The beach on the other hand was wonderful and had a lifeguard. Hotel maids were wonderful and towels etc could be had at anytime. This room would have been perfect for a honey moon couple but for 2 friends who are not partners with their 2 teen grandchildren it was WAY too crowded. Kids did not enjoy the room at all and I only enjoyed it for the view. There is also a $28 / day parking fee. Knew about this in advance,so no surprise. The service is quick and efficient. Rating service as a 4 due to inability to eat at hotel restaurant. Maid and parking attendants are excellent.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed in the New Otani Kaimana Beach 3 nights, as we started enjoying our honeymoon trip back in late June 2015.The hotel is just outside Honolulu town center, near Kapiolani Park which is a huge green area in front of Kaimana Beach, less than half an hour away from Honolulu Airport.The room (a double one) was quiet and clean, with everything you can expect from a hotel like this (air conditioning, flat tv, safe,...); everyone was very kind, from the people at the lobby to the guy who brought our bags in the room, to the guys who took care of our car in the parking (which costed some extra although well spent money, to avoid fines in the public parking lots on the avenue).The beach outside the hotel wasn't that big, but it was enough for us; in the nearby you can visit Waikiki Aquarium and Honolulu Zoo.We chose to have our meals in different places we found in the area, so we can't say anything about the food in the hotel, but we think it could have been ok.We can surely recommend the New Otani Kaimana Beach to anyone who seeks for a quiet and easy place to stay in Honolulu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We loved the location of this hotel -- a little off the beaten "tourist" path of Waikiki yet close enough to walk into Waikiki for restaurants and night life. The beach is just big enough, with great sandy swimming area and coral for snorkeling not far out. We watched lots of swimmers make their way out to a buoy (way too far for me!) and loved watching the surfers too. There's a reason this is beach favored by the locals! The hotel is lovely, with an open air lobby area, and two decent restaurants. Our room was the corner room with two walls of windows facing the Waikiki skyline and the ocean. It was a lovely sight to wake up to each morning! Our wrap-around balcony was great for relaxing. The room's view and amenities were accurately represented by the hotel's website. I will definitely stay here again. It was a "right sized" hotel for us. The little corner store in the complex had all the necessities we needed for our stay (water, snacks, beach things, wine/beer and more) and the hotel gives you a 10% coupon to use there.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: On the plus side, the location is on a beautiful stretch of beach with a large gorgeous public park separating it from the hustle and bustle of WaikikiThe hotel is very old and quite tired. Think 1960s Motel 6 in a nice areaThe rooms are tinyThe closet is tinyThe bathroom is small with a small counter and a small tub showerThere is no desk (people in the 21st century travel with laptops), very few outlets in the room for charging phones, tablets, laptops, etcThe AC is very old but functionalThe views and location are good but for the same price, top hotels on Waikiki with modern amenities are availableOverall, very disappointing for a luxury hotel in the 21st century in a major resort destinationThe people and service are greatThe hotel needs to be torn down and rebuilt

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Before I go to Lanikai beach I needed to stay at Waikiki for 1 night. This hotel was old but cleaned well. I felt uncomfortable for the small bathroom, but except for that I liked this hotel very much. The big reason that I chose here is a little bit away from Waikiki. I needed a quiet place. The vista from my room was gorgeous. I enjoyed the sound of ocean surf. I used a restarurant in the hotel. It was good but the portion was too much for me... This is American style, so no choice:-)

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I needed a room for one night on Oahu before my flight home and the New Otani was fine. The price was affordable and I liked that it had beach access. The room was small but clean, the beach towel and mat were appreciated and I was able to walk to Waikiki to meet friends for dinner. The common areas of the hotel are underwhelming but if all you need is a bed and a bathroom outside of jam packed Waikiki then this is a good choice. Two things I really enjoyed were the bath products and watching the locals during the early morning hours swim open water laps, surf, SUP and kayak. Things I didn’t like were that I could hear doors and guests’ flip flops in the hall and also because the hall is open to the sky there is a bit of a musty smell.
user_name:
gaill3
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We have stayed at this hotel several times over twenty years. We like the location opposite Kapiolani Park. The rooms are relatively basic but functional and clean. However, the best part of the hotel is the view from the higher floors. We booked rooms with an ocean/waikiki view, but were given rooms on the third floor. The staff was unbelievable inflexible. Needless to say we will not be staying here again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is in the perfect location. It's away from the busy area of Waikiki. It's at the end of Waikiki Beach and beginning of Diamond Head. You can walk to both. It is right on the beach. Everyone was very nice. We had a standard room and it was very small. There was not much drawer space or a place to put much. I would recommend getting a larger room.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is a wonderful hotel up from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. This is much more for adult, or couples who do not need a pool. It is right on the beach and it is worth paying extra for the view and wrap around lanai. This was my second visit, and we upgraded to an ocean and park view on a high floor. The hotel is also much cleaner and the Hau Tree is as good as usual. The staff is friendly and the beach is at your fingertips. Enjoy, you are in Hawaii.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel is right on the beach about 10-15 min walk to Waikiki. We had room 530 looking directly to Diamond Head amazing view. The staff are friendly, You can borrow beach towels and mats at no charge. We Only ate in restaurant once for breakfast - beautiful view of the beach. - good breakfast also. The hotel room was spacious, clean and comfortable- really enjoyed my visit

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Can't beat the location but the hotel is rather tired and the bar opening times highly restricted so if you're looking for a good late night scene look elsewhere. Handy if you have access to the Outrigger Club which is fun and located right next door.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani is a little dated on the exterior, but the rooms have been nicely updated. Housekeeping comes twice a day and does a fabulous job. Views of Waikiki and the ocean on the west side of the hotel main tower are stunning. Also enjoy the Hau Tree Lanai restaurant in the hotel to dine under the trees literally at the beach's edge.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We were in town for basically 24 hours to attend a funeral and needed a last-minute booking. We usually stay at the Ala Moana Hotel but it was booked. Hawaii Prince is our second choice and the cheapest room was $450/night. I remember my brother staying at the New Otani a couple years ago and saying it was a good place to stay, especially away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The kama`aina price was $144/night before taxes/fees and with valet parking of $28/night, the total was about $200.We checked in around 9:30pm and since it was late, there was no wait at the front desk. Easy check-in and right up to our room. We got one of the smaller rooms (you can see the various sized rooms on the Emergency Plan info on the door) and it's size reminded me of some of the hotel rooms we stayed in while in Japan. Just enough room to fold out our small suitcase we brought along. The bathroom is a bit cramped if two people are trying to get ready in the morning. The shower did have drainage issues but had good pressure. I believe the king-sized bed might have been two twins put together because we could feel an indentation down the middle. We had a partial view of Diamond Head, although the iconic "end" part of it was blocked by another building. The beach and ocean was visible but looking over the balcony. Easy check-out early the next morning. Staff including the front desk employees and valets were friendly.I'd recommend this hotel if you're on a quick overnight trip or if you want a quiet place to stay. If you want to be in the middle of Waikiki nightlife/restaurants, I'd recommend staying near Waikiki Beach instead, as there's nothing in the area of the New Otani to do at night.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife and I picked this hotel to be on the border of Waikiki but not get caught up of the noise and what not. If this is what you're after then the location of this hotel is perfect.Otherwise, unfortunately I was not overly impressed with the hotel. Some may appreciate the 60s-esque Japanese style building/look but this was not for me. Our room, although pleasantly an ocean view room, was small and cramped.The room service also left something to be desired. The bed sheet and duvet cover were stained and naturally we expected these to be changed by house cleaning. When we returned to our room we were met with clean white sheets, however on further inspection it turns out the sheets had not been changed and the duvet sheet had been turned inside out. Not great.The beach connected to the hotel is good but not great, there are much better beaches around - including Waikiki beach just down the road (although admittedly much busier).On reflection, if you are looking for a quiet hotel but close enough to the main tourist area then this will be perfect for you, but it wasn't quite for me.Free wifi was good and free local newspaper every morning.Stayed June 2016.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Excellent stay at this wonderful hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful, amazing views from our room. Don't be put off from the walk in, we found the walk a pleasant 10-15 min stroll to the start of Waikiki and thoroughly enjoyed staying down near Diamond head.Will be back to satay at this hotel in the future, Maholo!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I won't be too harsh but it's not as good as I was hoping for. I am used to the Hyatt resort, Hawaii prince, Sheraton Moana (when I can afford) and Marriott resort and spa. This would be my last choice.The staff are nice, but a very casual attitude. More like a motel attitude. I shouldn't have to explain. I had a standard ocean view room room 516. The room was small but the view was fantastic if you want to just sit on the lanai the whole time. My room seemed clean but carpets need to be pulled, they were starting to gather.The bed, I feel, was b class. Very holidayinish, one of those overnight hotel beds along the highway.The balcony was nice though you can peak very easily around the barrier to see in other rooms. This gave me a lack of privacy and security.Very quiet out here. Was a 20 minute walk to Waikiki or 1hour full paced walk to Ala Moana shopping center. It took me with catching the bus an hour and a half. By the time I walked to the Hyatt area (20 minutes) then 35 minute wait for the Waikiki trolley then the 30 minute ride to shopping center, I was exhausted. Of course I had just flown 12 hours.Restaurant doesn't open until 7am and there is nothing for a 20 minute walk.Bed linens are changed every couple days unless you put card on pillow. The shower was awful, no pressure and the shower had was one of those removable hand held devices. Not saying that you "have" to hold it. The draining of water was "super" slow so your standing in a pool up to your calves the whole time.There is "no gym". They do offer spa service but you pay. I can go anywhere for that. The workout is your walking.I was up at 5am starving. Was at restaurant at 6am. No open until 7. So I can't really go anywhere unless the plan was to stay out, but they have a great locomoco breakfast dish (google it).You see my dilemma right? Nothing really opens until 9am.The pros:Quiet, on the beach and good food at the Hua tree restaurant in the hotel. Staff are nice not "super nice".The cons:Too far from everything, no shuttle service. The staff are nice but not super nice. There is no gym. I don't like the lanai barriers. No pressure in shower and slow drain. Small rooms.This place is great for the late riser who wants it quiet and doesn't care about bed or their time. They just want to relax. Even being a distance, it's not motivating to want to do that 30 minute walk to the center of Waikiki then walk some more then a 30 minute walk back. I guess you could can it if you want to splurge.If you don't want the action it would be fine but then you may as well stay home.Tip: if you decide to stay here, be sure to get renovated part of hotel "not" the walk up moderate/budget part of hotel. You will be sorry. I don't even know why they would offer it.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We picked this hotel near Diamond Head because we did not want to be in the hustle and bustle of the Waikiki area but still not too far to get to the main tourist area. The hotel itself is very nice and clean with smallish rooms but well appointed. It has a very nice swimming beach right in front and is a short walk to Diamond Head in one direction and to the Waikiki beach area in the other. Only a nice park with clean and safe walkways separate you from that area and its shops. The hotel also has its on very romantic restaurant that serves a nice breakfast under the trees. Service was good and the staff were very friendly. The hotel is only 9 floors tall so get the higher ocean view rooms if you can. They all feature their own lanais to soak in the beautiful Hawaiian sunsets.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel is quiet and the staff is really friendly. Wish they would've had room service and a pool but at least the property has two nice restaurants (kind of pricy $$$ but really good food). The rooms were clean and I had a view of Diamond Head. The beach is nice and they give you a free mat and beach towel too. There's a convenient store right on the property with plenty of water bottles, alcohol, spf lotion, etc for really cheap which was great! I would recommend staying there to a friend.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is a family owned hotel which makes it even the more special. This was my first time in Hawaii, and my boyfriend's third time. Even he was impressed. We wanted to kick ourselves over and over again, for not having found this beautiful hotel and stayed here from day one 5/16-5/26. We got an upgrade, without even asking for one. I watched the sunrise for the 3 mornings we were there. What a beautiful sight. The staff is constantly going out their to may their guests feel at home. Wonderful views of the Ocean and Olomana Mountain. Supper affordable!, free coffee every day (Not the case at Marriott Resort Waikiki Beach -claiming a 4 star status hotel when it really is a 2+ and has the indecency of charging guests $28 for coffee daily "and is not an option". God forbid you rent a car because you will pay the Marriott $32 daily for parking. Again, no options. It is their way or the the high way. The New Otani, on the other hand, is a beautiful place, with character and a peaceful vibe. Has 2 restaurants with a beautiful picturesque view of the sunset. The rooms are so great, you almost don't feel the need to go to Waikiki Beach. Rooms have balconies which allow you to suntan privately if you would prefer so. I would highly recommend this hotel and would be delighted to return some day. I plan to tell everyone I know, while I also tell them, to stay away from That good for nothing Waikiki Marriot.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed at the New Otani, in an Ocean Front Deluxe room for three nights, May 22-24th. This was our ninth time to Hawaii, and our 4th time to stay at the New Otani. The Ocean Front Deluxe Room was wonderful. It had quality upgrades. It was a comfortable size for two people. And, the view was spectacular. It was super quiet. The bed was very comfortable. The room was very clean. I have only good things to say about this room.You can see my other reviews of the New Otani and notice we have always stayed in the Ocean View Superior rooms, which have been in various states of refurbishment. They have not been as nice, so I was very pleasantly surprised at how much better this upgraded room was.We originally had booked the Ocean View Superior room this time as well. However, when I went to confirm my reservation, I noticed that the price had dropped considerably, from the rate at which I had booked the room. I asked the reservation agent, if I could get the new, lower rate, and she hesitated. So, I asked if I could be upgraded to another room, and she agreed.From this point on, I will always request this room, because it was fantastic.The service at the hotel, is still just o.k. No one was rude…but, no one was exceptionally friendly or helpful….No one exuberated that “aloha” spirit. The common areas of the hotel are still bland and dated. The interior atrium, hallways and elevator corridor looks like a public institution and need some updates. The lobby area is also very dated and run-down. The furniture is worn, and the tile flooring looks like the original when the hotel was built in the 1960's.Also of note, there were far fewer homeless people camped in the park.With the above said, I will return to this hotel. The location is wonderful.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Upon checking in we found out that we were upgraded to a top floor suite - for free! It was amazing! The wrap around balcony made sure you had full access to all views. Bedroom in pacific suite was separate from living area. Bedroom viewed diamond head while living area viewed Waikiki. With automatic curtains was able to have privacy from other rooms and apartments next door. We ended up ordering food in because the room was so great. Bar staff friendly. Check in desk was not rude but not cheerful. Had wet bar sink and fridge but no microwave. Full shower and extra large tub.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel has array of two amazing restaurants right on the water, a beautiful picturesque view of the sunset and the city of Honolulu/Waikiki. It's right on the water and at the end of the Waikiki strip, a little past the aquarium and a feeling that you aren't in the middle of being so close to all the hustle and bustle of the city and tourist.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel is a gentle and beautiful place to stay on the far eastern side of Waikiki Beach. It's for those of us who are introverts and yet want a beach experience. The hotel contains two restaurants: The Hau Tree Restaurant is open air place looking out on the beach and the Japanese restaurant on second floor also has a beach and ocean view. The Hau Tree Restaurant is a lovely spot. One morning we saw a rainbow arching over the far side ofHonolulu as we ate breakfast. Both restaurants are very high quality. It is great to have places to eat onsite. The staff is wonderful and welcoming. There is valet parking for a daily fee. There is also a daily fee for beach use and the hotel provides towels and mats. There is an outdoor shower to rinse off and a lifeguard stand on the beach. All in all the prices were reasonable for a beach location in Honolulu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: A short walk to Waikiki this hotel a charming beauty with an excellent open restaurant right on the beach. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. The staff was very accommodating and the food excellent.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: First time to visit this hotel. I booked this because they said top floor suites were renovated. I stayed Otani Suite and it was very very nice and I liked it, it's not suite but huge studio though...From this room, you can enjoy both Diamond head and Waikiki beach view. And it's very very quiet. Only cons were pure customer services.... Most staff were not friendly and not willing to help. No business center, and WIFI was really slow...

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: As others have noted, this hotel is a little out of the way from the main part of Waikiki, up past the aquarium. This means that it's a 15-20 minute walk to the main restaurant strip in Waikiki. This wasn't a negative at all for me as I don't mind walking. In return, you get a hotel which is quiet, away from the traffic noise which seems to plague most of the other hotels, large rooms and an uncrowded beach at a price much below what you'd pay in the main part of town. The rooms have been recently refurbished and so look very fresh. There are good quality amenities in the bathroom and there is a bar fridge in the room (something which a lot of the more expensive hotels don't seem to include for some reason). The room was very large by Waikiki standards and had a full wardrobe as well as another chest of drawers, so plenty of room to unpack. Staff were pleasant and happy to cater for requests such as providing tea bags and a kettle for the room. I didn't have an ocean view but instead had a view over Diamond Head which was quite pretty and given the ocean was only a 2 minute walk away, I didn't miss not being able to see it from my room. Others have questioned the $10 resort fee as there is no pool, however, it does cover wi-fi, a daily newspaper and the use of towels, umbrellas and beach chairs. Given umbrellas and chairs were $10 per hour to hire on the main beach in Waikiki this didn't seem like bad value to me. They also have surfboards for hire and the surf is way less crowded than at the main beach. I ate in both the restaurants. I would classify the food as good but not great in both, however, the service was very good and they both have great views of the sunset so are worth going to if you don't feel like heading into town. A tip since the sunset views seem to get mentioned in almost all of the reviews of the restaurant - you can sit on the beach in front of the restaurant and take in exactly the same sunset view for free if you don't want to dine in.This was my 5th trip to Waikiki. The 3 others hotels I stayed in before this one were the Holiday Inn, Vibe and the Hotel Renew. I definitely prefer this hotel over any of these and would definitely stay there again next time I come to Waikiki.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is our favorite hotel in the whole world, and we've been from Kathmandu to Iceland, done Safari in Africa, and many conferences throughout the USA. Rooms all seem to have ocean view, there is always a breeze, and the beach is right there beneath the restaurant, the Hao Tree Lanai, which is also our favorite restaurant in the whole world! Two Hao trees plunge up from the restaurant floor and create a beautiful natural canopy. All tables have a view of the ocean and the beach, and the food is extraordinary, from breakfast with poi pancakes and fresh mango to lunch and dinner with choice of European or Hawaiian or Asian cuisine. At the same time, the hotel staff is friendly, very "ohana", treating us like family and always greeting us warmly every time we return.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is a simple hotel that offers you the chance to relax and enjoy the beach. The oceanfront rooms have lanai's that offer breathtaking views of a gorgeous beach and ocean. The oceanfront lanai also provides you with a great view of Diamond Head mountain.The superior ocean view is also worth it and offers a straight view of the ocean along with views of the Waikiki hotel strip.You can see the Friday night fireworks from either of these type of rooms. Both rooms were simple and clean. We stayed in both types of rooms offered and my mom and I really enjoyed ourselves. Like I said before I travelled with my mom and our only goal was to relax and enjoy the beach. On the days that my mom did not feel up to going down to the beach she was able to just relax on our lanai or just open up the doors and listen to the sound of the ocean waves. Priceless. I fell asleep a couple of very late nights/early mornings listening to the waves. I really enjoyed sitting on the lanai very late and listening to the waves. We ate dinner at Miyako once and lunch at the Hua Tree. Service was great at both restaurants. It was really nice to sit back and enjoy the view while eating lunch at the Hua Tree. It is best to make a reservation. Several mornings we ordered room service for breakfast. Breakfast and lunch was pretty reasonable. Eating at the hotel can get a little pricy, and I wanted different options for dinner. Therefore, many nights I walked and picked up dinner from the Barefoot Beach Cafe and a couple of nights I picked restaurants in Waikiki. PF Changs, Subway, whatever we were in the mood for. There are two walking paths to Waikiki. One is a flagstone path along the beach and the second is a walk down Kalakaua Avenue. It is a nice walk with lots of shade down this sidewalk. There are lots of Banyan trees to protect you from the sun and you pass the Aquarium during your walk to Waikiki. There is a park right next to the hotel along with Queen Kapiolani right across the street. There is a convenient store named Russel's store on the property that has many items available if you've missed something while packing. There is a laundry service available for a fee and/or a laundrymat also available for use if needed. This is a very calm area. There is so much to do in Waikiki, with lots of shopping and restaurants. You can rent a car and go to another beach if you don't prefer this one. But again there is lots to do on this island. This is truly a great place to stay. All staff was eager to please and went out of their way to accommodate. The cleaning staff was the best. Turndown service is there if needed. The rooms are a little bit small but the lanai's made up for that. Also, real estate is pretty expensive here so you get what you pay for. If you want to party I would suggest staying closer to the Waikiki end. And who doesn't love to party. But if you want to relax then this is a great place to stay. I went back and forth as to whether I should stay here or at a different hotel and I am ultimately glad that I stayed here. My mother agreed. This is not my first time in Oahu, but it has been a while. I am glad that we had such great peace while staying here. Honolulu has become a bit touristy so try not to visit during spring break. I would stay here again with an Oceanfront room on a high floor (hint). I do plan on visiting again but would like to visit another island. I had a layover in Kahului and would like to stay there once. I will still make sure to come back and visit Kaimana Beach and The New Otani. Thanks for making our stay a great one. Mahalo.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is an older hotel built on beautiful San Souci Beach at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki. It is a bit out of the way and a good place if you are looking for a quiet beach vacation. It is very quiet located across the street from Kapi`olani Park. The rooms are tiny but very clean. The staff is nice and helpful but for us it was a bit too far from anything. The main business section of Waikiki was about a 1/3 mile walk. Everything was a long walk or cab ride away. There was a $10 resort fee and I can't understand why. Maybe it was to provide the towels to take to the beach but the spa was an extra charge and there is no pool here.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: A very nice hotel with a great restaurant overlooking a beautiful, sandy beach, with a distant view of Waikiki. We had dinner and breakfast in this cozy location and enjoyed every minute of the ambience, view, and quality food. Walking around the area is very enjoyable, with beautiful old banyan trees and bougainvillea. On the negative side, the room was very small and overpriced, with a limited view of the ocean. Great for one night!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Just outside of waikiki and honolulu, which is great, because it has it's own little private beach. The hotel has some beach amenities. Like most places in HI, the restaurant was pricey and we didn't eat there. Our room was big which was nice, but the layout was a bit odd and we the TV was way far away from the bed. We found a dead cockroach in our room when we first walked in... not sure how it made it to the 3rd floor. Despite this finding, the hotel does look newer/updated and clean. So not sure what the deal was there. Overall not bad for the price, we found a decent price through expedia, but overall wasn't super excited about this place.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I was fortunate enough to spend one week at this hotel and I surely enjoyed it.LOCATION. Vote A. I love that I am closed enough to Waikiki, but not close enough to have to deal with the hustle and bustle of it. However, that being said, then you need to have a car if you plan to eat in Waikiki every night or even if you plan to stroll along Kalakaua Ave (where the fancy shops are). Without it it would be a long stroll and, in high humidity days, not necessarily a pleasant one. On the other hand, if you plan to walk to the top of Diamond Head, then you are closer than staying at most hotels in Waikiki.PARKING: Vote B-. It is valet parking only. As the parking lot is very small, it is necessary to rely on valets. Valets are very efficient though. However, when there is a line, one might have to wait a little longer than he or she would like to. Many people are put off by the fact that they have to pay a daily fee for parking, but in Waikiki that is true pretty much everywhere. So this hotel cannot be judged negatively just because of that. ROOMS: VOTE from C+ to A. I was lucky as I could get a corner room with a view on the Ocean on the Waikiki side (like the one in the picture). I loved it. Vote A.
