I have seen other rooms and I was not so impressed. Of course, one pays extra for the privilege to stay at one of the corner rooms. The room decor is not exceptional, but it is practical and clean; besides, the views from the window pretty much make one forget about the rest. The bathroom is smallish in size, but it works. Overall, rooms are not big in size. There is a fridge.LOBBY/HALLWAYS: VOTE B. Nothing great. The last time I was there the hotel was under renovations. They do a little at the time. So the rooms will improve and the hallways are probably going to be looking better, but it is very basic and strikes a contrast with the tenor of the rooms, at least the choicest rooms.RESTAURANTS: VOTE B. There is some choice on the premises, but honestly it is very limited compared to all the variety one can find in Waikiki. For that reason alone, I rent a car, i.e., so that I can travel around and eat at different places. There is a small store that sells some grocery, but the items available are very limited. There is more choice at one of the supermarkets that are located maybe 1 mile away. Be aware that some packages come with free breakfast and some don't. It was not a big deal for my wife and I as we planned from the start to sample traditional Hawaiian foods and so we were often driving to specialty stores.NOISE: VOTE B. The hotel per se is quiet. No loud students or people in general. This type of hotel is not very suitable for students in terms of cost, ambiance, and activities. So one is safe against this kind of issue. But one cannot avoid the people at the nearby park and sometimes noise begins at 7am. High volume radios mostly. It is not the hotel people, it is the public park though. Sure if you stay at one of the towers of the Hyatt for example, you might hear less of it, but then it is a totally different experience."PRIVATE BEACH": VOTE A-. It is nice, it is not crowded and it is relaxing. You can get towels and chairs in the hotel lobby. Not a great place to snorkel though. We used it for 2 days, then we went around O'hau to try different locations and beaches. Not a major issue, as long as you are renting a car. OVERALL: VERY GOOD HOTEL. A little difficult to book as it is on the smallish side and rooms tend to fill fast. Prices can vary a lot like on the rest of the island. I would consider this hotel only if I can stay at one of their higher end rooms. Otherwise, I can just stay in Waikiki (this is Waikiki as a matter of fact, but I mean closer to where the action is) because if the room does not have a view, there is little to do after one goes back to his or her room. For the food, the place is adequate and there is not much choice on the premises or around it. The most desirable feature, for me personally at least, is that it is quiet and it does not feel like a zoo as soon as you leave your room which happens at much bigger hotels. Of course, not on a par with the top choices on the island, but then neither are their prices.
user_name:
Maurizio T
Agoura Hills, United States

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for two nights before going to another Island. Let me start with a fast 15 min. cab ride from airport, always a plus. Greeted with a warm smile and a upgrade to a room facing Diamond Head. Room was very spacious and a wonderful view. The hotel is next to a park and across the road from a park with great hiking paths all over. The public restrooms in the park were fully supplied and freshly cleaned in the a.m. Town is w/in walking distance if you desire a rush and crowd. We ate breakfast at the hotel in a lovely setting on the beach. You won't want to eat anywhere else, service, food and the atmosphere are fantastic. It's so worth a try. The rooms are clean, hotel was staffed adequately for our needs, location is perfect for sleeping in peace and relaxing without the crowded area. You won't be disappointed.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I stayed here for one night while waiting for a room to open up at my business destination hotel and was very pleased with this place. Would have stayed a couple of additional days after my business was done for vacation if I had time. Breakfasts at the restaurant down on the beach side are great and would be worth showing up just for that.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We've been staying at the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel for close to 25 years now--and we feel rewarded every time we stay.Most importantly, the staff are wonderful and many are long-serving veterans here. At a time when the aloha spirit can seem contrived or phony at some places, there's a genuine feeling of warm welcome here.Recent renovations have greatly modernized the rooms and make more efficient use of the space. Our bed on our latest visit is a delight and the bathroom is well-designed and functional.The Hau Tree Lanai restaurant is a pleasant --if pricy--place for a meal. Save it for a special occasion. The adjacent bar has a great light menu and is good place to watch the sunset.The location could not be better. It's at the quiet, Diamond Head end of Waikiki, adjacent to Sans Souci beach, which is a local favorite. You can swim in a gently rolling surf, protected by a reef. The hotel is also adjacent to Kapiolani Park, a broad swath of green great for walking or jogging. It's gratifying that the New Otani has preserved the great qualities of the past--warm staff, good food and service--and added renovations that have made the rooms even better. There's no place we'd rather stay.Tip: We prefer the Waikiki view rooms to the direct oceanfront rooms. The view is just as fantastic and there's less direct sun.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: What a great hotel! It's like it has its own private beach, and a cool Resteraunt on the beach. The new Otani is 5 minutes outside the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and at the foot of the famous Diamond Head. Next to the Kapiolani park, and the Waikiki shell it's perfect for a getaway and still feel like your in Hawaii not the over crowded Waikiki. Plenty of parking great Japanese Resteraunt Miyako, and the Hau Tree Lanai one of my favorite Resteraunts. Room decor is clean and new. Flat screen tv's and and every room has a view. For the price this is a winner!!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Initial room we were in had faulty a/c so we were upgraded to a suite. There the sink was draining slowly but front desk took care of it in a speedy fashion. Housekeeping is excellent and fulfilled all requests. Street parking is plentiful, just be mindful of the signs.
user_name:
jenw391
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed her 3 nights and really enjoyed it. They upgraded us to a ocean front room with great views of the beach, pacific and waikiki. We could just sit hours on the balcony enjoying the view. Location was perfect for us, not in the middle of the noise of Waikiki, but within walking distance.Hotel itself looks a bit older, hallways aren't very inviting, but the room was perfect. Very big, huge balcony, can sleep with the balcony door open to enjoy the sound of the waves (no bugs!)They have valet parking only which is convenient but expensive, street parking can be difficultHighly recommended

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Reserve an OCEAN VIEW room. it's worth it. Reserve a table for Breakfast at the Hau Tree Lanai. worth it. Don't worry about a "long walk" to Waikiki. i'm 30lbs overweight, and it was short and enjoyable. in fact, we walked all the way to Macy's and back. Staff is a little "stiff" but fair. with the exception of the bell guys at the front who hand out free towels mats and chairs- They were AWESOME! also, there is a convenience store right outside the front door with everything you need from beer to kids beach toys. i would also like to give credit to the cashier at the store. friendly and Super helpful. if you want a quiet place with a beautiful sandy beach without the huge crowds of Waikiki, this is the place. The only complaints i would have are-i'm not used to cockroaches, and caught 2 hiding in the bathroom- to which the front desk girl replied "it's a tropical climate. theres nothing we can do."also, try to stay above the 3rd floor. the 3rd floor Ocean Superior room has a beautiful balcony, but has a little corner room to the left where if someones out on THAT balcony, they're facing you, and just 8 feet away.i had an old man reading a book and staring at us the entire time. he was out on that balcony all day long. kind of killed the intimacy. overall, it was good though.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I cannot say enough about this beautiful place. We were intrigued by the reviews, but once I saw how busy and loud Waikiki beach was I was so grateful for this location. It's a very short (but beautiful) walk to town either on the beach or through the park. Both are well lit with people around so I never felt uncomfortable walking at night. You can literally hear the city noise fading away as you get closer to the property.There's no pool, but we prefer the beach and they have a beautiful one here. It was never over-crowded even though all beaches are public. The hotel provides towels and beach mats, and even let us use chairs at no charge after we asked. We reserved the Ocean Front Deluxe room (818) and it was spacious and beautiful. The bed was really comfortable- my only complaint was that the pillows were really hard so after two nights I left a note for housekeeping and came home to find two awesome down pillows on the bed. We had a huge bathroom and also a really long balcony. We couldn't have asked for a better view.Do not miss breakfast! I'm not even a breakfast eater, but this was some of the best food I had in Hawaii (and we'd spent the previous week at the Westin in Maui!) We had the regular breakfast with a huge piece of ham, potatoes, eggs, toast, and coffee. On the last day there I ordered the Macadamia/Coconut French toast with fresh berries, and discovered their coconut syrup- I thought I'd died and gone to Carb Heaven.I can't brag on the staff enough! All of the Valet staff were eager to assist in any way possible, but Tony was soooo helpful in recommending local "dives" for the best food. (Ono Hawaiian Foods is incredible- get the lau lau) He had the best personality, and full of energy. I'd already mentioned our awesome housekeeping lady, and the concierge, Joy, was on point if we needed a car rental or info. I would highly recommend this property, especially if you hate crowds. You won't be disappointed!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Nothing new about the New Otani Hotel except the name. The location is great for those who want to avoid the bustle of Waikiki, which is about a 15-minute walk away. What's not so great is the hotel is tired, tired, tired. Carpet, tile, bathroom tile and fixtures, etc. are from another era. The "king" bed we had was two twin beds moved together. No hair dryer in the room. People who worked there were very friendly and welcoming, except those at the front desk who barely smiled. Relatively affordable hotel but I'd rather spend a bit more for an updated property.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed at New Otani for business, and paid our own upgrade for an ocean view room. The view is lovely and our room was very comfortable. For Waikiki, (on the quiet end) I suppose the price was good as well. The overall vibe felt a bit dated though and the hotel didn't offer much in the way of beach perks - just a mat and towel, with no chairs or lounges - not grea for us older folk.. We ate breakfast at the restaurant only twice. Nice setting down at the beach but the pink table clothes and white painted rod iron chairs looked like a throwback, And the breakfast was just okay for very high prices. We ended up going elsewhere when we could.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel is in a great location. The beach and snorkeling right in front of the property were a highlight. We purchased inexpensive beach chairs at the local Walmart because you can't rent chairs on this beach. You do get nice beach towels and mats from the concierge. Staff was generally nice although a little too insistent on doing things their way sometimes. The valets were great. Restaurant for breakfast and dinner were a hit. Need to make reservations for breakfast to be sure to get a seat. We had an ocean view room. It was worth the extra money. We'd definitely stay here again.
user_name:
D420AOjimg
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for a romantic Valentine's Day/ President's Day, 4-day Weekend. The hotel was located at the south end of Waikiki - relatively quiet but an easy walk to the hustle and bustle of central Waikiki, and very close to the zoo and the aquarium. We went snorkeling at the beach right next to the hotel. We had a great view of central Waikiki and the ocean from our room, which was a little small but very clean and nice with a small fridge, coffee maker, table and chairs, and a comfortable bed. The staff was consistently friendly and helpful. They knew the area and were quick to supply towels for the beach. Plan on the extra charge for the parking if you have a vehicle, but the valet parking was quick and efficient. The in hotel restaurant had good food and excellent service also, with nice views of the ocean and the White Terns that roost nearby. Yes, this hotel is not quite as fancy as some of the other Waikiki hotels, but it is nevertheless a very comfortable place to stay. I would recommend it!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This was our third hotel in Honolulu and by far the best experience. It seems to be newly renovated and is literally on the beach. We had booked a room with Diamond Head view, but when we asked for a room with sea view, they gave us one without any additional cost. Here the people in the reception is empowered to make intelligent decisions - contrary to the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel.The room was small, but sufficient. A private balcony with a magnificent view were we spent the evening listening to the waves and watching the city on a distance.It is a 10 minutes walk along the beach (nice pathway) to the busy area of Honolulu.Highly recommended.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for over a week for work. Nice staff, good food, and a wonderful location to explore Waikiki Beach. This location gives you access to Waikiki Beach - without being in the core strip (which frankly is somewhat excessive). Breakfast are really nice (try the yogurt and fruit bowl!). Rooms are not huge, bar closes surprisingly early (before 10pm) and I needed to reserve a time for breakfast - but I would be happy to stay here again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: View from room was excellent. Hotel is rather old and drab. Food was good but service was extremely slow and had to always ask for service. Location was great. Price was good for the area we stayed in. Little bit of a walk to get to stores but not bad. Cabs are so expensive, it's worth it. No pool but who needs it when you are right on the beach. Good place for just a couple of days. If I would have been there longer, would have gotten better accommodations even if it was alot more money.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Walking in to the oceanfront standard room, it's all about the stunning turquoise water and sound of crashing waves. The vibe is low-key, within a 10-minute walk along the beach and park to commercial stretches (Starbucks) and another 10 minutes' walk to the heart of big-hotel/intense shopping of Waikiki. The standard oceanfront room is small-ish, contemporary decor and nicely refurbished bathrooms - but we spent more time on the balcony than in the room. We found street parking easily, rather than pay $28 for the hotel's valet parking (some of which is metered during the day.). We'd definitely stay here again. The hotel's restaurant is a nice terrace setting on the water but the menu was not in any way interesting nor thoughtful.
user_name:
kab0406
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Everyone was super nice. The food was great. Our room was wonderful and we enjoyed our stay. It was definitely one of the highlights was our comfortable room.I enjoyed breakfast and looking out on the beach...it was so relaxing and a great way to start your morning.Most of the tour did not pick up at this location , we had to god to the Ashton Beach holtel to catch tour buses. It would be nice if the buses could come down a little further.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We visit Hawaii almost every winter. Usually we stay at the Disney Aulani for a few nights then somewhere in Waikiki, usually Hilton Hawaiian Village. This year I wanted a more relaxing experience than the zoo at the Hilton, so I researched and found this hotel. It is about a 10-15 minute walk to the edge of Waikiki, near the Duke Kahanamoku statue and plenty of restaurants. The hotel building is directly on the beach. No roads to cross. No parking lots to cross. Just go out and there is the sand and water. It is a smaller boutique style hotel. The common areas are dated. The room we stayed in looked like it has been remodeled recently. It is really nice and modern. We booked the Robert Louis Stevenson Suite (9th floor) for 3 people. We had a queen bed and a small sitting area/living room with sofa and chair. There was also a table for dining. We had plenty of room. Our lanai directly faced the ocean. We could see Waikiki to the right and were able to watch the Friday night fireworks right from the lanai. We had 2 night chairs and one lounge chair on the lanai. The atmosphere was a bit more formal here than we are used to for Hawaii. The sign in the lobby stated you had to have shoes and shirts on. We are more used to being able to run around with no shoes and in swim wear almost anywhere in the hotel areas. Not a big deal, just something to mention. We used room service for breakfast one morning and ate at the restaurant the next morning with a reservation. I had read to make a reservation or you wouldn't get to eat there for breakfast, but on the morning we were there, it seemed like there were plenty of open tables. Everything was clean, the view can't be beat. I heard that the regular rooms are a little small, but the suite was great. Couldn't hear noise from the other rooms. There were fewer guests, so no noisy kids running up and down the halls like in bigger hotels. They have towels and mats available at the bell hop desk. The beach in front of the hotel was busy but never seemed too crowded to enjoy. I did not realized there was a reef not too far out and it is awesome for snorkeling. There were tons of fish. We even saw the state fish humuhumunukunukuapuaa. My son was pretty happy about that. This was big for us because Hanauma Bay had been closed due to jellyfish while we were there, so this was a good alternative to that without the crowds. Website was specific about which rooms were suites, but the other classifications of rooms were less clear. It was hard to know the view you would get without knowing the floor you would be on. We wanted the suite for the room and it guaranteed us a high floor and amazing views. For the other rooms, you would almost need to contact the hotel but I don't know if they guarantee a floor before check in.Overall, this is a great hotel. The wifi was not great at all. Hardly ever stayed online. The lack of crowds is much more relaxing than main Waikiki. It is pretty expensive compared to what you can get in Waikiki, but worth it for the atmosphere. Also, getting to other food options is not too far away and that can save you a lot of money as well.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We were there for three nights and really appreciated the quick access to the beach. The room was very small which made me a little stir-crazy by the second day. The restaurant in the hotel was very expensive and not kid-friendly. That being said, the food was very good. The valet fellows were all very nice and friendly and helpful. We found the other staff rather hurried and not as helpful.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Two nights here, late January. Rooms are small but adequate. Away from the noise and traffic along Waikiki, but an easy walk away. Very nice beach. Outstanding breakfast menu, and the restaurant is noteworthy. Attentive, well trained staff. This would be my first choice for future trips to Honolulu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We chose an Ocean Superior Room for 4 nights. At first, they made some mistakes on our booking order. They gave us Ocean Waikiki Superior type instead of Ocean Superior, and claimed that not all the types revealed on the website of Booking.com. After we told them that the price we paid and the picture displayed on the Booking.com indicating the Ocean Superior type, they finally reconfirmed our booking was correct. They had nice attitude and good service on dealing with subsequent room changing process.If you booked New Otani on any hotel agents, make sure you receive the right room compatible with your booking order.Our Ocean Superior Room was on the 5th floor. The view is absolutely great! All the rooms were just renovated. It is a clean, quiet and relaxing place to spend all your time idling in front of the ocean with the scene of whales occasionally spouting and jumping out of the water. The curtains of the room are able to block all the light. The (free) Wifi (resort fee included) signal is stable. There is a valet parking costing $28 per night, while surrounding parking area are free and easily available at night. This location in comparison with the Waikiki downtown is a good choice for car parking. Overall, we had a very good experience in The New Otani Kaimana Hotel!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We booked our room before we left based on reviews. We opted for an Ocean View room, but upgraded when we got there. The ocean view really was only a side view of the ocean. The room we upgraded to had the "side view" of the ocean, but also a full on view of Diamond Head. You could watch the sunset on the ocean and the sunrise over the Mountain. Both were spectacular. The staff was very hospitable and welcoming. The upgraded room was very roomy, the original was small and a bit cramped... so choose carefully as an upgrade might not be available. There is parking in the streets, but the Pro Bowl Beach party was a 1/4 mile away on the same beach and they closed the street for 2 days, so the valet parking was great. The valets were friendly and knowledgable and always offered directions or suggestions if asked. We only ate breakfast here one time, as it was pricey, but it was delicious and stunning to eat beach side. You are walking distance (about a mile) from so many things. A quiet park across the street, the aquarium and zoo less than 1/2 mile. Gets you out of the congested traffic downtown. Loved this hotel and the staff. The walk ways outside the rooms are a bit worn. I would have loved to have one of the robes (In room for use and you can purchase), but they were expensive. But very comfy and convenient to have there. The Lanai was perfect for having mimosas in the morning watching sunrise. There is a fridge in the room. The upgrade had a little dining table and settee. If we go back to Honolulu, we will definitely staff here again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Wonderful hotel located on the beach that's next to Kapiolani park. The outside of the hotel is unassuming. Rooms are newly updated with fresh designs. Standard amenities are all there. Quiet air conditioner to keep you cool on those hot summer nights. It's a quiet little hotel that I would recommend to friends and family.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed for four nights in November and initially had a tiny but well designed and equipped room, with a fabulous view of the ocean and the Waikiki skyline. On the third night the hotel upgraded us to a superior room with the same great view and much more space. This small boutique property is in an ideal location in a quiet area on an un- crowded beach a pleasant 15 minute walk from Waikiki's ground zero. The restaurant has great food and a wonderful patio right on the edge of the beach. Staff is friendly and helpful. A 4.9 out of 5.0. The only negative is the in-room coffee which is awful.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I'm a little late in writing this review, but I definitely wanted to post it. I stayed here in May for combination business / pleasure. There was a minor snafu with my reservation--in that despite my confirmation number in print with the days of my stay, the person at the registration desk could not find a record of my arriving the day I arrived on her computer. It was a split bill, but the same confirmation number. It was a bit disconcerting, as I had never been to Hawaii, had just gotten off a 6 hour flight and had no room available. Further, the person at the desk was not offering any solutions to the problem, just telling me I had no reservation. Finally, I said, "OK, you have no reservation for me for this evening, but do you have ANY rooms available for tonight?" And of course, they had an available room, just not the room I was supposed to stay in. So for my first night, I stayed in a room facing Diamond Head. It was a one-bedroom and it served its purpose. Wifi was spotty though, and I had to hold my device on one corner of the couch for it to work. Also, while the room had a nice view of Diamond head, there were two small drawbacks. First, it overlooked the parking lot and some guests could get a bit loud. Second, the room, particularly the bathroom, was bit tired.After that first night, I spent next few days in the main hotel (so I checked out, had my bags held and checked back in later that afternoon). The room was much smaller than my first, but very modern and had a lovely view of the ocean and Waikiki. Wifi was much better in this room, but there was a trick to getting the right connection.In both rooms, my bed was very comfortable and I slept well. The amenities were great (L'Occitane soap? Yes, please!). The staff were generally very friendly and helpful except the first person who had real difficulty troubleshooting a botched reservation. The hotel is situated just outside of the busy downtown area, close enough to walk but distant enough to avoid the hustle and bustle.I ate at the Sunset Lanai lounge one evening (beef and chicken skewers). Service was a tad slow, but good and the food was good. Another evening I ate at the Hau Tree Lanai and ordered the catch of the evening, broiled with the Citrus-Mango sauce. That was one of the best meals I have ever had while traveling.In all, I cannot wait to return to Hawaii and stay at the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: After a terrible experience at a nearby hotel, we booked a long weekend in a Ocean View Standard room at the New Otani, and we couldn't be more pleased. The room, while small, was clean and comfortable with an awesome view of the beach, park and skyline. The New Otani is on the sand at Kaimana Beach, which is only a short (15 min) walk from Waikiki Beach and shopping. The location is perfect if you want quiet relaxation, but with an easy option for the nightlife and excitement of Waikiki. The building is older, and shows some signs of age in the common areas, but the room was nicely kept. There are a couple of shops, a spa, 2 restaurants, a bar and a convenience store on property, which is great if you are not in the mood to wander down to Waikiki or into town. The property is quite large, with several different room categories, which might change your enjoyment of the hotel, but the descriptions are very accurate and the prices are reasonable. I would not hesitate to recommend The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel.
user_name:
Joshua-Cain
San Rafael, California, United States

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel is in a good location if you prefer to be away from the crowds of the commercial area of Waikiki beach but is within walking distance of the strip, also you can take the hop-on hop-off bus to get you to the strip. The hotel is right on the beach and the lobby restaurant is open air on the beach front, a very nice ambiance. For the $10/day resort fee the hotel provides beach towels, chairs, umbrellas, snorkel equipment, boogie boards and paddle boards as well as surf boards. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms have a modern clean design, Asian type flair. If possible go for the ocean view rooms you won't regret it.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Nice hotel, not the best one on the waikiki beach, but cheap. At the end of the beach, in a beautiful park. 8- 10 min by walk far from the main street of the town. Restaurant with an amazing view, wonderful place where have a drink.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This was the third time we've stayed at the New Omani and wanted to come back for one big reason: it is in Kapiolani Park and has its own beach. This means that you enjoy all of the benefits of being in Honolulu with many places to eat and cultural amenities but you are surrounded by the park rather than the "concrete jungle" of the city. This time we paid a bit more and booked a corner room facing Diamond Head Mt. Well worth it, if you can get it reserves since these book up. It looked like the room was recently remodeled. Everything was new and nice. The carpet, tile, paint job were neat and clean. The cleaning staff keep the room spotless. We enjoyed the view of the mountain and the park and had a large deck. We requested and received a high floor to avoid road noise. The room is very quiet. Never heard our neighbors. It was just a delightful place to spend our pre-Christmas holiday. When we were there it was raining more than usual and so right when we wanted to walk to dinner in town a rain storm come up. That meant we chose to eat at the hotel. Very nice. The main restaurant is pricy, but with a view like that we didn't complain. The Japanese restaurant is fantastic. We ate there twice.The only drawback was that we requested a king sized bed. They can't guarantee that. So we were disappointed when we walked into the room and saw a queen bed. We don't really sleep very well in a queen. To solve that problem my wife slept on the pull out couch (hey, her choice). Next time we will have to choose another hotel that can give us a king. But, we liked our stay and if you will too I am sure. The location, beach and staff are great.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Quiet hotel with a GREAT staff that will meet your needs.Clean rooms but small. Older hotel in good location at endof Waikiki. Well maintained. Good restaurants. Nice shops on property, even a hair salon.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Hawaii was our last stop of our US and Canada holiday. We had troubles with our incompetent travel agent, the room that I requested for the travel agent to book was not the room we wanted and was just a standard room, no views other than sea of cars and not the upgraded room with a balcony and ocean views that we wanted. My husband talked to reception in the hopes of getting upgraded. Unfortunately on our first night they are fully booked but we were promised a new room in the morning. The staff did not disappoint, when we left he hotel in the morning to do some sight seeing, we came back to a new upgraded room and our luggage transferred. Do yourself a favour and book the upgraded rooms. It is way better than the standard room, it has been renovated its like you're in a different hotel. trust me. toiletries even changed from a standard soap and shampoos to L'Occitane products! We had ocean views and mountain views. The housekeepers were awesome and the staff would bend over backwards for you. It is not in the centre of waikiki but only a short walk. It is good to escape the busy waikiki

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: A wonderful hotel. All of the staff are so nice and helpful. Tom and Joy at the Activities Desk just inside the front door on the left, know every place to eat and every tour in Honolulu. I know that guests from other hotels in the area will come to the New Otani's Activities Desk knowing that the service will be outstanding. Tom put us onto Duc's Restaurant in China Town. What a find. The Hau Tree Lanai has wonderful food (the hotel restaurant) with a very knowledgeable and caring staff. Best drinks and service in town can be found at the Sunset Lanai (the bar in the hotel). Romeo and his staff are at your beck and call for any special needs. Orlando and his front desk staff will do everything in their power to make your visit special. Over many years of staying here, I have never overheard a guest complain about a thing. We love you New Otani Honolulu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Clean and modern. Well situated in a quiet area on a nice section of beach. All rooms have a balcony; ours had a partial views of the ocean and Diamond Head. Hau Tree restaurant has amazing Eggs Benedict and endless cups of Kona coffee for breakfast--not to be missed.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed here for a week over New Years. Our basic room was very tiny but did have a balcony. Next time I would spring for the room upgrade for more space and a view of the ocean. The activity guy was very helpful and even drove us in his private car so we could make a whale watching boat. The staff was friendly and the lady who did our room everyday was a master . Located at the Diamond Head end of the beach but able to walk to everything no problem. The fridge in the room was a nice touch and appreciated. Looking forward to coming back.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is one of those luck in to places. Our first trip to Hawaii and we loved where we were staying. It bills itself as a boutique hotel. I would agree. It is located far enough from the hubbub of downtown waikiki but right on the beach and walking distance to many of the name brand hotels. Our room wasn't huge but we had a large balcony that we could watch the beach, the park, and the sunset. Even watched a filming of the TV show, Hawaii 5-O. The staff was friendly, the food delicious and the beach great for swimming. Overall a great place to stay!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is the second time we stayed at New Otani. Since our previous visit in 2010, there have been renovations however, more need to be done. Our room was a " superior" room... The room had a superior view, bed was exceedingly comfortable, staff is definitely superior in service, the rooms always spotless and extremely clean, location is outstanding, the hotel beach is perfect but... The room furnishings and decor are not superior- just average, the lobby and hallways are very dated and worn. We will return to New Otani because of its location and the entire staff were genuinely welcoming and always helpful. Many mahalos!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Just got back from spending 10 days here for our wedding an honeymoon and we couldn't have been happier with our choice of hotels! This was our first time to Hawaii so we weren't really familiar with Waikiki at all, and after staying at the New Otani we are super happy that Weddings of Hawaii recommended them. If you are looking to experience Waikiki, but without having to deal with all of the traffic and congestion that comes with staying right in the heart of it all then this hotel is where you should go. There are local beaches within steps of the hotel that are much quieter than those down the street in front of some of the high rise hotels. Kapiolani park is across the street as well and you have a great view of Diamond Head when you are in front of the hotel. The restaurants and bar in the hotel also are right on the beach with great views of the sunset. Plus, you are only a 10 minute walk from the heart of Waikiki if you want to as well. Most of all, the staff here was so friendly and inviting, we felt like we were ohana (Romeo even gave us a blessing on our marriage on our day of departure). This will definitely be "our place" anytime we visit Oahu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is located very calm just on the beach. We could walk to central Waikiki in 10 minutes on a nice beach walk. The hotel had towels and beach acess but forgot to inform us about it. Tried do have breakfast one morning and they were to call our room in 50 minutes. She called after 1 hour and a half and asked if we would be interested in lunch instead... We saw diffrent people every day at the concierge and the woman that we talked to was not that friendly and she gave us the wrong time table for the bus. A plus is that you can store your lugage in a safe way if you have to check out before your flight. A big minus was that there was no chance to order and watch movies in the room, only tv. A very small room, but modern and clean.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: A quiet location at the end of the beach at the foot of Diamond Head. The hotel is within a leisurely stroll from the bustle of Waikiki shopping.  Noteworthy is the hotel's parking. There is a nightly charge and it's valet only due to the size of the lot. There is street parking for free after hours.  The restaurant is nice and scenic.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We had an Oceanfront Deluxe room. It faces the beach front and has completely unobstructed views of the ocean and the Waikiki skyline. It felt like sleeping on the beach--that's how close it was. There was also a peek of Diamond Head from the wrap-around balcony. It was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but still within walking distance of restaraunts, etc. The beach it sits n is an excellent swimming beach and wasn't too crowded. I don't think there is another room on Waikiki with such an amazing view and location.  The room was quite large and very modern. It had a really good layout. It was also quiet. This is the first time I've stayed in a hotel room and not heard other guests. The only thing that needs improvement are the common areas of the hotel which are worn and dated. I see that the hotel is already planning those renovations.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I traveled to O'Ahu for a vacation and made a reservation at the New Otani Kaimana hotel after being in Waikiki for a week. After being in Waikiki and learning more about the area and what was available from a first hand experience, my intention was to book a reservation at a nice, yet affordable, hotel for the end of my trip. I greatly enjoyed my 1st reservation in Waikiki proper, still I also wanted to stay at a nice hotel right on the beach with a beautiful ocean view. The New Otani Kaimana fit the bill. It offers affordable rooms, right on the beach, with views of Diamond Head, and it is quiet. Also, the staff I interacted with were great. I did not get a chance to enjoy the on-site restaurant. However, I did order room service and the food was great. I would make a reservation at this hotel again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife and I dreamed of going to Hawaii SOMEDAY. We celebrated our 10th anniversary and my 50th birthday in paradise. We were surprised and delighted to receive a special birthday surprise. The staff treated us like royalty. The room was exceptionally clean and well kept. We stayed in a less expensive room that faced Waikiki. We could easily see the ocean and the city--away from the hustle and bustle but only a short, romantic walk along the beach. The hotel was quiet and the staff attended happily and enthusiastically to every request. We ate at the restaurant under the big tree, right on the beach. My only regret is that we could only stay for a week. This should be rated the number one hotel in Waikiki!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I spent one week at this hotel recently. We followed advice from other reviews to book a corner room with city view on one of the top floors. Once we walked in the room we were really impressed by the standard of renovation and overwhelmed by the view. It was more than 180 degree ( in fact, 270 degree) panorama observing all - the Pacific ocean, the city of Honolulu, the famous Waikiki beach and Diamond Head. So we could enjoy stary sky and lights of night life and both sunrise and sunset sitting on the private L-shape balcony. Amazing!The room was cleaned twice per day.There was a safe, a fridge,TV, hairdryer, iron&iron board in the room.The bathroom was provided with bathrobes and towels as well as soap, shampoo&hairconditioner and body lotion of my favorite brand "L'Occitane". Making things better, the location of the hotel came up to our expectations to stay in a tranquill and quiet place but still in the short walk to the main strreet with restaurants and shops.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We were greeted with open arms. Tony, our valet driver, was so funny and personable. He gave us a great recommendation to a local restarant called uncle Bo. We were comfortable immediately and the view was impeccable. So scenic. It was so clean and quiet. We definitely hit the jackpot with this honeymoon stay at New Otani.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you want, quiet, class, and a great beach, stay at the Otani. It's about 3/4's of a mile past Waikiki - far enough away from the bustle, but close enough to walk to and from. We've stayed at the Otani for several years and can't imagine staying anywhere else. Ask for a view of the park!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I had the most wonderful stay at the New Otani Kaimana! The room was beautiful. The views were spectacular from my Ocean/Waikiki Superior Room (714). I especially loved the turn down service each night. A nice touch. The people were wonderful. The restaurant was a treat. We very easily used the parking across the street from the hotel. We liked being just a little apart from the hustle and bustle of downtown Waikiki beach area. It was an easy walk to the action. I was so thrilled to have the hotel turn out to be all I hoped for for this trip.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: location location location, this is why we booked but the whole place is old and run down. the room is super small 416 but we are lucky it is kind of the second row to the beach. having the balcony facing the see and Waikiki (at an angle) it is really relatively nice but the bathroom feels like being in a Motel 6 - although there you would not get L'Occitane toiletries but you need a little perk for this bathroom. The bedding is actually pretty good. W-Lan works fine. Parking is 35 US$ a day. You can get ice cubes on the 8th floor - again - kind of like in a motel. the absolute best is the location - quiet, directly on the beach. if you don't plan to spend too much time in your room it is okay - it is clean. And there is amazing sunsets right in front of the hotel. The Japanese restaurant offers indeed very good Japanese food, the 50 $ Chef's menu is well worth it's price and the hostesses very nice. (But if you look to the ceiling in the restroom you see what I mean when I talk about an urgent remodeling job). we paid 230 plus taxes etc per night.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: To be on Waikiki beach and away from the crowds, this is your best, and truly excellent best. Located at the farthest end of the beach toward Diamond Head it has its private beach, even natives come to, with excellent snorkeling. The hotel run by Japanese and also occupied mostly by Japanese is excellent. The rooms with partial great view toward the city are perfect. We were on the 5th floor. The service was excellent and the breakfast included in the room couldn't be better. An independent tour guide desk provided very good guidance for things to do, tours to take, etc.The Japanese restaurant (forgot its name) had great food of all types, but particularly good seafood. Of 5 nights there we ate dinner there on 3 of those, it was that good.If you go to Honolulu, this is it.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: New Otani/Kaimana Beach Hotel is a wonderful smaller hotel located just past Waikiki Beach on San Souci Beach. Steps away from the Aquarium and across the street from a big park, there is loads of free or inexpensive entertainment. The hotel staff are wonderful folks who have worked there for years. A returning guest like myself is frequently greeted by name. There are no doors to open to get into the hotel; the breeze from the ocean sweeps in and through keeping it cool and fresh. A bar on the first floor is open to the lobby and often features a musician playing tasteful music. The San Souci Beach is an island favorite and towels are available from the hotel staff.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for a week on my honeymoon. Great location-centrally located but not super busy. About a 10 minute walk from Waikiki beach. We loved that the hotel had its own beach area. We stayed in 2 different rooms (we had a reso at a different hotel and actually cancelled it to stay at the new otani) and both had amazing views. We will definitely be staying at the new otani again!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Away from the bustle of Waikiki. Nice small beach. On the trolley route. Restaurant was good. Bit expensive. Hotel undergoing renovations, no notice on the website that I saw, only saw SMALL FINE PRINT notice on my confirmation. My room on the 8th floor appeared renovated but the hallways looked well worn
user_name:
travlermb
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: First time in Hawaii and what a surprise. If you're planning to stay in Honolulu, as I did because of work, you might be disappointed. City is crowded, Waikiki beach is small and very noisy, and everything is very expensive. Most hotels are NOT on the beach and if you're lucky, you will have some partial view of the ocean. Our hotel was a miserable place yet expensive so we moved the first day. We we're lucky enough to find the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel. This small hotel is located 10 walking minutes away from Waikiki beach and has a true beach access. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Prices we're on par with what you can find in the city but NO CROWD! They have a very good restaurant and bar. The restaurant is directly on the beach and if you're with your significant other, dinning is very romantic at night. Only negative points are : poor Internet (wake up it's 2015...) and the Japanese restaurant. Internet suck. No VPN access, speed is bad, no real security. As for the Japanese restaurant, simply don't go. 10$ usd for a small bowl of steamed rice??? Seriously??? Tasteless food and can you believe they we're out of the best Sake? If you need to go to a GREAT restaurant, go to Michele next door... Do I suggest the Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel? Yes certainly. Just stay away from the Japanese restaurant...

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Very small hotel. Rooms are small. We had the superior oceanfront roo that was like a double wide compared to the map of other rooms. The view is incomparable. The wall tha t faces the ocean is all glass. The rooms are functional so you can have some coffee and sit on the lanai watching morning on the ocean. Rooms are clean. Turndown with orchids on the pillow is sweet. Sunset is right off the lanai. Bathroom big and beautiful. There is an alcove to,the room with space for suitcases. The room has a safe. We used the valet parking and found the valet staff to be fan static. They were friendly, helpful would give advise or directions if.needed. We had a jeep and often they would take the top,off or put it back on top. The hotel has beach towels and mats. They also have some chairs for the beach and some are better than others. The had a beach umbrella when we asked for one. Would stay here again and use the valet service in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani is right on the beach and from our ocean view room we had a panoramic view of the sea and Waikiki (including the spectacular Friday nigh fireworks at the Hilton). The hotel is in a peaceful setting which is terrific, but quite a walk away from restaurants and shops. It takes about 15-20 minutes to walk into Waikiki - a hot walk during the day, and a bit spooky at night. Buses run nearby, but not frequently. The hotel itself is not plush - all the rooms come off an internal courtyard - a bit like a 1960s motel - but our room was pretty good, clean and spacious enough, though not plush either. The breakfasts in the hotel dining area are delicious - and popular. Need to book.Summary - quiet location which has benefits but also downsides; much more affordable than any Waikiki hotels on the beach with this sort of view.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We were in Waikiki for two nights and selected the New Otani to be just a bit away from Waikiki craziness, but still within reach of the beach. Our room (416) had a nice little balcony with an ocean view & a queen bed. The room was rather small, but it worked out ok. It was clean. During our stay there was some construction activity (room renovations) on our floor. Workers left many tools, power cords and carpet scraps along the hallway we had to use to get to the elevator. It made us step very carefully - probably not a good floor for anyone with walking challenges.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you are looking for a hotel on Waikiki that has good service and a location directly on a quiet, swimmable beach, then this would be a good option. It is located at the far end of the beach near Diamond Head, so it is not convenient if you want to be in the middle of all the 'action', but if you want to be in the center of all that is happening and don't mind a short bus ride or a 20 minute walk then this would be a hotel to consider. Our room was not large and faced Diamond head and not the sea, but was very reasonable in cost, so was fine for us. There is a very nice breakfast area that is basically on the beach and quite popular. It is also open for lunch as well. The hotel caters a lot to Japanese tourists and so has a fine Japanese restaurant on the 2nd floor. If you're are looking for a place right on the beach which is never crowded and are not looking for all kinds of resort amenities...there is no pool...then this would be a hotel to consider.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel is at the end of Waikiki Beach away from the busy, crazy part of Waikiki but within easy walking distance of shops and hotels. We had an oceanfront room with beautiful views of the beach and ocean and a nicely decorated room. The sliding glass doors opened to a lanai where you could sit and watch the sunrise or sunset. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful; the valets were able to give us directions to our distentions which was very helpful. We ate breakfast and dinner at the Hau Tree restaurant downstairs which was a lovely experience. All the orchids in the lobby and restaurant are beautiful and the food is good. The restaurant overlooks with beach which just adds so much to the dining experience. We especially enjoyed our breakfast there. Should we ever be lucky enough to return to Oahu I would love to stay here again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We started an 8 day stay in Hawaii by staying here for 5 days. I wanted to be near downtown, but away from the crazy commercial part of Waikiki. Local friends said the New Otani was a good choice. Reviewing the website, I made sure to reserve rooms that had been renovated and were Ocean Front Superior. We were very pleased with the modern rooms [large bathrooms] and loved having balconies right on the ocean. It was wonderful to wake up, sit out on the balcony [eating papaya] watching the pink sky and hearing the surf - and for two mornings - checking out the Monk seal who slept for hours on the beach. The sunset was equally beautiful. The open air lobby has not been renovated, but fun to sit and watch happy people on vacation - it was a busy place. The staff is very nice and helpful. We got good information from the valet and the bell captain. Renovations were taking place on our floor - never heard them, but did see the workers who were always pleasant and trying hard not to be in the way. Very happy to get acquainted with this part of Waikiki. Beautiful Queen's beach, easy to walk towards the aquarium and see bunches of tropical fishies [not in the aquarium]. Kapiolani Park is fantastic to see Diamond Head up close or have a picnic under a banyan tree. Nice jogging and walking in interesting neighborhoods. A plus: close to Leonard's (a good walk or easy drive) and Rainbow Drive-In. Easy walk to the ritzy Waikiki stuff if you want. I will definitely stay here again - a bargain in Hawaii.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Love the New Otani! Quiet spot. Great food and service. walking distance along a beautiful ocean front path to Waikiki. We have stayed there about 10 times. There is a little store in the parking lot where you can buy anything you need from snacks to flip flops.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I spent six glorious days here in March/April this year and thoroughly enjoyed this quieter end of Waikiki so close to Diamond Head. But our advice is to spend a little extra to get a "deluxe" room. The Ocean Front Waikiki Deluxe (on the corner of the building facing the ocean and Waikiki) was just superb - and we're fussy - and very good value when compared with other more popular waterfront properties in Waikiki. The views were to die for and the sunsets absolutely spectacular. Our room (8th floor) had been redecorated and we found it most comfortable and stylish. We had breakfast each morning in the Hau Tree Lanai and the staff were always accommodating in our request for a front table adjoining the gorgeous beach right out front (just be sure to book ahead). However, don't bother to take the deal where breakfast is included in the tariff, as there is no advantage price-wise we discovered. We also enjoyed the Hau Tree Lanai for dinner and found the setting lovely and the food good. There's a nice bar area too with a guitarist playing in the evening. Front desk staff were polite but reserved.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I was disappointed not to be staying in one of the renovated rooms as the old décor was dated & tired looking. I thought the restaurant prices were overpriced and had to wait quite a while to get a drink at the bar. The front desk personnel were very helpful. However, we were glad we were away from the hurly burly & noise of Waikiki. It only took us about 15 minutes to stroll into Waikiki where you are spoilt for choice for restaurants & bars. We enjoyed having the beach just in front of the hotel & also the walk around Diamond Head was very enjoyable too. If we were back in Honolulu again I think we would stay here again but would book one of the updated rooms.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I stayed here where the website says every room has an ocean view. Well I got the one room that had no ocean view, no elevator, and minimal air conditioning. While it was a decently appointed suite, for the price it was average at best. I had to lug my luggage up three flights of stairs without so much as an offer of assistance from the bellman when I checked in. The hallways look like something out of the 1960s that you might see as in the original Hawaii 5-0 TV show where some crime has just occurred: dark, narrow, and somewhat seedy. The "Fitness Room" was locked the entire time I was there, with some dog inside guarding it I suppose, but I was not in Hawaii to do my exercise indoors anyway, so it did not matter but I had to walk by it every day and it did seem weird. Restaurant food for breakfast and lunch provided large portions, but was only warm, not hot and did not seem like it was freshly cooked. Overpriced as well, but in Hawaii, one comes to expect that to a degree. Great location right next to Kapiolani park and Outrigger Canoe Club. Hotel charges 26.00 for overnight parking, but you can park right across the street in a metered space for free from 6 pm until 10 am the next morning. I parked in the hotel one night, then caught on to the street parking. Hotel tried to charge me for parking my entire stay, but removed all but one night from my bill when I checked out (only to later add another night back on a few weeks later, I discovered - currently contesting that charge). I will probably not stay there again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Good size rooms for couples.best location away from hustle and bustle of waikiki (only a 15 min walk) all staff very friendly and helpful. Definately stay there again. Cannot fault anything about this hotel. So easy to go for swim at sans souci beach. Had a local munck seal on our beach 1 day.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel itself was great. It was kind of a far walk from the main strip but I liked how it was away from the noise. The problem I had was with the employee, Mai, who had checked us in. When we got there the room was not ready and we didn't receive any explanation on why or an apology and she made me feel like we were wrong for checking in. Also, I was informed during check-in that I received a package but I forgot to actually receive it since we had to wait for our room. A couple of days later I went back down to ask the front desk for my package and they told me that I didn't have anything. We went back and forth for a bit and they finally said that I did receive a package but that Mai had deleted the record so that was why they could not see it. I was really disappointed from the start and that was really not the way that I wanted to start my vacation. The front desk staff really gives the first impression of the hotel and my first impression was not good. After my first initial day, I hated going down to the front desk to ask for anything because of the service that I received from her. The hotels rooms and the bell service and everything else was great but I probably will not stay here again because of the check-in customer service that I received.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The other reviews are pretty accurate. The rooms are small and out of date but the location is amazing! Our time there was mostly stress free. Staff there was very helpful. We had construction start next door on our floor the day we were leaving but since check out wasn't until noon and construction started in the morning, it would have been nice to have been notified or moved the last day. We ended up having no power to one side of the room where the TV was plugged into. As we packed we wanted some entertainment. Hardly got an apology by the receptionist when we checked out. In addition they charged me for valet parking for our entire stay when we only used it once. They were nice enough to take it off and even comped us for the valet service we did use. The location is amazing as well as it is close enough to the Waikiki strip yet far enough to avoid the noise and craziness. Parking is the real issue because it is $26 per day to park at the hotel but if you plan on staying here and renting a car, just plan on being gone during the day as metered parking out front is free from 6pm - 10am. It was unclear if weekends were free but it's pretty inexpensive. It's a four hour limit and it's 25 cents per half hour. Overall I would stay here again!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stay here for the out-of-the-fray locale near Diamond Head, not for a luxurious room. You'll have everything you need (free but tricky wifi, a convenience store nearby, dining on site), but maybe not in spades. Our two bed DH view was so tiny it felt like a cramped little London room. The bathroom sink was slow draining. The house bartender lady was aloof at best and seemed pained to be polite (Union job?)? The beach out front cannot be better and makes it all worth it. Free towel and mat service is nice. Good room AC. Not sure I wouldn't book at a neighboring hotel next time though.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The good: the apartments have a terrific layout for a couple with a child, with a huge bathroom between the rooms and access to the main door from both rooms, as well. The restaurant manager was brilliant and hugely helpful in making it possible for us to cook three meals a day in the tiny apartment kitchen, since my daughter has severe food allergies. The beach is lovely, perfect for distance swimming as well as small children who like playing in the waves and building sand castles. The location is very nice and not at all in the midst of Waikiki. The bad: The apartment bedroom has no useable natural light because the window opens onto a corridor. They charge for toll-free phone calls and calls to the hotel's shops from the room. Weak Internet access in the apartment, bizarrely unfriendly staff at the desk where you book rental cars, tours, etc. Expensive restaurant with a pretty limited choice. They do give you beach towels and mats for no charge, but not other beach gear as another reviewer seemed to imply. The small shop by the entrance is, as others have noted, pretty expensive, but is cheaper for basics (eg milk) than ABC. There is a Safeway a long bus ride away.
user_name:
zaza107
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel was ok. The lobby & restaurant were nice and the room was outdated and small. The restaurant on site is very romantic and the food is delicious but you do pay for it. Our room was the size you'd find on a cruise ship with wood boxes painted and screwed to the wall as night stands. The bathroom wasn't dirty, but definitely had not been updated in many years. Based on pictures around the hotel, it looks like they are renovating and we just happened to have an old room. This is not centrally located in Waikiki, but is only about a mile long walk away. It is also about a 2 mile walk to the diamond head entrance. We happen to enjoy walking, but am entities such as restaurants and the tourist sites are all a decent walk away. The beach area is nice and it seems that locals use it often as well. There is no pool here either. The price was more reasonable than most other places we saw in Hawaii and our three days in this hotel were decent.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We chose this hotel because it is within walking distance of our friends' place, where a weekend-long celebration was going on. The hotel is at the eastern extremity of Waikiki Beach, so within walking distance of the shops and restaurants, but in a quiet neighborhood facing Kapiolani Park. The staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. Rooms are a bargain, with the tariff depending on the sort of view the room offers. Our room was a bit on the small side by American standards, but perfectly adequate and equipped with everything needed. Do take the hotel seriously that a breakfast reservation is best made a day in advance -- it is a popular breakfast spot. Traffic can be a bear, especially if an event is taking place in the park.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I would say be very wary of a hotel like this, with such wildly varying reviews. To be honest, we booked this hotel as it was the only one we could afford on Oahu. The reviews were mainly favourable at the time that we booked, and seemed to gradually decline in the 10 or so months until our visit. First and probably foremost, there is no pool! It is right on the beach, granted, but swimming in the sea is not for everyone, and while they don’t hide the fact that there’s no pool, it is not widely publicised. I was also under the impression it was a private hotel beach - not so.Secondly, it is a trek from Waikiki centre. Ok in the day time, not so great after dark when you’re walking through Kapiolani Park with all the homeless people hanging out: in their cars, in the public toilets, on the benches, wherever.Thirdly, the service wasn't great. Nothing in the way of a smile or friendly greeting on checking in, and reached our room to find we had been allocated twin beds. Clearly we were (and are) a married couple – what’s that all about! We were moved when I complained, and actually pretty much lucked out with a side room on the 8th floor (823) with a partial view of Diamond Head and the ocean, beautiful. Found room to be quite dated in terms of furniture/ décor, but it was clean enough, and had a certain island charm. Don’t think it helped that we flew in from Vegas, where everything is massive and shiny and looks brand new. We ate in the Hau Tree Lanai restaurant a couple of times for breakfast, which was amazing and would definitely recommend. We did always seem to get the table with the tree going straight through it, guess we just have those kinds of faces. If there were any toilets in the restaurant area, we would have ended up sat right outside them!Have to hold my hands up and admit that things may have changed in the 2 years since we visited (was actually June 2013, how time flies), but I’m pretty sure they haven’t built a pool, and it’s disappeared from the Thomas Cook brochure, which I think is telling. I would say if you’re going to shell out to get to Waikiki, make the most of it and stay somewhere a bit more expensive nearer the centre. You can then save money by eating loads of free sample cookies at the Hawaiian Cookie Company instead of actual meals.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I wanted to do a "budget" trip and had only one requirement for the hotel: 1) be RIGHT on the beach.......YES! The beach at the New Otani is excellent! It has quiet waves and is very swimmable and child friendly. We saw people snorkeling in the morning. The sand isn't the soft white sand you find at Lanikai-- it is a little courser but still fine.We opted for the cheapest room and it wasn't bad. It is OLD and SMALL but clean. We really only needed a comfortable bed for sleeping and we were fine. We were given a partial ocean view and we could see the beach from the patio, which was nice but we didn't really spend any time on the patio because the condo next door was only 10 feet away and could see straight into our room.The other great thing about this location is that you skip the Waikiki traffic so it's much easier to get to other destinations on the island. It is also close enough to walk to the busy streets/restaurants/attractions in Waikiki.We kind of missed having a pool. That was the only bummer about this property.Otherwise, very friendly staff and great service. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: After spending part of our holiday at the other end of Waikiki, we decided to try the Diamond Head end of the beach for our last day in Waikiki.We loved the beach here. Quieter less coral and less surf.We booked the Ocean Waikiki view room. The room looked recently refurbished, tasteful decor, compact bathroom, in-room safe, balcony and stunning view down the beach to the city. The corridors to the rooms are open to a central atrium. I thought my wife would have trouble with her vertigo here, but no issues.The lobby, bar and open air restaurant by the beach had a cool retro sixties vibe. This was one of my favourite venues after looking at lots of the named beach side hotels at the other end of Waikiki.Any more than 2 nights here i would be walking to central Waikiki for more dining choice. The walk to Moana Surfrider is a fast 15-20 minutes. Apart from taxiing you can walk down to the Pink line Trolley bus route and jump on the bus for $2 (the bus was actually an orange double-decker). This does a loop to Ala moana mall and back.The desk staff were happy to keep our luggage for seven hours beyond checkout while we shopped before going to the airport.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed 4 nights last July. A family of 5 people in 2 connecting rooms with ocean partial view. Rooms are large with nice design, very comfortable and quiet at night. The view was great particularly at sunset.The hotel is ideally located with direct access to a nice and quiet beach.Breakfast is good, but busy so it is necessary to book your table and time in advance.For lunch and dinner, you need your car to go to Waikiki. No restaurant in the area other than the hotel's one.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is an oldie but a goody.They are gradually refurbishing the hotel. even the older rooms are spotless and comfortable.Food is exceptional and the dining location is awesomely "on the beach"Try the seafood mixed grill and for breakfast the french toast. The beach is also very clean, uncrowded and a good place to swim. no corals and a nice stable bottom to wade in if that is your preference. All in the shadow of Diamond Head.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Very nice hotel just off the crowded Wakiki. We had one of the rooms with a see view and a balcony. Well, the room was not big, but you spend your time on the balcony anyway. Two nice restaurants. Breakfast was expensive, but probably average in Honolulu

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I started out at the mega hotel on the other end of Waikiki. I was combining work and relaxation. A local friend suggested New Otani. I fell in love with it. I had a huge patio over the beach, a window wall that made it seem as if I was in the middle of the ocean. There is a large beautiful park outside the front door. The food was great in both restaurants. I had a hard time leaving. It's an older refurbished hotel. The updated rooms were beautifully done. It is a "classy" laid back place without pretention. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I am a resident of Honolulu, who needed to stay at a hotel for a few days while my house was being worked on. As a local, I am used to beautiful ocean views, and this ocean-front deluxe corner room was able to impress me. I understand why the hotel's website describes it as "a highly requested corner room with a wrap around lanai and unparalleled views of the Pacific Ocean and Waikiki skyline." This is a great room, which will make your Hawaiian vacation a memorable one, with memories of sitting on the lanai watching a breathtaking sunset, hearing the sound of the waves at night, and enjoying the peaceful ocean in the mornings. I had room service, and my meal was excellent. As a resident, I have also gone to the hotel's famous oceanside Hau Tree Lanai and to the hotel's elegant Japanese restaurant called Miyako. It is a boutique-style smaller hotel, which is located at the outskirts of Waikiki next to Kapiolani Park in a neighborly area. Finally, the staff was excellent, courteous, and gracious. I am planning to return to this hotel and to this room, whenever I need a relaxing break.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We started the first 5 nights of our honeymoon at the New Otani in a corner room overlooking Waikiki and the ocean. Any room ending in 17 is a hit. We were offered the suite upgrade at checkin and they let us look and yes, it's the top floor and is much bigger, but in the end we chose our lower corner room because the views were amazing and the corner is so private, nobody can see you nor can you see them. We loved the wraparound balcony and enjoyed evening drinks watching the sunset. The room was a perfect size for us, really no complaints. We did find the hallways to be a bit tired and carpets not vaccumed daily (not so nice for a beach hotel). The free rented beach mats and towels were great and the private beach steps from the front was soooo much better than venturing jnto crazy Waikiki. We were in Waikiki for some snorkling and surfing activities and each time we looked at each other relieved we didn't have to stay there! Parking was ok at New Otani, after 6pm the free beach parking is plentiful but we did have some trouble during the day to find spots. Dining was great and we made full use of all our options. Room service was fast and with a smile (max 20 mins to wait) and we enjoyed lunch, cocktails and afternoon tapas at the lounge. Breakfast in the Hau Tree is crowded and a bit hectic, we only did it once then opted to find a local (more affordable and better food) option down the street called Bogart's- highly recommend. For dinner at Hau Tree we were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food especially all fish dishes. We also dined in a cabana at their Japanese restaurant the last night (you have to call ahead for the private cabana but it's really worth it). Delicious food!Overall service and our stay was unforgettable. Will miss sleeping with the balcony open to hear the waves at night!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Sure that I did not expect to pay more than 400 USD (without breakfast) for a room in this hotel that is not a luxury hotel at all but that has certainly one of the best situation in Waikiki and it was the fourth of July where prices are certainly higher than usual. The hotel is directly on the beach and far from the very commercial strip on the other side of Waikiki meaning if you want to rest away from the crowd, be on the beach and have no other hotel in front of your window is certainly the best choice! Waikiki is not a very long beach and you can walk easily in 15 minutes or less to the other end. I would only advise the corner rooms (or the ocean view ones eventually) but the corner rooms with two big sliding windows and a balcony making a corner too are really pleasant and a pure delight for the eyes and mind. You see the ocean, the beach, the war memorial( swimming pool), the city, the mountains, everything is spectacular from there. The beach at the foot of the hotel (no road, no cars, just a small bendy parking road) is just perfect for families or people that are scared of big waves meaning very relaxing. The room is not very spacious but furnished with taste and the bathroom is pretty small but I really don't care. There was no minibar but a fridge which is handy and a coffee pot. My main problem was more to adapt myself to the schedules of this international hotel with a restaurant closing at 9PM as well as room service! And breakfast not served late in the morning, a shock for international travelers that want to make most of their days and still be able to grab a snack or have a romantic time at a restaurant latter at night! The reception people were efficient but a bit too much in a hurry to explain things and we were held for 45 minutes in the lobby to get our room ready after a long journey (although we were there at the right checking time) with nothing to drink or even a water fountain, I found this a bit rough and would advise them to offer a welcome drink. Otherwise the hotel is very clean and the maids excellent. Again the achitecture and situation are very pleasant and I would recommend this hotel to my friends although trying to get a better value if they stay more than a day or two. I understood that finally Oahu is not a big island and even if you want to visit the rest of the island, this hotel can be a nice homebase and you really do not need to find a different one on the island as Waikiki has more restaurants and relaxed activities than anywhere else...

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I originally stayed in the New Otani about 10 years ago when my wife and I were invited to a friend's Navy change of command and we didn't feel like spending big $$ for a quick trip from California to Honolulu. We were pleasantly surprised to find a basic but comfortable hotel on Kaimana Beach which is a quiet neighborhood about 3/4 mile south of the bustling part of Waikiki Beach, which suited us fine. I had a Navy admiral at the change of command tell me "Oh the New Otani is like a Motel 6 you should have stayed at the W Hotel in Honolulu." I was only slightly offended having stayed in plenty of W and other high end hotels while traveling for business and not feeling like I had missed anything at all. Fast forward 10 years and my wife and I recently took a quick trip to Oahu to do some fishing and stayed three nights at -- you guessed it -- the New Otani. The hotel has only gotten better with some refurbishment having occurred. The rooms are in the classic Japanese-hotel-style -- smallish and somewhat spartan but neat and tidy. We had an ocean-view room looking back up towards Waikiki, which was really a treat. The Japanese restaurant served quality Japanese cuisine (I've traveled extensively in Japan and know my Japanese food) and the terrace restaurant overlooking the beach is awesome for Hawaiian-style breakfasts (make sure you make a reservation). I am sure if we get back to Waikiki we will likely be staying at the New Otani again.
user_name:
RonHinSD
San Diego, California, United States

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you happen to be in Honolulu Specifically Waikiki and start to tire of the tide of tourists and watered down drinks then the Lanai room and bar at the New Otani Hotel is your answer and also provides a beautiful beach in front for the perfect Sunset View.The service is impeccable the bar food menu varied and delish. Recommendations include the Honolulu tropical drink and the beef /chicken skewers.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Small room but clean and reasonably priced. Staff was very, very professional, polite and helpful. Great restaurant and bar, but remember to make reservations for breakfast because the restaurant fills up quickly. You can have breakfast in the bar if you forget. I loved the open-air view of the ocean from the restaurant. In the evening, it's a very pleasant walk to Waikiki for dinner.
