hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Great little hotel at the quiet end of Waikiki, no frills, great staff, did what it said on the tin, tour rep desk staff very knowledgable and helpful, highly recommended, this 2 week holiday was the best 2 weeks of my life, I loved Oahu.
user_name:
Spencer G
Downham Market, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Quiet, clean and friendly staff.Restaurant staff were amazing! Tony the vallet very helpful and friendly. Small rooms but extremely clean and quiet. A nice change from the fancy and busy hotel chains. Great location near the park and zoo. We love this hotel!!!!!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I have to laugh when people tell me they prefer to visit another island because it’s too citified on Oahu. Staying at the NEW OTANI I was right on the edge of the action and simultaneously felt like I was in the country because the experience was so easy, intimate, completely relaxing and literally so green. As a former Honolulu resident and concierge, the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel is the obvious best choice( yes much better than friends homes or AirBnB) not because this hotel is oozing with tropical flourishes in terms of décor or design but it because:1. It puts me smack up against Diamond Head2. Gives me a beach (used by friendly locals as well as hotel guests) right outside the lobby door3. it’s a 5 minute stroll to the heart of Waikiki surfing, shopping and people watching 4. And last I love strolling through the 108 acre Kapiolani Park with its majestic ironwood and palm trees and host to everyone from concert goers and artists to tennis players, picnicking families and zoo visitors.Three more great reasons why I stay here:• There is no attitude at this hotel.• I don’t feel like anyone is trying to sell me anything.• I don’t feel like a tourist.Also, there are massive amounts of free and low cost parking directly surrounding the hotel so you don’t even need to valet your rental car and it’s a quick drive to downtown Honolulu or other parts of the island as freeway access is within 15 minutes of the hotel.PRICE:There were 17 room categories. I elected a partial ocean view and got upgraded. Considering both the hotel and the room amenities, I consider the price fair. I’ve also previously stayed in the lower priced economy room with a view mainly of swaying palms in the park and although considerably less luxurious was still able to enjoy all of the hotel’s other amenities.HOTEL AMENTIES:One restaurant, The Hau Tree Lanai (open for 3 meals a day) has good Zagat and Yelp ratings and although pricy, it’s a great place to have dinner at least once as you’ve got a front row seat to the beach, the sunset, and on Friday night free fire works. There is also a small low key bar, open air lobby, Japanese restaurant upstairs, and best of all they offer you beach towels, mats, chairs all as part of your stay. The hotels low key bungalow style structure also houses a convenience store, bathing suit shop, beauty shop, guest laundry and even a realtor!ROOMI was told that the majority of rooms including mine have been upgraded and although very neutral, beige, unexceptional at first glance, that’s deceiving the rooms features are terrific: a large comfortable queen with plenty of pillows including a large bolster pillow for viewing the flat screen TV , free wi fi access, a mini refrigerator, coffee maker, robes, lock box, lanai with view of the hotel skyline and beach, and a luxury style bathroom with granite sink area, thick white towels, tub/shower combo and upscale toiletries by L’Occitane En Provence.SERVICEAlthough it looks like an ordinary front desk they are professional and multifaceted handling everything from checking the accuracy of my WAZE app, to minor scraped knee emergencies as well as weighing and repairing luggage and even assisting me when my rental fender got scraped up. I think it speaks volumes that many of the employees are long term like Roger, the smiling valet and houseman who been there more than 30 years, and Tom, the cheerful Travel desk concierge. Allergic to false aloha and pretense, I just love this hotel because it feels like home.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We were so happy to have a hotel in this location - removed from the noisy chaos of Waikiki. We enjoyed stunning sunset views from the private balcony. The rooms were clean and comfortable, providing both daily room cleaning and evening turn down service. Staff were friendly and helpful. We did choose to pay for the valet parking. We were there the 3rd week in June and the public parking was used heavily by local residents. People started filling spots at 6:30 am setting up on the neighboring beach to park for the day and spots were full past dark so parking on your own that time a year may be a problem. When school in session, you may have better luck with street metered parking. We were pleased with the valet parking service and deemed it a necessary expense for us since public parking full at times we were looking for it. You need reservations if you want to eat at the restaurants in the hotel even for breakfast. We were on a busy schedule of sightseeing all over the island, so the times we called for reservations they were already booked until too late for us. We never ate there but they were in a beautiful location and while we were there they hosted 2 Japanese weddings. There is a convenience store on the property adjacent to the parking lot. They have a limited supply of sandwiches, fruit, veges, soda, beer, wine, etc that you can get by on. We found finding good restaurants challenging on the island so we had to lower our standards. It's either very high end pricy or low end choices so if you can plan your day around meal reservations you will eat better. A side note for planning : traffic on the island is a nightmare if you are not used to heavy traffic. Plan on extra time to get anywhere as traffic is very congested and slow moving.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani Kaimana Beach is a small hotel sitting below Diamond Head and East of kapi'olani Park in Honolulu. It is separated from the hustle and bustle of the shopping and other hotels on Kalkakaua Ave and Waikiki. I like it because it seems a bit more relaxed and quieter there and it has several restaurants (one Japanese) and one really nice one (Michel's) close by for a special evening meal. The employees I've met have all been friendly and helpful and there is also a beach right there if that's what you want. I've stayed there several times over the years and eaten in their Hau Tree Lanai numerous times. I'll go back there when I stay in Honolulu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: It is an older hotel with smaller rooms, But comfortable and clean. The staff is outstanding maybe the friendliest in Waikiki. It is a close to beach as you can get. And Eggs Benedict in a plethora of variations are a must on the menu of the Hau Terrace. The dining tables next to the edge are literally feet from the water in this Al Fresco dining room tucked amidst native Hau Tree. If you make a reservation (yes even for breakfast) you generally get a preferable table.But best of all the Kaimana Beach Hotel is at the end of Waikiki Beach nearly on Diamond Head. It is very quiet and the weather breezes, sunsets, and atmosphere is as they say in Hawaiian "Olu Olu" comforting. The Hawaiian Royalty always choose this area for the beachfront homes or Grass houses because of its comforting weather conditions and the swimming is great.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: One of our drivers referenced the New Otani Kaimana as being "in the woods." He wasn't far off. The park that separates the hotel from the main strip along Waikiki offered a pleasant respite from the crowds, but kept the restaurants and shops well within reach. We were on the seventh floor with an above-the-trees view of both the whole spread of Waikiki beach AND Diamondhead. It was a memorable place to celebrate 40 years of marriage.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We had a corner room with a great view of Diamond Head. We also had a sliver of the view of the beach. The food is great the service was nice the people were friendly. Ask for a remodeled room. It seems that some rooms are nicer than others. The beach is fantastic and we will return.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Arrived early morning from cruise ship expecting to leave our luggage & come back later as it was way before checkin time but our room was ready & able to check in straight away which we were most grateful for. Lovely clean room, efficiently serviced every day. Great location, within easy walking distance to Waikiki, has its own beach a few steps away. Super friendly & helpful staff. An added bonus was the complimentary wifi. Laundry available for a small cost. Public transport bus stop nearby. Would love to return to Ohau in the future & will definitely be staying at the New Otani if we do.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Just back from one week stay at new Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel. Definately a hidden gem. Clean, staff super friendly and helpful. Loved the location.....definately close to Waikiki Beach but far enough away from the craziness. Rooms are small but no worries unless you travel all the way to Hawaii to sit in your hotel room. Booked a renovated Diamond Head View Room and no complaints. Beach clean and not super crowded. Valet parking is $26 a day but staff was helpful regarding parking at meters (1/2 for a quarter) across the street from hotel and also free parking on the same side of hotel. Would definately stay here again if my travels bring me back to Oahu!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is part of the Japanese New Otani group of hotels, and their only US property. Clearly it caters to Japanese tourists, as many of the hotel guests are Japanese (including large youth groups) and nearly all the hotel workers are fluent in Japanese - often more so than English. The hotel staff is unfailingly friendly and helpful. The location is ideal - a quiet spot about 15 minutes walk SE of Waikiki beach. The hotel has its own beach literally steps away. We really appreciated how the hotel was able to supply nearly any beach gear we could need - straw mats, towels, umbrellas, boogie boards, etc. Our room on the 7th floor had panoramic views of the ocean, Waikiki beach and high-rises, and lush green mountains to the east.We walked into Waikiki a couple times - a real zoo, not unlike the Las Vegas strip. We did have a lovely dinner at House Without a Key.Of the many fine aspects of our hotel, perhaps at the top is the hotel restaurant's breakfasts, among the finest I've had anywhere. First, the setting is spectacular. The restaurant is literally on the beach, but shaded by three mature trees (I'm guessing Hau trees, as that's the name of the restaurant.) The views of the ocean are wonderful, yet there's no wind or sun to worry about. They specialize in many versions of eggs benedict, all outstanding. The salmon benedict was at the very top of our list. The coconut/macadamia french toast is also amazing. Somehow, our room package came with daily breakfast for two, worth $33.50, or enough to get two full breakfasts daily, excluding tip. We had dinner there one night - excellent but perhaps not as exceptional as the breakfasts. Very romantic in the evening.From our hotel, we walked to Diamond Head crater, Waikiki, and the local restaurants on Kapahulu and Montserrat Streets. (Try Lau Lau at Ono's Hawaiian on Kapahulu. Delicious. One order is plenty for two.) Though we didn't go there, the hotel is virtually next door to an aquarium and a zoo. If you're feet get tired, you're always a quick Uber ride to the hotel. And the public bus service is pretty good - use Google maps to plot your route.What the hotel could do better: TVs were pretty small for this day and age. Internet wifi spotty, but at least it's free and it was sufficient for watching Netflix on our iPad. When we needed more reliable wifi, we used our iPhone as a wifi hotspot. These are very minor drawbacks. We would happily return! Thanks to all at the New Otani Kaimana Beach for a wonderful visit!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Private -like edge of Waikiki, beautiful swimming, snorkeling,surfing,all water sports. Wonderful restaurant right on the beach, sit and watch for the green flash as the sun sets through your maitai! Fresh fish every night book reservations! Rooms have everything, including bathtubs, not all on the strip do. Rooms are smallish but well styled Staff is as helpful as family!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: As other guests have noted, some of the rooms are only a little bit bigger than a queen bed -- we had about 18" clearance around the mattress. The web site did describe the room as 'cozy' -- which translates into about 10x11 feet (plus the bathroom). There was a little chair, stool and table in the corner of the room, but using them would block any walking space. Still, our tiny room had a balcony with two chairs overlooking the ocean which was pleasant in the mornings and evening (in the direct sun in the afternoon and blocked from the breeze). There were no screens on the sliding door to the balcony, so as much as we'd have loved to hear the ocean at night, that wasn't a great idea. If you don't plan on spending any time in your room, the room we had could work. But if you need to actually get work done at some point, or you don't plan on being outside all day, it's best to review your room options carefully. The beach is beautiful - and with a larger room, this might be a good choice. We liked that we were next to the park and not in the heart of the city. It was not an unpleasant walk (less than 1 mile) to restaurants and shopping.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: From the moment you are entering the turnaround at the entrance until your last goodbye this gem of a hotel seated at the base of Diamondhead will give you memories that will last you a lifetime. The staff are filled with Aloha! the perfect hotel for a stray action!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is in a secluded, dark area away from other Waikiki hotels. It is outdated and has a strange smell in the hallways. Staff was friendly, but that was the only positive thing I could find about staying here. Our room was the size of a shoebox.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed there last year and the hotel was great. sat on a private beach and the staff was so helpful. we bought a bottle of wine and had no wine opener so we called the front desk, and they brought us a cork and glasses and even helped recommend food options. would definitely stay there again. the room was a normal room, but we were only there to sleep and shower so it didn't matter.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Waikiki has become a bit like Las Vegas without the gambling. Kaimana Beach is just down the road and within walking distance of Waikiki. The hotel is understated, quiet, calm and relaxing. The beach is perfect with good swimming and snorkeling. The staff are very good, friendly and accommodating.A boutique hotel with all the amenities you need including surfboards if you like.Would liked to have stayed longer but will return next time I am staying on Oahu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We just visited Oahu for our first Hawaiian experience to celebrate joint 40th Birthdays. We stayed at the New Otani from April 8- April 15th 2015. I chose the New Otani because it's beach front on San Souci/Kaimana beach, and an excellent value money wise. The New Otani exceeded my every expectation! I booked an Ocean View room. We ended up on Floor 7 of the main building, room 720 with a gorgeous Ocean front Lanai/balcony overlooking the beach! We had splendid panoramic views of the sea life, beach goers, palm trees blowing in the warm trade winds and the waves hitting the shoreline. The sunsets from our private lanai were breathtaking. We honestly couldn't believe that the view wasn't a dream or some vivid painting. You can even see the Friday night Hilton fireworks from your lanai. Book at least an Ocean view room. You won't regret it.Logistics wise, the New Otani is an older hotel. There's no pool, hot tub or fancy fitness center. But who needs that with the beach and ocean right outside your door? Or you can hike to Diamond Head crater for a long adventure work out walk? Or go stroll in Kapiolani park which is directly behind the hotel. The Zoo and Aquarium are also nearby.Yes our room was a wee bit cozy. Not cozier than some of the rooms I've had in Japan, but just about right for two people. It had all the modern conveniences. Flat Screen TV, mini fridge, coffee maker, decent closet space, small bathroom and tub, with a line to dry your swimwear on, a small table and chair, and AC that worked well though it shuts off when you open the lanai sliding door. The wifi is free, but it's achingly slow. Think...snail slow! There is no resort fee here though which is a plus.The staff we encountered were all very friendly and helpful. We wanted for nothing. They helped with calling taxis, collecting bags, dispensing advice, letting us borrow beach towels and always had a friendly greeting upon our return. House keeping was efficient and tidy as well. Everyone treated us with the Aloha spirit.What made this hotel perfect for us was the ideal location. We loved being on this quiet beach. The vibe here is mellow, laid back and very popular with the locals rather than the tourist crowds. The sand is soft and plentiful, and the water calm enough to snorkel in. (we saw lots of fish here). It does fill up more on weekends when local families come to BBQ and play Ukulele. We found it to be charming and tranquil verses the noisy, crowded, smoke filled beaches of Waikiki. It is the perfect spot for an intimate romantic getaway. But not good for someone who wants in on a party scene or wanting a luxurious swanky hotel in a high rise. There are two restaurants at the hotel. The Hau Tree Lanai, under the Banyan tree which is very popular with Japanese tourists and has great breakfasts. Make reservations, because you'll need them. Or the Miyako a Japanese style upscale restaurant that we didn't visit. There is also a corner market, but it has very expensive prices. You have to take a bit of a walk to get into the more tourist areas in order to find other dining locations. The barefoot beach cafe isn't too far away if you want decent local style meals.It's about a 15 or 20 minute walk into the main parts of town from the New Otani. You can choose either a park walk way or the pathway by the ocean. The ocean path is very scenic,but also has no shade if that's an issue for you. We never had any problems walking back to the New Otani, even late at night and felt very safe.I am looking forward to returning to the New Otani in the future. I would highly recommend it to my friends in Japan, and my family as well. We had a wonderful getaway filled with the magic and natural beauty of Hawaii. Thanks New Otani for helping to make our dreams become a reality. Domo Arigatou Gozaimashita~ Mahalo.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife and I love the ambience at the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel. High floor mini suites offer panoramic views. With Diamond Head, the Pacific Ocean and swaying palm trees, it's a win, win, win. All staff members are friendly and knowledgeable. Breakfast at the Hau Tree Lanai is tops ... how do those limbs intertwine so gracefully?

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We were pleased with the New Otani. The room was small, but it worked for us. We had a fabulous view of Diamond Head from our room and private deck. You can walk out the back of the hotel right onto the beach.  There is a great little store to buy some food and drink items since restaurants are very limited around the hotel. Had some issues with the WiFi.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Fantastic location, a pleasant walk into Waikiki either through the park or on the beach front. This hotel is not modern, but it has a charm all of its own, and the sunsets from the balcony are not to be missed! All staff were very pleasant and helpful and housekeeping was superb! Would recommend this hotel if you want to be out of the bustle of Waikiki, but still with easy access.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani is a fantastic oasis on the water in Honolulu. We have stayed here multiple times to get away from the house and crowds that you get staying on the strip in Waikiki. Yet, with just a 5 minute walk along the beach, you are in the thick of it. Best of both worlds with a friendly staff and a wonderful outdoor beachfront restaurant.Get one of the rooms that have Diamondhead AND Ocean views. You get a wraparound porch that is amazing. Moonrise over Diamondhead is not to be missed.Highly, highly recommended.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This was our second time staying at the New Otani. Although the hotel is a bit older, in terms of decor and furnishings, as compared to some other hotels, the location is unbeatable. It is on the other end of Waikiki, closer to Diamond Head, so much, much quieter and peaceful. You can still walk into "central" Waikiki (about a 10 min walk), plus have a beach right in front of the hotel. We opted for an ocean front room, so had the most incredible view. Ocean front rooms have a direct, front-facing view of the ocean. On our last stay here, we had an ocean view room, which was facing towards Waikiki, but still had a gorgeous view of the ocean. So, both room types are excellent. The staff were all very welcoming and kind. In particular, we enjoyed seeing "older" staff working at the hotel. The woman who brought us our room service was an older, "local" woman and it was really great to see that the hotel employees such people instead of simply replacing them with younger workers. We will be back on our next trip to Oahu!! Highlight: One morning, there was a Hawaiian monk seal sleeping on the beach in front of the hotel! We could see it from our balcony and also went down to see it from closer up. The Hawaiian monk seal is an endangered species, so it was a real treat to be able to see one.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed here in February and had a wonderful stay ! The room was small ...but really well thought out ...so we did not feel like we were lacking anything! We did have a partial ocean view from our balcony. The employees were very helpful and kind! You can find free parking spots on the street after 6 at night til 10 the next morning . We did this our entire 4 day stay and just had to set an alarm on our phone to put $ in the meter if we needed too. Alot cheaper than paying for hotel parking. One of the employees even mentioned this to us...worked out great! It is right across the street from the huge park near the zoo...close to the road that winds up to Diamond Head and we did lots of walking up that road and you can even wind down a path to the beach once you get there to enjoy the ocean and watch lots of surfers. The beach for the Otani is in a cove ..it is very safe....I even snorkeled right out from on the small reef and saw lots of fish! All and all ...my favorite place to stay on the beach in Waikiki away from the maddening crowds...which I do not like day in and day out!Thanks New Otani ...we will be back!
user_location: Puerto Viejo de Talamanca, Costa Rica
user_name:
margolu
Puerto Viejo de Talamanca, Costa Rica

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I stayed here with my family and enjoyed having a quieter (though not quiet) stay on Waikiki with the sights within walking distance. We appreciated having some separation from the main area of Waikiki. The views from the clean and adequate (ocean waikiki superior) rooms were quite good -- all glass wall and a sliding door. We were able to see the Friday fireworks show at the Hilton, watch the waves, utilize easy beach access, and enjoy the balcony. There is no pool but it's not really a problem with the beach close by. Nice that they don't charge a resort fee and also offer free wi-fi. Downsides are: it's still Waikiki and the park next door can be noisy, bell and towel service and valet (but not all valets) were so-so, restaurant is ridiculously expensive. We never ate there and I'd suggest scouting out options within walking distance.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed at the New Otani Kaimana Beach hotel for five nights. We stayed in a moderate room on the 4th floor of the tower part of the hotel. The room was listed as "no view", so was much cheaper than the beach view rooms. However, when we sat on our balcony, we could still see the beach or diamond head, depending on which side we faced our chairs. True, the view was obstructed, but it was still nice.The moderate room, as others have mentioned, was quite small. For us, this presented a problem, as we had SO many suitcases. We were in Hawaii on a stopover while immigrating from Canada to New Zealand. If we hadn't had so many bags, the room would have been fine.The room itself was clean and housekeeping did a good job. The beds were comfortable and the hotel was very quiet at night. We slept really well!The biggest plus for this hotel is the proximity to the beach. You literally walk out the door of the hotel and you are just a few steps away. At the same time, because it is on the far side away from Waikiki, it is quiet and much more peaceful than where many of the other hotels are. I'd say that it's about a 15 minute pleasant walk along the beach to get to the main area of Waikiki with the shopping areas from the hotel.The staff at the hotel were very nice, especially the valets. Special mention to Kealli (hope I got the spelling right), who was fantastic to chat with and super helpful when we asked him questions. I would have given the hotel five stars if the room had been just a tad bigger, or if some kind of breakfast (even just a small continental) had been included in the price.We certainly intend to come back again, and commend the hotel on its service. Thanks for a wonderful time!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: So we wanted a cheap option in Waikiki and stumbled across this hotel which was far cheaper than prices we had for private rooms in hostels at £75 a night including taxes, booking through Amoma. Do your research like I did and you will know there is no pool, the hotel is on the beach and some 10 minutes walk or so to Waikiki and 5 minutes to the bus stop that will take you to Pearl Harbour and the Hanuemu Bay. Having compared numerous hotels I booked this because of the cheap price and location as being slightly out of Waikiki was a bonus, e.g. not on the main strip.The room, the cheapest one was a moderate room. Having stayed in hotels in London and Paris I don't think the room was particularly small, compact but fine. It is dated and with the louvre bathroom doors and old style fittings but it was clean and perfectly functional. Our room had great views of Diamond Head and the beach too, you just turned your head to the right so we didn't pay to upgrade as we didn't see the point as we had just great views from our balcony. Our room was 924. There was a coffee machine which we used to boil water and an ice machine round the corner. The beach is lovely and in my opinion you don't need a pool.Its not fancy and everything in Waikiki is expensive but if you can get this as a good deal it may just work out cheaper than a hostel.We had little contact with staff but they were friendly and gave us bus information, etc..

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: this is the 3rd time i have stayed at this lovely hotel. although technically in waikiki, it is separated from the bright lights of the big hotels by kapiolani park and beach front. i had a great room w/ a wall of glass facing the pacific and looking over this locals patronized beach, sans souci. there is a stream out through a gap in the reef so much favoured by local ocean swimmers. w/ the adjacent park land there is some shade an space for families to set up big gathering. the beach itself is not really crowded compared to the main strand of waikiki near the big hotels.i have met natives of the city who have repeatedly enjoyed the ambience of the beach front hau tree restaurant. with a generous breakfast lunch and dinner menu this is a lovely setting for a good mealthe visitors to the hotel seem to be a mix of japanese tourists and mainland north americans. i was able to watch 3 sets of japanese visitors get their requisite on the beach wedding photos from my lanai.staff is both friendly and helpful

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: What a disappointing stay & experience!I arrived late on Sunday night after 2 flights of 6hrs each, a delay and a cancellation. By the time I made it to the hotel I was exhausted and in need of a hot shower & rest. Imagine my shock when I can barely enter the room with my luggage. The room, described as "moderate", is their standard room. It would be barely 200sq feet, was dilapidated and tired. It resembled something out of a 1970s tv show!The following morning I raised my concerns with the Front Desk. They offered to move me to a Diamond Head view room for an extra $60 plus tax or an Ocean View room for $100 plus tax. In their defense, the room was booked through Hotel Tonight. The photos posted on the app show a renovated Diamond Head view room of approximately 280sq feet not the small and tired room (523) I was given. This amounts to blatant deceptive and misleading conduct.I declined the offer to move for a fee and took my concerns up with Hotel Tonight. They apologized and arranged for me to move rooms free of charge. This occurred about 9pm local time whilst I was out to dinner. The reality of moving at 11pm after a night out was not feasible so I remained in my original room. A further complaint resulted in an apology from Hotel Tonight and a $50 credit.The Hotel itself is dated and tired. I understand the rooms are undergoing renovations but my room certainly had not. My lanai looks out over the car park and onto the wall of an adjacent building. The noise from the generators and air conditioning unit outside is unrelenting. Moreover, the noise from idling tourist coaches at the front of the hotel occurs several times per day, not to mention delivery trucks and trash collection. My three-night layover has been somewhat of a nightmare. For an extra $50 per night I could of stayed in a reputable 4* hotel not this rundown dump! I'm told the breakfast here is good, as is the bar, but I've spent as little time here as possible. I have disputed the charge with American Express as I simply have not received the goods or serviced advertised and what has been provided is significantly different from what I was promised.On one final positive note I will say that the location is excellent. I have been visiting Hawaii for over 20 years and always stay around the Gold Coast / Diamond Head in either a hotel or apartment. It is away from the hustle and bustle but an easy walk to restaurants & bars.I'm still awaiting a response from Hotel Tonight...I will update this post once or if it is received.This morning I again followed up with the Hotel and they offered to move me, free of charge to a larger, renovated room. I have in turn contacted Hotel Tonight to highlight the discrepancies between the photographs, room description and hotel rating. Their rating of "SOLID" is not accurate particularly for the un-renovated rooms.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in March. It is on the quieter side of Waikiki with a great beach, perfect for snorkelling, saw some puffer fish and many other amazing sea life. The hotel room was nice and spacious with a nice view of Waikiki and the ocean on the 7th floor. Those amazing points aside I settled on average for my review because some of the hotel service. Our other hotel in central Waikiki had amazing service and this felt very different. The bell boy and people in the restaurants were great. However the service at the front desk was a little disappointing, no hellos or goodbyes and we where made to feel like we where being a bother not a valid guest. Also they do not arrange airport transfers. Other then that the hotel itself is lovely and quant and good for people who want to relax on the beach all day!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Booked this hotel because we wanted a quieter, more romantic area away from the crowds of Waikiki. Couldn't have been more pleased. We originally booked an ocean front view, (highly recommended), and were surprised to get a free upgrade to a suite with a view of the ocean, Waikiki beach, and Diamond Head. The room was large with wrap around windows and three doors to the expansive corner lanai. Large bathroom with double sinks, glass enclosed shower with an additional deep tub. The wraparound lanai had a small table and two chairs and a chaise lounge. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the air conditioning was quiet and kept up comfortable. The staff was extremely attentive to our every need, (we requested additional hangers and they were delivered within minutes of our request). The Hau Tree restaurant served and excellent breakfast on the tree lined outdoor patio. Having the ocean only 50 feet away was a real treat as was the beautiful sunsets. We also had dinner at Miyako's Japanese restaurant on the 2nd floor. Delightful, authentic Japanese cuisine and service. A little pricey, but well worth every penny. The short walk to downtown Waikiki, (just 10-15 minutes) was enjoyable and quite safe as it is lighted and many people strolling to and from the area.  Had an great view of the Friday night fireworks on Waikiki and visits to the zoo and aquarium, both very close to the hotel. A very large park is across the street from the hotel so the area is quiet most of the time. The beach is quiet compared to the downtown area. However, it's the beach the locals use on weekend so it is much busier. The hotel also helped up rent a car and took care of all the details so we could just enjoy of stay. During our five day stay we walked from the hotel to Diamond head, (about a mile and a half each way). Great views, but a little challenging for folks not in good general condition. On the way back from Diamond Head we had a terrific lunch at a Hawaiian Mexican style eatery in a small strip mall. Good prices, and the rice bowl was delicious and filling.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants quiet, comfortable surroundings, excellent food and exceptional service. On the downside, the hotel charged $5.00 to use the computer for 30 minutes, which was the only negative regarding out stay. Yes. I would stay there again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is situated on the Kaimana Beach right across from the Zoo and Aquarium park. The vies is fantastic, service good, access to the pristine beach easy and two good restaurants on site. It is an older hotel that is getting a much needed makeover by the Otani group. We had a fabulous view of Waikiki and was easy walking distance to the luxury hotels and restaurants there, just 0.5miles along the beachfront.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Very nicely placed at the very end of Waikiki Beach, but regretfully in need of a major refurbishment. Restaurant has an excellent view over Waikiki Beach and Honolulu, but bar noisy and a very strong draft is going through the reception area and lounge. Staff correct but do not appear especially friendly. Many japanese guest (but that is the case all over Honolulu)

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Arrived Feb 11/15 to what they call a moderate room with no room to walk in if you have luggage, free wifi that does not work at all, the phone in the room did not work, slow draining sink in bathroom and a closet that had cheap metal hangers and small. They moved us to a larger room adjacent to the main building, we had to walk up stairs as there was no elevator but no big deal we are capable but still no wifi. Our second day there we came home that night and I thought my husband was exaggerating when he came back from our room in the lobby to tell me our room smelled like a sewer and it did. The front desk manager came up with us and confirmed it smelled awful. He moved us back to the main hotel to a newly renovated room on the 6th floor which was lovely however moving 3 times in 3 days does not create for a stress free holiday. Also the taxi driver they called for us to drive us to Pearl Harbour refused to take a credit card for payment and when we made arrangements for a car rental pick up at the activity desk with Alamo no one showed up and they did not have a record of our reservation. The food in the restaurant was expensive and even a lousy Caesar salad was $14 at the bar. However the breakfast at the ocean view restaurant was outstanding and well worth the money. The hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki strip which was nice but it is an old hotel with a huge discrepancy in rooms. The front desk staff were amazing as many of these things were out of their control. I will never go back here to stay despite the fact they always tried to make concessions like removing the charge for our 2 breakfasts in house which was worth about $100. Holidays are far too precious and it was 3 days of non stop screw ups and stress. All of Waikiki was just too touristy and over priced for mediocre meals.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The setting away from Waikiki's noisy crowds make this small hotel the best choice, and it's easy to park on the street for free or meter. In addition the Hau Kai tree restaurant with breakfast daily under the trees facing the ocean is extra special. We preferred the croissant-egg breakfast that came with fruit although the Eggs Benedict would have been the best I've had if only the holland arise had been hotter (I know it will separate if too hot, but still it could've been hotter.) We also ate dinner here and the combo lobster, scallop, fresh fish was delicious even if $46. Miyako upstairs serves excellent Japanese food and at 8pm the fixed menu drops to $32. My tempura was perfectly cooked as was Tom's tonkatsu. (Although they didn't use pork filet thickly sliced as I do but sliced the meat thinly more like a schnitzel Tom said it was very good.) it's true the rooms are tiny and the rugs worn in the halls but the 2 restaurants and the setting make it the best choice. And the beach in front is sandy even in the water whereas other beaches' waters had coral bottoms --hard on the feet. If you want fancy you may not like this but if you want romantic dinners and great breakfasts and a view of Diamond Head with a short walk to all the high rise hotels and shops then this is for you.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Just stayed here this week. The property is really nice and the location is good. It's a little further away from Waikiki next to Kapiolani park close to the aquarium. It's right by Diamond Head and it's easier to find street parking here than anywhere else in Waikiki. It's right on a nice beach (which was a little crowded when we went) and has the restaurant the Hau Tree Lanai right on the beach. I can't speak for the food since I didn't eat there. There are beautiful sunsets from here! I stayed in a moderate room with a view of buildings in front of me, Diamond Head to the left and ocean view to the right. The room is TINY! It could work for one person but two people you're bumping into each other. Plus the bathroom door has one of those doors with the slits all through the door so you feel like there isn't any privacy. The room isn't sound proof either. You hear everything in the hallway. Luckily all of the guests were quiet when we were there. We also had problems with the room key not working on several occasions and had to keep going to the front desk to have it reactivated...? All in all it was a nice stay but not sure I would stay again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: But it was such a very pleasant stay because of the quiet and soothing sounds of the waves on the beach instead of all the honking horns, delivery trucks and dumpsters being slammed around just about one half mile away. We upgraded for a Beach View Room but were very surprised when we checked in to get a free upgrade to an Ocean Front Suite. EVERY employee we encountered was so pleasant, the Robert Louis Stevenson Suite was wonderful, with many upgrades including the Nespresso Coffe machine, two large flat screen tvs, a luxurious bathroom with upscale toiletries and beautiful functional furniture. The lanai had a very nice reclining lounge chair and two more quality chairs in place of the usual cheap chairs found elsewhere. The small refrigerator was refilled each day with complimentary bottled water. Everything about this hotel was wonderful but even that pales in comparison to the views of the awesome colors of the Pacific Ocean just a mere 25 yards or so from our lanai. The beautiful views from the restaurant right next to the sand on the beach was spectacular also. Right across the neighborhood type street was Kapiolani Park with acres of green space, tennis courts and located at the foot of Diamond Head. We had a pleasant walk one night to eat at Hula Grill located right above Duke's Restaurant. Basically the same food without the long wait time (we actually had no wait time).

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I stayed for five days visiting some friends. The best things about the hotel, hands down are the location, the beach and breakfast at the hotel restaurant on the beach... (other meals are too pricey.) It is on the far end of Waikiki near Diamond Head, but I loved the walk to downtown Waikiki, about 15 minutes... My room was fine, the balcony made the room, on the smallish side but a comfortable bed (although the sheets were really cheap), and not all that spiff, but totally fine.. There was a lot of construction noise so I should have paid the upgrade fee and stayed ocean-side, it was pretty noisy, but not the hotel's fault of course. The staff was great, very friendly and helpful. The room was pretty clean. The Barefoot cafe on the Beach just past the aquarium has fantastic food, is open three meals a day and is not pricey, cannot recommend this place enough, also recommend that and the coffee at the convenience store at the hotel decent....I would go back. PS if you want to rent a bike, the hotel had no idea where to go, but I recommend Hawaii Bikes in the Queen Kapiolani Hotel, right across from the zoo. Hands down, they have the best bikes.....

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Best hotel we have stayed in years. Located near popular areas, but kind of away from the main Waikiki area. Right across the street from nice big green space. Within walking distance of most fun things to do but away from traffic and craziness of Waikiki area. Restruant is outstanding and serves a great breakfast with great view of beach under the trees. Everyone was friendly and helpful at the hotel. We travel a lot but this was one of the best experiences we have ever had. Great view of the ocean. My favorite place to stay in Hawaii.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is a much quieter spot than in Waikiki proper, but you can easily walk back to the busy life of Waikiki along Kapiolani Park in less than 15 minutes. The little beach outside the hotel is an absolute treasure with plausible snorkeling, good surfing, and excellent swimming (swim out to the wind sock). The banyan tree restaurant in the hotel is absurdly priced, but it's an amazing location. Sit under the trees with your breakfast, sip the coffee, and enjoy the beach right next to you.I feel right at home at the hotel. The friendly valets, the lazy koi, the breeze blowing through the lobby...
user_name:
Michael D
Madison, Wisconsin, United States

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed in the hotel for 7 nights. The first impression when going up to the room was an "Alcatraz feeling" due to the architecture of the inside of the hotel. The room was really small and in definetively need of renovation. BUT the room was clean and we slept perfectly.The hotel has a great location aside from the busy Waikiki beach. However, the walk back to the hotel in the late evening is not recommended due to the darkness in the surroundings.The bar and the restaurant was top. Really good food and nice drinks. The ambiance in the hotel is perfect. We liked the hotel better and better for each day.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: On the way from the airport in our shuttle, the driver asked where we were staying for the drop off, he instantly said that we were staying at a great hotel with a great location. He also told us the best bars to visit which were just a 10-15 minute walk through the Kapiolani park. The hotel it's self looks a little dated, but I think it's part of it's charm. They have a lovely fish pond out the front. And the Hau Tree Lanai restaurant is totally fantastic. Great food and it's right under a giant Hau tree that's on the beach.The beach is beautiful, you can have a swim in the sea or watch people surf.It's just so lovely.Also when we were back to the hotel late, we asked if the staff could order us pizza from Pizza Hut, which they kindly did for us.You are really close to Diamond head, so close that you can hike straight from the hotel.They also have some tour organisers at the hotel too. There we arranged a day trip to see where The TV show Lost was filmed and Jurassic Park and Pearl Harbor. And a day out at a Ranch, a Luau experience and also a swim with sharks experience.It was my first trip to Hawaii, I would definitely stay at the New Otani Beach Kaimana again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We had just an overnight in Honolulu on our way to the Big Island, and wanted a hotel close to the airport. Be aware that 9 miles from the airport took THIRTY minutes to get to! I had booked online a "moderate" room which in the photos looked very nice. The room was clean and basically comfortable, but SO SMALL you can barely turn around. For the nearly $200 we paid for a single night plus $45 in cab fare one way it was NOT worth the price.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: After a week in the busy Waikiki area we treated ourselves to our 4 night romantic boutique hotel on the Sans Souci Beach. We had a full ocean view... the waves were so wonderfully loud at times I had to close the patio door. It was a perfect retreat. The dining room has perfect ambiance and great menu choices. We will stay there again and highly recommend this oasis for couples <3

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Have stayed here many times over the last 30 years for all the right reasons.1. Location. It's an oasis in the Waikiki area, out past the strip and next to Kapiolani Park, biggest on the island and a great place to walk or run everyday.2. Beach. Great 'private' beach outside the hotel, used by local families too.3. Restaurant. Could be just the best location on the planet. Eat under a very old banyan tree overlooking the beach (where Robert Louis Stevenson apparently wrote his last two books).4. Service. Really nice people, very accommodating and helpful.Will return again, as always..

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed here on our first trip to Honolulu this year. Its location was the primary reason--it is out of the madness of central Waikiki and has a lovely, quiet beach in front of the hotel It is about a fifteen minute walk to the center of Waikiki, and not one you would want to make late at night since the path is unlighted and you walk through a park full of homeless encampments.The hotel itself was built shortly after WWII, and its primary market seems to be Japanese tourists. It is small, quiet, and the rooms are small but well-appointed with great views to the beach and downtown Honolulu. The front desk staff is clueless, and service in general seems indifferent except for the bell desk. The kitchen closes at 9 pm, so if you come in late (as we did) you are out of luck--no restaurant, no bar food, no room service, and no other restaurant open within walking distance.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel is currently going through some renovations, although it was was hardly apparent.We were given a room upgrade and it was a great room that was newly renovated (Room 728, corner room). The bed was very comfortable and the room was spacious. The view of Diamond Head was splendid and we even got a little glimpse of the water from the balcony.The lobby and ground floor restaurant could use some updates, but beyond that were clean and accommodating.The hotel itself is not in the thick of Waikiki. We chose it for that reason. The beach in front of the hotel was nice and not too crowded. A great place to watch a sunset as well. We made the walk to the more populated area to the west a few times. It's a long walk, but a nice one.Parking at the hotel seemed a little pricey, but everything on the island seems that way. We might have been ok to park on the street even, but just decided to not worry about it and leave the car at the hotel. The staff is very sweet and lovely. This hotel seems to cater to a large Japanese clientele. We enjoyed our stay and would stay there again. I had hoped there would be a pool, but alas there is none.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Went for breakfast, lunch & dinner to Hau Tree several times. Portions excellent. Service good. Had a few meals with a long term patron of the restaurant and she was greeted by her first name and they gave us special attention. The servers were excellent.......she was in failing health and nothing was too much trouble. Loved them for that!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed in the New Otani for 2 nights after traveling the Hawaiian islands for 3 weeks. As you can guess from the name it is a Japanese hotel. The staff was quite friendly. The location is about a 15 minute walk from Waikiki Beach where you find shops and restaurants. They provide free WLAN which is not encrypted, so be carefully how you use it. The hotel has a private beach which was pretty crowed and not really nice. The room was very small and did not seem to be “new” at all, it rather could use some renovations. Well, it is really a low budget hotel, but after staying in a couple of other hotels in Hawaii I cannot recommend it. It might be okay for a short stay, but if you celebrating something or want to have a great vacation just spend some more money and you get a much better experience. When we visit Oahu again we will definitively choose another place.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The location of this hotel is right at the end of Waikiki, so it's like a private beach. Not too busy or noisy, and very relaxed. The hotel is a real, old Hawaiian hotel, not a brand new retro decorated version, so I found it charming. I booked the lowest price room for one night, and was very happy with my choice. Cotton sheets, a small balcony with a sliver of beach view down below, good shower, and a little fridge and coffee maker. I will definitely be back for a longer stay, and bring my husband...it's very romantic eating at the restaurant on the lanai downstairs!
user_name:
Elizabeth S
Auckland Central, New Zealand

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is located near Diamondhead away from the crouds. We stayed in tbe Otani suite that had views of the park, beach and Diamondhead. The hotel is showing its age but is undergoing renovation. The suite was just recently finished and is modern and nicely done. You can shower or soak in a tub and have a magnificant view of the beach. The only issue with staying here is unless you are eating at the hotel it's about mile walk to restaurants.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Loved this place! Walking into the lobby, this floor was open to the outside and wonderful seabreezes were flowing in. We stayed in a well appointed and updated room with a lanai facing Waikiki and the ocean. Lovely. The New Otani is located next to the Kapiolani Regional Park at the end of Waikiki. We didn't had the crowds of the busy central Waikiki Hotel district. It is also next to Diamond Head, although we needed to take a taxi to get to the State Park trail entry. Hotel food was excellent in both restaurants.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: What a good location for some peace and quietness. In walking distance to the waikiki strip. Good parking spot in front of the hotel if you dont want to do valet parking. Nice park for some morning stroll.. Rooms small but clean. Right on the beach! Good food.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The NOKBH is the perfect place away from the noise and crowds of Waikiki. Kaimana Beach is a great mix of locals and visitors with excellent snorkeling. The staff is extremely polite and accommodating. A must visit place.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This was my first trip in 40 years and I travelled on my own. I had an ocean view room on the sixth floor with a view to die for, exactly as it is in their photos only better. Lovely room with a very comfy bed. Kelly at the bar with her lovely smile made walking into the lounge area easy on my own for a late lunch or drink and the evening waitresses were lovely as well. Food and beverages great and well priced. How spoilt did I feel when I came back to my room each night and my bed was turned down and orchids on the pillows and bed lamps turned on. An easy walk to everything and the beach literally on the back doorstep was just beautiful and much quieter than down in the main waikiki area. Thank you all from the bottom of my heart. I will be back to stay many times. Dianne Ehsman

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We think ( wife and I) the Kaimana Beach Hotel restaurant is one of the best in Waikiki. They justreally do a good job. We actually go there regularly for birthdays, mother's day, etc.The view and the restaurant are the best

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani hotel at the end of Waikiki could not be any closer to the sea if it wanted to be. You walk direct from the hotel onto the golden sand and then a very short walk and you are in the sea. It is a safe swimming area and further out there are good waves for surfers. The cuisine at the restaurant is excellent as is the service. Rooms vary in prices but the room we were in, had a view to the beach and also to Diamond head and the coastline some miles away. Cannot speak too highly of this hotel, its service and its food. It is at the end of Waikiki beach and there is a 200m walk to the bus stop but its just the perfect place to spend a blissful holiday.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This place is a gem. At the end of Waikiki so it's nice and quiet, yet only a 10 minute walk to the hustle and bustle of the touristy area. The ocean view room was small but well-appointed. Wifi access is slow but free. The staff is, without exception, friendly and very helpful. I HIGHLY recommend Miyako, the Japanese restaurant on the second floor. The food was absolutely wonderful.
user_name:
Adam R
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We only spent a day in this lovely hotel before heading off to the big island. It was the Labour Day w/e so a lot of people around for the ocean race. Staff were polite, obliging and helpful. The decor the usual tropical arrangement. You could have walked into Waikiki but we used "The Bus" the stop being very close. You virtually have your own beach out front of the hotel. I would definitely stay here again for a longer period. It is getting a little tired, but I believe renovations are on the cards, which must be hard, as it is always well supported. We used a shuttle service to and from the airport (Roberts).

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Loved every minute. Gorgeous room, large, renovated, all the amenities, wrap-around balcony with views of Diamond Head and the ocean. Walking distance to lively area, but quiet and gorgeous beach. LOVED the little Koa Tree restaurant. Front desk staff was excellent. Concierges (I spoke with two of them) were a little strange. One suggested I visit gardens which were actually under construction. The other told me it wasn't really worth it to hike Diamondhead, which I did and it was wonderful! Got better info from front desk. Front desk also helped arrange airport shuttle which saved me over $50.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: my first trip to Hawaii and i just loved to stay at the new Otani, everything was just perfect, from service to food and of course the best location ever. Once in a lifetime you should sleep at one of the most famous beaches in the world, the Waikiki beach and all i can think is i need to go back....

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Hotel was everything we wanted, walking distance to Waikiki Beach area, but far enough away to be away from the crowds and noise. We had a superior room on the 6th floor with fabulous views of both Diamond Head and our beach as well as Waikiki Beach. The sunrises and sunsets were beautiful, especially the color reflected over the beach. The room was nicely sized,clean and had small refrigerator, table and two chairs, sofa, safe, and a comfortable king bed that could be converted to two twins. With the balcony doors closed, the room was extremely quiet and dark with the blinds closed. Bathroom was big enough and had shower/tub combo. The Hau Tree Lanai restaurant was very good. Reserve early so that you can get a seat with a view at the railing. This is al fresco dining, so there were birds flying in, so directly under the tree limbs is not ideal.Service was great from front desk staff, bar service, wait staff, housekeeping and parking. Parking costs an additional $24 per day and is valet only. The valets were extremely helpful though with some great suggestions for our day based on our itinerary, including the simple suggestion to borrow a hotel umbrella to shield the sun. Hotel has rain umbrellas, beach towels and mats that you can sign out, no charge.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This place was great clean tidy and very pleasant helpful staff, the beach is right there with a bar close by, you couldn't ask for more, just a short walk to town. Valet parking was great. Just really good value all round.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is my second stay at the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel, and it won't be my last. When compared to other options in Waikiki, this is the best option...and the best part is that it isn't IN Waikiki. The lobby, restaurant and hallways are very dated and shabby. The beach is all public, so there are no chairs or umbrellas. There is no pool. However, the rooms make up for it! We booked an oceanfront room, but were bumped up to an oceanfront deluxe and were completely wowed when we walked in the door. They have the most incredible views with large lanais with comfortable chairs. The beds are comfortable. The bathroom is a touch small and has a shower curtain, but the toilets have TOTO bidet/washlet seats. They use L'occitane products. The wifi is strong and fast. The TV and furnishings are lovely. The rooms were renovated for most of the hotel about 3 years ago, I believe. After my second stay, it is now my favorite place to stay in the Waikiki area and will stay there any time I visit in the future. Oh, it's expensive, but everything is in Hawaii.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I enjoy trying different hotels in Waikiki. This place was great. My booking was a last minute deal because I didn't like the rate at another hotel. So I was quite surprised to get upgraded to a 1 bedroom apartment with a partial view of the ocean! My balcony must have been 10 feet long. Everyone was very nice and everything worked fine. They use proximity keys which appear to resist being demagnetized - saving you and the hotel the MUDA of rework! I didn't have a chance to try the food, but there were many customers. The only thing on the down side was that there is no elevator in the tower I stayed in... but the room was worth the climb.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed here with our elementary school boy in an oceanfront room. We had a king size bed and cot for him and still the room felt spacious. It was lovely to wake up to see the beach outside and a view of Waikiki. Bonus: we could see the fireworks Friday night that are set off at the Hilton!Another treasure: you can snorkel at the beach outside the hotel. There are beautiful tropical fish at the coral reef about 20 feet from the shore. You don't need to be a good swimmer; you just need a snorkel mask and you can float above the water and watch nature in action. It is probably not as spectacular as Hanuama Bay, but then again you don't have to drive there or pay an admission fee!The rooms are newly renovated and nicely appointed. The bathrooms are spacious.Do make a reservation for breakfast at the hotel restaurant the Hau Tree Lanai. We did not and ate at the bar and the Island Breakfast with poi pancakes and fresh pineapple is not to be missed. However, the real experience is sitting outside under the trees and eating.The Miyako restaurant has a nice view but we were disappointed in the food. the chicken teriyaki was fatty.Starbucks is about a 10 minute walk away, but there is also a convenience store in the hotel that has breakfast items for sale, including coffee, as well as other snacks and drinks. Very convenient!Note that for dinner you need to drive somewhere if you are not eating at the restaurant and parking in Waikiki can be a challenge. you wouldn't want to walk the 10 minutes at night because of having to walk through a dimly lit park (which is beautiful during the day).Absolutely lovely hotel and we will be back!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We live on Oahu and were seeing jack Johnson at the waikiki shell so we wanted to stay the night close by. We stayed at the new otani. The staff was very friendly and our room was beautiful. We had an ocean view with a private lanai. We were able to get a fantastic kaamaina rate, for locals only. Also my favorite breakfast at the hau tree lanai is downstairs, they have terrific eggs Benedict .

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Excellent value. on the beach. perfect out of the way. for business and families. love the small apartment with kitchenette for families. fancy restaurant worth at least one visit to enjoy the outdoor meal under a historic hau tree, right on the beach. best place to stay if you're doing the Honolulu marathon:)

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: It is just a short walk from Waikiki, and with a really nice beach right in front of it, far less crowded than the ones in Waikiki. Service provided was good as well. We stayed in the studio, and it was comfortable enough, but later we moved for one of the rooms in the hotel, and it was great!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We enjoy staying here as kamainas, the room is small, but works, the view, not great, but works for us. We like being next to Kaimana Beach and being on the quiet end of Waikiki. The service is wonderful, hotel will provide a coffee maker if requested.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: the rooms are all completely remodeled, the food is still wonderful (especially breakfast), the beach is one of the best in waikiki, and we love this hotel. never stay anywhere else if going to waikiki

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I was looking at booking rooms at Kahala, Trump or other higher end hotels, but ended up staying at the New Otani and I have no regrets! We stayed at this hotel 18 years ago when funds were tighter and I generally stay at nicer hotels now, but was so glad that I didn't overspend for this last trip to Oahu. We had a car and were really in HI to visit friends and eat good food so accomodations were not as much of a priority. We had been to Hanauma before, so snorkeling out in front of the hotel was perfect for us. This is probably what made our stay here so worthwhile. Clear, calm water with nice size tropicals, bone fish and even a small moray eel with the convenience of easy access to the hotel room. The beach was never super crowded and we liked being so near the water.Be sure to get a larger remodeled room with a balcony overlooking the water. We saw the fireworks at the Hilton over the water (on Fridays) and relaxed on the balcony admiring the ocean views. The bathrooms are fairly basic & small still, but the furnishings are nicely updated so provides a good value considering you have direct ocean access and am away from the hubbub of Waikiki central. The park next door hosts many locals having gatherings in the day, but gets very quiet at night.We had breakfast at the hotel once and the view was great. The food was good, but it's not easy getting a reservation for breakfast and there are a lot of great breakfast places if you have a car, so didn't really experience too much of the hotel food. I like the location because so much great Hawaiian food is within a short drive. Koko Head Cafe (Top Chef's Leeann Wong's place) and Alan Wong's for their tasting menu were a highlight! For local quick eats, we liked Diamond Head Grill (go in the store for incredible local desserts).Would return here for future visits to Oahu!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel is just a little walk away from the town. It is on the beach which was brilliant. They provide towels for the beach. The hotel booked a tour for us and it was very good and picked up from outside the hotel.The rooms are fairly basic but were clean. We had a lovely view of the beach and you could see the mountain on the other side. The actual reception area and hotel is airy, light and pretty.The best thing was the restaurant. The seafood was excellent.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I travel to Honolulu a couple of times a year to visit my mom and regularly stay at the Kaimana Beach Hotel. I refuse to stay in the middle of the shopping mall that Waikiki has become, but like to be on the beach and reasonably close to my mom's retirement place in Punahou. When I lived in Hawai'i years ago, Kaimana was our regular beach. It's primarily a local crowd with a nice park adjacent and Kapiolani Park across the street. The Diamond Head view rooms are our favourite and, if you must, Waikiki proper's a short stroll down the beach. There's no pool, but there is the Pacific Ocean out the door. So A+ for location.I think the rooms are great. They're not particularly spacious or fancy, but you really shouldn't be spending much time in your room anyway. I'm over six feet tall and have no problems whatsoever. The staff are very helpful and friendly and the bar and Hau Tree Restaurant overlook the beach and offer very good food and drinks. There's also a Japanese restaurant on the second floor, which I've never tried.I highly recommend the New Otani Kaimana Beach.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Firstly let me say that the location of this hotel is excellent. On one side you have the lovely beach and the other side Diamond Head. The lobby os lovely with a beautiful setting for the restaurant and the staff are really nice.However, the room we had was not what we expected. It was nothing like what the pictures on their website show. Stepping out of the lift was like going back in time compared to getting in ib the lovely lobby. The decor in the hotel is like a cheap hotel or a 1970's b&b. The room was small and dated. There is nothing positive I can say about the room. I have read tgat there is renovations taking place in the hotel but don't trust the pictures on the website. The rooms shown are nothing like what we got!!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed at the New Otani Hotel for two nights. Our room which was on the 6th floor overlooking the park and Diamond Head had a king bed and roll-away bed for our grand-daughter. Cost was $213/night. Room was very clean and comfortable. The restaurant serves excellent food in a very pleasant setting next to the beach. The meals are expensive (dinner entrees from $30-$49) and there is not a less expensive choice at this hotel. The staff is very pleasant although the concierge is somewhat rude. Overall a good choice.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife and I have now returned from Hawaii and had time to reflect on the two weeks we spent at the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel on Oahu. The first thing that comes to mine is some great service in the midst of a personal crisis from many staff; Orlando, an employee on the Main Desk stands out as having been extremely helpful during that time. He went above and beyond in helping us- nothing was too much trouble and he was professional, helpful and sensitive to our needs. We would recommend the hotel on the quiet end of Waikiki beach- superbly clean, the place had a really good feel to it. Great little beach down below and walking distance to the delights of downtown Waikiki and beyond. Much better than those on the other end which felt a bit like "Disneyland on steroids" (if you know what I mean). We just wanted peace and quiet, which is what we got. A most enjoyable hotel to stay at. We were with a large group for a musical event across the road at Kapiolani Park, and to accommodate lots of visits from group members requested- and were given- a coffee percolator, microwave and electric jug for the duration of our stay. We would recommend the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel for a quiet stay in a convenient location.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: When I opened the door of my room I said "wow" - the view was incredible. The room was looking down all of Waikiki, in particular over the little golden sand beach directly below the hotel, and the old swimming pool where Duke apparently trained for the Olympics. They must have been renovating because on the floor above me rooms were still being worked on during the days, painted, etc. My room was lovely, clean and new. The bed was super comfy, the pillows squishy and feathery. The room was quite small, but perfect for my short business trip. I took the 10-15 minute walk into the heart of Waikiki, and it was really nice. Not very far at all. The room was very quiet too. When I have stayed in the center of Waikiki I have had a hard time sleeping because of the noise. Here it was peaceful and lovely. Didn't try the restaurants, but they looked very popular. $25 fee for overnight parking. Friendly staff.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Close to Diamond Head and Waikiki, but still a short distance from all the crowds. We walked .6 miles to Starbucks a few times. Go upstairs to LuLu's for breakfast. Good value and food. Back to the hotel...rooms are small, but clean, with big screen TV and nice bathroom area. I broke the shower head and it was fixed within a few hours. Good water pressure in the shower. Service is great with free beach towels and beach mats to checkout. Nice restaurant and bar, but a bit pricey. I had a little trouble with the valet parking guys putting our car so close to other vehicles that I had to climb in the passenger side and over the transmission shifter to drive the car. He tossed me the keys and said "you can get it". The hotel credited back two days worth of valet fees for the poor service. A BIG WARNING TO DRIVERS: it is illegal to use your cellphone in the car. My son (driving, but stopped at a light) was checking the GPS on his phone and written a $297 ticket.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Quiet, peaceful, friendly staff, free wifi, great beach next door 5 minutes away from your room and only a short walk to the centre of the action - definitely returning! Can't imagine anyone having a bad experience here..

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We enjoyed staying close to Waikiki without feeling like we were downtown. This location, next to the "locals' beach," Kapiolani Park, the zoo & aquarium, as well as great little cafes and restaurants on Monserrat Avenue. Plan your trip to coincide with some of the free festivals in the park, such as the Ukelele Festival every July. The hotel is comfortable for couples or families. With the kitchenette, it's possible to save on restaurant meals. Our room had a balcony with a great view of palm trees and the beach stretching all the way down to the Royal Hawaiian--great place to watch the sunset over Waikiki!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We booked here for our second trip to Hawaii as we read there was a lot of construction work in the main part of Waikiki.(international market flattened and new shopping centre being built)We were not disappointed it was lovely and quiet.The beach was much nicer too ,wider and not so hectic with good snorkling .Our room was a little on the small side ,but clean and the bed very comfy .We had a small baloney with views of diamond head .The hotel however is undergoing a refurb which didn't effect us but we had one of the old rooms.You can see why it needs an over haul .The hotel was Built 50 years ago and our room was stuck in the 80s .none of the cupboard doors fitted in the holes ,the split system leaked and there was great lack of electrical sockets .We did have a peep in the new rooms and they were lovely .The staff are nice ,and very helpful.The pay off for being in the a quiet part of town is the walk to the main part of Waikiki every day.The resturant at the hotel is lovely .great view & food but there is little else that end of town.The distance didn't bother us but for some reason the lights on the seafront path don't come on til well after dark ,and even if they are on ,there are parts of the path that have no lights ,hell parts of the path have no path .so sensible shoes and a torch is a good idea.It is well documented that there is large numbers of homeless people on Waikiki beach ,so the night walk back to the hotel can be a little daunting ,but I only felt threatened once .so if you are a little infirm and are travelling alone I wouldn't recommend this hotel for that reason .

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife and I stayed in the tower in mid--July for 5 nights. Half way through I saw an enormous cockroach on the bathroom counter, which I then killed. We got transferred to another room, at my request. The rooms (both) are very small. The hotel is undergoing a very needed renovation. Everything in the room is dated. But the A/C worked well, and the location on the beach is really nice. Restaurants are expensive, modern, and we liked the Japanese one. Car parking is by valet, moderately expensive (24/night), but the workers are very efficient. It is about 1/2 mile walk (nice) to restaurants and shops in downtown Wikiki. Hawaii is expensive, but I feel given the fauna and room size this is not a very good deal. A few years ago we stayed in Wikiki at Embassy Suites hotel - pricier but modern and a better deal in my view.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Loved our stay here! Had a superior ocean view room and our view was amazing.Rooms are well equipped and very clean. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Hau Tree restaurant is well worth a visit, bit pricey, but food is very good and don't think anything beats this location. An evening meal, sat watching the sunset over the ocean is to die for! After reading some of the reviews, was slightly apprehensive about the homeless in the park, but to be honest this really wasn't a problem, and felt safe at all times. It's about 20 minute walk into Waikiki and all the hustle and bustle but so nice to leave all that behind and return to Kaimana.This really was a holiday of a lifetime and would have loved to have stayed longer, and if lucky enough to return to Hawaii in the future, would definitely stay at the New Otani

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Very clean, very friendly, attentive staff. Towels and bamboo mats are provided for the beach free of charge. Parking is expensive, but we found free parking every night other than July 4. Adjacent to a public park great for morning walks, runs...I even did Yoga in the park one day. Great views of Waikiki...we loved the fireworks, too! Much more reasonably priced than the Waikiki hotels. The open air lobby has a beautiful breeze and a nice view. Our room was very small (Twin beds!) and very dated.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I've stayed here several times now and absolutely love this place. Right on the ocean just outside the hustle bustle of Waikiki, yet a world apart in serenity and aloha spirit. Make sure you spring for the corner rooms - there is no better way to treat yourself. The rooms are not large, but well equipped. Friendliest service. Great lobby bar with live music and ocean views. Hau Tree restaurant is a must for eggs Benedict. Great Sushi restaurant. Can't wait to stay again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel was fine and the restaurant was a bit pricey but actually very good. My only other comment is that there is often a photograph of a natural pool associated with the hotel. It is actually next to the hotel and was a public natural pool that has been closed to the public and I think that the hotel should remove that photo from their marketing. There is a beach and it is quite nice and safe to swim in. In fact it seems to be the place where the triathletes train. So if you are a triathlete traveling to Hawaii this may be a good option for you.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
