review_body: Our Diamond Head view room was very small, the sink in a recess in the room and toilet and shower seperated from sink area by a door, very cramped. However was kept spotlessly clean by housekeeping staff.The restaurant was too expensive for us for to eat at.The beach area was still beautiful and the hotel provided mats and towels.All the staff are very friendly and helpful.The hotel is in the process of refurbishment so there was some noise in the early morning as the plumbers/decorators arrived.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: After booking I had mixed feelings about both its location and an email advising of construction work going on in the hotel, but ... I really enjoyed my stay. Its location is both a plus and a minus, to the far East end of Waikiki beach, hence isolated from the noise and pace of Waikiki city, which means it is quiet, but a 10 minute minimum walk to shops/restaurants. Smart reception/lobby area, excellent restaurant and bar area in which had breakfast and supper, superb views from room across Waikiki, small rooms but spotless. Contrary to the hotel I had stayed in the previous 5 days (in Maui), internet access and a safe in the room were free, although parking is limited, hence valet only and relatively expensive ($24/day). I would stay again, in the end the construction work going on was inobtrusive and did not affect my stay.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed in this hotel overnight after visiting Maui and Hawaii. We had previously stayed in the busier, bustling center of Wakiki and we were looking for a more relaxed and less hectic environment, before catching a flight to the mainlnd US. The New Otani was perfect for our requirements. Its ner Diamond Head. It's older and being renovated. Our room was small and a bit worn, but the queen bed was comfortable and we had a great view of Diamond Head from our balcony. You walk directly out of the hotel onto the public beach which was not overly crowded. The beach is next to a large well tended park with a small public aquarium. The hotel provides bamboo sand mats as well as beach towels. Very friendly helpful staff who made some good recommendations for dining options within walking distance. I would definitely stay here again although I would upgrade to a larger room. There is no swimming pool or health club in the hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed at this wonderful hotel 4 days in June 2014. The start of our Hawaiian Vacation, and we were not disappointed. Our Waikiki and Diamond Head views were spectacular, Fireworks on Friday night, Rainbows over the Pacific, green park , well maintained right next door. The room was serviced twice a day, and a turn down service each evening.The entire staff is exceptional.Try to have breakfast at least once, at the Hau Tree Restaurant, it is world class and a great way to start your morning . The Honolulu Zoo and Aquarium are within walking distance, as well as nice shopping, at the Royal Hawaiian Center. This Home away from home keeps you outside of the Big City Crush of Waikiki crowds , yet gives you easy access to the Iconic Views.Mahalo.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Nice hotel, located directly on the beach. Positives? Away from the Waikiki crowds. Negatives? Away from eating places outside of the hotel's 2 dressy restaurants and small bar. The hotel is also going through a major renovation at this time (June 2014). If you plan on being in your room beyond 9am in the mornings (during the week) beware. Renovation work starts around 9am, meaning that loud Jack Hammer and drill sounds can resonate through the hotel's concrete walls, and feels like you are inside a ringing bell. Other than that, the "Modest" hotel rooms are very comfortable, especially if you are traveling by yourself. About the hotel restaurants, we ate dinner the Miyako, the Chef Special Prefix dinner was excellent. We also breakfast at The Hau Tree Lanai, the ambience was beautiful, the food was average, and the service was very spotty (had to ask for coffee refill and water after waiting patiently for refills).

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I stayed here the night before the Honolulu Marathon. The location was great. I was able to walk to the zoo to catch a shuttle to the start line. It is an easy walk to the zoo and aquarium. The room was basic and clean. Nothing fancy but a good location.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I love this place! The location is perfect with the beach, park, and Waikiki and Diamond Head right there, yet just enough removed. Though it may not be the most shining and up-to date, this place emanates a feeling of Aloha and the Hawaii that I know and love that is disappearing as things update and modernize. The staff is excellent and genuinely friendly and kind, the food and service wonderful. I don't want to stay anywhere else when visiting Oahu!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This New Otani is beautifully located nearby Diamond Head at the end of Waikiki beach, the beach itself is very nice. Sadly, the room's condition was poor: a whole in the carpet, old and dusty curtains, squeaky bed, old linens, etc. The service at the front counter was not very attentive and the wait staff at their Japanese restaurant was borderline arrogant, however, the bell staff was pleasant and welcoming. This was an unpleasant surprise to me as I've stayed numerous times at New Otani hotels in both Japan and the mainland U.S. and the service and condition of their hotels have been impeccable. The price we paid was reasonable but we would not return to this hotel unless it is refurbished/updated and management retrains its staff on how to be polite and attentive to its guests.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I must say that I was a little worried because the reviews for this place were mixed. I loved this place. It is away from the craziness of Waikiki, but close enough to be part of it if you wish. All of the employees were very happy and friendly. I mean very happy and engaging for conversation with local tips. I was even invited to go diving. The rooms are dated but clean and has an evening turn down service from the old days that is just charming. The food at the Hau Tree is very good, however a little $$, for every night. Take a 10 minute walk to the Barefoot Cafe for a great dinner. The beach could not be closer or nicer. The only complaint I have is anyone with a tattoo must cover up all signs of a tattoo. Most look like they are burn victims with their arms and legs wrapped up in bandages. This is so silly since this is where tattoos came from hundreds of years ago. Please change that policy, please

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is an older building that has been done up recently, the rooms were clean and tidy and many have great views across Waikiki Beach.I found it much better to be away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Waikiki, but still a short walk into town.the hotel also fronts directly onto the beach so it was a great place for a morning / evening swim.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I stayed here for four nights while celebrating a relative's 90th birthday. The location is ideal for access to Waikiki beaches, shopping, and walking around Diamond Head. I quickly learned to park my car on the street. Using the valet parking was very, very pricey and since I wasn't around the hotel during the day, I could easily find parking after 6 PM and was gone before 10AM. My room was spacious, the bed was comfortable, the linens had a nice feel to them and I could regulate the AC. I chose a room facing Diamond Head. Since I wasn't in the room very much, I didn't feel like paying an up charge to see the ocean and Diamond Head is gorgeous in the morning with the sun coming up behind it.But it was some little things that weren't quite right. There were tiles that had fallen off the baseboard in the tub area and the wallpaper was also beginning to peel. The drawers and doors in the dresser were askew. I wondered about the quality of the maintenance. The management did say they were renovating the floor above, so I hope the small lapses in maintenance were in advance of renovating the floor I was on.I'd definitely recommend this hotel to others.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: sleek Asian design, beachfront, spacious rooms,attentive staff, responsive to every need,good restaurants with excellent foodvariety, pricey hotel menus. sixth floorroom 621, just lovely with perfect balconyfor checking the waves, drinks, sunsets. toto automatic washlett Japanese toiletsa bonus. $24/overnight parking a downer.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I recently stayed at this hotel. Room was good, loved the location, but the restaurant is so sub par for breakfast. It was a disappointment for value, as the meals were pretty inedible, unless you order a bagel and cream cheese. That was pretty good. I hope this hotel can upgrade it's breakfast for guests. Dinner was wonderful. However, our service from the front desk was excellent, and I would suggest it for the traveler who wants to be away from the crowds, but is only a walk away from from dropping serious dough on a noisy hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights and had a really great time. We were greeted with really friendly helpful staff, nothing was to much for them. We got upgraded to an Ocean View room as we were on our honeymoon, which was a really lovely surprise. We had an amazing view from our room, we could see Waikiki Beach and the ocean of course. We had a balcony with a couple of chairs and table and was nice to sit and enjoy the views when it got really hot as the breeze was most refreshing.It is a 10 minute walk to the main Waikiki strip, which was fine for us, as we wanted more of a relaxing stay rather than the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. I miss Oahu and when my husband and I return, we will be sure to stay at this amazing hotel.Thank you all at the New Otani for making our stay so special.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The perfect hotel for enjoying Oahu. It has a quiet and open location, yet is easily accessible to all of Honolulu. Although the rooms are not large, they have been very nicely remodeled. Terrific views and balconies. Wonderful restaurant. Friendly staff. Great beach. I've been staying here since 1980 and it remains my first choice for Honolulu and Oahu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed for five nights and it was a great find.....upper floors facing Waikiki are the rooms to get ( we stayed in room 612), killer views of the whole of Waikiki, and none of the crowds. A five minute walk to the start of Waikiki, very pleasant next to Kapiolani Park, and the Aquarium. Breakfast is under the Hau Tree overlooking the beach. One of only a few hotels that have a beach, and none of the crowds of Waikiki.No pool, but you have the beach right at the hotel. Over the years we have stayed at many hotels from one end of Waikiki (the Hilton complex of towers) to the Kahala, and for the price, this is a hotel I would recommend for the veteran travelers to Honolulu, disappointed with the shopping mall Waikiki has become, and also for the 1st timer to the islands Very attentive staff. We will return for our next visit to Honolulu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for four nights and enjoyed the hotel very much. Our room had a killer view of Diamond Head. Nice breezes blow through the lobby. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Great restaurant. The hotel provides beach towels. Swam out to the orange beacon, as did many other people. Saw some colorful fish close to the beach.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Just recently spent 1 night in Waikiki before traveling up to the North Shore. I wish we could have stayed here longer. We stayed in a studio in the Diamond Head wing which was extremely comfortable. Arlene and the rest of the staff are outstanding! We were able to change our reservation and get a crib on short notice. The beach is awesome with great snorkeling right there. We will definitely stay here again in the future.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I had chosen Kaimana Beach hotel for its quiet and private beach. Our room had a Diamond Head and sweet beach view. It was great to be able to head out to the beach at any time. We enjoyed staying away from the crowded beach! The hotel staff is friendly and attentive. Whenever we had questions they did their best to help out.This hotel is a 15min walk away from Waikiki. It was great to explore the area by foot or by bus. There are neighbouring cafes, the zoo and aquarium wasn't too far. There is also the option to have a picnic across the road at the park and take in the city views.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Away from Waikiki, a truly beautiful hotel with great viewsStill my favorite place to stay in honolulu.Yes it is a bit old but many of the room have been updated.Staff are brilliant - friendly and efficient. The only glaring weakness is the strange gym associated with the hotel - it is never open one has to make an appointment to get in.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: WE have been staying here for a number of years & find it a haven from the congestion & bustle of Waikiki . Right on the beach, spectacular swimming, substantial rooms with lanai's directly on the water ( spend the extra $ to get deluxe waterfront room), great food including a fantastic Japanese restaurant in the hotel, Miyako. The beach is ideal, clean & safe swimming for all ranges.Best of all, the aloha spirit is alive and well in this small hotel.Also in the hotel is the JUJU'BE Clinic & Holistic Healing Spa. Make sure you don't miss having the best massage of your life from Yuko. Having been a massage therapist myself, and partaking of massages when I travel, I can tell you with complete assurance, that Yuko is the most gifted practitioner I have ever gone to. We always come back!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is definitely dated. the bathroom finishes looked like they hadnt been updated since the 80s. the room was spacious, though, and very clean. the view was amazing. and its a great location. very good value as well.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We returned recently from a wonderful week’s stay at the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel. We have been many times to Honolulu in the past but haven’t visited for a number of years. The Kaimana Beach has always been our favorite hotel. We were delighted to find that it is as lovely and friendly as ever. The hotel is right on a small reefed beach that is enjoyed by locals and tourists alike. The Hau Tree restaurant is right next to the sand and the sea, shaded by the trees. The trees are quite old and have a history as does the hotel.We booked into a Ocean Diamond Head deluxe room, and we were glad we splurged. Our large balcony overlooked Kapilani Park and the ocean with the Waikiki skyline in the distance. The scene in the park was ever changing: from exercises groups in the morning to families setting up for the day with tents and barbeques. The homeless were there as well with chairs and tents. No camping is allowed overnight and that seems somewhat enforced. They were quite friendly though and didn’t seem to create a problem during the day. We loved the park. A short walk brings you to the edge of the Waikiki hotel area, but it is nice being a bit away from the more built up area.We had breakfast every morning in the Hau Tree restaurant. In the evening we got take-out and sat on our balcony for dinner. One night we had a urge for some tsukemono (the Japanese picked vegetables). I went up to the fancy Miyako restaurant to see if I could get a plate to go. They could not have been nicer or more welcoming. They made up a special plate for us that was absolutely delicious.During our stay we did the Wednesday morning walking tour (2 hours) of the China Town area. We would highly recommend that tour. The history of the area is fascinating.We look forward to returning to the Kaimana Beach Hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the New Otani. Room was spacious, clean, and the staff was very responsive to requests and questions. Great location a little out of the heavy traffic. Reasonably priced too....

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Nice quiet property at the edge of Waikiki. Close enough to walk to the busy part of town with its shops and restaurants in one direction, while walking in the other direction will take you to older areas with quiet charm and the feel of bygone eras. Too bad the Natatorium next door has been left derelict. Perhaps it will be resurrected? The beach is great. I loved sitting on the restaurant terrace under the trees watching the waves.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I stayed there in 1977, when we first came to Hawaii and had great memories of walking to and from Waikiki through the park and being "so close, yet far away" from all the hustle and bustle. We since lived in Honolulu for 2 years and have always recommended it to friends. We decided to go back for "old times sake" and it is as new and well-kept as always. If you want to eat at the Hau Tree Lanai restaurant, which is FUN, you need to make reservations for the NEXT day….its that popular….I loved the Poi Pancakes! Great experience and nice beach in front of the hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: While certainly not a new hotel, this one has a quieter location on Sans Souci Beach, across from Kapiolani Park. Rooms run small, but the ocean front have great views. Partial ocean views might take in the side of the nearby condos. Our east side room had a partial ocean view, but the Diamond Head view was blocked by another newer condo as well. Bathroom doors have air slats, so aren't very private.The lobby is open to the breezes, and has some seating (not terribly comfortable,) and a bar area, The lovely breakfasts are served in the Hau Tree Lanai restaurant, which is directly on the beach. ( you need to make reservations for any meals!) You can swim and sunbathe right in front of the hotel. It's a 15 minute walk to the east end of Waikiki (ABC store and Starbucks) and the zoo, past the aquarium. There is a beachfront cafe half way to Waikiki that is OK. There are Japanese tour groups that come in for breakfast. Parking: get ready to pay $24. a day for valet parking. Pretty stiff, but again the location is really nice, and it doesn't take long to figure out the way into the hotel (one way street right in front.) We used the Sixth Street exit going EAST from the airport, past Waikiki exits, as it avoids going through downtown Waikiki. (We found our Garmin useful as well.) Also, you can get back on the highway to go to downtown HNL and Pearl Harbor WEST, etc, from Fifth Street However, going West bound from Hanauma Bay you would want to take exit to the right for the Kahala area, then go left and down around Diamond Head to the South to get back to the hotel, or you will find yourself in Waikiki again, as you cannot exit off Sixth Street going WEST, if you are already on the highway.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Hotels in Waikiki are generally expensive, but the New Otani provides good value for money. I would call the Kaimana beach area the quiet end of Waikiki. Still, with all the activity in Kapiolani park, the area is very active. Waikiki while fun, can feel like a tourist trap when you are in the heart of it. It is an easy walk to get into the thick of Waikiki from the New Otani, but then you get to retreat to the more local feeling Kaimana Beach/Kapiolani Park area. Right at the foot of world famous Diamond Head, it's a short trip to the Diamond Head look out for a stunning ocean view, and it's also very close to the Diamond Head Visitors center and crater rim walk.The hotel is right on the beach and it is a short walk to board rentals if you fancy some surfing or water activity. The small but engaging Honolulu Aquarium is practically next door, and the Honolulu Zoo is an easy walk as well. Those two places, coupled with the beach and park make the New Otani a great stay for families with children.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is next to The Colony Surf and the Outrigger Canoe Club and is in an area know as The Gold Coast next to Diamond Head. You're in walking distance to the Waikiki strip of shops and night spots along Kalakaua and the aquarium and zoo. But far away so that if you open the sliding door you can listen to the sounds of the waves at night if your room faces the beach/ocean or you can dine outside at the Hau Tree Terrace and view the ocean too for b'fast, lunch, or dinner. It's a great place to chill and re-energize the batteries!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Recently stayed here for 2 weeks with family in a moderate room. Staff friendly rooms cleaned everyday. A bit of a walk into the centre of everything. Hotel is a bit dated but that didn't bother usBeach behind hotel was amazing very clean and not crowded. Staff and management are exceptional.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We recently enjoyed a few days stop over at the New Otani Kaimana hotel. My brother and his wife have vacationed there for the last 30 years...so I had to check it out for myself! Got a corner room with spectacular views of Waikiki Beach. Lovely sitting out on the large balcony. The beach area was secluded but easy to access - we went snorkeling a few times as well right off the beach! Park and aquarium are right next door. What we particularly loved was the meals at the restaurant, Hau Tree Lanai. The breakfasts are wonderful, fresh and served in a relaxing atmosphere. Lunch and dinner are great as well but on the expensive side. All in all, a memorable experience.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I've been traveling to Waikiki and Oahu for the past 30 years. It's an urban beach and the hotels are always really hard to choose. Many hotels are old and not renovated, as is the New Otani. What sets this hotel apart is its location, which cannot be better if you crave to be out of hectic Waikiki, but not as far off as the north shore. The bad:It's an old hotel. It's in bad need of renovation in many areas, the lobby and restaurant, the elevators, and the institutional hallways. Sadly, this is the norm in Waikiki and not unusual. There is no pool. There is a laundry room, but it's small and dirty. The room rates are really astronomical considering these flaws. Parking is $24 a day and valet only. There are no beach chairs to lend or rent, only straw mats. We were surprised that the hotel didn't have more small touches in the room, like a bottle opener. The housekeeping was spotty and I had to request that the floors be vacuumed twice. I don't think they changed the sheets the entire week we were there. Dust built up. The turn down service never included a change of glasses. The good:The views are unbeatable! The recently renovated rooms are completely comfortable and spacious. The balcony and balcony furniture are comfortable and relaxing. The front desk and valet service is good. The beach it's located on is lovely and cannot be compared to Waikiki. We had a washlet in our bathroom (something we Japanese residents love). Besides the occasional noise associated with it's location next to the park it's balanced with the location being so green and open. It was my first visit to the New Otani, and I could return but I'm not sure. Considering the price of $360 ++ per night for our room category, plus the parking, plus the high food costs, and the relatively depressing state of the facilities outside the room, I will definitely be thinking twice.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: From the moment I asked for a quote until I checked out the staff did everything they could to please us. There was a misunderstanding with the rates, which they immediately resolved at their expense, including a credit for breakfast. Outside that the rooms are lovely, well serviced and come with delightful L'Occitane products. We stayed in room 610 and 612 (family room adjoining via a balcony) at $478 plus tax making it $545 per night for the Ocean, Waikiki, Diamond Head Deluxe and Ocean Waikiki Superior. Compared to some hotels in the city end the rooms, view and size were exponentially better. Room service or food at the restaurant was pricey so we shared a $17 fruit platter or bought from the local ABC shops (granola, yoghurt and fruit) making the stay much more affordable. The views are to die for, from the ocean alongside the beach and park, and all if Waikiki to Diamond head. It's about 15 minutes walk at a slow pace to the bustle and noise and crowds of the main drag in Waikiki, which is actually great as you get a bit of exercise in. If you walk the opposite way, you get to Diamond Head state park in 45 minutes, and a further 45 minutes see you hiked up the summit to look down over the hotel and Waikiki. Not to mention the walk is past some lovely mansions! We even saw humpback whales in the distance. All in all good value, service and surroundings.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We just returned from staying a full week at The New Otani...our first experience on Waikiki and at this great hotel located right on a small section of public beach just south of the Honolulu Acquarium. We loved our spacious room located at the end of the hotel with a "wrap around" balcony and the up close and birds-eye view of Diamond Head from the 8th floor. Our room was attractive, clean, comfortable and relaxing....and if we needed something it was delivered promptly. The location is prime...a little more than a mile down from the heart of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and far more relaxing and quiet. We loved the walk downtown alongside a beautiful park and the waterfront, and so appreciated being able to return to the solitude of a friendly and personable hotel staff, relaxing hotel lobby, great bar and restaurant and our lovely room after experiencing other larger hotel areas in the heart of Waikiki which were overrun with tourists. This hotel has been around for a long time and I suspect that they are continually having to improve worn carpets, etc. We found our room to be in excellent shape...simple, comfortable and utilitarian. If I were to mention anything that might use a little replacing it would b the carpeting on the 8th floor near our room...it looked a bit worn and faded...probably from lots of use but not from neglect. Otherwise, everything looked great. I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat for its' great location, lovely people at the desk and serving in the restaurant, as well as very reasonable prices considering the location.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I just spent a week in Honolulu at the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is past the zoo on the quiet end of Waikiki. While the room we had was quite small, the bed was very comfortable and we had a view of both the ocean and Diamond Head from our private balcony. We had a great breakfast at the Lau Tree Lanai which is right on the beach. It is very busy so reservations are a good idea. There is a small general store on the property which was convenient and a good place to get coffee in the morning and then head out to the private beach. The beach was quiet and never over crowded, it was a great way to start the day. I would definitely stay there again.
user_name:
Patti N
Monument, Colorado, United States

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: There's a very good reason I, and many others have been returning to the New Otani for many years. Consistency, beauty, grace to name a few. This wonderful property never fails to delight, from the first view of the open-air lobby and ocean beyond, the never failing cheerfulness of the staff, and the feeling of being a million miles away from the chaos and sheer number of people in downtown Waikiki.The location, at the foot of Diamond Head, yet only 10 minutes walking time from ground-zero Honolulu, is one of the biggest blessings of this property. Oh....that and the beach in front of the hotel. San Souci Beach is one of the nicest stretches of sand in the city, and yes it can seem crowded at times. The difference is that the crowds here are mostly locals and families out for a day on the sand, and the beautiful bodies of visiting military men and "professional" women showing off. Thus the local name of the beach; "Dig Me Beach", as in hey! Dig me....I'm worth looking at. The water is crystal clear with a gentle slope out to some coral reef with good snorkeling.Having undergone a recent multi million dollar room renovation, the suites are small but perfect in a Japanese-austere fashion. The best rooms are the #17 rooms, ocean view deluxe corner units with wrap-around glass walls and lanais that look down on the beach and downtown Honolulu, AND have amazing sunset views. Expensive? Yup. But totally worth it

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I had to go to Honolulu for the marathon; i knew I wanted a hotel close to the finish line - this was chosen and I'm very happy with my choice - so much so that I'm going back in April....I booked though Blue Hawaii Vacations - got a night free - stayed in the Ocean Waikiki View room - I would give my view a 100 out of 10 - I was in love with my view - the Waikiki skyline unfolded every morning wearing a new look - utterly mesmerizing - I don't think I could ever get bored with it - absolute feast for the eyes!!! My room was lovely too.....The front desk staff, I would give 5/5 - they were an absolute delight...Now it is an old hotel, with a central courtyard open to the sky, so don't expect shiny and up-market, more homely...but very clean and well cared for....There is a beach, but it's kind of wierd, you can't just walk straight on and off, you have to go up and around....and the beach is tiny....compared to other Oahu ones...but many people crowded on from early day - more of a local beach.The restaurants in the hotel were lack lustre....the bar food was passable....I tried the sushi place, good food, slow service, it was fine...the main restaurant, with the patio on the beach, I was excited to try....I explained to the hostess that I was allergic to garlic and asked if that would be an issue - I was assured no.....however, once I was seated, by the beach, with water and bread - my food options sharply diminished once the chef was brought into the equation! The final options for me were a/ salad or b/ a double order of, not cheap, mushrooms on toast as my entree....I walked....My friends dined there often and loved it; if you have food issues, beware....There are so many great restaurants in Honolulu that it was not an issue....see my other reviews!The Otani is parked at the other side of the park to downtown - I was alone walking, briskly, up to midnight, and felt safe - there are tons of homeless people, but they keep to themselves and don't bother you....it feels a bit creepy...but I was fine.....All in all - I love the Otani - so looking forward to going back - I have requested my same room....lovely to be removed from the madness of Waikiki but close enough that you can indulge with a 10-15 minute walk! If you want fancy and modern, stick to the chains, if you can afford it, do the Royal; if you like a good deal, with the best view in the house, and a relaxed atmosphere, choose the Otani....Aloha....Yvonne

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We chose the New Otani because of the reviews and the value. We were very happy with our choice. The hotel has a very nice open air and Asian style ambience. Our rooms were on the fourth floor of the main hotel and had beautiful views of Diamond Head during the day and the lights of Honolulu at night. The rooms were on the small side but nice, clean and modern. The staff were courteous and friendly and we had a great time with the waiters at the Hau Tree Lanai restaurant. We only ate breakfast at the restaurant (be sure to make reservations) but they were the best we had on the islands. Be sure to try the Macadamian French Toast with fresh fruit. The restaurant is right on the beach and has a beautiful view of the ocean. The location for us was ideal - it is located away from the hustle and bustle of downtown, closer to Diamond Head - and quiet. We enjoyed the 15 minute walk along the beach and park each night to try out various restaurants in downtown Honolulu and we needed the walk after eating the filling and delicious dinners each night!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Under the Pali of Diamond Head, the New Otani Kaimana provides everything you desire of Honolulu without all the overcrowding. The upgraded rooms on the west side of the hotel provide sweeping panoramic views of downtown, the perfect vantage point for viewing the Aloha Friday fireworks displays each week.The staff are superb; courteous and helpful. The onsite dining is very popular locally which is always a good sign, reservations are necessary but worth the planning effort. Don't miss the French Toast for breakfast at the Hau Tree Lanai.The Asian flavor of the ambiance is rightfully subdued.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed at the New Otani for 4 days at the end of our Hawaiian honeymoon. We spent the majority of our honeymoon on the Big Island, but wanted a few days in Oahu to relax and check out the Pearl Harbor memorial. We picked this hotel because we wanted something a little more quiet than the hustle and bustle of Waikiki beach. It is located on the far end of the beach, down near Diamond Head. Also, we got a very good deal on this hotel. We were able to get a beach front room for the same price of a non-view room at comparable hotels down on Waikiki beach.Our room was modern and recently renovated. It was a gorgeous corner room with views of both the Honolulu skyline as well as the ocean. It was great to sit out and relax on the balcony overlooking the ocean. Awesome sunsets. Service in the hotel was good - - we ate dinner at the restaurant and had great meal. The beach is really nice there too. No pool, but you didn't really miss it with the great sandy beach. It was about a 10 or 15 minute walk down the beach to Waikiki, which was perfect for us. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: At the quiet end of Waikiki this hotel exceeded our expectations. Quiet, relaxed and absolutely wonderful hotel staff. The staff were always extremely helpful and all genuinely friendly. We stayed in a moderate room. They are small and showing signs of age, but we knew that would be the case as the rooms were accurately described on the hotel website. The Hau Tree Lanai restaurant is a real treat for breakfast and offers one of the best Loco Mocos around. Pupus at the Sunset Lounge is a lovely way to end the day and Gerry makes a great Mai Tai and Margarita. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a beachfront location with great swimming beach, but doesn't want to battle the crowds on Waikiki.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I chose this hotel because of the many positive reviews it got. Either I'm staying at an entirely different hotel or guest have low standards for boutique hotel. I am staying in the main building. The lobby area looks reasonable and the dining area overlooking the beach is exceptional. When I reach my floor, it's dark and dingy. The layout looks more like a motel.the walls need painting and quite bare. A few cheap paintings would help the aesthetics. The basic room is just that. 1970's looking and small. The view is not bad with diamond head to the left and the beach around the corner on the right. Breakfast is expensive. A buffet would work better. The access to the beach is great. The surrounding area is nice and quite but dark and a bit scary at night. If I paid outright cash for this room I would re-book. I used my points for this can't have too many expectations.i can't say that I would ever consider this hotel again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We had a wonderful time at the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel during our stay in August 2013. I booked this hotel via hotwire and got a really good deal (all other hotels were fully booked and extremely expensive during summer time). We had a room with the ocean view and saw the beautiful Waikiki sunset. They also have this automatic A/C system, the A/C turns off by itself when you open the door/window in your room. It's very energy efficient and I really liked it. The only down side (or maybe good side for some) is the hotel is off the Waikiki strip. If you don't have a car, it's quite inconvenient to get around because cabs are expensive. However, if you want a silent romantic getaway this is a perfect location. I would definitely book this hotel again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed at the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel for 10 days in September 2013. The hotel is in a great location and the beach and swimming as well as snorkeling right there are fantastic. It was great to be able to walk a short distance to get anywhere we wanted and needed to go! The views from the room were amazing. The staff were all exceptional with great service (other than the Miyako restaurant where we had a reservation, were ignored and left due to the horrible female server there who needs to retire!). The rest of the staff were more than friendly and always willing to please! The hotel and rooms were very clean and up to date. The Hau Tree Lanai and the Sunset Lanai Lounge were fantastic, but we do not recommend the Miyako Restaurant at all! Do not hesitate to book yourself in to this hotel! We hope to return in the near future!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is my 3rd trip to Hawaii. It seemed like hotel rates have increased more than expected since my last trip a couple of years ago. My usual inexpensive hotels were not available so I took a chance on New Otama Kahaima Hotel, especially since it was off of the Waikiki strip. Here is a list of the pros and cons of the hotel based on my needs and experience. Note that my discounted stay was NOT in the main building.Pros-quiet room, some yahoos in the hallway or outside building, couldn't hear much of my neighbours-high taps & railing in bathtub-a bit of a view of the beach, room faced park-clean-kitchenette, & stocked with supplies-going to hotel; bus stops close to hotel-lovely restaurant overlooking beach(did not get a chance to eat here)Cons-night mgr, no smile, not friendly, knew I paid with Hotwire & tried to convince me I had gotten a better deal than I knew, gave me their rate brochure; my room was in a separate bldg than the main hotel, nice room but not worth that much more than the rate I paid-has no elevator in low rise building(for standard rate rooms)-not in main hotel-too soft mattress-shower and toilet room quite small (sink in a separate room)-air con made some odd but quietish sounds but didn't keep me awake=older appliances -far from main area, which suited me fine but shouldn't be in the same price league with those closer to stores, restaurants, and main bus stops-have to pay for internet-leaving hotel; no bus stops close to hotel, about a 10 min walk with your luggage in towin the hot sun or possibly in the rain

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: For vacation, we like to to relax and be central to the water sports we like to do. I am in the hotel business so when I was first told we were going to Honolulu to celebrate my birthday, I stereotyped the island (still beautiful, but hustle bustle compared to others) and I had been to Honolulu on a number of occasions. I wasn't exactly as thrilled as I would normally be as I like to relax away from tourism when on holiday. This gem truly surprised me. We had an incredible renovated ocean view studio, footsteps to the Outrigger Canoe Club. The service provided by a smiling hospitable staff, was always outstanding. The food at Hau Tree is consistently delicious n a most pristine setting. Breakfast reservations are definitely recommended. Once rested up on my beach vacation, it was an easy adventure into Waikiki on foot. This is a place of true aloha and charm...we intend to return to for years to come.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: There are gazillion hotels in Waikiki. Most are crowded, noisy, unremarkable places. No charm. No Hawaii sense of place.The Kaimana - however - is different. It's like an oasis amid all the activity. Located right on the beach and just at the foot of Diamond Head, the Kaimana is conveniently located, well-priced, and nicely 'local.' It has the old Hawaii feel that is rapidly disappearing from Hawaii.The Hau Tree Lanai (little restaurant downstairs) is on the beach and has the best view of the setting sun.Looking forward to visiting again in Feb!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is just a 10 min walk on the edge of Waikiki - with a great view of Waikiki and Honolulu. It was a nice beach outside and Kapiolani park on the other side of the road.You can easily walk to Diamond Head state park in 20 mins - or to town in 10. The Waikiki Aquarium is 2 mins away - that's where you'll find the bus stop (which of course you don't need to use as you're so close to town).There's a nice walkway following the ocean from the hotel and all the way to downtown Honolulu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We picked this hotel because of some friends who said that they had a nice experience here. When we checked in I discovered that there is a big difference between the older rooms and the new revamped rooms. My travel friend, this is the difference between 1970's laminate and 2010's fashionable and comfortable.The lobby is small, but served our needs well. The lobby bar was quiet during our stay, but we had a nice time meeting some people from Australia.Our room was on a high floor with a nice view of Waikiki. One of the palm trees has now grown high enough to block some of the view, but it was still very nice.I appreciated the free internet and the ability to get online without having to dish out extra cash. Valet service was fast and friendly.Over all, this was a great hotel for our vacation.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is the third time we've stayed at the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel. We like being able to put on bathing suits, grab a towel and mat in the lobby and walk right out to the sand. We bring our snorkel equipment. One day, we went to spectacular Hanauma Bay Park, a bit of a drive, but the other days we snorkeled in front of the hotel... walking past the photographer taking pictures of the beautiful Japanese bride in her white gown on the beach!Waikiki is an easy 15 minute walk along Kapiolani Park Beach. We recommend heading in for a drink or lunch at the Beach Bar at the Moana Surfrider, a beautiful setting at this historic hotel.It's worth having a meal at the New Otani's Hau Tree Lanai restaurant, on the terrace overlooking the beach. We also have enjoyed the hotel bar and the Japanese restaurant in the hotel. But those meals were on the first or last night of our visit, there are many great places to eat in Honolulu.We tended to go out for a walk in the morning and pick up coffee and breakfast to eat in the park or on our hotel balcony. There are coffee shops in Waikiki as well as the ABC Stores selling snacks along with the souvenirs. Easiest of all is to buy coffee, fruit and yogurt at Russell's Convenience Store right at the corner of the hotel. Our rooms always had a refrigerator.Instead of heading towards Waikiki, you can walk in the other direction towards Diamond Head. There are a couple of small oceanfront parks before you reach the Diamond Head Lighthouse, where you can walk down a steep hill to the beach or stay up above and look down on the surfers.The service at the hotel was excellent. We had a rental car, and the valet sprinted to retrieve it. We were greeted everytime we walked through the lobby. And one night at the restaurant, we watched the staff take great care with some elderly patrons.This visit was the first time that we'd stayed in the main hotel tower. We were on the fifth floor, with a view of Diamond Head. The other times, we stayed in the low-rise wing between the main hotel and Kalakaua Avenue. No elevator, but a bellman willingly lugged our heavy suitcases up the stairs, and our rooms had a little kitchenette. Views are of Kapiolani Park, which is used by all kinds of people from sun up until after dark. For us, that was part of the charm .We've found this hotel to be a good base for our Honolulu visits.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for me and my partner's one year anniversary. Beautiful hotel away from the touristy hotels. Pro's: Great beach view room is a must - You get to see enjoy the views of Waikiki from here.Balcony - you get to enjoy a beer and the sunset Beach access - not crowded at all and somewhat okay to snorkel (reef problems)Service here was great and rooms are clean.5 miles away from the Waikiki strip - worth walkingCon's:Have a rental car? you have to pay for valet overnight parking - $24 dollars a nightFood is literally average - no continental breakfast Recommended nearby food places:Diamond head Market & Grill is the best for breakfast - Spam masubi and their scones are delightfulBogart's Cafe - Breakfast burrito with Portuguese sausage. Nomz.com!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for a week, and while the hotel isn't a spectacular resort, its location and views are out of this world. It's location on Kaimana Beach puts it just past Waikiki, which is a great thing, really. First, you're out of the crowds of people on Waikiki, and second the slight separation from Waikiki gives you unforgettable views of Waikiki and the beaches day and night (night time views are especially breathtaking as Honolulu glitters at night). The rooms were clean and comfortable but a little small. Service was reliable and very friendly; the valets were especially helpful with tips for places to go and things to do. The Hau Tree restaurant in the lobby -- open air right on the beach under a 100 year old tree -- was a great breakfast location (though you do have to call ahead the night before to make sure you have a table because it is one of THE most popular breakfast and lunch spots in the city). The comparative value was excellent; keep in mind everything in Hawaii is expensive, but the rates here were lower than most other beachfront hotels).

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I knew it was going to be good, but didn't know it would be perfect. Great service, breathtaking views, secluded beach, excellent food and just far enough away from all the crazy stores and shopping (Beverly Hills meets Cancun meets Disneyland - didn't you come to go to the beach?) of Waikiki. You have to ask for a coffee maker in your room, or a tea kettle, but then it's there for the duration. Wonderful activities desk - very helpful. They recommend reservations at their restaurants because they are two of the best in the city and indeed the breakfast was amazing. PS - went to a luau and had a perfectly horrible 2 hour bus ride there - missed the sunset and had a chatterbox guide full of tall tales about the island, the word aloha, his life, past luau customers, Chris Brown, the Duck Dynasty folks, etc. Skip the luau and get the pig at Ono's Hawaiin Food, a la Anthony Bourdain, instead - one serving is enough for two and it's under $30.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Hotel is located right on the beach, no roads to cross it is right there, the hotel is located about a 10 - 15 minute walk from Waikiki where the shops, bars restaurants are located, there is nothing around the hotel as it is in a residential area, I know this because the first night we were there we wandered around looking for somewhere to eat and managed to head the wrong direction, anyway the next day it all made sense! The walk is a consideration as it is a reasonable distance to Waikiki during the day the weather is quite hot and at night the area attracts homeless or people that sleep in their cars or in tents right along the footpath. There are no camping signs in the park but the roadside grass must be exempt so that is where everyone is. I mention this not as a criticism of the hotel but I wouldn't have been keen on walking back at night without my husband, of course a taxi would eliminate this problem but sometimes it would have been nice just to have something close by. I was impressed by the beach, it was clean, the water was nice and the hotel blocked the sun in parts so there was shade available, the hotel has beach chairs for $5.00 a day and provides towels. As for the room after much consideration we chose a room on the higher floors one of the corner ones with a view of both the beach and Waikiki and booked it a couple of months prior. Upon arrival we were told that for an extra $80 per night we could upgrade to suite with a view, this came as a surprise given that I had booked a room with a view. I whipped out my paperwork and showed the check in person what room I had booked, she looked a bit thrown and nothing more was said. Once we got to the room it seemed we had been put in the suite anyway, I can only assume that they overbook the rooms and sort it out later trying to get some more $$ from people. I can't compare the room we had to what we had booked as I didn't see the other, it was direct oceanfront but not on the corner. The suite had dated decor, probably late 80's early 90's nice sitting area and big bathroom and closet. Jacuzzi didn't work at all just made noise, the bed was large and comfortable and the bathroom products were good quality. I wish now that I had insisted on the room I had booked as I believe they had been renovated, before I booked I read a review that spoke of a similar circumstance at check in so maybe that is how they do things. I rated the hotel as "average" as I felt "very good" did not apply, average seems harsh I would say it was good in that the location is good if you want quiet, the rooms were clean and as it was my first time in Oahu I can't compare to another hotel. If I were to go there again I would probably try another hotel to be closer to amenities, if I were to stay here again I would go for one of the cheaper rooms, whilst I did not see inside the diamond head wing it is located right on the small park and probably represents good value for money. Did not eat at the hotel restaurant but I can say it was always very well patronised and bookings are needed, the hotel bar is very small located at the end of the lobby. I should also mention that the hotel very kindly allowed us use of a room after check out to have a shower and get changed as we had a late flight, this was a nice touch and very helpful.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Otani hotel. The location was perfect being secluded just outside the Waikiki Strip. The near by park and amazing beach front access was enjoyable. We had a large city view room which was spectacular. The staff was very helpful, including the valet, bellman, front desk and the various restaurant outlets. Highly recommend this hotel for your next visit to Honolulu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The rooms are small. They do not supply coffee making facilities. Breakfast is included but cost an extra $20.00 day charging $5.00 ea for coffee. There is not a swimming pool they supply towels for beach but no loungers to sit on. The bar is again inadequate the dining expensive. A big walk to town for entertainment. Would I stay here again no! We inquired about upgrading to a larger room cost $80.00/night. difference on web site between rooms $50.00. Do the sums.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: While I wouldn't exactly agree with the description "boutique" hotel, the New Otani Kaimana is a decent value and well-located if not exactly luxe or stylish. There is no pool nor accommodations for beach goers who want more than a tatami mat and beach towel to perch upon. Between hotel errors on reserved bedding configuration and a rather horrid plumbing problem (who knew shower drains could disgorge such stuff) we have now seen 4 different rooms in 24 hours. At this hotel, rooms are not created equal. It is an old property with aging physical plant and wide quality differences between rooms. By all means, book a corner, ocean-view room on a high floor. The property is Japanese-owned and caters especially to Asian tourists. (Better rooms have toilets with built-in bidet functions.)We're here for a conference otherwise would not have chosen this brand or location. The beachside restaurant is nice and the staff very accommodating, however.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: nice hotel operated by Japanise owner,next to Waikiki,I stayed 7 nights in the apartament with Diamond Head and park view,very comfy 1 bdrm,staff professional and helpful,I can recomend this hotel to everyone who do not like city noise

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights. Just what we needed. We wanted to be close to Waikiki, but not in the middle of it. We stayed in a Diamond Head View room, was perfectly adequate, but a little dated. Bed comfortable, nice view across park and Diamond Head from balcony. Air con a bit noisy, but kept us cool. Can't say much else about the hotel facilities because we tended to leave early in the morning and not get back again 'til evening, so never really made any use of them. Made it back in time for sunset a couple of times, which was very nice from the hotels beach. The walk into town only took 10 minutes, or so. As has been said elsewhere, you will pass an awful lot of homeless people on that walk. We stuck to the brightest lit paths and never had any issues, but can't say we felt entirely comfortable through some sections. Our rental car was small, basic and old, so we had no concerns about leaving it on the street and making use of the free overnight parking. I was fortunately able to park under streetlights less than 100 yards from the hotel - could see car from balcony. No issues at all.We enjoyed our stay. But, on this occasion, it was only really a place to dump our gear, sleep & shower.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Love the hotel and the location. My complaint isn't the hotels fault. The walk into town was what we originally loved about this hotel. But now with the increasing homeless population the walk is not safe. It is not well lit and people were getting attacked by homeless people every night. Don't park your car anywhere there isn't security guards at or consider it broken into. Broken glass all along this strip from cars getting broken into. I feel safer in Mexico than I do oahu now. So sad. I use to love this place. However I won't be returning. But this hotel is a great place to stay if you take a cab or travel in a large group.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Had a great stay in room 616( overlooking the beach and city ) great views.Staff are helpful and great food ( had breakfast and 2 dinners)! The rooms are small but comfortable with a .balcony. About a 10 min walk to Waikiki Beach, shopping and lots of places to eat( which can be a bit pricey)! I'll return for sure!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We were deciding on whether to stay in one of the bigger hotels in the main resort or the Otani in the quieter location. We decided to go with the Otani having read many positive reviews and keen to avoid a crowded beach, but unfortunately we were very disappointed. We found the hotel staff quite distant, particular in the bar (which was like a morgue most of the time), not particularly welcoming or helpful. It lacked warmth, character and was not enjoyable for us being there. We walked to the main shops and restaurants every evening but was not comfortable with all the homeless people around. The walk was about 15 mins. The beach was nice but without sunbeds or parasols it was uncomfortable staying there for a long period of time. We were surprised to see so many dogs on the beach. The room was tiny but as we don't spend much time in there it wasn't a problem for us. However, the cleaner bashing away with the hoover at 7am was not fun! Great to see the surfers early in the morning!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I stayed in room 812, September 1st through 7th. This was my 6th time to Oahu, 3rd time to stay in this hotel, and 2nd time to stay in this same room. I was pleasantly surprised to find that since I stayed here in 2011, the room has been further updated. There is now a granite countertop on the sink and new tile in the bathroom. The old wallpaper has been ripped off, and new paint applied. There are new fixtures, carpeting and bedding. All in all the room is much more inviting and pleasing to the eye. My only complaint, is there is absolutely no artwork...not even any cheap travel prints. I would stick a couple of pictures on the walls of palm trees or something to make it more homey. The main common areas of the hotel are still very much out-dated, but with the open air lobby and interior....you can kinda overlook that. :-) Obviously, the view from the balcony of the ocean and the city is still spectacular. This time my neighbors were quiet, so rested wonderfully. Also, compared to previous stays at this hotel, the staff was much more pleasant. I guess it depends on who is working. They still make you pay to print your boarding pass, (what a rip-off, so just checked in with my i-phone, and then printed the boarding pass at the airport). The bar is still more expensive than any others on the strip, (11.00 for a mai-tai), and the convenience store is still more expensive than the ABC stores...but, knowing all of this, I planned accordingly and tried not to dine or shop at the New Otani stores. I still had to request a coffee maker, which seems odd that this is standard in every other hotel I stay in. And, the ironing board is one of those "dorm sized" things....granted the hotel literature said you can request coffee makers and a full sized ironing board...but, why not just provide one already?Also odd, is the in room safe. It locked and everything...but, it was not bolted to anything. I literally could pick it up....so if someone had the inclination...they could see it was locked, and know that is where I put my valuables, and just walk away with it.....very strange.....so, New Otani...please permanently bolt the safes in the room.Regarding Honolulu, the poor WWI monument Natatorium is still in a state of disrepair, and is an eye-sore. It is my understanding that they may be tearing this grand old structure down, instead of rehabbing it...what a shame....and, what an insult to the military, that this honor to them has suffered this fate.Also, disappionting is the number of homeless people in the city. I have been coming here for 10 years, and the number of homeless has increased probably 10 fold in that time. Where there once were a few in the Kapiolani Park, there are now dozens camped out, ignoring the no tent and no loitering signs. As I ran nearly every morning I was there, I passed by the exact same group of homeless camped out under the structure in front of the Natatorium. They had sleeping bags on the ground and benches, various food and alcohol lined up on the wall behind them. They were always there, each morning....obviously loitering. Also I noticed a group of 3 men permanently camped out in front of the Starbucks every day, on the major corner below Lulu's...just on the sidewalk with their shopping carts and sleeping bag...one even had a sleeping bag on a blow up air floatie. I am not sure what can be done about this....and we do need to be compassionate to their plight... Currently, I enjoy staying in Waikiki, and driving to the other side of the island during the day....however, with all of the homeless...I am now toying with the idea of staying on the other side of the island...and just driving a couple of times into Waikiki. From what I read, the city says they are cracking down on the homeless population...but, obviously this is just lip service, when you see the exact same people loitering in the exact same spot for 6 days in a row.So, the hotel has updated the rooms. It is an older hotel, and has not been gutted to the studs...or restored to its original character....so, it is not going to be a 5 star property, if that is what you are seeking. But, it is nice. It is clean. The views are spectacular. This time the staff were pleasant. And, this time my neighbors were quiet. Having it's own beach is nice, and the beach is far less crowded than those on the other side of Waikiki. The beach seems to draw more locals, and that is fun. In my opinion this is the best hotel for the price.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Good location right on the beach. Close enough to walk to where all the action is and far enough from all the noise to make it nice and quiet at night. Very good king size bed, but the room was a little cramped. It would have been better with a queen size bed. Excellent restaurant overlooking the beach. The staff was very helpful. An independent travel agent was available for advice on tours etc. Overall good value for money

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed here a couple times in 2013. It's within walking distance to Waikiki beach and shops, but far enough for a more secluded feel on its beach. The aquarium is also very close and lies between the hotel and Waikiki. Food is great and the hotel staff is very helpful and friendly. Parking is $20/day, but free at night if you park on the street after 5pm, but the street is usually full.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel is on the waterfront, on SanSouci Beach, and right under Diamond Head, Honolulu.The lobby is without walls, and brings in lovely breezes from the Pacific. The restaurant and bar are within the lobby area, and the diner can enjoy views of the ocean along with the fresh air. Try the Blue Hawaiian or MaiTai coctails: you just can't get them anywhere. Hau Tree Lanai restaurant serves a fantastic Eggs Benedict, in many styles. A legend in Honolulu. Served artfully with cloth napkins, and under the Hau Tree branches. The staff at the desk was attentive. Beach towels are an amenity. The hotel corridors span a center courtyard, and rooms face out to the ocean or to Diamond Head. Rooms are clean, have personal toiletries, and have a small refrigerator. A mini market on the property sells snacks and personal needs. When you stay here, you do not need a vehicle. To get back to Wakiki, you can walk or take a city bus. There is also a bus direct from the Honolulu airport. A beautiful city park sits across the street from the hotel, and you can walk to Diamond Head park. Away from Wakiki, the hotel is quiet, peaceful, convenient, and clean. Look for the Otani hotel club pass for additional hotel bargains. I really like this hotel!!!!!!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: New Otani is well located down on the end of Waikiki at the quiet side of town. It is perfect for romantic walks around Diamond Head and the Beach in front of the hotel is the best you will find....In the early mornings the water is so calm and crystal clear.The rooms are small but how much time would you spend in the guestroom anyway....Hau Tree Terrace is also the best place to enjoy the sunset and breakfast

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This Hotel has it's own Beach which was very handy for us....also it wasn't right in town made the stay very pleasant....food and drinks were good too and the room was tidy and clean. We had a great time in Honolulu and staying in this HoOtel was part of having a very good time :)

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We booked this property as part of a package purchase with Hawaiian Air, so don't what rate we paid. I chose it to be within walking distance of the action of Waikiki but away from the noise and bustle. It is perfect for that, in a quiet area. There is a beautiful, large park across the street. Valet parking only, or searching for street parking ..... probably quite a challenge in this busy area (we chose valet.) From our balcony we had a sliver of beach view if we leaned over the balcony railing. Air conditioning worked well in our room. Beach access was great and there were beach towels and roll-up mats available at reception. Staff was professional and helpful; printed out our flight boarding passes for us. This gets 3 stars because, other than location, it is just average. We were satisfied, but not very impressed. The lobby is small and tired with uncomfortable furniture. Rooms (we booked 3 rooms for 3 couples) - the same comment - rooms small with average comfort level beds. Something was wrong with the seal on our sliding door to the balcony which caused a VERY loud constant whistling,roaring noise (which we could not stop by closing tightly, cracking slightly or smothering with bath towels!) Also, something is wrong with a large number of the room door closing mechanisms. I was kept awake by multiple VERY loud door-slamming noises late into the night. (Our room was on the 8th floor facing Diamond Head.)

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Hotel entrance is a bit dated. The hallways are a bit dim and really need to be updated. However, our room was amazing (8th floor) with stunning views of Diamond Head AND the beach. Spurge for a corner unit...the view and breeze are worth it. Great bargain. Friendly staff. You can be in the heart of downtown in less than 5 mins by car.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: ...despite a sort of small room, but the view makes up for it. We had reserved a room with two queen beds and had to settle for a room with just one king - that was a mild disappointment, but once again, the view is stunning. Our room is "superior ocean view" according to the classifications. Great AC which is very much appreciated after a lot of sight seeing. We have not tried either of the restaurants here. We asked for feather pillows and got them right away. The staff is efficient and friendly. The location near Kapiolani Park at the quieter end of Waikiki makes it very pleasant indeed. I would give it 5 stars if we had gotten the room we had asked for - otherwise, very nice indeed. No swimming pool - but right by San Souci beach, which is lovely.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I just got back from my honeymoon in Oahu and we stayed at New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel. I cannot say enough good things about our stay. Initially, I was a little worried that we would be too far away from all of the restaurants and shopping, but it was perfect. We enjoyed not being in the middle of all of the hustle and bustle. The hotel is located on the quieter end of the beach and that suited us wonderfully. The beach is beautiful, never over crowded. The customer service was awesome. Every time we came in we were greeted warmly and welcomed back. It made me feel like I was coming home. We had a breakfast package that included breakfast everyday we were there. The breakfast was delicious. We tried something new each day. A couple days we didn't make reservations for breakfast but they accommodated us anyway. We did have dinner one night at the Sunset Lounge which was pretty good, however we never made it to the Hau Tree Lanai for dinner. The best part about our stay had to be our VIEW! It was so beautiful! We had a Waikiki beach/Ocean view and it was just what we were hoping for. The bathroom area was a bit small but we got over it. Overall this hotel worked out wonderfully for us and I can't wait to visit again. By the way, we stayed in the newer building that has been renovated.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Rooms are nice, staff is great, the beach is right outside the hotel. Our view is of Diamondhead which is awesome. We are in an older room but still nice for the price. The restaurant is a bit pricey, but its Hawaii and you are on vacation! We only had one problem and that was the drain in the shower was slow to drain but I called and someone came and fixed it within 15 minutes.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you want to avoid Waikiki but be close enough to the action, then this hotel is the place to be. Get a room that has a Waikiki view. Staff is friendly, rooms are spacious and clean, but this is all about the view. The restaurant, Hau Tree Lanai, is amazing. Even if you include the breakfast package, you must make a reservation for breakfast. Sounds strange, but this little gem is jammed anytime in the AM so heed their advice. VERY expensive restaurant. For lunch and dinner but worth it.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you want to avoid the crowds of Waikiki Beach try the Kaimana Beach Hotel at the east end of Waikiki, near the Aquarium. The staff is attentive and the Hau Tree restaurant is right on the sand. Lovely spot for sunset,

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The optimal choice for those who like a quiet and relaxing beach holiday, a nice, clean uncrowded sandy beach with safe and convenient passage into the sea near Diamond Head, akvarium, public park, bus stop in Waikiki, Downtown, Pearl Harbor, the airport, before the start of Waikiki Beach - about 10 minutes walking. the hotel consists of two buildings, which are connected by a common corridor. 9-storey main building stands on the beach, a 3-storey extension is along a public park, surrounded by parking lots, very old, noisy not comfortable for the rest. It contains the most economical rooms - Diamond Head Wing Studio, Diamond Head Wing One Bedroom, Diamond Head Wing Park View One Bedroom. When choosing numbers suggest using the official website of the hotel, which is narrated in detail illustrated with every hotel room. Of course, taking a room in the main building only. From April 2013 began the reconstruction of rooms with 9 floors. Also updated the facades of the building. But the discomfort is minimal, almost no noise. Only the passage of the beach is covered, we have to use the nearby park trails. Breakfast optional reservation in advance, as a lot of people who want to sit in the shade under a tree overlooking the beach and sea, as did Robert Stevenson. Every morning, many Japanese come here for breakfast on buses and taxis. As I understand, the place is very popular and well known. The chef prepares a variety of dishes, my husband liked them very much. For a beach holiday give special mats and towels. In general, the rest is viewed positively. A little depressed pristine condition hotels and rooms. But all of this will solve the reconstruction of the hotel. The staff is friendly, active attentive to all needs and desires.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Small, outdated room in great need of a makeover. Windows were covered with anti glare coating that was hanging in shreds. Bathroom door was made of shutters that hadn't been cleaned in years - the gaps between the slats were encased with grime and dust and god knows what else. Walls, ceiling and furniture were scuffed and dingy. Great location though. Service was unfriendly and unhelpful. I stayed here years ago and found the service then to be exceptional. I don't know what's happened to this formerly lovely property, but I definitely would not stay here again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights in April 2013. We stayed in the older wing, quiet but dated. Bed was comfortable but had to use stairs no lift.Restaurant was great best meals we had in the whole month we were in Hawaii, try the french toast.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed three nights during the 4th of July week to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. Since we were married near this hotel (Diamond Head Beach Park), and stayed there for our honeymoon, we have a special attachment. We have returned to Hawaii at least once a year since our wedding - staying here and at various other properties both on Oahu and other Islands - so we feel like we have a good basis of comparison.There are accommodations in Hawaii that are more elegant than this one, but the charm of the Otani Kiamana exceeds most of them! We checked out after three nights to stay at the Royal Hawaiian because we had previously booked a room there for the later part of the week. Although the "Pink Palace" is exceptional in many ways, we wished that we had just stayed at the Otani.I know there are some that like the "Big Resort" type of environment. However, we have come to appreciate the quiet end of Waikiki. The Otani Staff has always been accommodating to us, we have always been given a nice room (although small), and always been happy there.If you like the big crowds, conventions, noise, and have to have a swimming pool - this may not be your place. We will return here.I suggest that you book and ocean front room and/or a suite. If you like beautiful views and a little peace, you will love it! You'll also like the Hau Tree Lanai for breakfast!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Booked this room last minute on HotelTonight app. They warn you that you won't know your room until arrival. Always wanted to stay here because it's RIGHT ON THE BEACH, and a great location for Stand up Paddling! This hotel is valet parking only or you can self park on the street...somewhere. It's located next to Kapiolani Park so parking can be tricky! I chose valet. They unloaded everything, including my SUP and stored it for me. Love that convenience!Keep in mind this is an older hotel. The room we stayed in...323...is nothing to boast about but it was clean! The direct view was of the parking lot and a couple of REALLY close by hotels. But to the right was a sliver of beach, ocean & palm trees. Although I had hoped for a view of the Natatorium, No matter, we just needed to sleep. For our needs it was perfect. Just a queen bed, t.v., fridge, and safe. Bathroom was clean and for the deal ($159/night) was just what we needed. There is no pool and the restaurant "Hau Tree" (I think) is quite pricey. The room service was great! Not only timely but Fresh fruit, perfectly cooked eggs and bacon, fresh coffee!! I would definitely stay again with the right deal! But I'd request a better view!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Had I walked into this hotel and looked at the lobby and smelled the public areas, I might have just turned and walked away. However, when I got to my room and found it newly redone, elegant and quiet, it made everything much better. I have nothing but good things to say about the room. It was truly elegant and modern, and the view was absolutely fantastic, with a great vista of the Pacific Ocean, Waikiki Beach, and Honolulu and the Oahu shoreline all the way down to Kapolei! I was very happy with the fact that the insolation was such that it was nearly completely quiet, and in fact the only noises you heard were from the screaming kids on the beach. Perhaps had I been on a higher floor (and maybe someone could tell me how one can be assigned a higher floor) that might have been better, although even when you heard the sounds from the beach they weren't terribly awful or intrusive. Perhaps I should mention that we were there over the Independence Day Holiday, so I probably shouldn't complain. At other Waikiki hotels it would have been MUCH worse. The bed was very nice, and although I have a lot of back and leg pain when I sleep on most beds (including my own), this bed gave me total comfort and a very good night's sleep. The TV (after I had to ask twice to have it made operational) was very good, a nice big, flat screen. The bathroom amenities were really nice, although I sort of expect a Toto "washlet" toilet from a Japanese hotel (this was a Toto toilet, but had no washlet features). The bathtub was just barely big enough, but it was okay. I asked for room service twice, and the first time they didn't get all of my order. They forgot the bagel and refused to give me the bagel they actually had. Why another guest should have gotten that one is beyond me. They were very polite about it, and the room service was timely and very friendly, and the food was good.I was put off by the fact that there was no coffee/tea maker in the room. If you asked for it, you were provided with it, and it came in a timely manner, but I've gotten used to the fact that they are usually provided in the top hotels.We had dinner at the Hau Tree Lanai, the hotel's restaurant, and the location (right on the beach) was nice, and it had a very laid-back ambience, so you didn't necessarily expect four-star service, and the service was friendly, accommodating and helpful. The food was just okay, and although I wouldn't compare it to a five-star restaurant, it was what you might expect at a beach eatery.The hotel has no pool or hot tub, and if you're expecting that don't reserve here. The beach is very nice, with that magnificent view of Waikiki, and I enjoyed watching the surfers, paddle surfers and outrigger paddlers throughout my stay. I was there over Independence Day, so on the 4th the beach was just totally packed with people, and although it was sort of fun watching from the lanai, I don't think I'd find it particularly pleasant or peaceful to laze on the beach. It was nice being on the lanai, though.If I had one main gripe about my stay it's that I wasn't given a higher floor, even though I had requested one months in advance. I don't know what you have to do to get a higher floor, but even trying to tempt the desk clerk with a nice tip (this on advice from a book about how to improve your stay in a hotel) I had no luck. But I've had this kind of experience in New Otani hotels in Tokyo.
