They're oh so very polite, but if they don't want to give you something you could just as well be talking to a brick wall.So in conclusion, let me say that the (refurbished) rooms are very nice and pleasant, but the rest of the hotel could definitely use a facelift. The employees could work on being a little more pleasant and accommodating. In order for me to give this hotel anything more than "average" a lot of work will have to be done.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: It is called boutique hotel, virtually. The rooms are tiny, but clean. Reception staff is very helpful but the beach towel guy does not like his job. The beach in front of the hotel is clean and convenient.Not to suffer with public transportation better option is rent a car in Honolulu! However, in that case add your nightly hotel cost a $24 for mandatory valet parking in hotel property. You may find space on the street parking weekdays if you are lucky. Weekends, forget about it. It is an outdated hotel as most of the things in Hawaii.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Like many hotels on Waikiki, this hotel suffers from being a refreshed version of a hotel built 50 years ago during Waikiki beach's heyday. Given that we paid almost 300 bucks a night, we were disappointed by (1) the very noisy room (could hear every door slamming, and the chairs being dragged across the lanai and the sliding doors from the room above); (2) the lack of elevator access to our second-floor room (we stayed in the older "suite wing"); (3) the lack of a swimming pool; and (4) the language issues of some of their employees (it's great for them that they cater to Japanese tourists, but this can be difficult for us native English speakers).

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel is a little further away from all other Waikiki attractions but we loved the view and the location. We had a Ocean View room and around the corner we could see the Diamond Head. The beach was quiet on weekdays. The hotel provides mats and beach towels but no umbrellas.The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was quite nice and L'Occitane products were provided. (It is my favorite so I may be biased.)Hau Tree Restaurant had the best breakfast and dinner but we wanted to explore Waikiki restaurants as well. There are two buses that pass by the hotel. 19 and 20 were pretty good to take us close to the Waikiki restaurants. The staff is extremely nice and helpful. We called for a taxi to get to the airport. The valet gave us a coupon for a set price of $29 for the company they called. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We came to Hawaii last year and stayed in Kailua so thought we'd try Waikiki. I RESEARCHED many places and the New Otani delivered! Our son was getting married in Kapiolani Park adjacent to the hotel so I also booked a room for him, which they upgraded to a suite(free of charge) when he checked in. We splurged and got the Ocean Waikiki superior and glad we did. Our son's room was a corner suite with a beautiful view of the park and Diamond Head. There is a workout room next to the small laundry room with 2 washers and dryers. All the staff went out of their way to help us - the valet even took the bride and her attendants over to the park! Only thing I would change is charging to use the computer for printing boarding passes. Mahalo for a wonderful week!!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is wonderfully situated, right on the beach under Diamond Head, with a lovely quiet park behind it -- so much nicer than the busy Waikiki waterfront just a short walk away. Rooms are not lavishly sized but well-planned and comfortable, with lanais overlooking either the park, beachfront, or Diamond Head; the bathrooms could use updating but are perfectly functional. Beds are soft (a bit much so for my taste) and linens and toiletry amenities are somewhat sub-par; there is a refrigerator but no mini-bar. There is, however, plentiful storage space and the closet contains two luggage racks to make unpacking easier. There is no pool or fitness center, which might be a deterrent to some; but the beach is what you come to Waikiki for, and the hotel offers mats as well as towels for sunbathing comfort. The Hau Tree Lanai – an open-air beachfront restaurant shaded by twin giant hau trees – serves a delicious breakfast, which is highly popular with visiting Japanese tour groups, so be warned and reserve ahead of time; we were out at lunch and dinner every day, so didn't sample menus for those times. And we also missed the Miyako Restaurant; perhaps on another trip we'll try it. Service is a bit haphazard but everyone is so good-humored and welcoming it seems silly to complain about it.
user_name:
Amanda S
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We used to live in Honolulu. We love this location. Away from the cheesiness of Waikiki. Great swimming beach. Nice surf spot. Easy paddle out. My husband and son love that. Plus the hay tree lanai is the best place to hang out for a leisurely breakfast or lunch. Watch the beach scene and the waves.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is right on a beautiful well maintained beach away from the busy part of Waikiki. Room sounded small when we reserved room, but was comfortable for my wife and I. We had a private lanai where we sat and could watch the ocean and listen to the waves. The climate was so comfortable that we left the lanai door open at night and room stayed cool and we were able to hear the ocean waves while we slept (very peaceful). Hotel staff, other than the concierge, was very helpful. The valet's went above and beyond by giving us useful travel information for places of interest. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, and stay here if we ever get the chance to return to Oahu!!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We loved our room. Great view of Waikiki, the ocean and Diamond Head. Large open plan quiet room with good bathroom. And a case stand, I love that! Easy access to the beach with towels and beach mat provided.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I was a little nervous about the new otani after reading some of the reviews. When I arrived the valet helped me with my luggage and was very friendly. The front desk agent was lovely! we were getting married on the island so she upgraded us to an ocean view room.The room was beautiful with a large lanai, ocean view and a mountain range view. Stunning! New otani was really a dream. Simple but very clean. All ocean view rooms get turn down service which is always a nice touch. I love that it was in a quiet area but only a 10 minute walk to the main area of waikiki. If i come back to the island I will be staying here again.
user_name:
Hamkitty
Las Vegas, Nevada, United States

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Our FTE Conference was here from June 10-14 and the hotel staff was so nice and hospitable...thinking the 3-4 Japanese weddings daily must prep them for all kinds of people!I know for next time to get an annex room- much bigger for sharing - but the rooms, although small, are quite utilitarian.No complaints, and RIGHT ON THE BEACH, with free towels, mats for the beach- you cannot go wrong here.It is a mile or so from the main waikiki dag- but it suited us just fine- less hub ub and tourists hangin' about~ very nice, and the rates to stay for the conference were very reasonable for OAHU...some stayed early and afterwards, due to the great pricing.Dining there is a bit pricey for teachers (our group) but the lunch we had and breakfast fixins and fruit medleys were awesome.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I booked this hotel for a 5 day vacation in Honolulu, I was given a unit that really falling apart and smelled bad. i had requested a king size bed but the unit had twin beds. i was mostly disappointed because the rate i paid was the same as staying in the renovated tower. They advertised as having a washer and dryer in its units but in it did not, they have a laundry center with 1 machine and dryer for everyone staying at the hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I were in town for a wedding and booked this hotel for a week long stay. The hotel is undergoing renovations (which we did not know) and the room we were given was NOT renovated. Tiny, smelly, dirty, dilapidated. I refused to sleep in the bed and the one chair was so dirty I put a towel over it before I sat down. However, the real reason for the bad review is that there was no effort made to accommodate us. When we called downstairs to inquire what would happen if we checked out early we were told we would pay for the night. No one asked "is there a problem?" or "Would you like a different room?" Even when we showed up in the lobby with our suitcases 40 minutes after we checked in (there was no way I was going to spend even one night in that room) no one asked if there was anything they could do. To their credit, they did not charge us for the night, merely watched us load our bags in the taxi and leave.Other people in town for the same event did stay there in the renovated sections and say it was okay. However, we could not leave fast enough. The room was so bad I am surprised they didn't try to warn us. We would have been willing to upgrade if necessary to change rooms. As it was we booked into the Marriott at a bit more than we would have paid here, the New Otani didn't even offer that or anything else as a solution.
user_name:
Blissed1015
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Pick a newly renovated room great views of ocean or Waikiki skyline probably a pricey hotel as your paying for location great staff and exceptional conceierge if your planning just to stay in hotel and on the beach and u get a deal the yes stay here.. If not stay cheaper you only will sleep there

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We recently spent two weeks in Hawaii,including several days in Honolulu. This hotel had been booked online through an agency there. It is owned by Japanese-American interests, so the decor is contemporary, neat, and oriental. The service is polite and very good--we were checked in promptly, even though we had arrived early for our room. A minor glitch with our new flat screen HD TV was fixed promptly. We requested a corner, ocean front room which was provided as an upgrade. The linens were fresh daily and turned down in the evening with a plumeria flower on each top pillow. One of the nicest features was their open-air beach front Hau Tree Lanai restaurant, where we both had an excellent breakfast. The down-side was the small bathroom. A mini-frig. is provided, but no microwave, which would have been nice. This is busy Waikiki, adjacent to the famous beach, two public parks, and other hotels, so it is crowded there.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is my third visit to Oahu in the last 12 months and 20 something visit in the last 20 years and I have to say the most enjoyable visit of all thanks to the Kaimana Beach Hotel where I’m currently staying for 9 nights. The location is perfect if you want Ocean views, but not right in the crazy hustle and bustle on downtown Waikiki . You are only a 10 to 15 minutes’ walk away along the pretty beach front or beautiful park to downtown, so it’s best of both worlds here. The hotel is right on the San Souci beach as is their restaurant. The staff are family like and that is all part of the charm of this hotel that gives it its personality and character. From the Valet to the reception, everyone is helpful. It's obvious talking to a few other regular guest that once you’ve stayed here you won’t want to stay anywhere else. Why would you with views and a location like this. The rooms are currently having a makeover and I started my vacation in their basic room not yet refurbished, which was amazing value for the money. Really good views of Diamond Head and I could see the ocean, plus free in room internet, what more could you want. I’ve had to work a few days from my room while here, so I asked if I could get a better room. The lady on reception went out of her way and for a very reasonable price. I got one of their amazing deluxe beach front refurbished room with a wraparound lanai and breathtaking views of the Pacific Ocean and the Waikiki skyline, which at sunset is memorable sitting on your own private Lanai. Then to wake up to sunrise over Diamond Head as the first rays hit the Pacific, it’s the perfect honeymoon location. I can confirm the photos are very accurate, which is a nice surprise compared to other hotels I’ve stayed at. I really don’t understand why this hotel is not in the top 10 on Tripadvisor for Waikik. I stayed at a hotel right next door last year which is highly ranked and yet the Kaimana Beach beats it for views, service, and room quality (refurbished rooms). I can’t recommend it enough. I also advise asking for one of their rooms ending in 17. You won’t regret it.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani Kaimana Beach is ON the beach and one that is less crowd than right on the main street in Waikiki. There is the ocean on one side of the hotel and a large green park on the other side. The bus to most of the city runs right in front of the hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful. Waikiki IS a resort zone- so it is expensive and fairly crowd. Kaimana is more like what Hawaii use to be before it biggered itself.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Great hotel in a great location. We had the ocean/wakiki superior room on 8th floor. The view is amazing and the room is modern with a very comfortable bed and a large balcony with table and two chairs. The hotel is on a smaller, more secluded beach than waikiki but if you would prefer the busier waikiki beach it is only a ten minute stroll. The smaller beach (san souci ithink its called) is much less crowded and has a lifeguard so safety is not an issue. There is a park between Waikiki and the hotel, but we found this park safe to pass through even after midnight. We just stayed on the road and the worst we came across was a large cockroach and a homeless guy asking for dimes. We ate breakfast in the hotel on two mornings (you must book this 24 hours beforehand as it is very popular), which was quite expensive but was delicious and had a great view looking out onto the pacific ocean. The staff were very helpful and the rooms were cleaned spotless everyday. I would highly recommend this hotel, as it is close enough to Waikiki to enjoy each evening but far enough away to be able to relax. Diamond head is the large mountain/crater opposite the hotel and I would recommend walking up for some beautiful views of honolulu (this hike is not very strenuous and takes 30/35mins and is suitable for most fitness levels). Gym, spa, beauty salon/hairdresser, convenience store, clothes store, japanese restaraunt, self service laundry/laundry service all available.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Having read all the reviews prior to my visit May 2013 I was a little bit apprehensive too say the least as to what we could expect. Having arrived after 4 nights in Las Vegas I have to say that first impressions had us fearing the worst. We were allocated a room on the six floor and another room on the eight floor, with a view of the ocean to the right and Diamond Head to the left. Yes the rooms are small (but after Vegas anything would seem small), but after a good nights sleep all of my party agreed that the rooms were adequant. They were cleaned everyday and we had no trouble with creepy crawlies. We found the towel man to be very pleasant and more than helpful especially when it came to locating a couple of beach brollies. We had a meal in the Japanese resturant on our first night which was very very good.I would not hesitate to stay at the New Otani Beach as it is not as bad as some reviews may lead you to believe, and its in a great location ie right on the beach.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My girlfriend and I had booked a room in the Diamond Head wing of the hotel as it was the most affordable for us and still close to Waikiki Beach. When we arrived on 15 May we checked in and went straight to our room so we could get settled in and make our way out for supper. When we returned my girlfriend noticed that there were small ants crawling all over the kitchenette area. When we looked closer we noticed that the ants were also in the bathroom and in a few places around the bed. We went to the front desk and explained the situation to the clerk. He offered us another room in the main tower for the night and said they would spray the room in the morning so we could move back in for the next night of our visit. The next morning we talked to the manager on duty and she was aware of the situation. She explained that the staff could spray to get rid of the ants and would move our belongings back in afterward. We headed out for the day and returned shortly before supper. At first everything seemed to be ok and we didn't notice any ants. However after we had gone out for supper and returned we once again noticed that there were ants in the room as with the previous night. We once again went to the front desk where the manager on duty assigned us to a different room in the same wing. In both cases the rooms we were moved to were upgrades from our original room. However the upgraded rooms do not take away from the fact that we should not have had to move in the first place. For the price I paid for the room I would expect that something like an ant infestation would have been handled before someone moved into the room. I have had less problems while staying at an Econolodge. It was also frustrating in that we were there for 2 nights and were not in the same room either night or in the room that I had booked either night. I would have expected to be moved after the first night to an equivalent room for the duration of our stay. With the exception of the person on duty at the desk the first night, who made us feel like it was our fault, all other staff we dealt with at the hotel were very pleasant and eager to help. All in all though our stay at this hotel was not a pleasant experience. While I cannot comment on rooms in the main tower I would avoid the Diamond Head wing and am not likely to stay here again or recommend this hotel to any of my friends.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I first stayed here during the 1960's and continued with yearly visits into the early 70's but then switched to the Kahala,and most recently, the Halekulani. The Kaimana experience is more low key and reminiscent of Hawaii of yesteryear; but mind you, choose your room carefully as some rooms are very, very small. I had a lovely, renovated Ocean Deluxe room on the seventh floor (#721) with views of the ocean and Waikiki with a wrap-around porch with views of Diamondhead. A comparable room at the Halekulani would have been priced at more than double the nightly rate. Orignally they were going to put me on the 4th floor, but when I reminded them I had called the week prior to request a higher floor, Mai at the front desk, graciously jumped in and granted my request. The beach in front of the hotel is perfect (I brought my own towel and beach chair) with a lifeguard, and Waikiki is an easy 10 minute walk along the water.The poi pancakes at the Hau Tree Lanai are the best breakfast treat - better than the French toast or the Eggs Benedict. For dinner, try the Ahi Salad Nicoise - delicious and well priced. For good, less expensive food, take a short walk past the Aquarium to the Barefoot Beach Cafe - try the garlic shrimp plate (just like you find on the shrimp trucks around the island) for lunch.Dined at Michel's for memories - dinner was nice, wonderful setting, but my best meal was at Alan Wong's. Try the Passion Fruit Mojito - best cocktail ever! The service was vey attentive and the food features local, fresh ingredients.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel is in a lovely spot, tucked not far from Diamond Head and fronting the beach. It looks like a 1960s-era hotel (and some of the maintenance shows) but its location away from the main strip of Waikiki Beach is a huge plus.The hotel is about 10 minutes or so level walking from the main strip of Waikiki Beach – a good stroll, a safe neighbourhood, and a short taxi ride if you really cannot walk this. Well worth being away from the racket and noise of the main strip.The open bar and restaurant area was a pleasant way to get one’s land-legs back after the flight from Australia, even if the maître d was a little bit short. The bellman allegedly helping us with luggage then slammed the door in my wife’s face as we struggled up the stairs in the apartment wing (above the shops). Maybe they had heard that Australians are reputed to be terrible tippers. Other staff were very pleasant, and uniformly helpfulWe chose a 1-bedroom apartment, with a TINY kitchenette and no work desk but otherwise spacious. We had our own basic kitchen implements which, together with my skills in microwave cookery, had us self-catering when we weren’t eating out. The room overlooked the adjacent park.Several maintenance issues with the room – loose power outlets, eccentric microwave oven (only worked if we closed the door a certain way), and TV remotes that were really simply fancy paperweights. But most were addressed when reported (except the microwave – we received lessons on how to close the door).No noise problems that we experienced, and a lovely spot on top of the beach. Lovely for a dip or for just strolling and watching the sunset.Now be warned; this is NOT a business hotel, This is reflected in the absence of a business centre and work desk in room, and in (initially) the rather laid-back way they initially treated our complaint regarding the very slow wi fi. A technician did a drive-by assessment and determined the wi fi was working; our problem was that it was not working properly. The hotel finally had the problem assessed properly, and indeed found that the wi fi was indeed not working properly. But by that stage I was 4 days behind in my work.But if you are after a vacation or a nice stopover to or from mainland USA / Australia, then this is certainly the place to be.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is a really nice small hotel located right across the street from Kapiolani Park and away from all of the tourists of Waikiki. It literally takes seven minutes to walk from the hotel to Waikiki Beach. It is super quiet and has an awesome beach right in front of the hotel. It is also within walking distance to the Aquarium, which is also a nice little feature. We had a room on the seventh floor overlooking the park, with views of the ocean and wonderful Honolulu sunsets and skyline views. It was superb and very relaxing. This hotel is owned by a Japanese company, so they do cater to a TON of Japanese tourists, so we were definitely in the minority here. But they are all very nice and friendly and treat all guests extremely well. I am beginning to have more of an appreciation for the smaller boutique style hotels of the world as they have to compete with very large companies and seem to do all of the little things better than the larger places. This place does everything right and also has a fantastic restaurant on-site, Hau Tree Lanai, which gets super busy because it is probably the closest you will ever come to dining right ON the beach in Honolulu and has wonderful food and great service. It is a little on the pricey side, but everything in Hawaii is expensive, just know that before you go there. The staff here is exceptional and I would DEFINITELY stay here again. The only downside for some people might be that they do not have a swimming pool, but their beach is right out front and it's very calm and excellent for swimming. If you go out further, you will be swimming with turtles. Beautiful place, beautiful people. A+

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights recently. We had booked an Ocean Wakiki Superior, recently renovated, room but, upon arrival, were upgraded to a junior suite on the 7th floor! The suite was on a corner with a view of Diamond Head in one direction and Waikiki beach and the ocean on the other so we could see sunrise and sunset from the lanai. The views were fabulous! The staff was very friendly, helpful and accommodating. The hotel was only a 15 minute walk to central Waikiki, along a path next to the beach and park. We felt as if we had a private beach! We enjoyed a meal on the first floor restaurant under the tree. We'd definitely like to come again!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is right next to the Aquariun and across the street from Kapiolani Park. Very convenient to the zoo and lower Waikiki. Small and intimate and away from busy Waikiki. On the beach. Good food.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for a few days on honeymoon and was the most perfect hotel... we had a side sea view that also overlooked waikiki. Hotel was right on the beach and Was only a few minutes walk from central waikiki. Staff where very friendly and helpful and we loved it. If ever get back to hawaii will be staying here for sure!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My sister and I just went on a girls-only trip for 6 days and we stayed at this small gem only 15 minutes walk away from the busy Waikiki area. It was perfect! We were there to relax and that's exactly what we got to do. Since this hotel is located right on the beach, it felt like we had a private beach with literally private beach access and the hotel even supplied beach mat and towels for guests to use. With our Air Canada package, we got an ocean view room, which turned out to be ocean view + park view + Waikiki view room. It was AMAZING! The room was one of the renovated ones so it was so nice and clean. Housekeeping staff was wonderful, made our bed everyday even when it didn't have to be. The very minor down side is that some of the morning staff wasn't the greatest, but evening and night time staff are just marvellous and wonderful all together! Since our flight wasn't until 8pm, the afternoon staff arranged a hospitality room for my sister and I to stay at so we could change and get ready. The hospitality room was one of the rooms yet to be renovated, but it was great as we got to see the view of the Diamond Head Mountain. The beachside restaurant was amazing as well! Wonderful food with magnificent view! My sister and I have agreed that we could stay there again for our next visits!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I stayed one night here. Loved the bed and the big lanai with chairs. I had a great view of Diamond Head. This hotel is right on the beach and is close to the aquarium and zoo. Kapiolani Park is right across the street. If you walk or run, the hotel has a map with distances for various runs. My room was in an area of the hotel that is being upgraded, so the room was a bit tired. However, the stay was comfortable. I also had dinner in the bar and had the best steamed fish with ginger and fresh vegetables. The mai tais were also respectable.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I always enjoy staying at the New Otani as it is located in the most superb spot in Waikiki. It's a hotel for those that want to experience the beauty of Waikiki in a peaceful setting. The staff is friendly, helpful, and always goes the extra mile to make you happy. The rooms have been upgraded in the gift of minimalism with great taste. The views are spectacular. Everything is walking distance. I always enjoy my stay when I get the gift of staying at this hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed at the New Otani for a week. The room was quite small but we did get a pretty good deal through BookIt.com so the value in what we paid seemed on par. There was nothing that was really outstanding about the hotel itself, it has all your regular ammenities and the staff were really friendly. We loved that the hotel was beachfront and we could snorkel right in front.There is about a 10-15 min walk to get to the main strip which was fine with us for most of the stay. The only time it got challenging was when our arms were full of bags to bring back to the hotel.If you eat breakfast there, be sure to try the macadamian nut french toast, it was very delicious.Overall we enjoyed our stayed but next time we will book something in the heart of the city just to try that experience out.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This place was recommended by our travel agent and when we first arrived we were taken to a room that still needed to be renovated. Our travel agent quickly corrected this and we were taken to a newly renovated room. The views were AMAZING and it was a wonderful hotel. The room service was very quick and the food was outstanding. The rooms were very clean and it was very peaceful and quiet. a short walk to the hustle and bustle of the noisey area and so well worth it. We were able to park in the park next door and not pay the daily parking fee which was very nice. The hotel staff was very friendly and we just really enjoyed our trip. We will be staying here again when we come back and visit. There is not a pool or hot tub at this hotel but this hotel is on the beach and the natural reef is wonderful and you are able to swim in the ocean which is far better than any pool.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel was right on the Waikiki beach and was beautiful. The temperature was in the 80's everyday and in the 70's every night. It is located in a great spot where you are not far from anything you want to do, shopping, eating, mountain climbing or whatever. I can't wait to go back again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel is a wonderful choice if you want to be on the beach but away from some of the bustle of Waikiki. The beach in front of the hotel is wide and the water is shallow for some distance, making it ideal for families. It offers great views back to Waikiki and is opposite Kapiolani Park. The proximity to the park and the beach promenade toward Waikiki, make it ideal for access to walks and jogging. The downside naturally to the distance from Waikiki is less choice of restaurants in the immediate vicinity. The hotel restaurant is very good and offers a beautiful intimate setting for sunset dinners or breakfast. They are well known for their eggs benedict selections. My wife and I live in Honolulu and just spent an overnight anniversary celebration. We stayed in their smallest oceanview room which was compact but not unreasonably small. The balcony to the beach overcame any feeling of smallness. It is also much quieter than Waikiki.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I'm a frequent visitor to the Hawaiian Islands but this was my first stop on Oahu. My main focus was to visit the Arizona Memorial and other museums of Pearl Harbor. I'm very pleased I choose the New Otani over many other hotels with "better deals" on Waikiki Beach! The hotel is with in walking distance to the busy "Las Vegas" atmosphere of the strip. But felt miles away because of the green space provided by Kapiolani Park. I'll admit it I'm not a Waikiki type vacationer. So it was nice to have some green space and ocean around the hotel instead of shopping malls. The New Otani sits on a perfect little beach with an outer reef that protects it from the main swell-great swimming beach for families. There is a channel in the reef that leads out to offshore breakers so one can have the best of both ocean conditions right at your doorstep. I also found it fun and interesting to walk around Diamond Head Crater Park-watching the surfers on the coast and strolling thru nice neighborhoods made for a great walk.We stayed in a series 17 room (full ocean view) and felt it was well worth the splurge. The only downside to this hotel is the lack of a swimming pool (guess that is what the ocean is for!) and gym. There is small gym with kinda worn equipment on the property next door that one can access for $15 a day-run on the beach or in the park instead.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here between 23rd March and 2nd April 2013. We loved the fact that the hotel was about 10 minutes walk from the main stretch of Waikiki which meant the we were close enough to walk into the centre but far enough away not to be bothered by noise. It also meant that the beach was not as busy. The beach is right next to the hotel which was brilliant. The staff were extremely helpful and polite and nothing was too much trouble. The room was a reasonable size but lacked storage space. The room was also dated, the bathroom needed a face lift. We had met friends there and their room seemed to have been updated so perhaps ask for this. The reception rest rooms had obviously been updated as well so perhaps they have a running programme. We did not eat in the main restaurant (mainly as we are not fish lovers) but we did have a bar snack which was lovely. We had a room on the side of the hotel but this meant that we had views of the beach and also the backdrop of diamond head and we loved sitting on the balcony.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Our first visit to the hotel was lovely. We stayed overnight when we arrived on Hawaii, and our room was just right. We had an oblique angle view of the ocean (more park than ocean), we had a tremendous bathroom, and a nice, squishy bed. On our return, a couple of days before we left Hawaii, we were booked into a room on a low-standing wing of the hotel. The room was over the break room for the gym downstairs, so cigarette smoke wafted in through the open balcony door. When we went out to stand on the balcony, we were chased in by cockroaches. Inside, we found ants on the bathroom sink and near the coffee machine at the front door. The air conditioner vent was covered in dust. Thankfully, when we complained the next day, they moved us back to the nice side. But honestly, if you get the wrong deal or rate or cycle of the moon, you could wind up in a room no better than a no-tell motel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani is by far the best hotel in Honolulu - I would not stay anywhere else. After spending 5 nights at the crowded Sheraton in Maui, my partner and I were craving a peaceful, beautiful, authentic hotel. The New Otani did not disappoint. The views from room 821 were breathtaking, and the room spacious and modern. Every night, the staff left beautiful flowers on our pillows after turnover. The restaurant was definitely one of the highlights - it sits directly under a banyan tree, and provides an almost mediterranean feel. You have to try the beef burger! Delicious! The hotel is located away from the constant crowds (but close enough to walk to dinner and shops) and tucked away on it's own private beautiful beach. The beach was very clear and my partner saw turtles most days! The staff were fantastic and everyone was very friendly! On one particular night, our waiter went out of his way to try and help us fix our camera on the iPhone so we could take the perfect picture! We will not stay anywhere else in Honolulu and highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I love being able to walk outside my hotel and be on the sand, walk to the water and then snorkel. No traffic to deal with, directions to sort out or trouble finding parking. As others have said the staff is most delightful and helpful. The real treat, however, is the restaurant. I think we ate every meal, except one, here. Grassfed beef, fresh vegetables and of course excellent fish. Think we'll choose a warmer month than February next time.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Very good hotel with very friendly staff , very clean room ( book a corner room :))perfectly located if you want to enjoy a quiet stay in Hawaii :)Enjoy, you won t be disappointed ! Also .... Try the eggs Benedicte for your morning breakfast : just delicious !!!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Most beautiful part of Waikiki, queens beach with private beach in front of hotel. Quiet, beautiful beach front restaurant, superlative service. Small but comfortable rooms. Evening live music on weekends acoustic and tasteful. We have been here twice and will always return here when we go to Oahu. Why choose another spot?

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Hawaii is expensive and hotels are in high demand. You have to pay the Hawaii premium to vacation here and it's not really fair to compare accommodations in Hawaii to anywhere else in the world. It's like New York City. If you want to go there, you have to pay the price. We stayed in a Ocean View Superior Room. Half the hotel with ocean view is renovated and I believe other half is not. If you are going all the way to Hawaii, pay the price and get the ocean view. It's worth it. The room was narrow and long with a mud room/foyer but spacious overall. Nice size bathroom and living area. There was a small couch for two (more like one) but you don't go to Hawaii to lounge and watch TV. It's hard to say whether the extra $$ for the corner room is worth it or not. From our balcony, we could see Waikiki beach so I think it was ok for us.The best thing about this hotel is the location. It's about 15 minute walk to the southern tip of the Waikiki strip. Also, you can find street parking (valet parking is quite expensive) over night and we were there over Thanksgiving weekend so we didn't have to feed the meter when we went walking about in Wakiki. Also, unlike most hotels on Waikiki, the hotel is right on the beach and so you can go for a quick swim. The hotel will give you mat and towels. The staff is super friendly. We had drinks/appetizers which were ok. On the weekends, there's live music. The hotel seemed friendly for families.
user_name:
Danny H
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I stayed at this hotel 03/06/13 thru 03/11/13 and didn't want to leave. In my opinion it was the cleanest and nicest hotel in Waikiki. It's hidden away from the hustle and bushel of the downtown Waikiki strip, it felt like we were staying in exclusive resort. The stay were all friendly and informative. The hotel as all the amenities you would need, such as hair salon, laundry mat, two restaurants, a convenient store, just to name a few, just few minute walk from shopping, surfing, aquarium, zoo, park and the beach is right out your hotel door. The next time we go to Hawaii this is where will stay!!!! Aloha, "Just Hang Lose"
user_name:
Pamela A
Burnsville, Minnesota, United States

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed there from 3.4.2013 through 3.10.2013. When reserving, I requested an updated room overlooking the ocean. It was basic, but clean and very pleasant.The rooms on the other side looked dated, but still clean. Although there have been some unfavorable reviews about the park, noise, cleanliness and staff problems, we found none of this. It's right on a public beach/park, not a private area, so there will be some noise. All of it died down by 9:00 pm every night, which was more than acceptable. You literally walk out the back door onto a nice, sheltered beach area without the crowded conditions on Waikiki. The staff including housekeeping, bell desk, check-in, valet, activities desk and restaurant were all more than helpful and seemed to care about our stay. The housekeeper kept missing (or not taking) my tips, I had to follow her down the hall once and she seemed reluctant to take it. I think if you treat the staff respectfully, you'll be treated well in return. The air conditioner was a new Mr. Slim which was super quiet and easy to operate, none of that annoying A/C rattling keeping you awake even at high-end hotels. The room was somewhat small, but what do you need when you're spending all of your time out of doors, swimming and hiking? Some people sitting next to us in the restaurant owned a condo down the street and said that they recommend this hotel to their friends and family. A woman we met in the elevator said she had just checked out of a noisy, loud resort by the Waikiki beach and was hoping the New Otani Kaimana was quiet. This is not a resort and it is very basic, however, it was exactly what we were looking for - when we walked down to the Waikiki beach area, it was a cluster ruckus with horrendous traffic, and we were so glad we stayed right on the San Souci beach. If you're looking for perks and updated resort amenities, this is definitely not the place for you. If you want a clean, basic room with great ocean views, sunsets and an uncrowded beach, this is where to go. Check out Leonards, Rainbow Cafe, Diamondhead Beach Club, and the beach restaurant between the New Otani and Waikiki for reasonably priced, excellent food.Rainbow and Diamondhead Beach Club are both outdoor restaurants -- if there's no picnic tables available, you can always take it to your room and eat on the lanai. The food on Waikiki Beach was way overpriced and nothing special, and we were happy with these recommendations from one of the valets.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I found the rooms to be mediocre and the service at the front desk excellent. We had a problem though with the concierge desk, the morning concierge (older Asian lady) to be very short and cut us off in the middle of our questions to say she had to put money in her parking meter!!!!!!!!!! This is unheard of in a hotel of this calibre and when you are paying these prices I expect better service. Her recommendation of Germaines Luau was awful and she kept trying to send me to Roys which we have down the street where I live when I specifically asked her for local restuarants that you can't find anywhere else.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We booked our reservation through Otel.com, and got the room we wanted, the view we wanted and at a good price too. Love the beach and the staff -- and the fact that it borders Kapaolani Park -- where the Aquarium and Zoo are. We kept seeing Japanese couples being married on the beach - must be a good business. There's a great beachfront walk through Kapalani Park to bustling Waikiki. And it's only a 5 km. walk to the centre of the Diamond Head crater. The staff were terrific - very accomodating and professtional.We'll definitely be back.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I recently stayed at the hotel and I must say, the rooms are pretty small. I paid for an upgraded room facing the Pacific and it was an amazing view. It the 3rd floor room, 2 floors above the restaurant. The hotel staff was pretty friendly, accommodating and helpful. There was one valet staff member there that was a bit rude but whatever. The upgraded rooms were very clean, modern and beautiful. The TV was a bit weird though. Upon leaving, we also requested a hospitality room, which we were able to use to freshen up before our red eye flight. They gave us the annex room, the one with no elevator. This room compared to the upgraded rooms was a NO NO. If you get the chance, UPGRADE!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: this hotel should probably be a 1 or 2 star property. I stayed here because I had a 125 dollar credit to use with the app hotels tonightand my out of pocket expenses came to a total of 40 dollars. The hotel is a series of 3 or 4 buildings very old construction most of the interior and exterior always in common areas are not updated at all.when we got into our room and turned on the air conditioner there was an overwhelming older of mildew. there were bugs why's throughout the room mold and mildew on the tiles in the shower and the toilet ran all night long. We did however have a room that had a partial ocean view which was nice. The location of the hotel is nice quieter nearly Honolulu Zoo but I can't see spending more than 50 dollars a night for it.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I stayed at The New Otani Kaimana Beach hotel for seven nights, and found this stay even better than the last time I was there. The hotel has done extensive renovations to its lobby bar, and guest rooms bringing it up to date with a fresh modern sense, and little touches of aloha. I have been to Waikiki several times, and this is a definite favourite hotel for me. It is located on the far side of the Kapilolani Park, away from all the noise and congestion of the main Waikiki area. It is a beautiful ten minute stroll to the main Waikiki area. (If you prefer the sounds of party people screaming at night, or the sounds of the garbage trucks at 7:00 in the morning, I suggest you stay in the main Waikiki area). At the New Otani, I had an excellent room which was tastefully appointed, and very spacious. My lanai wrapped around the room, so that I could see Diamond Head on one side and the whole of Waikiki and the ocean on the other. By day or by night, I was always finding myself staring out at the spectacular view. Housekeeping was excellent and my bed, was very comfortable- which is the most important thing. At night I slept with the curtains open to marvel the view, and the lanai doors open so I could listen to the ocean waves and wind wrestling the palm trees. It was truly a treat!I am a runner and swimmer, and I just needed to step out the door and I was on my way up to Kahala for a daily run, without having to weave through the crowds in the main area. The Sans Souci beach outside of the hotel, also gives guests an almost "private beach" feeling, and one can easily swim out to a marker for a nice workout. There isn't a swimming pool at the hotel, but you don't need it as there is little surf at the beach outside the hotel. Surfers are also in abundance in the area as there are some great waves off shore. They even have a storage area for boards at the hotel.I dined in the Hau Tree Lanai restaurant at the hotel a couple of times, and you do need reservations to dine there, as it is a very popular destination for both locals and tourists...and the foods are excellent. I had the Kaimana Eggs Benedict one day which everyone else around me was eating and it was done to perfection.On another visit, I had a salmon dish done in a miso sauce, the portion and presentation was perfect and the salmon perfectly done. Whether staying at the hotel or not, I would suggest this restaurant, as it is literally right on the beach, dining under the tree provides a very special atmosphere. Apparently the restaurant will often get sold out for weddings and other special events as well.There are not many shops in the area, but the hotel does have a small arcade with a convenience store (alcohol, produce, snacks and sundries); hair salon, and a couple of other specialized shops. So one does not have to go too far. There is also a spa in the hotel, which I never used, and the Kaiseki Japanese Restaurant, Miyako- with chefs direct from Japan!The hotel also has free WIFI throughout the building, which is a great plus. Many of the other hotels in the area only offer this in the lobby, or end up charging you for this. I did manage to meet with the General Manager as well, who informed me that the hotel is going to continue renovating a lot of the hotel, and I assured him to keep up the great work as I would again be back. I have stayed at several hotels in the area, from low end to high end, but find myself returning to this gem. Would I recommend it? YES, in a heartbeat. It has everything you need and more.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Get me a stretch of sand, bone-warming sun, and a place to chill out, especially during the winter months, and I'm a happy man. I want to wake to the soothing sound of breaking waves. I want to take in the aroma of suntan lotion as people stroll by. I want to follow strange footprint patterns in the sand. For me, this is true escapism.If you feel the same way, you want to check into the New Otani, a Pacific retreat in the shade of Diamond Head, just minutes away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, on Kaimana Beach. The perfect place to perfect the art of laziness.Outside, multiple scenes entice. Puffy white clouds in a deep blue sky drift by. Colorful sailboats and yachts maneuver on the deep blue sea. Paddle boarders negotiate incoming waves. An outrigger canoe looks like a gray dolphin. Yogis go through their morning rituals.The Hau Tree Lanai is a popular place for breakfast, lunch or dinner to enjoy eggs Benedict, shrimp linguini, or your favorite steak. Scented flowering vines spill over the walls. Robert Louis Stevenson enjoyed many hours here where he lounged and wrote.The rooms feature warm tones of cream, tan and chocolate. The flat screen TV allows for learning about the many island treasures.Floor-to-ceiling windows present an uninterrupted view of Waikiki Beach. Open the windows and let in a soft breeze.Round sweeping balconies are perfect for star gazing at night. Or for watching the play of lights up the mountainside.During the day, kiss away an afternoon on the balcony with your favorite novel. Or order a bottle of sparkling wine and chill out on the chaise longue.The coma-inducing bed allows for some wonderful naps in between island tours.Cool tiles in the bathroom soothe after a day on the beach. A pleasant surprise was a supply of full body towels and the scented bath soaps.Troll the lobby for some excellent people watching. Or wander over to the lobby-level bar fora mai tai or your favorite tropical drink.A convenience store on site was a welcome relief for late night snacks and drinks.The multi-lingual staff will attend to your every need, including room service when you want to order in, and scented flowers on your pillow when turning down your bed for the night.The New Otani is well placed for park strolls, or the occasional jog to shred those extra pounds.Insider tip: Book a room higher up so you can get a better view of Waikiki Beach and the mountains in the distance.It's perfectly understandable if you feel like crying when you leave the warmth of this resort.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We were both very happy with this hotel and will come back next time in Honolulu. I'd recommend The New Otani as long as you don't require a full service hotel (which oddly enough we usually do but here the pros outweigh the cons!).We decided to stay at the New Otani based on friends recommendation and Trip Advisor reviews & were VERY happy with our choice. The location is good as it’s not in the craziness and hustle/bustle of the crammed hotels concentrated in downtown Waikiki.The hotel is located right on Sans-souci beach which felt like a locals hang-out (which we liked) and is short walk to the downtown Waikiki. Something important to note is this is NOT a full service hotel (i.e. not round the clock room service and no pool) but the views of the Pacific, Diamond Head and downtown Waikiki more than make up for it!We were lucky enough to be upgraded to the Waikiki suite and the suite was FANTASTIC . This is a corner suite with views from all the windows, a large balcony with lounge chairs, and everything about the room makes you feel like you are truly on a great vacation. We invited our group of 6 over for the sunset cocktails as its a perfect setting.We had dinner one night in Miyako - the Japanese restaurant at the hotel which is very good - I would HIGHLY recommend making a reservations for one of the cabanas on the balcony and get there in time for the sunset - a GORGEOUS view. We were a group of 8 and each of us liked our dishes and the we had a great waitress. We also had a breakfast and dinner at the Hau Tree Lanai which is the lobby/ beachfront restaurant - it's a very charming setting underneath the ancient Hau trees.Remember when making a reservation to ask for Ocean view (depending on your budget) - we originally made a reservation for a room with Ocean & Diamond Head views - the combo is beautiful!
user_name:
Craig K
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife and I spent 5 nights at this property during our honeymoon. We were upgraded to an Ocean View Deluxe room with an amazing panorama along Waikiki (and beyond towards Eva Beach) and out over the Pacific. Although the room was rather small, the scenery from our balcony more than made up for this fact. The open-air lobby is especially welcoming, and includes a bar for afternoon/evening drinks and snacks. We also tried one of the two restaurants on site (Hau Tree Lanai). The hotel is situated at the Diamond Head (east) end of Waikiki across from Kapiolani Park and near the base of Diamond Head. Accordingly, the neighborhood is quieter and less congested than the heart of Waikiki further to the west. There is a decent beach with good snorkeling right in front of the hotel (Sans Souci Beach). Due to its location, it is about a 15-20 minute walk to many restaurants and other hotels in Waikiki. However, the hotel is also more accessible to less touristed local (and less expensive) restaurants on Kapahulu and Monserrat Avenues. The concierge desk and valets were also especially helpful in providing restaurant reservations and driving directions during our stay.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This old hotel - known to locals as the Kaimana Beach hotel - is the closest hotel to Diamond Head. It is located right on the beach - you walk out of the hotel lobby on to the sand. Its restaurant - the Hau Tree Lanai - nestles under an ancient tree and you can drop a blossom on the beach from your table. Our favorite moment at the hotel is going for a swim at dawn after a cup of coffee on the sand and watching the sun come up over Diamond Head. Our favorite activity is walking through Kapiolini Park.The rooms are small but all have wonderful views and the linens and service ar good. The hotel is a favorite of Japanese tourists.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Location. Concerning hotels, the problem with Honolulu is that the great majority of them are concentrated in Waikiki. And concentration is indeed THE problem here. Waikiki is a ghetto, a fancy and expensive one but a ghetto nonetheless. Yet the area just outside of Waikiki is actually very pleasant: Kapi'olani beach park, Sans-sourcing beach, the park going toward Diamond Head, etc... So what to do? Should one get stuck in Waikiki just so one could enjoy these areas? I tried that one year and it was terrible. The traffic jams, the overpriced parking fees, the overwhelming concrete, the list goes one. Thankfully, there is one solution to this conundrum. And that is The New Otani Kaimana. The hotel is located right on Sans-souci beach. In fact there is a door behind the reception desk that takes one directly to the sand. The view toward Waikiki at night is gorgeous. If one gets tired of Sans-souci, Kapi'olani is only a short walk away, essentially on the other side of the Natatorium. Then if one really wanted to go immerse oneself in the ugliness of Waikiki, that would only take a bit of a longer walk. Finally, there is yet another immense advantage. Parking can easily be done on the street right in front of the hotel. Starting late afternoon (7PM?) until 10AM, street parking is free at the meters facing the hotel. After 10AM, it's 50 cents per hour. So with just a bit of planning, parking at this hotel is essentially free. Compare that to the rip-off prices in Waikiki, something like $20 per day and more.Room. This hotel was built in the sixties and it shows. There is not much to the architecture. It's plain, not to say ugly. Some may say the cluster of buildings in this neighborhood takes a lot away from the beauty of Diamond Head in the background. Luckily, the rooms have all been refreshed. The bathroom is spacious and the new fittings and furniture make it quite attractive and comfortable. The balcony, equipped with lounge chairs is a great place to relax. The couch and coffee table make for a functional, spacious place. The fridge comes empty but I like it that as I always buy my own things and it's nice not to have to compete for space with the usual overpriced stuff that hotels put into their fridges.Food. I heard the Japanese restaurant at this hotel is very good but I did not get a chance to eat there. I did eat breakfast one morning at the Hau Tree restaurant down by the beach. The view is gorgeous, especially at day break. But the food is mediocre and overpriced. I can't say about lunch and dinner since I was always out for those meals.Service. Not much to say there. Usual level of service expected form this respected chain. The soap and other amenities for the bathroom are from L'Occitane en Provence. Really nice stuff.All in all, I was very happy with this hotel and will come back next time I need to be in Honolulu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: As it is stated Otani is at the quiet side of Waikiki. Meaning less traveled and away from the tourist herd. Our room was small, and the bathroom could have been a little bigger. But lets face it folks who wants to hang out in a hotel room when you are in Oahu aka paradise. I must add that the king bed was a world of comfort which included goose down pillows. We slept well and in total comfort. The staff are very friendly the breakfast served in the patio on the private beach is something to write home about. Do try the macadamia coconut french toast!It was our first stay in Oahu, and when we return we will book at the Otani. If you know of a good thing, why bother elsewhere.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We were quite content here. The room was small, basic and the decor was dated, but it was clean, comfortable, quiet & everything worked. Our view was officially of the side of the next door condo (which was kind of neat seeing the lifestyle of some residents) but we lucked out and had a partial ocean view too.The Hau Tree Lanai restaurant is where we had all of our breakfasts and they were superb dishes, in a lovely outdoor setting.We also ate a couple of times (lunch/snacks) at the main floor bar. Pricey, as Hawaii is, but fine, and we always sat at the edge with an outdoor view.**There is not a lot of dining choices in the hotel/immediate area. You have to make the walk to Waikiki for all the restaurants. If you are ok with walking 15-20 minutes straight down the road, this is no big deal.Yes, this hotel is a ways down from the touristy busy-ness of Waikiki. Surrounding the hotel is public parks and residential. Definitely a good choice if you dont want to be in the centre of the crowds.Hotel right on the beach is nice to have.You can borrow a beach mat from the front desk, very easily.BUT, the sun is strong and there is no shade on this beach and no umbrellas (unless you bring your own). One benefit of being down in busy Waikiki is the easier rental of an umbrella. The beach here itself though is nice and effective.There is no pool.Homeless people: we'd see the odd one here and there around the hotel area, but not near as many as in Waikiki. They werent troublesome in the daytime. Walking back from Waikiki at night though, just be alert... we had no problems but I could see it being unnerving to some.**Yes, we did save quite a bit of money by staying here. Honestly, I'd have to try one of the chain hotels in Waikiki at a higher price, to see if having THEIR amenities made it REALLY worth it to pay extra for a hotel room.But if your budget is small, this hotel does the trick nicely :)The woman at the tour desk was helpful and we booked lots of side trips through her that all went perfectly.**Airport shuttle.. we used Roberts Hawaii both ways, reliable service, pleasant staff, similar cost to other shuttles. Booked them to pick us us at airport, before our trip, right from home. Would definitely use them again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed here one night because we had a layover on our flight to Sydney. We didn't expect much... just a room to comfortably spend the night in near the beach.The rooms are very small and pretty run-down. This was not a surprise given the cost. What we were most disappointed with was the service. The hotel staff seem to be angling for tips in any way they can. For instance, the bellhop insisted on carrying our bags up to the room and upon checkout when we wanted to use the luggage dolly to take our own bags down he stopped us and said "not without me". We were also taken aback by the lack of English speaking skills of the majority of the staff. We have traveled throughout Southeast Asia and have yet to come across either of the above.We would not stay here again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We flew in for a quick 3-day trip and the Kaimana was recommended to us. I booked one of ther "moderate" rooms at a pretty reasonable rate. Front desk staff were very friendly, and sympathetic when the first room they assigned to us hadn't yet been cleaned :-/. Finally, we arrived in our room (beautiful Diamond Head view). Though on the small side, the bed and linens were terrific, and the bathroom facilities were entirely acceptable. A small refrigerator was included, which we appreciated. Overall, the hotel is in ok shape, but I think renovation time is approaching, or ought to be. The bell and parking staff were terrific (parking is $24/day for guests, with in and out privileges). The place where the Kaimana didn't excel was in the Hau Tree restaurant. Although the food was fine (we had breakfast there on checkout day) the staff--from the hostess, to our waiter, to the rest of support staff--was entirely bereft of joy or "Aloha". No smiles, almost no conversation. It felt like everyone on the floor if the restaurant was just phoning it in, service-wise. The difference was striking compared to the personnel in the rest of the hotel. Would I stay here again? At the right price, definitely. But unless they right the restaurant, I'll walk down to Eggs'n'Things. They talk to me there.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I did A LOT of research on Hawaii before we left for our honeymoon in August 2012. We spared no expense and traveled for more than 24 hours to get to the islands so we wanted to be sure we had the perfect trip. I did a lot of research into the hotels in Honolulu and I am so glad I did because the experience we had at our hotel really made the trip. We decided on the New Otani because of it's location. We are in our mid 30's and were looking for peace and relaxation with the option of adventure and excitement if the mood hit. The New Otani did not disappoint. It's location is PERFECT. You are just a 10 min walk along the beach to the hustle and bustle of Waikiki without being in the downtown core. We were able to hit the strip, enjoy the amazing restaurants, do some shopping but then quietly stroll the beach back to our peaceful hotel. The beach feels virtually private and was never crowded. Many locals use this beach to avoid the tourists and that was just the experience we were looking for. At night we would sit on the beach and watch the moon and there was not a soul around. Our room was incredible. It was recently renovated and the furnishings and view were spectacular. I believe it was room 606. We had a corner suite with a wrap around lanai that had amazing views of Diamond Head, Waikiki and, of course, the ocean! The Lanai restaurant in the hotel is breathtaking and offers delicious cuisine. We ate there many times during our stay and were not disappointed. We found the staff to be friendly and very helpful. We absolutely LOVED this hotel and if you are looking for some real peace and quiet in Honolulu this place is the answer. When we go back to Honolulu we would not even think of staying anywhere else!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Fully agree that photos are deceiving: the room into which we were initially placed was smaller than would have been permitted by prisons in most states. The front desk manager was unfriendly to the point of being unwelcoming; true, I asked to be moved from the impossibly small, tacky, un-renovated noisy room on the 4th floor over the parking lot as soon as I saw it, but I was polite and professional. She was dismissive, curt, and unresponsive. Only after another manager came on duty was I taken seriously (would it have been different if my husband had made the request? I got the feeling I was not treated with respect for several reasons, but my gender was one of them). The next room was slightly more expensive but it wasn't claustrophobic; other guests who upgraded to the top-level rooms liked them, apparently, but for that kind of money, I'd stay at the Halekulani or a cleaner, updated hotel. I would not recommend this hotel for anyone, despite exceptionally good service from a friendly bell staff--they appeared to be the only folks who understood the meaning of the word "hospitality." They put you in awful rooms and extort more money for a decent night's stay once you are there.
user_name:
Dr R M
North Stonington, Connecticut

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Early in my Hawaiian trip I shattered my leg which required surgery. This Hotel was part of the last leg of my trip and by the time my wife and I arrived we hadn't seen much of anything outside of the hospital. When I arrived in my wheelchair, the manager upgraded my room to ocean view and they arranged to allow me to stay longer as I couldn't fly home right away. For our entire stay the staff continually asked about my recouperation and how they could make us more comfortable. They made sure we always had everything we needed and I've never felt so welcome....Since much of my time had to be spent sitting around, the room was perfect and my recuperation was enhanced with the relaxing ocean view from our balcony.The restaurant's food was delicious and appetizers were usually enough for us.The location really offers a private feel and the beach is great, but the staff and management made our stay here special and memorable.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Found this small hotel away from the crowds of Wakikiki. Peaceful surroundings, witha great beach without the crowds. Small lobby bar and oceanfront breakfast dining. Comfortable rooms with ocean views. I was on business , but felt like i was on vacation at a private resort.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Tnis is a small boutique hotel very near Diamond Head away from Waikiki, but close enough if you want to stroll over. They have a small bar for light bites. Theynalsomhave the very renowned resturant....Hau Tree. Excellent for breakfast, lunch and dinner. It sits practically on the sand. A Robert Louis Stevenson hangout. They even have a suite named after him. The team at the hotel is excellent. They will see to your every need. Rooms are small, very small. It's the location your after, not the room. The beach in front is a "local beach". Safe swimming. Not really set up for kids.....

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We just stayed at this hotel for one night while on business. When doing my research on the hotel, I was impressed with how beautiful they were and anticipated a beautiful room when we arrived. To our disbelief, the room we were given looked more like a cheap motel room still decorated in 70's decor. When I called the front desk, I was told that there was nothing that could be done to move our room, but I could pay to upgrade to the room advertised on the website . . we declined. I feel this hotels advertising is totally deceiving and will not stay at this hotel again.See photos. . . .
user_name:
Pacific Builder... M
Lahaina, Hawaii, United States

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Beachfront property on the quiet, non-commercial end of Waikiki. Stayed on the 7th floor facing diamond crater great room with a sitting area, frig and large balcony with seating. Our rate included breakfast which never disappointed and was served in a lovely open air restaurant setting looking out to the ocean. The mai-tais and banana daiquiris in the lounge were perfect and the fried zucchini app was excellent. The staff at the reception desk were incredibly pleasant and went above and beyond to answer any question we had providing bus info maps etc. my only complaint would be the absence of a pool but that was a fact we were well aware prior to booking. As for restaurants within comfortable walking distance....lulu's great fish tacos ( casual good for sunset, reasonably priced, Tiki's great mai-tais, fish and chips also casual good for sunsets. Favorite was Uncle Bo's the seafood trap appetizer is a must, the baked opah with shrimp and the seabass dinners were not only great but included a starch and veggie for $22 Drinks were also very good and cheap ($8 avg)Must Do: the diamond crater hike sneakers or hiking shoes are a must and don't forget your camera. Took the 23 bus to the entrance ($2.50 pp) walked in and paid the fee of $1 hike took a comfortable 80 minutes round trip.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: It's like you are a world away from the hustle and bustle of Wakiki. Quite boutique hotel fronting the best section of beach in Wakiki. The beach isn't crowed even on the weekend, and there is a calm cove to swim. Oh and the views are to die for, especially at night. As a boutique, it lacks some of the facilities you find in larger hotels. There is no pool (not that you need one with the great beach just a step away), the bar closes early and the restaurant isn't open all the hours of the day (let alone late at night). However what they do have, it top notch. The restaurant food is excellent, the serve great drinks at the bar, and the rooms are wonderful. I was in one fo the upper rooms facing the ocean, and it was clearly renovated recently. Quality furnishings, nice bed, marble bathroom with new fixtures, and large flat screen TVs. They have a activities desk, furnish towels and mats for the beach, and rent snorkels/fins. I found the service staff very good if at times a bit slow. The hotel and rooms were always clean and well kept. I will stay here again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Great hotel right across from Diamond Head. Be a part of Waikiki without the crowds and hassles. Great beach. Amazing beach front restaurant. And you must try one (or more) Mai Tai's. They ARE the worlds best!!Very efficient staff with wonderful Hawaiian hospitality. Try to upgrade to an ocean front room. You won't be disappointed.  Can't wait for my next trip in Fall of 2013. I will be staying here for sure and bringing family and friends.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is my favorite place to stay in Honolulu. I wrote a positive review of the hotel after our stay last February but mentioned that it needed some renovations. When I made reservations for our December visit I requested the same room (ocean front on the 8th floor with great ocean and Waikiki outlooks, wrap around lanai that even gives a peek at Diamond Head) because the views where so spectacular. When we checked into the room we found it had been completely remodeled, a lovely surprise! The bellman told us that they were in the process of remodeling all the rooms but not all have been completed. It would probably be a good idea to ask when making reservations. Another reviewer mentioned that this is a three star hotel in a five star location, which is a very good description. It is somewhat expensive but this is on the beach in Honolulu. Having lived in Hawaii for 8 years in the 1980s, one realizes that everything is more expensive. It is certainly less expensive than most of the waterfront hotels in the midst of Waikiki and much more serene. Besides having a wonderful beach/ snorkeling right in front of the hotel there are not a lot of options for children's entertainment, although the Waikiki Aquarium is in easy walking distance. This is a hotel not a resort, which frankly is a plus for us. There is no pool or hot tub nor adventure packages done by the hotel. There is a charge for car parking (as there is at every hotel in Waikiki). We found the hotel staff very pleasant and accommodating. They printed our boarding passes at the desk for us although another reviewer said that they did not. We bought the breakfast plan which worked out well for us. Since we have numerous friends in the area we only ate in the restaurant one night this trip but always find it more reasonable than any other beach front restaurant. The restaurant is small and can get very busy because it is popular with locals and Japanese tourists so reservations are recommended. We typically buy liquor at the store and have our cocktails in private on our balcony where the view is more spectacular than in the bar...cheaper too. We travel to Hawaii several times a year on business and could probably stay anywhere but this is our hotel of choice in Honolulu...beautiful views, low key, great location. If what you want is entertainment for the kids, hustle bustle Waikiki, lavish public rooms and obsequious service you might be happier somewhere else. If you want the best views for your money, a charming small restaurant, a quieter beach, and more serenity than you will find any where else in Waikiki, I recommend the New Otani!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Upgraded to a oceanview balcony for $100 extra a night. As most reviews say this is a wonderful view property and right on the beach. Really this is only one of many things to consider when traveling, for us at least.For almost $500 a night you think you could get a printout of a boarding pass for a tour or a printout from the internet period. Point me to a computer across from the main desk $5 to start and $$ per page to print. Come on. Then charge for a chair to sit on the beach, a chair! Valet service for rental is alright but they walk 20 feet get the car open the door and have their hand out. The valet service cost more a day then our car rental.Cut out the two-bit charges and offer more services for the money. We will look somewhere else next time. Economy being what it is bang for the buck and SERVICE is important to us. Definitely not for traveller's with children, nothing for them to do. Don't get me started on the costs for drinks and food.It was for our 20th wedding anniversary and it wasn't until I ribbed the front desk clerk that maybe a bottle of wine or fruit basket was in order that he went to the back and came back with two boxes of macadamia nuts........

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I wrote a very favorable review of this hotel a couple of years ago. In my opinion, it is still a lovely three-star lodging in a five-star location. Those panoramic views from the balcony are not to be missed. The beach is still quiet and peaceful. The park is serene, and I never mind the shaded walk to Waikiki. But among the senior staff members on duty (not the young people,) one can detect an unmistakable streak of arrogance. Complimentary morning coffee service is sketchy, with no apparent allegiance to the advertised schedule. Restaurant managers are slightly irritable. The concierge seems weary of tourists and uniformed about events. (I finally found enthusiastic help in the lobby of the Outrigger in Waikiki.) I get the feeling that this property caters mainly to local residents and frequently returning business travelers, kind of like a private club that is somehow obliged to serve the general public. That's a shame because the young people who work here do a beautiful job of making you feel welcome. Funny how little things like that matter so much when you're on vacation far from home.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: First it is FAR from waikiki, have to walk 20 min to catch a bus, trolly or shuttle bus. Second the service is extremely disappointing. Amenities in the room is not complete, i have to ask for a 'do not disturb' sign! Third the hotel is old and need refurbish seriously! The cupboards are at least 20yrs old. The bathroom got mold and old stint!I would definitely not stay in this hotel again!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Hotel has great little beach side restaurant with the rudest staff I have seen in Hawaii. Tried to have lunch there today and I have taken people there for the last 35 years ........but today the hostess was not only rude but insulting, The front desk manager was no help and when I asked to speak to the general manger of the hotel I was told he was on the second floor and to go to the house phone, was the put through only to voice mail. Such a shame but my last trip to,this quaint restaurant because of staff and customer service.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This was our 6th stay at the New Otani and we feel quite at home. The big attractions areSans Souci Beach in front of the hotel, the lovely stroll along the oceanfront to downtown Waikiki and the friendliness of the staff. We stayed in a newly renovated Ocean Waikiki Superior at a special 3 night minimum package which resulted in a nice discount from the published rack rate. Bathrooms are tiny but clean. Evening cocktails on the balcony enjoying the lights of Waikiki were a treat. Daily breakfast at Hau Tree Lanai was a great way to start the day. Don't forget to book in advance, or you'll be in for a wait. Only negative were smokers on adjoining balcony who's second hand smoke regularly drifted our way, causing us to close our balcony door and switch on the air conditioning.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife and i stayed on at the otani for the first leg of hour honeymoon. 4 nights. This is considered a boutique hotel.Positives.Ocean view rooms have great views of waikiki and the water. Really one of a kind for the price. $224/ night. Overnight valet was $23. Valet drivers were quick and attentive and very nice to talk to. Hotel is right on the beach. Sana souci beach is a small private area great for swimming and snorkel and launching kayaks. The waves do not get rough here. No board sports here though. You have to make a short walk down the beach walk to find much surfing and body boarding.
