Come on, where is the value added touches that you could provide?Now the good:This is the quietest hotel I have ever stayed in. I never heard the neighbors above us, or to the sides, the whole time we were there...except when I was on the balcony and they on theirs! Seriously. Fantastic. The room was comfortable. It was small as others have stated, but it had ample storage. There was a built -in chest of drawers with five drawers, a small closet with a shelf. A built in for the refrigerator, which had a drawer above. There were shelves over the sink. There was a cabinet under the sink for your toiletries to be nicely put away, and there was shelving near the bed. So, once the luggage was unpacked, the room was very comfortable for two people, and always seemed tidy because of the fantastic storage. The bed and linens were very comfortable. The maid service turned down our bed every night and put a small flower on the pillow. That was very nice. But, they also straightened up the room, and replaced towels, etc...So, we effectively had maid service twice a day. How cool is that?In my opinion San Souci is the best beach on the Waikiki strip. And, this is evident by the number of locals that were also using it. The beach was sandy, (other parts of Waikiki are rocky). There is a natural reef not far out, so the water is calm, and there is good snorkeling. And, this hotel is right on the beach...so, easy to run to your room for a break, and then right back out.The location of this hotel is also fantastic, (except for the homeless in the park)....I love the fact that the hotel was a 10 minute stroll from the strip. We could enjoy all the restaurants, night-life, shopping, and happenings on the strip, and then quickly retreat to our quiet hotel. What a treat...the best of both worlds. The view was breathtaking, (except for the neglected Natatorium). Lying in bed we looked out over the ocean, and could see part of Waikiki. From other vantage points in the room, you could see the park, and residential areas of the city, etc...It was so cool to observe the happenings of the Waikiki Strip, and at the same time the calm and quiet of the ocean. This is my 4th trip to Honolulu, and at this pricepoint, overall has been the best value for the price. It is not a Lodge of the 4 Seasons, or a "W". But, it is quiet and very clean. It could be exceptional with some more renovations and more personable staff....but, I guess that would change the pricepoint.I will definitely stay here again. And, would definitely recommend this hotel to friends. Albeit, if the walk through the park is a concern to you, I would suggest taking a taxi, which would be a minimal charge from the strip to the hotel....as it is hardly half of a mile in distance.I hope the city works on the Natatorium and the homeless population. And, I hope the hotel works on the staffing and renovations, with these tweeks....it could be a premier location and hotelTip to those visiting Oahu. The Waikiki strip is fantastic...and a lot of fun. But, definitely rent a car and check out the other parts of the island....particularly Lanikai and the North Shore....a whole different vibe, less touristy and pristine beaches. Hike Pali Lookout, and checkout the rainforest hikes....beautiful

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Best value really in honolulu. It has its own intimate setting that separates it from waikiki but still be part of waikiki. A buddy told me about this place and I was skeptical at first but everything about our stay exceeded expectations. Would definitely come back and recommend to friends.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed at the New Otani for our minimoon and it was awesome!! We got a great room with Diamond Head, Kapiolani Park and Ocean Views! The hotel is impeccably clean, the room is not huge but it has space enough for two, luggages and beach stuff. The lanais are great, the bed is comfy. The Loccitane products in the bathroom are a great treat!! =D We live in honolulu, so we got a great deal for kama'aina rate. Besides, we love kaimana beach. And the Miyako restaurant (located in the 2nd floor) is an amazing experience! Definitly would stay again and recommend to everyone.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Beautiful hotel. Close to Zoo and Aquarium. Great snorkeling out front and a good surf break. Really felt like we had our own private beach. Stunning rooms with all the amenities and a dreamy comfy bed. Stayed at a New Otani in Tokyo for 2 months with IBM years ago.... Was the nicest hotel I have have ever stayed at until the Kaimana. This is really a nice hotel. Best part was Tom Forbes at the desk in the lobby. He set us up with boards, golf reservations on a beautiful course and a car rental. Felt like we were dealing with an old friend. Sat for hours talking with him in the lobby. Seemed to know everything worthwhile to do and gave a lot of free advice...and sunscreen ;-)

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Ten years ago we were married on the lanai of this hotel. We just went back for our 10 year anniversary. Service was still attentive, and accommodations were very comfortable. The view is AMAZING. The beach is quiet, and although it's a bit of a walk to downtown Waikiki, it's worth the trade off for a tranquil beach. It's heavenly. Our 3 year old fit in just fine. Hau Tree Lanai is very tasty--try the Eggs Benedict!! It was an excellent vacation, both times we didn't want to leave this paradise!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is not the most luxurious hotel but, very clean and tidy. We upgraded to an ocean view room (you can get it cheaper by requesting it at check in instead of at the time of making the reservation) which was a very nice and clean room. We looked at other rooms and suites which were older and somewhat run down. Staff was very attentive. Room service was quick and food was always very good. Location is great; easy walk to hustle and bustle of Waikiki yet quiet in immediate area of hotel. Beach at hotel is very nice. Hotel has beach amenities such as, towels and chairs, nice outdoor restaurant, and on premise laundry. VERY comfortable beds! There was an $18.00/day fee for parking (pretty typical for Honolulu). I will definitely stay here again... as long as I can get an ocean front room :)

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Just south of crazy Waikiki partying and loudness. Lots of Japanese guest - very respectful and quiet. Rooms are very small, but nice and clean. No coffee pot in room - you have to go down for their minimal free coffee service starting at 6:30 am.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights last year with my 4 year old son. The hotel is located at the end of the main avenue and is quite a walk to the bus stop. It has its own beachfront though and is towards the quieter part of the city. The room was adequate but agree with other reviews that it is outdated. Rooms were clean and bathroom was okay. We had our own veranda too. It was very amusing to see that the hotel staff was majority filipinos. As a filipina, it was nice having them treat my son so well. Hau Tree is a cool place very refreshing place to sit and watch the waves. Breakfast was alright and check out was not a problem. They also have a coin laundry room which might help if you are long staying guests. Right beside the waikiki aquarium.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I researched this book quite a bit on TripAdvisor and other places. This was our first time to Hawaii and we were looking for a quieter place. We were found what we were looking for at the New Otani Kaimana. Upon check in to our room we immediately smelled smoke! The prior occupants had smoked in the room even though the entire place is smoke free. Our bellhop knew this also and called down to get us another room. Upon entering it was great - except it had two double beds! A quick trip to the front desk had us back on our original floor (8 of 9) and upgraded to a Jr. Suite at no charge! We were well pleased. The staff aired out our original room for two days before anyone was put in it. This smaller hotel offered a nice beach that took only a minute to reach from our room vs the other mega-hotels farther down the beach. We walked downtown several times taking only about 10 minutes to get there. Our room rate included breakfast and we were able to order anything on the menu. We were charged any additional amount over the $14 allowed for the "standard" American breakfast, but usually only amounted to a few dollars. We rented a car and the parking ($18/day) cost more than the car did, but we found it very useful. We explored all over and put 350 miles on it in a week. The weather was very windy while we were there, but the Waikiki side of Oahu was well protected. We will definitely return and stay again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Had a great time in this delightful hotel with gracious Haiwaiian charm. It is far enough away to avoid the noise and crowds of Waikiki but you can walk to most of the other hotels if you are able to walk 10 minutes. The restaurants at the hotel were excellent. I will never understand having comforters on a bed in Haiwaii. It is not the place for loud groups. Weddings are very frequent occurence. It has a good beach with lots of families. We will ber back in the fall.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Excellent location with bus transportation very convenient to everywhere on Oahu with a few connections. Daily morning paper, beach towels and mats provided. Just steps from an interesting beach. Staff is young, enthusiastic with positive attitudes; they really tried to make the guests comfortable. Guest laundry facilities available on site. The fact that construction was going on between 9AM to 5PM on our floor was distressing, especially since nobody warned us ahead of time. There was no concierge; there was no clothes drying line in the shower/bath. A screendoor to the balcony would have helped. The San Souci occluded our Diamond Head view; but we had a nice sliver of sightline to see the beach and the ocean. We did appreciate the cleanliness and the attentiveness to our tiny room. We had guests visit us a couple of nights at the hotel; there is no real lobby, just a nice breezeway with little privacy. We got in vehicles and went to Lucy's and had fun; hey, if Lucy's is good enough for our POTUS, we can enjoy it with out guests, too. All in all, for our few days and limited purposes, the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel worked out well. We may want to revisit the place after all of the updates, refurbishing, and construction is completed.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We absolutely LOVED our stay at New Otani. I'm not sure what these other reviews are talking about when they say things like "outdated" or "bad service". Our room was beautiful, albeit small. But the size of the room didn't matter ... we only slept there. We spent most of our time enjoying what Oahu has to offer. If you're going on vacation only to spend time in your room, then go to Wisconsin or something ... don't go to Hawaii.The staff was fabulous! The breakfasts at the Hau Tree were wonderful! Everyone there was friendly and helpful and we had NO surprise charges. For the people saying they were unhappy with the "not previously communicated" parking charges ... the parking charges are listed on New Otani's website, and if you don't want to pay for parking, you can park for free across the street. One thing I would tell people about visiting Honolulu, especially if you've never been: if you rent a car, invest in a GOOD road map and STUDY it before you go. The streets there are nuts ... they change names without warning and many are one way.Also: MAKE SURE YOU VISIT THE NORTH SHORE! Snorkeling is WAY better at Shark's Cove on the North Shore than it is at Haunauma Bay. In Haleiwa, visit Killer Tacos and the North Shore Smoke Shop ... awesome, awesome, awesome. I really want to live there ... I wasn't made for living in a land-locked state! :-(

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We didn't personally book this particular hotel, it came as part of a package. The hotel itself is situated on a beautiful beach just a 10 minute walk from waikiki and its shops. It has a calm and peaceful atmosphere and perfect if your holiday is based on pure relaxation. The rooms, although a little on the small side were kept clean and tidy and provided everything we needed for our stay. The staff were friendly and went out of their way for you. If there was a downside for us personally it would be that there wasn't any entertainment at the hotel at all, out of the 2 weeks we were there I believe there were 2 nights we had a gentleman playing a guitar at the bar and that was it. However, if entertainment isn't an issue then it doesn't matter. Bottom line is if you need something to keep you occupied then you may like to look elsewhere but if you want nothing more than to relax then I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you care about value and location, this is the place to be. Easy 10-minute walk to the edge of Waikiki, with a beautiful (but kinda small) beach right behind the hotel and a lovely park across the street.Note that the hotel is renovating some rooms right now so there is noise during the day on weekdays. We had a pre-renovation room and it was a bit worn and dated (not to mention small), but still clean and quite comfortable.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed at the New Otani in October 2009 - we have been to Waikiki before and stayed at a studio at Island Colony, but this time we were getting married and decided to have a treat for the wedding night and nights leading up to the wedding. We spent ages decided on a beachfront hotel, and then (knowing how noisy Waikiki can be at night) we stumbled across the New Otani and began to get really excited at the prospect of our stay! The New Otani is situated in the shadows of Diamond Head, so is about a 10 minute walk from Waikiki proper which means you're close enough for convenience and far enough away for total relaxation!When we arrived we were checked in quickly and shown up to our room. All the staff throughout the stay were so friendly, from reception staff to wait staff to maids. We booked a deluxe oceanfront room - huge with a wraparound balcony straight on the oceanfront - when we arrive it was about 9pm, and the view of the Waikiki lights was amazing - only topped by our beautiful view when we woke the next morning.The room was quite basic, but everything that we needed was there and nothing was dirty. The service we received prior to arriving was very good as well - booking a hotel from 7000 miles away is not always easy, but I have had a harder time trying to make reservations for work in the hotel down the road - you would never have known they were across the other side of the world considering how easy everything was.I apologise if this sounds over the top, but I can honestly say that there was nothing about the New Otani that I would change - outstanding service, amazing views... who could ask for anything more!!!!(Check out my separate review of the Hau Tree Lanai restaurant - also great btw!!)

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I've been coming to this place for at lest ten years, always get the same room location and have decided that this place is over priced. It is a deluxe corner room with wrap around balcony, the best rooms overlooking the beach and all the lights of Waikiki. All the bed coverings have been the same for 5 years and marks are on everything including the tv unit/dresser which is a form plastic. I paid $370.00 a night when all the other hotels were giving discounts this year. The rooms are tiny.For breakfast the Hau Tree Lanai still have locals coming and the view is wonderful and away from large tourists groups. Weekends make a reservations. The food here is not fantastic at night unless you are the meat and potatoes kind. I have never been to the Japanese restaurant.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I booked a moderate hotelroom and figured i could get it upgraded once I was there since I had heard that sometimes they will upgrade without extra charge. The hoel is smack on the beach, about a 10 minute walk South of Waikiki. If you are a tennis player, which I am, there is a public park with drop-in tennis 2 minutes away. So, all in all, the location is very good.My room was tiny and faced the apartment building next door; I spent a night there and figured that if I spent a week there I would really get depressed, especially since I really prefer a lounge chair on a balcony to a towel on a sandy and lumpy beach ( to rent a beach chair costs extra. I paid $50/ night for an upgrade.Whatever you do - avoid the Juju-Be Spa at the hotel! Although there was a picture of a lady getting a hot stone massage on the photo in the brochure, I was told they "don't do that anymore". My treatment consisted of 15 minutes of waiting to get acknowledged, 10 minutes of having my feet in lukewarm water ( same kind you get at any pedicure shop her in Portland), 15 minutes of "relaxing" - lying there with an Ipod listening to Zen music and the loud talking and running and laughter in the hallway outside ( the walls of the "treatment room" don't reach the ceiling), and, granted, 10 minutes of some kind of facial massage with a lotion,; and they stick a straw in your ear and call it "ear candeling". Not the best way to spend $65+tip.Friendly staff; I didn't eat at the restaurant but it seemed good and was popular; grocery store is a bus ride ( or 20 minute walk) away. Refrigerators supplied in every room, coffee pot on request.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I visited The New Otani Kaimana Beach for a conference. Some good things about the hotel...is that you are on the edge of Waikiki. So, you are separated from the major crowds of tourists but you are close enough to venture in with a 10-15 min walk. You are close to Diamond head as well but without a car it's still a 45 min walk to get into the crater and then do the trail of Diamond head. The beach is nice and not crowded. You have a nice reef right in front of the hotel to snorkel or waves to surf. In general, the rooms were clean and the staff polite. We had a Ocean view...so it's hard to complain too much about the room.Some bad: The rooms are small. I was sharing a room with a friend, so we wound up having to share a king, which was two twins pushed together. Not a big deal if you're just sharing the bed with a friend but I would be annoyed if I was sharing the bed with my husband and you can feel the crack from the two twin beds from being pushed together. The bathroom is small as well and a bit outdated. The showerhead is not that adjustable for positioning between someone tall/short and the pressure is weak. Which is frustrating when you're trying to take a showerfrom being all sandy in the beach. Probably my biggest complaint is that the hotel bar closes at 10pm and they do last call at 9:45pm. That is just ridiculous! Especially when the hotel is hosting your conference. You cannot go down to the bar and have a beer while talking to colleagues. The room for the conference is okay for small speciality groups (max. 100 pple). The screen is small, just a pop-up screen with a stand. So, if you are not in the first coupld of rows it is difficult to see the screen. We had our banquet at the end of the conference and the food was good. The also have two restaurants, neither of which I ate at but the one is right on the beach and looked very nice atmosphere. But I would probably stay here again for a personal vacation (and just make sure my bed isn't two twins) but not for a conference. I'm sorry a bar that has last call at 9:45pm is a deal breaker for me!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Once again to all the staff, Mahalo, Mahalo. The New Otani is our home away from home. 12 wonderful nights. I would never consider staying elsewhere. You are 100%.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed in the park view suite. good size room, useful kitchenette. Hotel provide towels and beach mats for the gorgeous beach out the back - more private than the main beach in Waikiki and calm waters. Breakfasts are excellent! Would definitely recommend it.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: For someone on a budget, I chose this hotel because I got a great rate on it. In the future, I probably will stay elsewhere. For starters, the hotel sign is small and a bit hidden, which is easy to miss if you're unfamiliar with the hotel. I missed it the first time I passed it. I was told that it would be fixed with the big renovation occuring in 2010. Eighteen dollars a night for valet parking is ridiculous. On a side note, had I realized I was as close to downtown Waikiki as I was (about a 15 minute walk), I would not have rented a car. Unless you're going all over the island, you don't need to rent a car. If you don't walk to the downtown area, there's a trolley or buses are available. Back to the hotel. A plus is that the hotel is kept immaculate and you get complimentary beach towels and snorkel gear. On the negative side, my room had two beds, yet the closet was barely large enough for one person's clothes. The internet in the room was another item that was overpriced, causing me to seek out another hotel with much cheaper rates. Beyond the room, some other downsides for me included them allowing dogs on the beach and charging you to use the fitness center. A first. This was my second visit to Oahu, and being alone and on a budget, this is not a hotel I can recommend.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: i just looked out the window and its snowing and -23 yuk(calgary)WOW,what a holiday,everything was fantastic,the room,the service,the valet parking,the food,i can't really say one negative thing about our stay,the front desk staff even printed out our boarding passes,so we would not have to pay,on one of those pay computers.Would we do the whole trip over again??YES,would not even think twice.I would like to thank all the wonderful people we met,that made our stay in paradise,a trip of a life time.,,,Mahalo,,,,Aloha,

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I have just returned from a week’s stay at the New Otani Hotel. For me, a solo traveler in need of rest and renewal, it was a perfect choice. I wanted a spectacular view of both the ocean and of the Honolulu shoreline. I wanted to be surrounded by green grass, palms and grand old tropical shade trees. I wanted a clean and beautiful beach at my front door and peaceful walking paths at the back. I wanted to dine on a shady veranda anytime I felt like it. I wanted prompt service and a warm welcome from every staff member. And I wanted a beautiful, quiet room with a generous balcony and a comfortable bed from which I could see both the city and the mountain lights. Especially, I wanted access to Waikiki without being in the midst of its noise and revelry. Got it all. Will return. Will bring family. This place is a little treasure. Opt for a deluxe ocean view room if possible.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for our honeymoon. We were able to get a 50% off rate because of the 50 year statehood celebration and occupied the Otani suite at the top of the hotel. The views are simply breathtaking. Being somewhat out of waikiki, you have a great skyline view, as well as an unobstructed view of diamond head. Many nights we just stayed on our balcony to watch the sun set. Our room was big and great, but again, this was their most expensive room so I do not know about the others. The private beach is fantastic, the free towel and beachmat service was appreciated. The valet parking was expensive, but it at least guaranteed a parking space, something very treasured in waikiki. It is about a 15 minute walk to waikiki proper. At night the route through the park to get there is not lit and made me feel very uncomfortable. There are two restaurants, but because we liked the downstairs one, right on the beach, so much we never made it to the Japanese place. Overall, a great hotel, but try to get a deal.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is pleasant, and very affordable for Waikiki. We booked a room with a view of Diamond Head (the "cheap" rooms, which was a truly stunning view. The room was smallish, but very clean and comfortable. My only problem with the stay was the poor service we received on check-in, when we tried to confirm that we were getting a king or queen. The staffer at the desk basically ignored our inquiry and gave us a room with two twins, which we did not discover until we opened the door to the room. Apparently they had no more Diamond Head rooms w/larger beds, and would not give us the correct bed size in another section because they did not want to upgrade us. This is a huge issue for me. Perhaps I'm unreasonable, but when I reserve a queen or king, I expect it to be there. We had to wait while they sent up housekeeping staff to push the beds together and re-make the bed. The lack of communication and professionalism by the front desk clerk turned the beginning of the one night stay into a very unpleasant experience. Too bad, because it should be a nice experience.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: After much research on Trip Advisor, we chose this great hotel in an equally great location at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki Beach. They have their own beach - San Souci Beach - for swimming, snorkeling and just playing in the water and sitting on the sand. Their restaurant, the Hau Tree Lanai, is outstanding. We had breakfast there every morning of our 5 night stay and wish we could be there again right now! It was difficult to leave and hope we can return some day. Our advice would be to book an ocean view or ocean front room. We chose the ocean view junior suite which gave us views of Honolulu as well as Diamond Head via a wrap around lanai. It is truly a million dollar view! This will be our first choice if we ever return to Honolulu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed at this Hotel for two nights prior to going on a cruise from Honolulu. It cost us less than $100 per night and it was very nice. When we arrived they upgraded us to a room with a kitchenette and it overlooked the park next door with a view of the beach beyond that. The room was very clean and comfortable, even included a complimentary 1/4 pineapple already prepared in the fridge. The bathroom was clean, the shower worked great. The bed was comfortable - a big king-size. The restaurant was a little pricey but the food was very good. The only complaint I have about the room was that it was on the third floor of the older building and there wasn't an elevator so you had to climb the stairs. Get a porter to bring up your bags. The hotel is away from the busy part of Waikiki but close enough you can walk in about 15 minutes if you want to. It is right on the beach at the far end of Waikiki Beach. Would definitely stay here again if ever back in Honolulu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Our annual trip to Honolulu at the New Otani did not disappoint; we love the location of this hotel, the friendliness of the staff and the way you feel like part of the neighborhood (one I wish I could afford!). The hotel is completing it's room upgrades and everything looks great. The restaurant seemed busier than normal but the food and totally awesome location are as good as ever.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel and loved it. We did some research using this site and wanted to stay away from the noise and crowds of Waikiki. It is perfect hotel for those who want to be close to the main drag of Waikiki but far enough to be quite when your relaxing. and the walking to Waikiki and the walk from hotel to top of Diamond head will burn off all the food you can consume -- so eat up and walk where you want to go.We had use of the beach just out side the hotel and the park next to it was nice as well. Note try snorkeling on hotel beach I saw plenty of cool looking fish right there.We ate at the restaurants there several times and love the location. The staff was helpful whenever we needed them to be ... the last three nights we upgraded to an ocean view and it was wonderful and I recommend .All I can say is do a little research here on trip advisor and you will get plenty of tips if you decide to stay here.Here are my tips #1 stay at the New Otani and get an ocean view ... ask for free upgrade and be nice about it... beggars can't be choosers.#2 we used Jays limo for transportation to and from airport. $50.00 each way plus tip and go ahead and spring for fresh cut lei upon arrival. It is a little more than taxi but hey it is cool and spacious and the way to arrive and depart.#3 Take the shuttle to other sites like Hamana Bay and Pearl Harbor. Concierge there at hotel can make all the arrangements about $16.00 per person per trip#4 rent a car and go to north shore and Jump off the rock at beach and go and spend the morning at sunset beach ... then try shrimp trucks and have a shaved ice cone.#4 eat breakfast at Hotel restaurants #5 to relax and just unwind close to hotel ... Check out LULU'S good food and drinks and good live music too#6 My wife and I enjoyed two meals at the Hula Grill above Dukes in Waikiki... get there about 5;30 pm =Wait for a table along the rail and set and eat dinner while watching the sun set from an out standing location.Food is in large quantities so maybe share an Meal and leave room for huge desert portions.#6 If you want to try something different and like food take the Hole in the wall tour one of your first days.#7 from hotel walk to top of Diamond head 45 minutes to inside crater and 30 minute hike to top do it in the morning and it is a good hike and great view... there are taxis that will take you or bring you back but you still have to hike to top ... water and tennis shoes only if you are smart?#8 Don't try to do too much just relax and sit on beaches till you get sun burned than do out and eat well... repeat this often and have fun.#7 We like this end of the Island and would recommend this hotel and location.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My spouse and I arrived in Honolulu on a Friday evening. We were absolutely thrilled to be visiting the islands and had planned quite the gauntlet for the days that followed our stay in Oahu. We traveled to four individual islands during our trip, begining with our stay at The "New" Otani near Waikiki. The hotel's location wasn't bad, it was a few miles down from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, nestled right under Diamond Head crater. I wasn't too thrilled with the $18 per day parking charge that was not communicated prior to the stay, but whatever, parking fees do not really surprise me these days. My issue with this hotel is their absolute lack of customer service and the unbelievable extreme to which this hotel is mis-managed. They mistakenly upgraded our room. There was no communication of this as the bill that was signed when we checked in had the original fee listed with our reservation. We inquired upon this with a phone call after we made it to the room. We were not told anything, in fact, the receptionist said, "I have no idea what you are talking about, I'm sorry.". Terrible.The hotel itself was decent. I would not stay there again. The room we were in must have been one of the nicest in the hotel (the ridiculous charge that I will get to in a second), and that is not saying much. In a way, I'm happy they screwed up because I would have probably been shocked had I been forced to stay in any other accomodations. That said, the hotel is away from the crowds of Waikiki, so that is one positive thing. But I really take nothing positive away from our stay due to the ridiculous error made on their side regarding our reservation. We were called on the day we were to check-out by some lady claiming to have just returned from vacation. She said she had reviewed our bill and needed to add some charges. These charges totalled $1,500. I kid you not. There was no effort by their staff, management, ownership to remedy or rectify anything. They illegally charged the account without signature or allowance to do so, and when called about it - they did not budge. Absolutely stay away from these thieves. There are nicer places to stay anyways. A confirmation and your initial signature means nothing to this hotel - they charge you as they please. Be warned!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The location is perfect: the hotel is far enough from Waikiki to get a good night's sleep but still within walking distance to take advantage of all it offers and the walk to Waikiki was scenic and fun. It was so quiet and peaceful at this hotel. This hotel is lovely, very pretty and clean. It is on Sans Souci beach, a small, quiet beach at the doorstep of the hotel. The staff is consistently sweet and helpful. They give you beach mats and fresh beach towels every day. The Hotel has a convenience store on hand which came in really handy for things we forgot to pack. The on-site Hau Tree Restaurant is an island institution that rivals any beach-side setting, dinner was delicious: here you'll find a fantastic restaurant right on the beach and feel the ocean breeze as you dine on excellent food and tropical drinks. The food here is amazing, especially the fish and seafood. We opted for a Ocean View Deluxe Room but they upgraded us for free to a Ocean Front Room. The private lanai stretched the entire length of the room and turned the corner to extend along the other side, so there was a complete ocean view, and then a view of the city lights the other way. The view was spectacular, we could see and hear the ocean all night, look at the glittering skyline of Honolulu, and enjoy the park scenes.I would recommend this hotel highly.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We enjoyed our stay and moved to a room with a view of Diamond Head, which was much better than our original location! The hotel is older but the history supports the ambiance--overall, cool place, great location and very accomodating staff

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: It was just a short walk from Waikiki but the hotel was very quiet and nice. Having a beach right outside the hotel was another great part of the stay. And the restaurant's food was delicious!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Overall satisfied! Just a quick note Hotel is a good, location is good, but wait till you see their Asian style, No privacy bathroom doors. Imaging your partner had a bad upset stomach. You are going to here it All.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We are returning kama'aina (locals) who for years hosted visitors at my house in Kaimuki, who often coupled it with business stays at most of the Waikiki hotels. So since relocating to the mainland east coast, we now get back to friends and family at least a couple times a year and have stayed recently at several places from the higher end Outrigger Reef, Moana Surfrider, and Hawaiian Village, to the trendy boutique newbies like Renew and Wyland (now Courtyard) referred by our circle. But this was our first stint at the New Otani, which a gal pal from Seattle had tipped me about several years ago....(Mahalo Jo!)The positive T/A reviews are spot-on regarding room layouts, decor, amenities, and overall property condition but in the end, staying here is all about choice. If you are looking for a pool scene, nite-life, mega-resort activities, or beach-service pampering, this will not suit your needs. But if your druthers are hassle-free and relaxing aloha nestled on one of Oahu's best locals beach, that's just far enough away from the Waikiki din, you will find hard pressed to top the value this next-to-million-dollar-plus-Gold Coast Condo row brings....One of the best things about the hotel is the multiple options for accommodations at every price point from simple no-frills quarters to high-end suites. We opted for a Diamond Head Room, mainly because living size was larger in that price range and the cooling trade winds front that side of the hotel. The room was listed at 315 SF, which in Hawaii counts the outside covered lanai (deck), where we spent virtually every early morning having coffee in sun-splashed cool breezes, mesmerized by an unparalled view of Diamond Head. And yes the living space is tight--er, cozy as they say in positive speak--- but the window bank sliding door and a smartly placed mirror wall gave the room a more spacious feel, which seemed to get even bigger as the week progressed. TIP: ask for a higher floor on the Diamond Head side so your view of Kapiolani Park is not obstructed by trees.Otherwise the walk to Waikiki action is about 20 mins.....Kapiolani Park is what any major city park balances in terms of challenges, but in the four years I lived here and the many times I have visited, I don't have any negative experiences to share.....and the Gold Coast is indeed the sweet spot on the island, especially Kaimana Beach, which has a sandy shore break so you won't need deal with foot coverings for rocky shoal. TIP: while towels and beach mats are free at the bell desk, head to Longs in nearby Kaimuki and for about $15 you can buy a decent beach chair.The on-site Hau Tree Restaurant is an island institution that rivals any beach-side setting, as does Miyako, the Japanese restaurant above which offers exquisite outdoor tatami dining perched over the soothing sounds of rolling surf. Note service stops before 9PM so you'll need look for late nite fanfare elsewhere. TIP: the adjoining bar shares the kitchen with the former and offers more reasonably priced pupus (small plates).Some of the minuses....our split system A/C did have an occasional drip, half the satellite tv stations were on the fritz, both the WiFi and ethernet connectivity was very poor and pricey, the queen bed is actually two full beds cluged together ala an "european matrimonial" configuration, and the hotel is showing its 60 year age upon closer inspection, i.e., fraying wall paper, slow sink drains, etc.Bottom-line: for thirtysomething-and-up no-frills couples who love the beach, are sans kids, and prefer a residential park-like setting to the usual resort-strip feel, this deserves a hard look. TIP: A Hawaii Statehood 50% discount special may still be running.....if so, opt for the Queen Kapiolani or New Otani suite at slightly more than a regular room rate.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is far enough away from Waikiki beach to be nice and quiet but is walking distance to several attractions. There is a great park across the street with street parking that will save you $18 per night. The Hau Tree restaurant is amazing for all meals. The only minor issue I had was the beds. I requested a Queen and they wanted to push to twins together. The pad wasn't that comfy and being a bit shorter than a Queen I asked for another room. They moved us to a room with a real Queen bed and we were very happy. This is a great hotel but call ahead and make sure you have a real Queen bed if you get a "moderate" room.Haunauma beach is just down the road. The hotel will give you towels and mats for the beach each day. Several great restaurans (Ono's, Leonard's) are just north on Kapahulu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you want to be in civilization, but also amid natural beauty and tranquility, this is the place. The palm trees of Kapiolani Park are right outside your balcony and Waikiki makes a dramatic view in the distance. The park is a huge source of entertainment in itself as there is always something interesting going on there. You can watch outrigger canoes and stand up paddlers in the water.There is a slight retro feel to the hotel, which gives you some sense of being in Hawaii at midcentury. The hotel hits all the important targets for me, and none of the superfluous ones. You will not miss a pool. Breakfast on the beach was a highlight of our trip.The staff is consistently sweet and helpful. They give you beach mats and fresh beach towels every day. For small fees, you can rent chairs, umbrellas, boogie boards, and snorkeling equipment.The food is wonderful and there is always at least a limited menu available, until 9pm. The concierge is very helpful.I recommend staying in the corner rooms 517, 617, or 717. These rooms have a view both out to sea and down the coast to Waikiki. You can lie on your bed and look straight out at the dramatic view. If you want a slightly smaller, more inexpensive room, I would get the Waikiki view, as there is more glare from the ocean view and you will not be able to look out that way all the time.It is really nice to come in from your adventures and sit in the open air bar with a drink, and your kids are welcome there.On Monserrat, there is a great "plate lunch" place, the Diamond Head Market and Grill. Great quality, very healthy. That can really help keep your food bills down.If you are moderately fit, you can walk to Queen's Surf, the best beginners' body boarding beach. Or, park in the Zoo parking lot on Kapahulu.I would suggest bringing a large umbrella that will stay put. That's the only thing missing.One last tip: Get a massage from Yuko in the Jujube spa. She has magic hands and the Japanese style spa is fun and different.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: What a perfect location for my first trip to Hawaii. This hotel is lovely, very pretty and clean, nicely decorated but modest (no pool, no Prada, just a little grocery store, hair salon and one beach boutique shop). The staff are great, dinner was delicious (if a bit pricey), in the loveliest location on Waikiki. It is on Sans Souci beach, a small, quiet beach at the doorstep of the hotel. With a wonderful park right across the street, aquarium, zoo (at the other end of the park), and small botanical garden. I took a ten minute stroll along the water and the park to Starbucks in the main Waikiki area every morning, returning to sit on a park bench, looking over the water, seeing more than one rainbow, and enjoying the surfers and picnic-ers as they arrived. The view from my ocean view (not ocean front) room was spectacular--I could see and hear the ocean all night, look at the glittering skyline of Honolulu, and enjoy the park scenes. If I closed the sliding glass door it was also very quiet (if noise of ocean or weekend fireworks bothers you).

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani is just far enough away from the bustle of Waikiki to allow yourself to relax and find plenty of room on the beach to stretch out. This is definitely the quieter end of a very lovely beach.We arrived from an early flight and were thrilled to find we were able to check in early. We booked the cheapest room category available which was about $150 i think - and yet we still had pretty good views of the ocean from the balcony, looking right. This was room # 323 and if you don't mind a slightly smaller room than some of the other categories then this is well worth your money.We had dinner at the Hua Tree restaurant and it was delicious. I also recommend the very yummy Mai Tai's they make. Watching the sun set capped off a lovely lazy day of not much more than paddling in the turquoise waters a few metres away. The staff at the restaurant here were unbelievable - so very attentive and courteous and just lovely.Room service was very expensive but there's a little corner store attached to the hotel which is a much better option for a meal or a snack. The high cost of room service is the only thing I can think of to knock points off!The front desk staff were very helpful and had some great suggestions for dinner. We walked to the Tiki Restaurant, 10 mins down the beach. There are 2 restaurants here in one building and we chose the cheaper of the two as we could sit al fresco and watch the sun set. The ribs were boneless and the best meal of our holiday.Back to the hotel I can't think of a better place to relax in Waikiki and have a bit of breathing space from the bustle of it all. Beach towels are also available for free from reception.If we were to stay at Waikiki again I would not hesitate in booking us in here again, it was outstanding. This hotel has a real charm about it.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Jogging early in the a.m. followed by Island exploration the rest of the day was our routine this time on Oahu. The location was far enough from Waikiki to get a good night's sleep but still within walking distance to take advantage of all it offers. The rooms were kind of small but we were not spending alot of time in them. The staff were always kind and helpful. The view was toward Eva Beach so we had great sunsets. Nothing but good to say about this place.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We arrived on May 30 and stayed till June 6th and had a great time! Everyone is so friendly there and that helps when you're first time travelers and women traveling alone at that. They made us feel so welcomed and took care of our every need while there. We ate at the Hotel restaurant for breakfast each day and by the second day they remembered us by name which was a great feeling! We felt like family! Hedy was our favorite waitress and she hugged us goodbye when we left. Marrissa was our housekeeper and was fabulous and so friendly. Everyone at the front desk and the travel desk (Tom and Joy) treated us kindly and we never felt like we were anything but valued guests. It was a wonderful experience and I would recommend this hotel highly.It was a little off the beaten path but close enough to enjoy everything the city has to offer. We took the bus #2 to downtown several times with the hotel's maps and instructions and totally enjoyed it. The Hotel has a convenience store on hand which came in really handy for things we forgot to pack. If you are looking for a great place to stay with a very personal touch than this hotel is for you! Our room was lovely and the view was to die for. We stayed in the Ocean View room with plans to upgrade to ocean front if the view wasn't good and the view was perfect!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We came here on the advice of a family member who had been to the Hau Tree Restaurant for lunch, and we were very glad we did. The hotel is perfect for those who don't want to be on the "main drag" of Waikiki and are happy not to be seduced every five minutes by shopping at expensive stores for designer labels. Here, you'll find a fantastic restaurant right on the beach and feel the ocean breeze as you dine on excellent food and tropical drinks. We especially enjoyed our breakfasts and recommend getting the package that includes them. You'll eat here among many locals who come here for a good dinner or a business lunch. We chose the Diamond Head view room but upgraded for our last two days (we were here for four) to an ocean view suite, which was fantastic. Nothing wrong with the Diamond Head room, except that it is quite small and we wanted a bit more space. The upgrade was worth it and we highly recommend it if it fits your budget. (Unlike others on this site, we weren't able to get the upgrade without paying for it -- despite the poor economy, the hotel was quite booked!) We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good beach location that isn't part of the Waikiki "scene." It'd definitely what we'd classify as a "hidden gem." If we return to Honolulu, this is the only place we'll consider staying.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel was great. The price was fair and its ocean front with a beautiful beach. The hotel is outside the Waikiki area (only a 3 block walk/10 minutes) but we loved it. If you stay in Waikiki, you have the noisy night crowd late into the night and early in the morning. It was so quiet and peaceful at this hotel and the walk to Waikiki was scenic and fun. The staff was extremely helpful and very kind and accommodating. We followed our trip from here to Maui and stayed in a more expensive, higher star hotel there (Royal Lahaina Resort) and found the New Otani to be our favorite among the two. We got better treatment here then in the other hotel. Price was hard to beat and the only reason this hotel got 4 stars instead of 5 was because the room was on the smaller side. But at the end of the day, who is in their room long anyway when you're in Hawaii?

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you want to get away from Waikiki, that is the one. Of course you have to walk 10 minutes whenever you want anything. Even though they have very good dining and room service right there. The beach is nice but more windy then in Waikiki. The price for the room is a real deal but you have to pay for everything else extra: beach chairs, parking, internet.We recommend to get a cozy hotel on the north shore and just come down one night to visit Waikiki, that much more romantic.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This was my second stay (the first was 9 years ago), and the place has only improved over time. The location is perfect because it is away from the craziness of Waikiki, and it is nestled between the ocean and beautiful Kapiolani Park, walking distance to the Zoo and Aquarium, and with gorgeous unobstructed ocean views. I had booked an ocean view room for $315 but was unexpectedly upgraded to the Waikiki Suite on the top floor. It was a huge suite with two bathrooms, two closets, a living room, a wet bar and sitting area (for eating), and a separate bedroom. The private lanai stretched the entire length of the suite and turned the corner to extend along the other side, so there was a complete ocean view, and then a view of the city lights the other way. This must be the best suite in the hotel. Not everyone will get to stay in this suite, but it was a fantastic treat. The hotel is clean, beautifully decorated, and has the Hau Tree Lanai restaurant, which joins the sand and has beautiful entwined hau trees for shelter. The food here is amazing, especially the fish and seafood, which I ate at all four meals I had. Room service was prompt and food was hot. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. The general manager, Jean-Paul, was onsite and generous. I would never stay anywhere else.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I arrived at the New Otani on April 5, 2009. Right away we were greeted by the very friendly ladies at the front desk. We had asked about an upgrade to an ocean view room and was told it would be an additional $50.00 a night. We were glad to accept the offer because we had called just before leaving for our trip and was told it would be an additional $160.00 a night. We had already found the hotel at $135/night on hotels.com, so we were excited to have the upgrade for $50/night. We accepted and told the receptionist about our horrible experience in Atlanta where our plane was delayed 4 hours due to a fuel leak and we spent 13 hours on the plane. She kindly upgraded us again for the same price to an Ocean View Deluxe which is considerably larger than the regular Ocean View. You can check out the rooms and sizes on their website. The staff was very friendly and our room was cleaned twice a day. We did not get to experience the fresh pineapple in the fridge as some reviews stated. I'm assuming because we did the upgrade at the last minute which we were ok with. The view was absolutely beautiful and worth the extra $$$. The room was very clean. Some fraying of the wallpaper in the bathroom but nothing serious. The hotel was very quitet and we never heard anyone in neighboring rooms. We slept with the lanai door open every night. The walk into town from our hotel was about 15-20 mins depending on how fast you walk. My husband and I did not mind the walk, as we saved a bunch on not renting a car. The Ala Moana shopping center is a little farther than we cared to walk, but most of the stores at that center are in town as well anyway. You can get a bus route information sheet at the hotel if you care to take the bus. It's $2.00/person I believe. We never quite figured out the trolley system, but that is a means of transportation as well. I think the pink trolley takes you to Ala Moana Center. If you're up for a walk, we recommend Diamond Head Crater, which is only $1.00 admission. We walked from the hotel but took a taxi back for about $10.00 We took two tours which picked us up at the hotel and dropped us back off. Pearl Harbor and Big Island Circle tour. If you don't mind spending the extra money we also recommend taking a taxi to the hotel from the airport and back. It's around $35-$40. We made the mistake and took the shuttle which was $9, but we spent another hour on the shuttle. We were dropped off last because the New Otani is away from town and all the big hotels and restaurants and shops. There were homeless people in the park across the street and under the picnic shelters in town but they never approached us and seemed to just stay to themselves. There are street performances each night. The best one is Basketball Man and I can't quite remember where he sets his show up, it is somewhere on the main street, Kalakaua Ave., and he is really worth watching. They come out just as it starts to get dark. We recommend The Shack for lunch or dinner which is quite a stroll from the New Otani, but totally worth it. Go before 8:00 p.m. though or you get charged a $10.00 cover charge because they have a band. The food and service are excellent. Cheeseburger in Paradise has good food too. We will definitley return for another wonderful vacation !!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel is a wonderful little gem away from the packed high rise towers of Waikiki proper. It's only about six stories high and perfect for a solo traveler or couple who want a clean quiet comfortable atmosphere at a reasonable price. The "Moderate" rooms are smaller than the typical American hotel room but I spent most of my time on the beach or enjoying local attractions and the nightlife in the area so I didn't really miss anything. My room was on the Diamond Head side but I could see the beach from my balcony and best of all, hear it at night. What a great way to get to sleep!The hotel staff is wonderful, espeically the restaurant and bar staff. The food is incredible and highly recommended. Plus, you can't beat the beachfront location!!After having stayed here I can't imagine staying at anyone of the mega-hotels in Waikiki on my next trip.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Our stay at the New Otami involved two seperate nights, one before a cruise around the Hawaiian islands, and one night after. The hotel is located near San Sousis Beach, about 10-15 mins walk away from Waikiki. Had we had more time it would have been nice to enjoy the peace and quiet near the hotel. However, since we had limited time a more central hotel would probably have been more convenient. We arrived late in the evening at around 10. We were tired after the long flight and very hungry. Unfortunately, the hotel restaurant had already closed and we did not have the energy to walk and find a restaurant. Therefore we had to go to sleep on an empty stomach. Thankfully we found some pineapple waiting for us in the fridge. :)Our room was upgraded to an ocean view room which was a pleasant surprise. We couldn't see much in the evening of course but when we woke up in the morning the view was spectacular. The room was comfortable although not very big. We ordered room service for breakfast to enjoy the view from our balcony. The food was good although not very filling (considering we were still hungry from the previous night) and quite expensive. When we came back to the hotel after the cruise, the room was the same size but not with the same view. We were on the other side with a partial view of Diamond Head. The staff are very helpful and friendly. They stored our luggage for us the last day after we checked out so we could go around Oahu before our flight.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We actually stayed in Waikiki twice during our trip. the first time here and the second time at the Wyland Waikiki. The new Otani is on the beach and the rooms are OK. It's nice being able to walk out of the hotel and right onto the beach, and a relatively quiet beach at that. The staff is friendly and helpful. I would stay here again for a moderately priced beach front hotel. It is not a far walk to main part of Waikiki beach. Now the second time, we were at the Wyland Waikiki hotel located closed to the International Market. Not that the International Market place is that great (lots of souvenir junk) but it's a good location for a downtown setting. Restaurants and other shops are close by. The beach is about 2 blocks away and easy to find. We found the Wyland way more updated. Friendly staff, very clean hotel and very comfortable beds. Oh yeah, the bed at the New Otani was very firm. The Wyland offered more amenities (like free internet) at much lower price per night. Pool and hot tub were nice. New Otani no pool or hot tub. It's nice being next to a beach but Wyland sure made it easy to compete with the New Otani. Overall, I would prefer to stay at the Wyland because 1) cost 2)location 3)amenities 4)newness.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife and I visited the Kaimana Beach Hotel for the first time in 1978. We've returned to the islands every year since then, each time staying with our friends at The Kaimana Beach Hotel. By friends, I mean the staff who treat their visitors as though they're part of the family... the aloha here is real, not the corporate, tourist version The hotel, located on Sans Souci Beach, is a short walk to Waikiki, but far from the craziness. This is like old Hawaii, slower paced and relaxed.The rooms, while on the small side, are more than adequate. We usually stay in the Ocean Front deluxe suite, which affords panoramic views of the blue Pacific and Waikiki Beach. At night, the view of Waikiki is amazing.Because the hotel is far from the noise of Waikiki, we're able to sleep with the huge sliding glass door open and listen to the surf all night.The Hau Tree Restaurant is a hidden gem. The food is wonderful, particularly the Macadamia Nut French Toast for breakfast... it's way mobetta and the view can't be beat.I highly recommend the hotel for those seeking a slower paced vacation. The Kaimana Beach is not a full blown, resort style destination... it's more kama aina in nature.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for a second time due to the location. We really like the Waikiki area, but not all the comotion on the beach. We walked to and climbed Diamond Head and walked to Waikiki Beach each day. The hotel is getting dated but is in good condition. The included breakfast was a great way to start the day. Wish we would have stayed on this island (and at this hotel) an extra day or two.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The Pros: Private Beach, open air lobby and garden, helpful staff, gorgeous public bathrooms downstairs easily accesible from beach, clean sheets, L'Occitane toiletries, double rolls of T.P. (A plus when there's two girls in the room and you don't want room serviced during your trip :), flat screen T.V. with many channels, next to a parklike setting, near the quieter end of town, the bar does KILLER pupu (snacks) like pineapple shrimp and beef skewers (and you can order from the Hau Tree restaurant at the bar), only 1/2 mile from the South Seas Grill (Diamond Head grill to the locals) VERY GOOD FOOD for GREAT prices, clean towels and beach towels, in-room safe, directly adjacent to Russels a super-stocked convenience store, directly adjacent to da'Kappa coffee and sandwich and shaved ice shop, 8 minute amble to Waikiki beach proper (and I mean amble.. through a beautiful park and boardwalk area) if you walked faster you could be there in 5-6 minutes.Cons: (some more of a nuisance than others) Shoebox rooms, bathroom "doors" are sliding shutters that block no sounds and there is no bathroom fan to mask noises, trash trucks and laundry start crashing around at 6am on that end of Waikiki, so if you're sleeping with your slider door cracked for air... good morning!, shower diverter didn't catch completely so water pressure was reduced, wallpaper dated and frayed a little, TINY closet, no coffee/tea hotpots in each room (but brought up promptly when we asked for it), an old half of pineapple was in our fridge when we checked in. No pool but the ocean is very calm because it has breakwaters on either side of the San Souci beach.But I must say I'd rather like staying here again if I could get a good price. The good definitely outweighed the bad. Bring earplugs. The walls are thin and you'll hear people banging their doors each time they come and go. If you're looking for luxury, this isn't it. If you're looking for charm and beautiful views, and the sweetness of having your own little slice of beach, this is the place for you.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: It's been a while since we were there, but I would love to go back! It was absolutely perfect, especially if you want it all, but maybe can't afford the 5-star hotels. We stayed in one of the Ocean Front Deluxe rooms - they're corner rooms with an amazing view of the ocean and downtown Honolulu. I was so glad that we were directly on the beach (San Souci) without being in the middle of Waikiki. At night, we were away from all the ambient lights that can spoil the view if you're in the middle of all the high rise hotels. It was just beautiful; the air was soft and velvety and we were there during a full moon, so it looked like a postcard at night! The furnishings weren't fancy, but they were pretty and clean, and seriously, you won't care because the minute you walk inside, you'll be enthralled by the view outside!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I received excellent rates on a "Moderate" room on the Diamond Head side at the New Otani. The sixth floor room was very clean and adequately appointed. New bedding and carpet, dated (but well-cared-for) furniture. It was definitely a basic and small room, but that is what we paid for and we weren't in Hawaii to sit inside all day. Every member of the staff we encountered was extremely welcoming and provided excellent service throughout our eight day stay. For us the location of this hotel was perfect. The beach is so quiet and beautiful, not packed like Waikiki. We were close enough to Waikiki and the touristy area of Honolulu that we could easily walk (5-10 minutes) to that area when we were interested. The hotel is next to the Aquarium and walking distance to the Zoo. Close driving distance to Diamond Head. Like any hotel, there were a few minor annoyances: when the water in the next room was turned on to a certain level there was a pitchy noise (usually neighbor quickly adjusted the water, so no problem). Our room was six floors above the back of the restaurant, which was kept clean, but was loud in the morning. The electronic room keys required patience and, occasionally wouldn't work on the locks. The staff would cheerfully make us new room keys. The cost to use the internet was, if I remember correctly, $11/day or $55/for a week. The cost to use the valet parking lot was $18/day. None of these issues would prevent me from staying at the New Otani again.Tips: If you want to forego the valet charges, there is definitely parking on the street, outside of the hotel but I did not want the inconvenience of searching for a spot. Also, we used the free internet at the nearby Safeway.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife did all of the homework in selecting which hotels to stay at. She narrowed it down to two hotels, this one and the up market Royal Hawaiian hotel (aka Pink Palace). As it was our first visit to Hawaii, we opted for the Royal Hawaiian Hotel for a touch of luxury at $530 plus tax sea view room per night. After a wonderful week staying at the Aloha Pualani Hotel (a real gem) in Kihei, we moved into the Royal Hawaiian and were stunned because the renovations were still being completed and the noise was pretty horrendous. Our room was nice, but certainly not worth $530 a night plus tax. The hotel was very good in understanding that our needs were not being met and we decided to move out and go to our original second choice the New Otani at the other end of Waikiki.On first impressions you could see that this was a different class, we were smoothly checked in, after booking direct on Expedia two hours earlier, we paid $935 for three nights in a deluxe Ocean view room.The rooms are okay, and in reality they could do with a bit of a face lift, but, once they do that I can see the prices going up considerably. The previous review from walkoutdoors1997 pretty well summed up our experience.For some the walk into Waikiki might be a bit far, but it was not for my wife and myself, who could worry about walking along the beach at Waikiki, there are much worse walks in life. It only takes about ten minutes before you start getting to the shopping area, and if its that big a deal, take a Taxi or pay a couple of hundred bucks extra a night and stay in the centre of Waikiki.The beach in front of the hotel is excellent, even on a busy sunny Sunday, there was plenty of room (my pictures were taken on a Sunday).We ate at the wonderful Hau Tree Lanai restaurant one evening, its great food, and very healthy compared to many of the restaurants in Waikiki, we paid about $100 for two main courses (fish) and a bottle of wine, which was okay. We also ate at the Japanese restaurant upstairs, which was excellent too, great Sushi.Just to agree once again with walkoutdoors1997, we did notice the homeless people near to the Aquarium, and its true that they did not bother us at all, during the three days we stayed at the New Otani, so dont let that put you off.In general the hotel is very good, the staff are well trained and the food quality is exceptional. If we ever stayed on Waikik again, I would not hesitate to use this hotel again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: New Otani is not going to be a 5-Star Experience or anything like that but it is a good value for being on the Beach and this close to the Zoo, Aquarium, Diamond Head and Waikiki. If looking for a good vaule, this migh be your place

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We recently stayed four nights at the New Otani on our first ever visit to Hawaii. If you are looking for the party scene or a mega resort experience, don't stay at the New Otani. But if you seek a small hotel with a quiet setting on the beach, this place is for you. Our Junior Oceanfront Suite was compact but very well-fitted and attractively decorated. It was comprised of two rooms - a sitting area and a sleeping area - separated by sliding louvered doors. Both spaces opened onto the large balcony with sliding glass doors.The bathroom was relatively large and featured both a bathtub with handheld shower and a separate glass shower cabinet. The vanity was in an alcove off of the sleeping area.The hotel is an enjoyable ten minute walk along the beachfront boardwalk from the edge of Waikiki. Staff throughout the hotel and in the Hau Tree Restaurant were friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the New Otani along with 13 guests for our wedding trip at the beginning of December. My parents and I had stayed at the New Otani during a previous visit to Oahu, so we were familiar with the location and hotel. We knew it would be the perfect place for our guests to stay as well as for our reception.From the beginning, we told our guests that the rooms would be small. When my parents and I stayed at the New Otani a few years ago, we had an oceanview room with a cot crammed into it. It was not a pleasant experience. This time around, we informed all of our guests that the rooms would be small but that it was an oceanfront boutique hotel at an affordable price. We had a variety of rooms at all price levels--the majority of our guests were in Moderate rooms, but a few had Oceanview or Diamond Head view rooms. My husband and I had an Ocean Front (317) room, and my parents were upgraded to an Ocean Front Junior Suite (718) room. All of the rooms were impeccably kept. The chilled pineapple in the fridge upon arrival was the perfect touch.I agree with previous posts regarding palm trees obscuring views. If you want a view, request a room on a high floor. We had a wrap-around balcony that had a great view of the ocean as well as a very good view of Waikiki. It was partially obscured by the palm trees, but I'm scared of heights and refused to have a higher room. Our view was wonderful, but if you're adamant that you want the perfect view, request to be higher up.All of our guests loved the rooms and the access to the beach. The service at the front desk was wonderful; the staff was also willing to help us out and offer us some aloha spirit. I am forever in gratitude for their kindness.Quite a few of our guests ate many meals in the Hau Tree Lanai and enjoyed it immensely. I had one breakfast there, and it was perfect. We also loved the little snack counter in the annex that has spam musubi and chicken rice balls. My husband and I ate way too many of these! I wish I had had time to try the organic shave ice syrups--they sound way too good. It is a fair walk into Waikiki, which is either good or bad, depending on your perspective. We walked through the park at night and never felt concerned over our safety. You're at least a 10-minute walk from the closest ABC Store, which in Waikiki is a rarity. However, the New Otani has its own little snack counter and shop where you can purchase food.We worked extensively with Lisa to plan our reception, and it went off without a hitch. Our wedding was in Waimanalo and coordinated separately, but Lisa and the Hau Tree did an incredible job. The florist had dropped off a beautiful centerpiece, and the Hau Tree set it out for us. Our musician, Doug Fitch, was recommended by Lisa and performed slack-key guitar music perfect for the occasion. My mother had ordered appetizer trays in advance, and they came out quickly once our guests arrived. The Hau Tree was also very accommodating with special requests. I wanted a pasta dish but don't eat shrimp, so the Hau Tree prepared me a special chicken-mushroom pasta instead. It was very, very special. They did a fantastic job in handling our reception, and we will always recommend them to anyone.My only unhappy experience at the New Otani wasn't actually related to the New Otani itself. A few hours after our reception at the Hau Tree had finished, my father-in-law and his girlfriend decided to have a "commitment ceremony" with a minister on the 2nd-floor balcony directly below our room--specifically after we had asked them not to do so. The result of this was that they made the rest of our time at the New Otani very uncomfortable and awkward for the rest of our guests and ourselves. Luckily the staff of the New Otani was very kind to my husband and me through this incident, and we hope to stay there again in the future under very different circumstances.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel has an incredible view of Waikiki! The rooms are quite small but that is really the only negative point for this hotel. Great breakfast too, BTW.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Overall, the Hotel was very nice. There were just a couple minor irritations. The biggest problem was the lack of a proper bathroom door. The door was akin to a door-sized window shutter that slid shut. It was just a bit uncomfortable to have little to no privacy while using bathroom. The room was quite small, which made the lack of a proper bathroom door much more irritating. Our room had a built in desk, mirror, closet and TV stand on one wall and the rest of the room was completely taken up by the queen-sized bed, with very little room to move around. If while traveling, you prefer a spacious room, this may not be for you, though they did manage to squeeze a very large flat screen TV in the room. That aside, everything else was great. The restaurant was top-notch and the outdoor seating area gave you the feeling that you were eating on the beach, which was nice. The lobby was also very well decorated. Also, the view from our room was great as we had a great view of the ocean and the park next door. The staff were very polite, but we really didn't interact with them too much so can't really give an opinion on them either way. As for the location, it is on the beach and is approx. half of one mile away from the area where most shops and hotels are located. The tours that we attended while in Hawaii didn't pick up from our hotel (not to say that others wouldn't) but asked that we walk down to the main street to meet at a larger hotel, which wasn't necessarily bad since we had nice weather, but depending on the weather, it could be a major inconvenience if you’re being picked up by tour companies. I would say that this was an average to above-average accommodation and is a good value for what you receive.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We have stayed at the hotel several times. It is with quiet nice, courteous staff, and clean rooms.The restaurant on the ground level facing the beach is a bit overpriced, especially for dinner ; the service staff can be a bit surly . There is a sushi restaurant at the hotel which we have never tried. There are some amazing ( and not touristy ) restaurants a short cab ride away on Kapahulu Ave. that offer a variety of reasonable ethnic cuisine.The rooms can be a bit small but suggest ocean view only since the other rooms face high rises and this defeats the purpose of being in a tropical setting.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We had the most amazing time at the New Otani. I never ever wrote a hotel review in my life although me and my husband have travelled a lot and usually stay in 4 and 5 star hotels around the world. But after our trip to the New Otani I decided I had to. I chose the hotel because of a recommendation from a friend who raved about how secluded and beautiful it was although being in Honolulu. And she was right. At our arrival we were welcomed by the incredibly nice staff who even got us an upgrade for our room. The ocean view room (716) was just amazing, overlooking the sea, the secluded Sans Souci beach right in front of the hotel, Honolulu skyline and Kapiolani Park. If you stay here, get an ocean view room, it's worth it! Having breakfast and dinner (fantastic restaurant by the way!) on the lanai right at the beach without the feel of a huge resort or hotel complex - it couldn't get any better. If you like big resorts and pool areas this isn't for you. But if you want to experience this very private feel with an outstanding service, then come here. The waiters all looked like they really love their job. Isn't that what you wish for when you go out dining on your vacation - except the great food? Well, you figured it out, we enjoyed our stay there. When our flight was delayed, they even offered us a room to freshen up and stay in at no cost until we had to head to the airport at night. Great hotel and only a 7 minute walk to Honolulu center. Definitely more than a 3-star hotel!!! Thanks to the staff for making this vacation an unforgettable one!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: If you're looking for a hotel away from the craziness of Waikiki area stay here. The hotel is right across from the Kapiolani Park and the Sans Souci Beach is right behind the hotel. We loved the beach area - there is a lifeguard daily - there are no crowds - the beach is raked daily - you can even go snorkeling here. This is what they call a Boutique hotel - translation - the rooms are very small. We booked an ocean view room - the view was spectacular - Waikiki in the distance and to the side the beach and ocean. The air conditioning unit above the bed was a bit annoying. We did get to peak into an Ocean View Suite room while the maid was cleaning it - these are the rooms to get next time!!! Spectacular! You also get some fresh pineapple in your room upon arrival. We also got a box of chocolates because we told the front desk it was our 30th Anniversary. Now we only paid of valet parking the first night as we were too exhausted after our flight ($18) - the rest of the week we parked for free in the Kapiolani Park right outside our hotel. Now there is also meter parking on the street in front of the hotel - but there is a small road (sorry can't remember name) right to the side of the hotel where the lifeguards parking is next to the beach this is where we parked for free all week. The locals frequent this area on the weekends - so get there early if you want free parking. We loved the Hau Tree Lanai restaurant in the hotel for their food and especially for the fantastic view. Every time we ate there the staff put us at a beach front table. Very romantic. The Lounge area makes the best Mai Ti's in Hawaii and there is entertainment most nights. Getting a mat and towel were never a problem...the staff at this hotel were very nice and welcoming. The hotel does not have a pool...but the ocean is right out your door. Waikiki is a 25 minute walk from the hotel - there are a lot of trees for shade in the park but once you hit Waikiki it gets really hot! So if your looking for less crowds - free parking - great staff - beautiful views - romantic restaurant - quiet hotel - great price - close to all the major attractions stay here. I would stay here again - but I would book a Suite instead of a room. Oh ya, when we asked for an upgrade when we arrived - we didn't get one like other reviewers got that I read about - oh well...maybe next time. To get a good sense of how the hotel and rooms looks go to wizardpub.com - click on Oahu - scroll down to The New Otani Kaimana Hotel - click on it and voila - a picture of the hotel the beach - click on 'Take me there' to see the rooms. I hope this helps!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
