review_body: I just returned from a week at the New Otani and overall it was a very good stay. The location is the strongest point for the hotel and mostly makes up for some weaknesses in the rooms. The hotel is located on a quiet stretch of beach slightly out of the craziness of Waikiki. It was about a 15 - 20 minute walk into shopping and the restaurants.  I had read the moderate rooms were small but wasn't prepared for just how small. You literally did not have enough space to turn around in the room! Also, I found the AC to be less than adequate. The AC was turned down on the lowest setting and it took at least 2 days for the room to cool off. Otherwise the rooms were fine and the staff was pleasant and helpful.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I have wanted to go to Hawaii since I was a child and with help of this Hotel and its staff it was a "Dream come true". Everything was great at the hotel and the room was perfect,sea view and looking towards Waikiki beach. The beach outside of the hotel was great and the little coffee shop as you come out of the hotel did the best coffee and fresh sandwiches. We met some wonderfull people and the staff were very helpful . Thanks to everyone who made "our dream come true" Patricia and Geoff Payne.Norwich England

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We chose this hotel due to the reviews here on trip advisor. Excellent location away from the hustle and busle of downtown wakai. Excellent beach outside the hotel with good snorkelling. Shop close by for snacks etc. Would recomend paying that little extra for a room with a view as we had the view of the next hotel (but hey you don't come to Hawaii to sit in the room). An awesome time.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Hotel has everything we needed and is in a great location.There is a small quiet beach and its just far enough from the crowds of Honolullu to be able to walk there for a meal or drink.The front desk staff were ok but could have been more helpful.Rooms were a good size and clean

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We were looking forward to some peace and quiet after spending 5 hectic nights with a group of over 100 people. At check in I asked for an upgrade from our Ocean View room (hoping for a Deluxe Ocean View) and we were given a Junior Suite (Room 318) without any hassle at all. Our room was on the same level as an open air garden in the centre of the hotel. A real unexpected surprise when we came out of the lift.During check in we were invited to the Manager's cocktail happy hour for Mai Tais and Pupus. The manager Jean-Pierre (JP) made us feel very welcome and the Mai Tais went down rather well. We unpacked and went straight out for dinner. On our return we noticed just how loud the A/C was and there was no way either one of us could sleep with that racket. Also quite a bit of loud talking and laughter was coming from the floor below. I thought it was from the bar but Reception said the bar was empty at that time. We were offered another room on the 8th floor (Room 810) which was much quieter and had a wrap around balcony with views back to Waikiki and over to Diamond Head. We were both quite grumpy and tired after having to pack up and move but we had our best night's sleep in 5 days. There was a small entrance way with a luggage closet containing the room safe. The bathroom was a little odd. One room contained the toilet and a shower over a bath and the hand basin was outside the bathroom next to the wardrobe. There was a Queen size bed in one room separated by sliding doors from the lounge area with a desk, couch and TV cabinet with mini fridge underneath. The view from the wrap around balcony was absolutely awesome. We slept with the drapes pulled back so we could look down toward the lights of Waikiki. The beach out front of the hotel is fantastic and was never crowded. It was quite shaded first thing in the morning but it didn't take long for the sun to come over the buildings. There are towels and sand mats available at the Bell desk. The entrance to the beach is just to the right before the bar and there is a tap at the top of the ramp to wash off the sand before going back into the hotel. You can not get back in the door at the top of the ramp and have to walk down the side a bit.Breakfast was awesome under the Hau Tree. So relaxing that we could have stayed there all day. Not much else in the way of dining options. The dinner menu had quite an Asian influence and there was also a Japanese restaurant on the 2nd floor. There is a small convenience store attached to the hotel but we just wandered back into Waikiki for dinner.I was a little nervous during our walk back from town as there are a lot of homeless and 'strange' people in the park. There would be no way I would walk there alone at night. My husband had to look twice when he saw his first gay couple kissing but he got used to it very quickly so it wasn't an issue. I had forgotten to tell him it had the reputation as the gay end of Waikiki. No big deal.Overall our stay at the New Otani was everything I expected it to be in terms of peace and quiet (eventually). I would definitely go back tomorrow given the chance.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Being our first time in Honolulu we were weary to try and find a place on our own. Our travel agent helped us with this one. We stayed five nights. The first room we were given was a shoe box. My agent said it was small but we never thought it would be as small as it was. It was an ocean front with a balcony and a king size bed but you literally had to inch around the bed because there was no room for anything else. Even the closet was small. There was no way that we could have even fit half our luggage in it. So we upgraded. The unfortunate part about that is that the only room available to us was an additional 120 a night. Ouch! We took it thinking something else would come available in the mean time. I believe that room was on the corner. It was definitely worth the extra money. It was beautiful. If you can afford it I would suggest staying in that room. By this time we had gotten our agent on the phone, thank goodness. They got us in a room about double the size of the first one for only 40 more a night. We loved it. The view was perfect and the size of the room was as well. If only we would have went with that one to begin with we would have been way better off and way less stressed. The service at this hotel was very good. They will do anything to try and get what you need. The restaurant down stairs was superb. The waiter was really nice and gave us a good tip on where to hike. He even got us a brochure for it. It was nice being away from all the hustle and bustle. But not too far. Every night we would walk through the park and down the strip and back. Or we would just walk along the ocean by Waikiki beach. And during the day all you had to do was walk out the door to get to the ocean. It was neat to see all of the early birds down by the shore doing their morning exercises. Over all I would recommend this place to anyone who asked. Staff was great and once we got into the right one the room was great too. Just make sure you check the size before booking to prevent a little stress.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The Kaimana Beach Hotel is situated in the shadow of Diamond Head on Sans Souci Beach, and across from Kapi'olani Park. Incidentally, Kaimana is Hawaiian for diamond, and this hotel is definitely a gem. Built in the late-1940's on the site of the former McInerny Cottage, which was a tasteful Victorian design with an ocean lanai and wood railing under a distinctive hau tree whose shade was enjoyed by Robert Louis Stevenson. The distinguished tree and wood railing have been integrated into today's Kaimana's dining treasure "The Hau Tree Lanai," an ideal venue for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. It's the most relaxing oceanfront restaurant in Honolulu. Renovated in the mid-60's, when the nine story tower was added, it has a retro look on the exterior, but an open, breezy lobby which imparts a tropical feel. No pool, but Sans Souci is a great beach, replete with local eye candy.The Kaimana was acquired by the vaunted New Otani chain of Japan, which has thus far wisely kept the Hawaiian ambiance that insures it remains a standard amongst locals, both the native-born and kama'aina, for dining and receptions. For instance when returning from a morning jog around Kapi'olani Park under the port a chere I bumped into a law school schoolmate who was then serving as Lieutenant Governor. Close to the Honolulu Zoo, away from the hustle and bustle of mainstream tourist strip, and located past the Aquarium and the World War I Memorial Natatorium, the Kaimana brackets the Diamond Head end of Waikiki. It's a short, but picturesque drive from the shops, cinemas, and restaurants of Kahala Mall. Location is probably why the property imparts a club-like, but casual, air of exclusivity. New Otani has avoided the mistake of overdeveloping their site. While hardly bargain priced, its prices provide better value than Honolulu's two grande dames further up Kalakaua Avenue. As a result there exists is a wide diversity of accommodations in the Kaimana's inventory. The corner suites are to die for, most of the junior suites are enviable, but they also have some rooms which afford hardly enough room in which to open one's suitcase. The GM, Jean-Pierre Cercillieux, has a colorful leadership reputation that no doubt inspires his staff. On our recent stay we encountered a reservation glitch, and an Internet disconnect. In each case the staff quickly and cheerfully addressed each problem. However, we're still waiting to confirm if we received our WorldPerks bonus points. Overall the location, view, beach, service, and food combine to make this gem at the foot of Diamond Head a "home away from home" to which the members our family enjoy returning.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel was exactly what I wanted. It's at the far end of Waikiki with a marvelous swimming beach (Sans Souci) right out the door. Quiet, out of the busy part of Waikiki, but a 15-20 minute walk away if you're missing the action. I booked a Deluxe Ocean View room on Travelocity for $183 plus $43 taxes and fees. Before I checked in I made myself look very presentable, (business casual) and fresh (after a long 5 hour full plane flight crammed into a tiny coach seat) and had my cool new Tumi suit case and was given an upgrade to a junior suite. It was a great room with a small living room that had a sofa, desk and flat screen TV. There were sliding doors that separated the bedroom. Best of all there was a wrap-around balcony with views of Waikiki beach AND Diamond Head. There is a smaller building that is also part of the hotel and although some of the rooms ini this small back building have beach views, some look out onto the parking lot. I would really spend the extra money and get an ocean view in the main building. For the price of a dinner I had chosen to upgrade to a deluxe ocean front, and by luck was upgraded. The way the main building of the hotel is oriented it looks like most rooms have a view of either Diamond Head, the beach, or out to the ocean. The hotel has many Japanese guests and there are nice Japanese touches in the rooms, like kimonos and a tea service, including a small tea pot with matching cups. I had breakfast at the hotel's outdoor Hale Tree restaurant but was not too impressed. Too much waiting, coffee not very good, kind of expensive but then again, I was right on the beach. I preferred the little shaved ice place downstairs where I got a great cup of coffee and a muffin for $4. We had dinner in the Miyako, the Japanese restaurant on the second floor. VERY Japanese and not for everyone. The sushi was very good, super fresh fish, delicious tempura. We were the only English-speaking Americans in the restaurant. It was $85 for 2. Back to the hotel room, it was very clean, the bathroom was a bit dated (some fraying of the wallpaper in the bathroom, some unattractive grout in the bathroom, thin louvred bathroom door which could be a little awkward but then I'm kind of scrambling to say anything negative) The amenities were by the French company Occitane , very nice! I would have liked a nice reading light, but the lighting looked attractive. Housekeeping was very prompt and thorough. The front desk staff is somewhat reserved in their demeanor. I think some people can take this as surly but I did not find it that way. They do not have forced smiles on their faces and they are very quick and efficient. This may be their style, there are a lot of Japanese guests, maybe that's the way they do things. It didn't bother me. For example, at the service desk they lend you straw mats, beach chairs and towels. We kept on getting mix ups because I would return the towels when no one was there, so it looked like I had 10 towels out when I had none. But it all worked out. A few last things: there is no pool (who needs one? the ocean is like a gigantic pool and it's right outside the door), the super cool W hotel is right next door which would be fun for a drink, parking is plentiful across the street, 25 cents an hour with a maximum of 4 hours, free from 6 pm to 10 am, or you could valet. Will definitely return to this hidden gem.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I got a great deal, but it wasn't my money. I traveled for business and stayed two days at this hotel. There are many positives. Yes it is quiet but close to the action, a boutique hotel, staff was great w/ bartender Gerry a legend with repeat patrons over many many years, many other things close by, and very pretty views. I can't imagine ever staying here with the wife and kid in such a small room. The AC, although very good was right next to my bed. It blew down on me the first night until I was freezing. I managed to adjust the motorized air vent control, but I didn't totally get it figured out. The bathroom I thought was a bit dated and water didn't run down the bathtub/shower drain the best. The beach is small here.I hope the info helps, I people watched a lot of happy tourists and locals in Honolulu, that helped make this business trip a bit easier.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This was my third visit to the New Otani. The hotel is really amazing that it can be so close to the Waikiki scene (a 20 - 25 minute walk) and so absolutely removed from it. It sits on its own beach next to the Kapiolani Park. So, the impression of one's surroundings is just ocean and trees. No street noise, no crowds of people. Although the rooms are small, they are comfortable and clean. Parking is very tight, but they always have found a space for our car. And you don't really have to have a car since The Bus stops just a bit away from the hotel. Since we are return visitors, the hotel has consistently offered us special little favors. So, even if the location didn't bring us back, the staff's service would. It's a great property!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I booked this hotel and had concerns after reading all of the other reviews stating that the rooms were antiquated and customer service was horrible. All of that was put to rest when I got there. I booked the cheapest room (I value my money), and when I checked in, simply asked for an ocean view at the same price and they were happy to oblige. The hotel lobby is beautiful, with an open bay straight to the water. The room was small, but it was just my wife and I and we were not there for the hotel room. I wanted to get out, so it didn't bother me at all. As far as being antiquated, I couldn't tell. I could have marked it down for the a/c, but I didn't complain about it to maintenance since I could just leave the patio door open and get all of the ocean breeze I could stand. Beautiful view from the balcony also. I spent alot of time there. Parking is easily circumvented. $18 for valet or simply park right in the street for free. Across the street is free from 6pm-10am at Diamond Head park, and then you have to feed a meter. I don't recommend getting a rental car anyways. You're not going to see Hawaii in a rental car. You really need to get off of Oahu to do that. If you do get a car, only get it when you need it because Waikiki is within walking distance to get everything you need. To sum it up, I would definitely, and probably will, stay again. The scenery and comfort cannot be beat compared to the hotels I saw in Waikiki. Excellent place for young couples who want peace and quiet to relax between activities with a beautiful beach and view.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The New Otani is near Diamond Head, and well removed from the hectic Waikiki Beach area. It is a bit isolated from other restaurants and shops, but it is right on a beautiful beach with great views of the ocean and Diamond Head. It has a great beachfront restaurant and lounge. The room was small but very clean and comfortable, good bedding with duvet cover. It was a nice romantic spot, and we were sorry we could only spend one night there on our way back to the mainland.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed at the New Otani for a week in April. We made reservations by phone and got the internet discount as well as a week discount. We were in a Diamond Head room on the 6th floor – with a beautiful view of Diamond Head and Kapiolani park.The room was small but clean and attractively decorated in blues and greens. It had a small fridge as well as a couple of chairs and small table both in the room and also on the lanai. With the exception of a little noise from the street on Friday night, the hotel was very quiet. The hotel sits on the Sans Souci beach which is a perfect swimming beach. You can get beach towels, mats, and chairs from the front desk. There are lots of food options within 2 miles (we walked because it is such a pleasant walk along the beach or through the park although parts of the park can be a little isolated late at night). All the following are nearby: Leonard’s Bakery (for malasadas), Diamond Head Market (great take-out for breakfast, lunch, or dinner especially the grilled veggies), Rainbow Drive-In, Ono Hawaiian Foods (great chicken laulau), and of course all the restaurants in Waikiki (including the Hula Grill for breakfast). We also ate breakfast at the Hau Tree Lanai a couple of times and it is very scenic.There is a convenience store in the hotel, a Safeway less than 2 miles away on Kapahulu and, of course, ABC stores in just about every block along Waikiki, so it is easy to pick up anything you need. You can use the hotel’s valet parking or park on the street or at meters across the street (25 cents per hour 10AM to 6PM). If you are flying out late in the day you can arrange for late check-out or get a hospitality room for an hour to shower and change. The hotel has a coin-operated laundry.As the other reviews mention, the staff is pleasant and helpful. We loved being in such a peaceful and beautiful setting but still close to the activity of Waikiki. I would definitely stay at the New Otani again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife & I, both late 50's, stayed at the New Otani for 7 nights in early March. This hotel is located on the Diamond Head end of Waikiki, which is less busy then the area around the Royal Hawaiian. The hotel has no pool but the beach is very nice & Kapiolani park is next door. Breakfasts & lunches are great, figure $15 per plate & dinner in the bar worked for us. We did not eat dinner in the restaurant. Staff very helpful. If you need lawn chairs for the beach just ask the front desk. At night we felt very safe walking to & from the main part of Waikiki. We prefer the Big Island, but if we go back to Waikiki will definately stay at the New Otani.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed three nights at the New Otani Kaimana Beach. The hotel is next to a park where there is a zoo and an aquarium. We were able to walk to those places and also to the Diamond Head crater and trail head. The walk to the trail head is a little longer, approx. 2 miles. The hotel has a nice beach in front, a great Japanese restaurant, a nice beach front restaurant and a lounge. There is a small store on-site also. The walk into Waikiki is aprox. a mile so you can shop, eat, and join the crowds there but then return to a nice quiet relaxing hotel.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I came back to Hawaii after 35 years. I so strange that Waikiki has hardly changed. I knew that I didn't want to be by the main crowds, I wanted beach access in front of the hotel, I wanted some place that was clean and well kept up, and with services.I got all these things and more.I highly recommend this hotel.Some reviews are critical of the dinner prices. The food is good. The view of the sunset is awsome. Many local people come the this resturant. You get what you pay for.Things I would redo.Rent a car only on the days I was going around the island. Parking is expensive but you can park on the street, just don't park at the metered places, they patrol that side for expired meters. With the wonderful beach just outside the hotel you won't need the car. Again many local folks come to this beach.The Bus system is all you need to get around town. If you plan to go to one of the North Shore Beaches for the day go early if driving. One thing that has changed is the amount of people and their were very few places (or no) at the prime beaches. Bring better walking shoes.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: An excellent place to stay! We found this hotel through trip advisor and were quite please with our visit March 15-22. We were looking for a quiet spot off the strip to escape the spring break madness and the New Otani was the perfect hotel. Upon our arrival we received a free upgrade to a larger ocean front suite on the sixth floor (if you are booking it would definitely be worth the money for the ocean front view). The suite was clean and spacious, the bedding updated - there give a fresh piece of pineapple in your mini fridge. The San Souci beach is right below the hotel and is definitely a quieter beach versus the strip. This beach is definitely filled with more locals than tourists. The 15 minute walk to the strip was fine during the day. For personal safety, I wouldn't recommend walking alone during the night time - there are a few spots where there isn't much lighting or foot traffic. We always made sure to pick up late night snacks on the strip as the hotel restaurant closes at 21:00 and there isn't a restaurant nearby (although we did forget to explore the W hotel next door - they may have a restaurant). The staff were friendly and accommodating - they provided beach towels and straw mats upon request. Not once did we feel that the hotel was too busy or over occupied - it was only when we went to the strip that we remembered that it was spring break. We also rented a car for three nights and the $18 per night valet fee was reasonable. The Hau Tree Lanai restaurant provided excellent service and had very reasonably priced breakfast and lunch for the serving sizes ($10-15) - we had the poi pancakes every morning (a must have) and the mahi burger was the best fish burger I've ever had. On check out day, we had a late night flight and after the beach we were given access to a hospitality room to shower and change. The only downside was the equipment room (not part of the main hotel) they stored our luggage in for that day. When we picked up our luggage we noticed a few cockroaches wandering about (not a huge concern - just make sure you have all your bags tightly zipped up to prevent unwanted hitch hikers home). All in all we were definitely pleased and would not hesitate to book this hotel again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We just got back from our 6 days at the New Otani. We picked the hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. I did read some negatives, but we took the chance anyway and are so glad we did.The rooms: we had a ocean front junior suite. This had a small sitting room with a big screen tv and sliding glass doors that opened up to a decent size lanai and the bedroom with a king size bed and another sliding glass door to the lanai. The views of the beach and Waikiki in the distance were amazing. We were on the third floor. One could argue that some of the furniture wasn't new, but it was very clean and was just fine.The staff: couldn't say enough about them. Friendly smiles and hello's and there to help you with anything. When we first arrived we requested a coffee maker for our room, and it was delivered before we could finish looking at our room!The food: As far as we were concerned the food was top-notch and promply served. The portions were large and you could easily take some back to your room. (yes, there are mini-fridges in the rooms)The beach: Fantastic and great for snorkling. From our lanai you could see the coral reefs and not a day went by that people weren't taking advantage of swimming there. Obviously the locals think the beach is great too as there were as many locals as guests.We would go back to the New Otani in a heartbeat!!!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband grew up in Honolulu, so when we were choosing a hotel for our Christmas holiday, we knew we wanted to be on the beach, but not in the centre of Waikiki. The New Otani Kaimana Beach is perfectly situated on a quiet street at the 'end' of Waikiki surrounded by a perfect, quiet beach and the beautiful Kapiolani Park.We stayed in an Ocean Front Room which is a corner room which has a wrap-around balcony facing Waikiki. It was wonderful to sleep with the balcony doors open and the sound of the waves lulling us to sleep. I would highly recommend paying the extra money to upgrade to one of these rooms.The hotel is owned and run by the Japan-based New Otani Hotel Group, which virtually ensures impeccable and polite service.The hotel itself, including the rooms, are a bit dated, however, you really will not find another hotel in Waikiki with this proximity to the ocean, unobstructed views and balconies for a better price!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: When I booked my room for my first trip to Honolulu I was looking for a place where I could relax as well as be close to waikiki. I hit the cover off the ball on this one. I was put in the annex, number 309, which is the closest to the beach on the top floor. The porch(lanai) opens onto a beautiful park with a good view of the ocean. I asked to see some of the the other rooms in the main building and was cheerfully given the grand tour. All the rooms were clean and would have a hard time choosing between an ocean view(in the sun), or the spetacular view of Diamondhead(in the shade). I stayed with the annex room mostly because it had a microwave and sink(hotplates on request) where the rooms in the main building did not. I had a breakfast,poi pancakes with three different types of sausage and a side of potatoes obrian, almost more than I could eat and everything exceptional. I had one dinner there, mahi mahi over a bed of creamed linguini. The filet was huge, enough for a snack for the next day. The service here is top notch not only in the restaurant but front desk, easily the most beautiful women on the island, bell staff eager and respectful, maid service efficent and thorough. There is no need to rent a car as bus service goes everywhere, including the airport, for 2$ with one free transfer per day. The number 2 bus stops almost in front of the hotel right in view of a beautiful fountain. If you are 55 you can get a seniors discount if you call the hotel on their toll free number. The aquarium is just a chip shot away and the zoo just beyond that. The snorkeling was good in front of the hotel but better on the other side of the aquarium. I walk alot by choice and was never bothered by anyone between the hotel and the waikiki strip. Truely paradise found. Aloaha

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My lady and I just spent 5 days at this hotel. We generally like places with a bit more local flavor.... not the typical fancy resort type place. The New Otani was excellent. It is small and right on the beach, the rooms can be quite small, so spring for the "Deluxe" rooms that are larger as it is definitely worth the extra money. The staff was excellent. We had a small problem with the tub drain and there was a guy fixing it within about 10 minutes. The restaurant is excellent for any meal, but breakfasts just have something special about them. Many locals come to the hotel just to eat breakfast. In general, you get the feeling that you are staying in a fine hotel a couple of decades ago, before Waikiki became the totally commercial and over-developed place it is now. If you want comfort, serenity, good service and good food all at a reasonable price, along with a fine location directly on a good stretch of beach.... then the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel is an excellent choice.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We found this hotel through Tripadvisor and were very happy there. We were only in Oahu for four nights and wanted something away from the center, but not too far. This was perfect. Quick, beautiful walk to the center of Waikiki and a few buses pass near the hotel on the way to Hanauma and the center of Honolulu. As most reviews point out, rooms are small, but who goes to Hawaii to stay inside?Great deal and location!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed here for a wedding. The hotel was clean and had a great location but the room was older and run down. The best rooms are on the suites on the top floors. get one of those if you can. The food in the hotel is OK, but you can do better out in town. The beach however is quite and clean and that is what most people want most. The price for the room is good compared to the rest of the beach front resorts on that strip.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed here on the way home to Australia after 3 weeks in the US so wanted to stay somwhere quiet where we could relax before flying home. One of the older hotels but surrounded by beach on one side and the park on the other, only a short 10 minute walk to waikiki with all the ABC shops and restaurants.We had a suite overlooking the park and the beach to Waikiki with beautiful views, very glad we stayed there and not in Waikiki as it is full on tourists with people everywhere.This hotel also has it's own private beach so is not crowded.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Nice room #312 - we were on 3rd floor, with a view of the Waikiki high rises and beach only slightly obscured by palm trees.Didn't try the restaurants - there's a Japanese and a Hawaiian - appeared a little expensive.OK value - I think we were paying about $230 / night which I thought was good for Waikiki, but when we needed an extra night on Thanksgiving night, they coudn't accommodate, but found us a top floor, ocean view room in the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani right on Waikiki for $185 - odd.Location is nice - the beach is wide there (better than the main drag I'd say), and attracts fewer visitors. Its a 10 minute walk to the middle of Waikiki.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is a very good bargain for hotels in Honolulu. It is right on the beach -- amazing view from ocean front rooms! It is very convenient to Waikiki, but not right in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The hotel is located in the midst of an attractive city park right next to Diamond Head, and is about a 10 minute walk from Waikiki proper.My husband and I spent two nights here at the end of September 2007 and were extremely pleased with our choice. If we ever return to Honolulu, I know this is where we will stay. We had an ocean front junior suite, and while it was not large it was very comfortable. It had a nice balcony, plenty of closet space, and a separate shower and tub. It was nice to have separate living and bedroom areas (they are separated by sliding doors). The patio restaurant is right on the beach and the setting is gorgeous -- the food is OK. For a longer stay it would get old to have most meals there, but there are many other choices nearby.I think it would be hard to beat the location and amenities for the price -- we paid less than $300 for our room (you get a discount by booking directly through the hotel's site).

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This hotel is highly recommended for value and service and convenience. My husband sometimes uses a wheelchair and the hotel supplied this free of charge for one week! Being right on the beach, we ate regularly at the restaurant there and the food was superb. Our view from our room over the sea and Honolulu was magnificent and breath taking. All staff were very helpful and our clothes washing could be done very cheaply as they have a laundry. Our room was very comfortable. This hotel was such good value.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife and I were looking to do an inexpensive week in Hawaii so that we can come back more often. The New Otani is probably the least expensive hotel that is directly on the beach -which means that you can walk out of the lobby onto sand -and it has great snorkeling. My wife and I were surprised to find a sea turtle in such a busy area as Waikiki. The hotel location was a short walk from the maddening crowds and though the surrounding parks had some homeless wandering around (like in Santa Monica, CA) we didn’t feel unsafe or uncomfortable. By the way, if you are a runner like me I could not think of a better place to stay to maintain you daily runs. Instead of playing the 'ocean view games’ we just decided to go for the least expensive room available. Internet rate of $135/night. Our room actually had a partial view of the ocean and Diamond Head. Perhaps it was a slow week and we got upgraded. The room was very small, a bit dated, but clean. My only gripe is that there is no door to the bathroom –only a sliding type louvered door. You better be very familiar with your traveling partner or you soon will be. The hotel is not fancy by any means but it was not a disappointment. It is just a reasonable clean place. We didn’t try any of the restaurants but did go to the fantastic Diamond Head grill at the W Hotel just 100 feet away. If you plan on spending your time outside of your room and need a good, clean, and inexpensive home base then I think the New Otani is a good choice.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: When confirming our reservation I mentioned that we would be on our honeymoon. After checking in, we were informed that we've been upgraded! We received a beautiful suite on the top floor, ocean front. What a start! A nice living area, HUGE bathroom, large and comfortable bed, panoramic view! Of course we spent a little more money in the restaurant. The food and service, from the valet to the busboy was very pleasant. We only stayed 3 nights, wish it were more. The beach was semi-private, yet you felt like you were alone. The Mai-Tais were the best on our entire trip, sunset included! Whenever we go back to Hawaii, will definitly stay here. You're away from the noise of Waikiki, very relaxing. Moral of the story....Perfect!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Great small little hotel just east of Waikiki. (5 minute walk) The location and the Hau Tree restaurant are wonderful. The rooms are small, but who spends time in their room in Hawaii. If you do not like to walk or need a pool this hotel is not for you. Breakfast at the Hau Tree is a must. The best seat in town. I would recommend this hotel to older couples without children who do not need all the glits and glamore of a large resort. We had a moderate room with a great view of Diamond Head and a narrow stretch of the beach. I will stay here again with my wife, but not with my children.Request a room on a high floor for a bette view and breeze.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed on the fifth floor, which had magnificent views of Waikiki, the beach and park. The room was a little small, but certainly big enough for two.The staff were all lovely and very helpful, when asked questions.We had a fifteen minute walk into Waikiki, which was good exercise. There are buses at the end and across the park and the 8, 19 and 20 take you to the Ala Moana shopping centre, where all the main shops are. The No. 2 bus is the only one that actually goes past the hotel, coming back, but if you take one of the others, there's just a short walk across the park to the hotel.We especially enjoyed the quiet surroundings of the hotel and the beach attached to it was lovely. Swimming was great.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Booked 2 rooms - one for me and the other for my teenage daughter and her 2 girlfriends. I had the ocean view room. The room itself was a bit small, considering the divider had a single bed in the living room. The bedroom itself had 2 single beds, so 3 people fit comfortably in one room. The view itself was very gorgeous. and mesmerizing. I took a nap one afternoon with the screen door open and fell asleep listening to the ocean. My daughter and her friend's were put into the older 3 story walk-up building. It was very spacious and you could easily fit 5 people. They had a microwave, dishes, a dining table with 4 chairs, large outside balcony, coffee maker and 4 large closets, a vanity station, and small shower. For the value, I suggest getting the 1 bedroom. I liked the fact that your hotel card key is used for each floor of the walk-up building, insuring better security. The location is perfect for a Waikiki Shell concert. Food wise, you should venture downstairs to have coffee and great baked goods (muffins, sinful desserts, etc). The restaurant downstairs has a great Sunday breakfast (hint: make reservations) and the food was a bit pricey, but worth it. My daughter ordered breakfast through room service and it arrived within 10 minutes. I have yet to experience any hotel beat this record time. The location being farther away from the noisy part of Waikiki is great because you are forced to walk at least 1/4 - 1/2 mile to the better restaurants. The food areas closer to the hotel are the local Starbuck's and Lulu's. Not to mention Teddy's Burgers. For parking, arrive early and park on the street (free parking) as there are many stalls near the hotel. The Sans Souci beach is much cleaner than the more populated part of Waikiki and is drop dead gorgeous. The hotel provides a small safe and internet service has to be ordered for a fee. Not having to wait for the elevator is a plus because you do not wait long for one to arrive! This is one of the older hotels in Waikiki and is a popular place for those who prefer to be near Waikiki away from the loud noisy streets. Call them today!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife and I have been staying in this hotel regularly since 1990. We find it wonderfully relaxing particularly if you are staying in a room at least on the seventh floor facing the ocean. The swaying coconut palms that are just below you are amazingly hypnotic. This is the only hotel that I know that I can spend hours on the balcony with a book ; totally at ease.The rooms are a little small but with the beach immediately adjacent and the park also adjacent it is easy to go for a peaceful stroll so if like me you quickly go ' stir crazy ' it will not happen here.There is a small store just at the front of the hotel to buy sandwiches and beer and wine so it is entirely possible to have an al-fresco picnic in the park, or on the beach, or on your balcony. If you take alcohol onto the beach be careful as in June within seven days we saw three Police patrols looking for drugs/alcohol ? I personally find that reassuring - just be careful.The staff are friendly and helpful and many have been there for years ! The restaurant overlooking the beach and at its level is lovely.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Stayed here twice, and will stay on the next visit. This is why I consider this hotel the best in Honolulu:Location. It's a bit of a stoll from the crowded zoo of Waikiki, but that's a good thing, because the hotel's beautiful little beachfront is serene, almost private. Diamond Head is looming on the land side, instead of layers of high-rises and street traffic, and you can see the rest of Waikiki arrayed down the long curve of the beach. What may have killed the popular appeal for this hotel, aside from the fact that it's out of the action, is the newer high-rise next door, which casts a big morning shadow on the beach.Rooms. We go for the oceanfront deluxe, because of the view (see photos).. The room is pleasant, spacious and clean. The person saying he had an oceanfront deluxe is mistaken: the palm trees only block the lower oceanfront standard rooms. The restaurants are fine. Nothing spectacular, but it's al fresco on the beach, which makes every meal memorable and -- something you won't get in the center of Waikiki -- intimate. The locals like to hang out here, especially around cocktail hour, and the atmosphere is unhurried, cordial and casual. The service is a bit slow, but if this is a problem then you have no business on tropical islands.If you've come to Hawaii to shop, party and do the tourist stuff, this is not the place. But if you want Oahu without feeling you're in Miami Beach, this is the place.Note: We got a good deal on the room through the hotel Website, but now it looks like you have to book by phone.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We spent 4 nights here the second week of June. I was very pleasantly surprised. The check in was smooth and the staff very polite and helpful. The hotel is very clean and although the room was small, we did have an ocean view. When I say small, I mean not much bigger than a cruise ship room and vey little storage. Since we were going to be at that hotel such a short time I wasnt going to complain, my husband however was not pleased. It really was a tight fit.The bed from the mattresses all the way to the pillows was a statement in comfort. I did not mind being in a hotel bed one minute I was there and I have never said that about a bed other than my own in my life. Believe me what the room lacks in space is made up for just by a good nights sleep.The room had a little fidge, but no coffee maker. I always travel with a small one of my own so I wasnt put out by it. It was nice drinking coffee on the balcony reading the paper that was included with our room pkg. every morning. Boy, those surfers sure get up early to ride the waves! The Otani also has a beach front location and a very nice beach. I've heard some say they snorkeled with good results, we however had no luck and we only did it once, so who knows.The hotel has a couple of different resturants, We ate breakfast there one morning and it was good, but a little pricey, I thought. There is also a snack bar that has beach access that was pretty good also, offering sandwiched, hot dogs, chile, soup, muffins and drinks. I also used the laundry mat on site, which did the job quite well. There is also a small convinience store which is great for snacks or souveniers on site as well. I think it"s open til 10PM or so.This hotel is close to the towns activity yet set apart by a park so it never feels crowded around the hotel area. Very relaxing to walk to breakfast through the park and watch the ocean! Lu Lu's is just up the street and offers great food at a reasonable price.All in all this is a great place to stay and I would stay there again with no problem. It's clean and very accommidating. It's not a 5 star, but your not paying 5 star rates either. If ya can't handle this hotel, you probably should'nt travel much because there's a lot worse out there!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We reserved a "deluxe ocean view room" which was approximately $260 per night. Our view from the 3rd floor was of a lot of palm trees, the park and if you leaned out, of the ocean. Ask and wait if needed for a 5th floor or higher room. It's not worth the price on the third floor. Still it's better than staying at most hotels in Waikiki. The walking distance to a the beach can't be beat and being across the street from a spacious park is also a plus. The room for the price came with very few amenities, a very small refrigerator, an old hair dryer, and that's about it. I would also recommend that you look into staying at the Iikai Hotel on the opposite side of Waikiki. It's expensive, but it has fantastic views, it's quiet as well, very spacious rooms, and you get so much more value for your money.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband and I got married at the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel in May of 2007. We were absolutely impressed and delighted by the staff and hotel from the moment we arrived. We had booked four nights in an Ocean View room and were upgraded (for free!) to an Ocean Front Deluxe room. The views were amazing from this room. From one side of the balcony, we overlooked the quiet, serene, and lovely Sans Souci Beach, with Waikiki to our right. From the other side of the balcony, we had a breath-taking view of Diamond Head.The room was very large, with a refrigerator, television, love seat, hair dyer, bath robes, and Neutrogena toiletries. They provided a nightly turn-down service with fresh flowers sprinkled on the pillows every night. The room was perfect for us, though it could have used some sprucing up with some fresh paint here and there. The location was ideal. It was very quiet, and at night, all you could hear were the waves from below, yet Waikiki was a quick five minute walk down the street. There's a convenience store attached to the hotel where one can buy liquor, souvenirs, and a selection of groceries. We ate at the Hau Tree Lanai and Miyako restaurants at the hotel. Both were wonderful. We especially enjoyed having breakfast at the Hau Tree Lanai every morning as we looked out over the beach. The poi pancakes were delicious!Our wedding ceremony on the "Imperial Lanai" was lovely. For those looking for a planned elopement or small wedding location, I can't recommend this hotel enough!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed at the Otani only for one night to break up our trip from Sydney to Las Vegas. The room was adequate for the amount of time we spent in it - i.e we didn't arrive till about 1am & booked out about 10am so really only needed somewhere to sleep. The room was a bit on the small side so don't think you would want to stay in a standard room for any longer than a day or two.However the location was great. It was out of town at Diamond Head but right on the beach. This allowed us to go for a walk by the sea and adjoining park when we woke late & then sit in the restaurant which was right on the beach for breakfast & enjoy the view. After another short walk it was time to pack up, check out & head back to the airport for our flight on to Las Veagas.We would certainly do this again. It allowed us to go through immigration in Honolulu rather than Los Angeles or San Francisco which was much easier & quicker. And it was nice to go for a walk by the beach in the sun when we woke.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I booked this hotel after reading a few travel books, based on the fact that it was smaller, away from the bustle of Waikiki, and somewhat near the University at Monoa. I knew not to take the NimitzHighway exit to get there, as it is on the far east end of Kapiolani Park, and is a bit hard to find. The staff was very friendly. My daughter and I were upgraded to a clean, small room with twin beds, with a fabulous view of both San Souci beach, and Kapiolani Park and Waikiki in the distance. We ate breakfast every day outdoors at the nice restaurant on site. Waikiki is a fifteen minute walk away, or the bus ($2.00) stops right down the street at the aquarium. Parking (valet) was a cinch, and the lot is so small it doesn't take more than a few minutes to get your car. The park got noisy on the weekendnights, but it wasn't unpleasant. The small beach gets crowded duringthe day, but is quiet at night. I would recommend this hotel to people who want a quieter place to stay away from Waikiki, and who don't mind either walking, or driving around Oahu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I read most of the reviews on this property before booking. I was a little weary due to some of the bad reviews, but found none of the negative things complained about in the bad reviews. The only negative was one rude valet attendent and the tight parking, but since it was valet it didn't really matter. We stayed in an Ocean Front Jr Suite. The room was spacious and the view was awesome. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The beach was beautiful and great for swimming. The best thing about this hotel is it's location. It is separated from the hustle and bustle of downtown Waikiki by a beautiful park and strip of beach. Yet all the happenings of Waikiki are well within walking distance to any able bodied person. We walked through the park during all hours of day and night and we never felt concerned about our safety. The views of the park and Diamond Head across the street from the Hotel are great. For food, there were all the high class dining spots on the "strip" downtown as well as all sorts of affordable options(fast food) only a few blocks further. All things considered, I would love to go back.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We read all the reviews before our trip to Oahu and were prepared for a mediocre hotel. So we are happy to report that were very pleased with the New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel. We stayed for 9 nights in a Moderate room and we had a terrific view of Diamond Head to the left and the ocean to the right between the hotel and the neighboring property. The room was clean and had everything we needed (refrigerator, balcony, toiletries, plush towels, clean bedding, ironing board, etc.) The only suggestion or improvement would have been an exhaust fan in the bathroom to help with the steam after a shower and the rolling louvered door lacked privacy. The bedroom furnishings and layout are typical to a standard hotel and are neither exceptional or unacceptable - however the pillows are terrific and the bedding is very nice. The staff was more than willing to assist with any question or request. We never had any negative experiences with the staff. I read complaints about dirty rooms - ours was perfect. I also read complaints about the sizes of the rooms. The rooms are not huge but completely adequate. If you are expecting the Hilton or another big luxury chain then stay in one. This is more of a boutique style hotel with a homey feel and clean friendly surroundings. Check out the price vs the big chains and see how you are paying for the big fancy room. But really what is more important... an extra 4 feet in the room or a comfortable room for the price in a hotel DIRECTLY on the beach in a quiet location? And really, who stays in the room in Hawaii unless to sleep anyway?The Hau Tree Lanai Restaurant was beautiful. I saw a review complaining about reservations for breakfast for a table with a view. Although the restaurant is busy and there may be a short wait we thought that this comment was interesting as all the tables had terrific views - the restaurant is beach front -inches from the sand - so really there are no bad tables we could see. The prices are high but hey eating on the beach in Hawaii is worth it - especially for breakfast. We didn't try the Japanese restaurant or the spa so we are unable to comment.The hotel is not brand new but most of Waikiki hotels are about the same age generally. The property is well maintained and inviting. We don't consider this hotel to be luxury but it is a far cry from a fleabag hotel in need of demolition. The New Otani Kaimana doesn't misrepresent itself and lives up to a feeling of home away from home. There is no pool if you wanted one - but swimming, surfing, snorkeling right in front makes up for it. Lastly the gift shop is more of a convenience mart - last minute small gifts, postcards, magazines, snacks and drinks but nothing fancy. The proximity to Waikiki is fantastic (10 minute walk along the park or along the waterfront). The benefit of this is that you don't have the city sounds at night and also don't have the city congestion but you do enjoy city convenience. There is an apartment building next door to the hotel but it is well styled and not an eyesore. One thing we will conceed is that the walk at night does make you a little nervous. It's very quiet and dark but we quickly learned that families enjoy cookouts in the park even late into the night so it wasn't a surprise to see young children running around laughing around 10pm. However, if you are nervous at night, the walk from Waikiki beach to the New Otani may be a little much for you (short but dark).If we have the chance to go back, we wouldn't consider staying anywhere else & would recommend this hotel to anyone we know.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: The hotel rooms are much too small. There was only about two feet of space when you walked into the room. There was no room to put suitcases. We cleared off the space above the TV for my husbands and put mine on the floor under the TV. I don't think I'd ever stayed in a room so small.The A/C either makes the room too hot or too cold. We were constantly making adjustments (even in the middle of the night). The air also seemed to blow directly down. We couldn't find a way to adjust it.We found the bar prices to be a bit high. We had a Mai Tai at Duke's for $7, and they were $9 at the hotel bar, and it was made with lesser quality ingredients (in my opinion). The restaurant prices seemed high, so we never ate there, so I can't give a review on that.The beach was almost a private beach for the hotel. It was quiet and peaceful. (Compared to Waikiki) The hotel lent us mats and towels to use. This was very nice.The bellman is also the valet, towel lender, direction-giver, luggage checker, etc. They need another person to assist with this job. We had to wait frequently, because we couldn't find the bellman, because he was outside somewhere or giving directions.Also, we had a later flight, so we asked if we could leave the bags while we walked around a bit, since checkout was at noon. They said it was fine. They had a room to put them in. We waited for the bellman, and he gave us a tag for our luggage. When we returned, we found our luggage still stacked in the lobby next to the desk. We were able to just take our luggage and walk out. No one ever questioned if it was our luggage or verified we had the tag for it. Not very secure.The walk to Waikiki was about 15 minutes. Not bad, but if I had to do it again, I would stay closer to the main beach for activities and a larger room and walk down to the beach by this hotel. Also, the buses no longer run on the road by the hotel, so you need to walk over to the zoo to catch the bus (not a bad walk 5-10 minutes), but not as convenient as described in another review).

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Booked this hotel based on frommer's guide. We were extremely disappointed. The room was not great and did not like the location. Is next to a nice park during the day , however, at night it is full of homeless and addicted people. Very scary to walk thru at night . Most activities and restaurants are towards that area. The restaurant at the hotel was over priced and not that great.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed in an oceanfron jr. suite. The view was beautiful...the room was vile. The sink was outside the bathroom, in a corner of the bedroom. The bathroom door was not solid...it was a louver door...the shower was army camp quality...the wallpaper was peeling and the tile grout looked filthy.The hotel location is private and it is nice to be away from, but within walking distance of, Waikiki. There is no pool and no place to just sit around and read a book. There is no hotel presence on the beach. If you want a chair, rent it from the concierge and carry it to the beach! This is not luxury by my terms.The restaurant is nicely situated, but they take reservations for Breakfast tables with a good view.....so you can arrive and see an empty table with a nice view and then be seated at the table next to the dirty dishes.We walked by some rooms and saw that they were literally 3 feet wider than the bed...........Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else! As for the reviewer who never stayed at a better hotel, my deepest sympathy!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Can't say enough...On a Quiet dead end street off Lahaina Baby beach, just one house in from the Ocean. All private, fenced in parking, ponds, herb garden, tons of flowers, even flowers on the bed, so sweet, cookies, baskets of breakfst goodies brought to you in the morning, sample bath products to try and they give a percentage to the Alzheimer's foundation...they have rafts, chairs towels, lotions, the whole nine yards. You totally felt like a home away from home. The rate was under $180.00 a night I believe and that was with cleaning...but you might want to check that out and be sure to make a reservation. Very relaxing, great location, walking distance to everything including downtowm...amazing find, and NOT a studio. Kaimana's Beach Hale....Hey don't forget your picture with Kaimana...he's a hoot...no pun intended.....

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We spent five nights at the New Otani in Honolulu and were very pleased with the facilities and service. The location is a 10 minute walk from the rest of Waikiki, through a beautiful park along the coast. The hotel has its own private beach.Our room was small but comfortable with a mini refrigerator, robes, all toiletries, plenty of towels, a seating area and a balcony. The hotel website is very clear about the locations and views and prices of the rooms. We paid a little more for Diamond Head view and enjoyed that; the ocean view rooms are more. You can look at their site and pick exactly what you want. The room was clean and well maintained.The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful at all times. The concierge helped us with sightseeing.The hotel itself has an excellent Japanese restaurant, and a pleasant restaurant right on the beach, with regional cuisine and fresh ingrediants. We had several breakfasts, several lunches and a dinner there and were pleased with the food, the service and the view. There are also restaurants in a couple of nearby hotels if you don't feel like going into Waikiki.This is a great hotel for anyone who wants to experience the beauty of Honolulu without the crowds and noise.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Fantastic location just a short stroll from Waikiki.Staff not very helpfull or friendly. Great place to stay if you don't care too much about service. Beautiful beach out the front.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: About us: we have been to many countries: CUBA, MEXICO, GREECE, NETHERLANDS, ETC..For our honeymoon, we decided to travel 4700 miles to Hawaii. Our first week at Maui was great. But it didn't last. We spent the second week in Honalulu at the "The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel."Let me tell you, I am a pretty patient person that understands mistakes. I didn't care much for the Expired gift basket we received or the constant "sorry no more beach towels" at the front desk. But when we received a message that the valet dented our rental car, we expected them (valet service and hotel) to take care of the situation. Instead, I had to hunt down the Valet and Valet company and continuously tell them I want this taken care of. And for the Management of the hotel, Well they couldn't be bothered with this. It was "MY PROBLEM" So I spend 4 days trying to fix MY PROBLEM calling Thrifty, the valet company and asking the front desk why they won't help us? To add to this, I had to pay the hotel for the calls made to THRIFTY AND THE VALET SERVICE and the parking fee (116$). THAT WAS JULY, IT TOOK NUMEROUS LONG DISTANCE CALLS TO HAWAII TO FINALLY GET REIMBURSED NOVEMBERFOR THE DAMAGE (650$)TO MY VEHICLE IN NOVEMBER!! MONTHS LATER !!! and the HOTEL, after many many long distance calls and emails, still won't bother saying the word "SORRY" In fact they won't call me!!!! No more America vacations for me, we will visit CUBA next vacation. We have been there already and the COMMUNISTS know how to treat travellers well !!! What a bad Hotel !

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife, our two-year-old, and I stayed at the Kaimana Beach in Mid November in the 7th Floor Diamond Head Jr. Suite. We had a very positive experience and would stay there again without hesitation:-The room was clean, comfortable the separate bedroom was useful for putting our son down to bed early in relative quiet. -Parents keep in mind, however, that this particular room's restroom is directly accessed from the bedroom, so one cannot use the restroom until after your youngster has gone to sleep and will not wake up with the creaking of the opening door.-180-degree wrap-around patio balcony provided a truly stunning view of Diamond Head that will not soon be forgotten.-Situated at San Souci Beach, outdoor excursions with young kids is wonderfully hassle-free. The natural reef about 50 yards from the shore makes this an ideal place for small kids to have fun with the water.-The Hau Tree Restaurant was a bit pricey for lunch and dinner on our budget, but breakfast was excellent and reasonable every day, service was great, and dining under the large Hau Tree was unforgettable looking out on the beach.-Being a very short walk away from the Aquarium and Kapiolani Park was very convenient. We didn't use it, but the handy local bus system had a stop in front of the hotel.-If you stay here, go to the hotel website and look both at the different rooms and the different on-line specials. We saved much money with the "free car" package not only because the rental fee was waived, but the package also gives you free valet parking at the hotel - saving us another $50.The Downsides of the hotel are limited but worth mentioning:-The hotel seems to be at that precarious place of not yet, but soon, requiring renovation. The room was spacious, but the interior was getting quite dated.-Plumbing was a little bit problematic.-Rooms facing Diamond Head get a day-long blast of Hawaiian sun and our room's air conditioning system, supplemented by having to keep the floor-to-ceiling window blinds closed during the day, still didn't keep the room cool.-Although the convenience to the beach, aquarium and park were a blessing, Waikiki itself is a very long walk or an expensive parking proposition if you don't plan to/aren't able to use the bus.-For those of us who found the restaurants to be outside of budget except for breakfast, the distance of other restaurants, etc. was somewhat inconvenient, particularly with a toddler.All in all, we'd very happily stay again with our youngster because no where else will one find a comparably nice, quiet, and convenient hotel for parents of small kids right on the beach with stunning views of either the ocean or in our case, Diamond Head.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My wife and I stayed 7 days here, it was mostly a good experience. Tthis hotel is a good place to sleep, eat and has a great little beach ! what more can you ask for? well maybe an upgrade on the furniture and amenities would help, looking a bit tired, staff is excellent, a/c in room kept us very comfortable lobby not air conditioned, it opens out to the beach!!! food was well prepared and served correctly, no loud noise at night , there is a park along the side and off the front excellent for walking and jogging. parking is $15.00 per day or you can hassle finding spot on street. We didn't mind being away from the insanity of the "strip" and we enjoyed walking off our dinner every night. The rooms can give you views of beach in back or diamond head on the western side, the park is on the eastern side and the park & diamond head on the front. they offer a laundry room and there is a little shop that sells and rents everything you need, try the coffee shop for a great cup of coffee and a fresh muffin, the best bargain in town. To qoute Arnold, " I will be back"

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: This is an attempt at writing a difinitve review of the hotel so there will be no further questions. First, the staff was outstanding! Second, the Hau Tree Lanai Restaurnant was not only an ultimate romantic place to dine, the cuisine and service were top notch. I've read several reviews mentioning how expensive it is. Well, if you consider Red Lobster or the Olive Garden fine dining, then yes, it's expensive. If you are accustomed to true fine dining, the Hau Tree is of an average price range. Expect to have a bill around $125.00 for two. The Miyako Japanese Restaurant was a traditional Japanese experience, complete with wait staff in kimono's and excellent food. The view from this restaurant was also breathtaking. Third, the rooms. Make sure to use the room guide on their website to choose your room. We stayed in the 'ocean front' room on the seventh floor (take the time to look at the room guide on the website). This room was spacious and the view (which was nearly 180 degrees from the lanai) was, to say the least, spectacular. If you want a coffee maker, just ask! We also had a king bed as per requested. I did take a moment to look at other rooms in the hotel and yes, some rooms were tiny, but if it's within your budget, go for the gold. Worth mentioning, there is a small convenience store which came in handy and a 'deli' which was not up to the standards of the hotel. Fourth, San Souci beach and Kapiolani Park (directly behind and to the side of the hotel) felt like a private getaway. The beach was never crowded and you can snorkel or swim to your hearts content. Don't expect big waves in this area. The surf was quite calm, yet relaxing. If you are looking to be away from the zoo of the Waikiki area (it's a 15 minute walk to Waikiki...I timed it) and desire a complete package of relaxation, incredible views, romantic dining, excellent service and a great room if chosen wisely, The New Otani Kaimana will indulge your every wish.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My new husband and I stayed here for our 3 day stay in Honolulu during our honeymoon. It was so nice to be away from all the hustle and bustle of busy Waikiki beach and have our own little quiet becah to relax on but still be within easy walking distance to the city for dinner and night-life, and even a few dya trip for shopping, etc. The view from our ocean view balcony room was BEAUTIFUL! The service was also excellent! Highly recommended for those who don't like to be thrown into the middle of everything but still enjoy being a part of it all.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: From start to finish this hotel and its staff provided a fantastic holiday for my wife and I. Nothing was too much trouble to arrange for my wife who is disabled. The concierge took the trouble to check with various tours on the latest info to ensure we encountered no unforeseen problems. Everyone very friendly and effecient and made our stay an absolute pleasure. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a quieter base from which to enjoy the island of Oahu.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: My husband surprised me with a trip for our 10 year wedding anniversary and we stayed at this great little hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were smaller than average which was a little disappointing, but we figured we weren't going to be spending much time in the room. We had a beach located right in front of the hotel which wasn't nearly as packed with people as the beach in town. This was perfect to start your day or end your day with. We were close to the park and walking into town was a breeze. Downtown Waikiki is so busy it reminded me of Vegas with all the foot traffic, so it was nice to be located a greater distance than everyone else. If you are staying there and are purchasing tours that will pick you up, just an FYI, you need to go out on the sidewalk and wait in front of the hotel, because of the limited parking, the buses cannot get in/out of their lot. We did a couple of shows that required pick-up/drop-off and a guest told us where we needed to be, so we aren't left behind. I thought it was a great place to be and if I go back, I want to stay there, away from all the hustle and bustle and have access to the beach from my hotel. :) Aloha!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: For a much more pleasant Honolulu experience than staying at Waikiki, which is a crowded strip of hotels, shopping malls and stores (with a busy beach thrown in), try staying outside of Waikiki at the Hotel New Otani Kaimana Beach. The hotel is near Diamond Head (east of Waikiki, near the Aquarium) and is only a 20-minute walk from the center of Waikiki, but feels a world away from Waikiki. There is a small but very nice beach just next to the hotel. For travellers who like to run, this is the place to stay--good running (although on roads) around the neighboring residential areas, Diamond Head, and the park next door. The hotel itself is a decent 3-star place: lobby and rooms are on the plain side and could use re-decorating, but are clean and pleasant enough for those on a moderate to moderate-expensive budget ($100-200). Don't expect too much of the rooms, though--they are quite small and furnished with furniture that looks like it dates back to the 1970's. (See photos). But rooms are clean, if not immaculate. This is typical of Honolulu hotels at all price ranges--they are overpriced for what you get. You are paying for the location. If you can afford it, pay for a room with a beach or partial beach view. (See photo).Only major problem with rooms is that air-conditioning units, which were manually controlled, were noisy and too powerful--room became too cold--and could not be fine-tuned. So room was either too cold or too warm (but breeze from outside helped during mornings and evenings).The main restaurant with the lanai dining room is beautiful--overlooks the beach and is shaded by a large banyan tree--so be sure to have at least a drink there. But food is very mediocre.All in all, highly recommended for those who want a quiet tropical experience, not malls and big luxury hotels.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We stayed at the New Otani from 9/06-9/12/06. We loved it! We had booked a partial ocean view, but we were up graded to an Oceanfront since we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. It was just wonderful to sleep with our balcony window open and hear the waves as we awakened each morning. The room was clean, but nothing fancy. The hotel is in a quiet part of town but only about a 10-15 minute walk to Waikiki beach. Although the beach in front of the hotel is nice, we really felt the beaches on the Windward coast are the most beautiful. The staff was very attentive, and service at the restaurant was very good too. The Hau Tree Restaurant in the hotel is right on the beach. It was the perfect place to relax for dinner after the long trip from Virginia. The avocado crab stuffed fresh Mahii was fabulous! We ate breakfast there every morning. I loved the Sweetbread Macadamia French toast.We will most definitely return to The New Otani!

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: A brief 4 night Labor Day weekend stay on Oahu with the New Otani as our HQ turned out to be a fine choice. Upon check-in, we were told that our "moderate" room was not available (we booked a package on Orbitz & were not expecting anything special for the $$$) so the clerk checked us in to the Diamond Head wing. We had a partial view of the ocean & Waikiki from our terrace & had a good sized room with a kitchenette. We were on the third level so that did mean climbing stairs (wing has no elevator) but that was OK with us. The room is a bit dated... bathroom, furnishings, the general overall look of the wing looked like it could use a little upgrade from the "queer eye guys" but it was clean, the A/C was strong, & we could hear the surf on to the beach with our terrace door open! We used room service a couple of times after venturing around the island & thought it to be a decent deal. Especially, a seafood-sashimi/smoked fish appetizer called the "tsunami" which for $16 could have fed two couples. We rented a car & used valet through our stay so budget an extra $15/day for that. In closing, I liked being a little bit away from the strip of Waikiki. In my opinion, the hotel offers respectable service, with a lovely location, a little dated in its look, but a comfortable place to stay in paradise.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: We loved this Hotel. It was clean, quiet and what a view. If you want to get away from the busy loud Waikiki, this is the Hotel. No waiting for the elevator, only twice in seven days we had someone else in the elevator with us. We had the Ocean Front Delux Room. I would highly recommend this room as it has a huge lanai, ocean view and if you walk around the lanai you get the cool winds and view of Diamond Head. Good size room.Take a look at the The New Otani Kaimana Beach website to give you a better idea about the Hotel.Since May 2006 the Hotel is a NO Smoking Hotel. After having always stayed in Waikiki, this was wonderful, quiet and refreshing. At night in Waikiki all we heard were people party and cars, busses all night long. It was always noisy in Waikiki. What made us decide on this Hotel is that our daughter last year said that Waikiki was too noisy, she kept closing the sliding door. Our daughter loved this Hotel all the way. The room was big enough so that she had space to play and run around and for us to do things too. It was not one of those tiny rooms. The kois at the entrance were another plus. It was also great having a removable showerhead so we could rinse our daughters sand off.The only bad thing was that the Beach in front of the Hotel was more of a swimmers beach and the more shallow area had too much broken glass. We like the shallow water of the Ponds right next to Waikiki Beach . So we had to drive to Waikiki for our daughter to swim almost every day, that was not soo much fun. Here are the good things:1. Quiet, no party no noises of cars. Only ocean waves all night long.2. Clean Hotel, good service.3. No waiting for elevator.4. Free or very cheap parking along park. 5. Kapiolani Park right across the street.6. Ocean front Hotel.7. Good swimming Beach right in front of Hotel.8. Bathtub with removable showerhead. 9. Hotel has only 7 or 8 floors.10. No smoking Hotel.Here are the not so good things:1. Have to drive to Waikiki for any interesting things.2. Front desk and Vallet almost never said hello.3. Had to keep curtains on side windows closed cause people on lanai could see in a little.4. Every night at 11pm they clean the beach and it's a little loud.5. Fridge was very tiny, could be a little bigger. This is a mini mini fridge.6. Beach in front of Hotel not the best beach for little kids. We never eat at the Restaurants there. And we never vallet parked. We discovered a good convenient store right by the Hotel. For everything else you have to commute.We would highly recommend this Hotel. We were very happy with our stay and will go back there next year. cs

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: Ignore the negative comments, this is a great hotel if you are traveling in the summer months. The other hotels that are priced in the same price range does not compare to this hotel. The best part about the hotel is the cleanliness, the quiet, the comfortable beds and the beautiful lobby. Just spent seven days at the New Otani Kaimana and we couldn't be more pleased with what we got for the price. We would say the location was secluded and elegant: you're about two or three blocks from the main strip of Waikiki but far enough that you can get away and have a quiet night's rest -- the main strip can get a little busy and common after a while. The open, airy lobby extends right through to the back where you can see the beach and the restaurant. The beach here is much less crowded than the ones on the main strip. The standard rooms are pretty small but this was not a problem for us. Plus who spends all there time in there room when you are in Hawaii. Our room was super clean and we were greeted with a complimentary pineapple in the fridge which we did not eat sorry to say we both don't like pineapple too much . We had spotless, heavy, white sheets on a thick mattress with two wonderful pillows. When we woke up, we opened our terrace door and all you could hear was the wind, the rustling of the trees and water -- very quiet. We were provided a morning local newspaper every morning which was great to find out what was going on locally. The one thing we did find peculiar is the louvered bathroom door, which leaves little privacy as you can hear through the door. Towels were thick and clean, bathroom products are all by Neutrogena. They do have Internet access and other amenities available if needed. The staff was polite especially the valet guys who were very cheerful every day. We will defnitely stay here again.

hotel_name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel
review_body: I loved it!We had a great room with a free upgrade to the honeymoon suite. We were there on our anniverary for 2 days before we left on the Pride of Hawaii cruise ship and needless to say, I would have rather just stayed here at this hotel than the ship. It was so nice and I felt like a part of the family. We had the nicest suite in the hotel I think, it was their honeymoon suite that was huge and spacious. Two of our whole walls where sliding glass doors that consisted of about 6 of them that just radiated with beauty. Our outside balcony was L shape so it was huge as well.We could see the ocean and look to the right and see the running park and Diamond Head Park. We were walking distance to the Aquarium, Diamond Head, shopping and the beach was right below us.
